I was sick of replacing my Littermaids every year and a half or so when they broke so I decided to purchase a Litter Robot.  It was such an improvement over the Littermaid.  Litter isn't wasted, the waste doesn't stick to the inside of the globe, and very little maintenance is required.  With two cats, I only had to change the bag once a week, if that.  You can just set it up and let it go.  It was also wonderful not to have buy special receptacles.  You can just use your typical kitchen trash bags.But, although my cats seemed to initially adapt to it well, one of them soon decided he didn't like it.  I have two cats, a 7-pound Siamese, and a 21-pound Ragdoll.  I was aware that the Ragdoll might be too large to use it, although I had read that other large cats of a similar size were using it fine.  Anyway, although he used it fine at first, he began to develop a problem where he would enter the globe, not turn around, and proceed to pee and poop all over the outside of the box.  After a few days of that, he gave up going in the box all together and started going in front of the box.  I tried everything I could to get him to go in and turn around as he had in the beginning, but it was to no avail.  I really think his size made it uncomfortable for him to maneuver inside the globe.So with a heavy heart, I sent the Litter Robot back.  I think it is a wonderful litterbox and worth the cost, but if you have a large or stupid cat (as mine is both), be prepared to send it back if your cat can't or won't turn around inside the globe.

I love the size of this litter pan.  I have a rather long cat and other boxes just weren't big enough for him to move around in.  This has solved this problem.  I don't really care for the storage on the end - but it's not a deal breaker.
It secure and safe. I wish it was more durable on the zippers. Mine already came off I had to sew it back on but its still great. I love to put my JRT puppy in this. I would buy it again.
Works perfectly never realized how much my animals went in the house *angry face* but it aided in cleaning up to prevent future accidents.
I tried a small size bag purchased at the market and the way my two dogs loved the product I knew I needed a large bag.  It was a pleasure to have it delivered.  I and the dogs recommend it highly.

Let me first say I own a golden retriever and two persian cats.  So as you can imagine shedding was an issue in my house.  I was fortunate to find my golden when he was 9 months old. When we first took him home after being "dog less" for two years, I couldn't believe how much he shed.  Simply petting him lightly produced fur everywhere.  I had heard about the Linatone supplement but was a bit hesitant.  Well, I took the plunge and tried it out.  After about four weeks my dogs coat was so soft and shiny it was just amazing.  WIth those results I decided to try it with the cats as well.  Same result just beautiful.  So the Linatone along with the "Furminator" grooming tool are a sure winner.  I couldn't be happier with both.  So if your like me an love your pets but also love a clean house, these products are for you.SincerelyCheryl

Definitely like ordering this on subscribe and save and not having to worry about running out or picking it up at the pet store.  Good food that did seem to cut down significantly on the hair ball episodes.

My dogs LOVE these. I had bought a smaller one in January and decided to go with a bigger size this time. I figured the smaller one is still going after 6 months so the bigger one should last years. My dogs chew on this everyday and barely make a dent. It keeps them occupied for hours and is definitely worth the money!!!

Got this because of the near perfect reviews.  I was disappointed.  The only good thing I can say about this product is that it is very quiet.  I wanted to cut down on clutter and reduce the amount of air pumps on my 5 tanks.  Figured I could run numerous air stones and bubble wands off of this.  It can run one bubble wand or air stone fantastically.  It will run 2 ok with a noted reduction in bubbles.  Add any more than that and the bubbles are reduced to a mere trickle.  I set this up 2 different ways to see it was my set up or the item.  First try was with gang valves.  Second try was with all hoses connected with connector tee's.  Same problem with both set ups.  So, sadly, this item is being used on a single bubble wand.  I am now using another brand of pump instead of this to run 8 air stones in 4 separate tanks with no problem at all.

My 76 year old mother is the &#34,compassionate cat lady.&#34,  People dump cats on her all the time.  The latest cat prefers pooping on the kitchen counter....mental note....invite Granny over in lieu of eating at her house..  I got her this for Mother's Day.  Worked like a charm.  It doesn't always go off immediately but well worth the money.  Thanks!

I bought two, one works well for one dog that eats normally.My other dog eats fast and enthusiastically, and so pushes into her dish while eating. The dish still gets pushed across the mat and into the wall, but it moves less than when placed directly on the floor tiles.But it does save the floor and grout from food spills, which is a good thing.

I love this bag! My cat likes it a lot more than her plastic carrier even though it's smaller. It (the size large) fits perfect for Alitalia's travel guidelines and the other airlines we travel with (Lufthansa and Air Canada). When I take her to the vet she no longer cries and she likes that she can see through all sides. I like that I can open a small hole on the side and pet her to reassure her without risk of her escaping. It's also stylish, a lady asked me where I found it because she wanted one too. I suggest expanding to Italy, there is nothing like this available here! Oh, also the sherpa insert is really nice and my cat likes it too. The seat belt holders are also very convenient for car travel, overall a great product!

I bought the medium size for my Yorkie-Poo since being a Yorkie, he is an avid chewer and nothing lasts for him except Kong type toys.  This toy lasted one month.  I took it away after the food was dispensed, which took him only 5 minutes no matter how tight I closed it, so he couldn't chew it up.  But just from chewing on it to get the food dispensed, bits and pieces started coming off.  Good concept, just dispenses food too quickly and product not tough enough.

My boxer/lab mix is a chewer....she loves these things, both flavors.  They are loud if you have tile or hardwood but it's worth the occasional crash if your Telfenhunde spends hours just gnawing away at that and not your shoes, furniture, etc.
My bunny loves this!  She is very busily and happily working on chewing her way from one end to the other.Bunn Fun !
These are perfect for low wattage low heat in a protected thin fleece cover.  But I was disappointed that they only last about a year.  I do not like disposable products and will not buy again.

Just ordered 4 of these collars for ONE cat. My other cats don't mind the breakaway collars and have worn the same ones for months or years! My one year old cat lost 5 breakaway collars in two weeks,(I know she is snagging them off on purpose!) which is when I searched for this type of collar. Found a kitten sized Elastacat collar locally which she wore for several months before losing so I am getting her the full sized collar and hope there is enough extra length to secure it under the buckle tab to keep her in it longer. These are inexpensive enough that if she wears it for 6-8 weeks I'll be satisfied. I purchased in orange.

Feeding my Yorkie grain free is a must because of her allergies. I ordered Hills Science Diet Adult Grain Free Dog Food because it looked good as far as nutition and I like to switch every so often because she seems to get bored with the same thing. She is also a picky eater but she loved this stuff! I also love that the bites are small. I would deffinitely recommend this dog food!

I purchased this gate to set up a new pen area for my pet rabbits. The narrow bars and vertical slots in this pen are great at preventing bunnies from ramming their heads through the slots and getting them stuck... bunnies are stupid.The gate has a panel with a door that opens. So you don't have to high step over every time and faceplant on your previously happy pet.The gate assembles very quickly and easily with one person.

I tried everything else to keep the crows out of the suet.  This works.  Crows or blackbirds DO NOT like to hang upside down so take the bottom removable plug out and the woodpeckers and blue jays will eat.

My African Grey loves this toy! It's destroyed happily quite quickly.  The only problem is that the chain/hook contains zinc!  I simply replace the chain and manually re-rope the thimbles.  The rope and thimbles are perfectly safe though.Always test anything metal with a magnet.  If the magnet connects, then the item is deadly to your parrot and needs to be replaced with a stainless steel version of the metal part!!!!  Many parrots die from lead and zinc!!!It is true that a magnet will connect to stainless steel. However, with lead and zinc based metals, the magnet connection will be much stronger than with a stainless steel material. Iron is also magnetic but covered with non-toxic paint makes it safe for birds. It is better to be safe than sorry since the zinc/lead issue is a huge silent killer with pet birds that many people are unaware of.
Great utility bag.  We obviously use it for dog training.  Lots of pockets, water resistant, easy to use.  Pretty much indispensable for Obedience School.

I've heard great things about this stuff. Frankly, I think its active ingredients, those of Nature's Miracle, and of Bac-Out, are probably the same. It's just a matter of which one's residual scent you like best.It's really hard to get the smell of cat pee out, because you have to get the enzyme liquid to all of the same places where there was pee, or the scent will persist. I think this stuff did a pretty good job of getting rid of the smell in places where I got the liquid, but I don't think I did a good enough job of really saturating the whole area.I'll probably buy it again.

After having gone through multiple dog beds over the years, eko has created a wonderful winning pet bed cover and liner. It's machine washable, comes with a cute paw print cover and liner. The zipper access makes it easy for the owner to fill the bed with old clothes, blankets, towels, pillows, foam, cedar chips --whatever you might want for your dog or puppy. This one was Medium Round approx. 34 inches.  Having tried to wash many of the bulky pet bed liners in the past, this one is great because you can take it apart and wash all parts throughly.Here's the true test, I filled it and put it on the floor and my puppy crawled onto it immediately and started chewing on his toys. &#128062,
The dog really loved these bones and it seemed to freshen her breath.  It was a good treat for a dog with tummy troubles.
This toy I imagine will last forever.  I bought two because my Golden chews and chews through toys very easily, but this one seems indestructible.  I put small treats or peanut butter inside it.

I have been buying these for years for my dogs (including Olde English Bulldogges, Mastiff, Lab mixes) and they love them.  They last for months and I never had an issue with broken pieces or my dogs choking on them like other chew bones.

I have 2 cats.  One is of the garbage disposal variety. She will eat anything. Even inedible things that she later spits out. They other is finicky. Extremely so. In the years they have been getting treats, this is the only one that gets an equal reaction from both. They *love* the Bonito flakes. I don't feed them to them daily, but they are the occasional treat.I have them in a high cabinet, as I know they would get to them on their own if they could. This is exactly what I think a treat should be, heathy, light and something special.

I was surprised when I read the reviews that didn't include the American Kennel Club Booster seat--or maybe no one gave a review for it. I think it is exceptionally well made. Very nicely done. The sides are solid and some of the others are net, but this is so much sturdier. It has a really nice covered pad in the bottom of the seat. My little girl dog is learning to ride in it. The seat has been a big help as our dog is a Rescue dog and was so afraid of even riding in the car. But the seat made her feel secure--and now she is beginning to enjoy riding in it. We take short trips every month or so and it's important that she be happy and comfy. And she is. I think this seat is a good value, and after all, the American Kennel Club should know what type of a seat would make a dog happy! It has easy to follow instructions on how to put it on the seat of the car--no problem. When not in use it folds up out of the way. The seat was delivered ahead of the time it was supposed to be, which was really nice. The box was very sturdy and secure. I would definitely recommend this booster seat! I really like it. (So does my little dog!)

The reviews for this were great but I was a little disappointed after I got this.  I thought the intent was for this to stand up and wobble back and forth (still vertical).  Instead, as soon as my dog(s) push the toy, it falls over on its side and just rolls around, staying mostly horizontal.  I understand this would happen if you try to completely fill it up, but even with the recommended amount of one cup, it still just falls over on its side with a single push.  It's not particularly challenging for them (the hole is pretty big) and definitely doesn't keep them occupied for long.The only time I've seen it working properly was when I was dog-sitting a small dog (pomeranian) and fed her dinner in this.  I have the size Large, for my med-large dogs and this is almost half the size of the pom.  When the little dog used it to dispense her food, it actually did what it's advertised for.  The Large size will definitely keep a small dog busy for awhile, assuming the dog is not afraid of it and is used to food dispensing toys.

Best in dog kennel ever!!Proa. not metalb. easily collapsiblec. quickly can be moved out of the way if someone needs to use the seatsd. Fits the length of my Dodge Durango middle rowe. Width is greatf. everyone who sees it loves it and thinks it is amazing.g. Color and design is classy and modern. Not a typical dog kennel/cageh. easy to clean/wipe down (my 9 wk puppy has gone potty in it...material is solid so nothing leaks thru but easy to wipe up any messes)I. great to store packages, groceries, etc in if the dogs are not using it....people on the outside of car cannot see into it when zipped upj. zippers on both sides, so you can enter/exist from either side of the carCon--nothing that would prevent me from buying again or recommending. this is awesomea.  If you want to use it in a reduced length, you have to figure out how to strap it down in that size....either they did not send me all the straps or they just do not provide them. I bought a couple bungee cords and luggage straps from Home Depot and that works. But it would be great if them include one extra strap and hook on the actual body of the tube to make the shorter length easier to useNeutrala. Ppl complain about not being able to see into it. It is OK and not as bad as some reviews make it out to be. When you look into it from the drivers seat, you an see into it and see the dog's shadow, but you can at least see in it. I think dogs can see better than us, so they are OK. (I personally think it has value in that outsiders cannot see well into it)b. height - might be nice if it were 'taller'...my 6 month old Rottweiler fully stands up in it and hits the top. It would be nice if it was taller.

I have a 40lb Australian Shepherd mix.  She loves all types of Nylabone durachew bones.  I don't understand why she'll often pass up a &#34,real&#34, bone for a plastic one, but she loves them and that's all that matters.  It's getting to the point that when she sees me bring an Amazon box in from the mail she expects it to be for her!  No, she's not spoiled :)

Pretty expensive for something that lasted a year. This is my second, my first lasted about 10 years. Quality has gone downhill. I bought an omega paw rolling cat box its manuel but works better than the littermaid and a lot cheaper. 35 bucks. would not buy another littermaid.

I bought this on sale at Target thinking my cat would really like it. She loooves catnip, and goes crazy over it usually. But I practically soaked her cat tree in the spray and she is sound asleep on it as I write this! The catnip smell is not super strong, I can sort of smell it, but it doesn't linger long. It's only 0.15% catnip oil (didn't notice this til after I got it of course, haha), which doesn't seem like very much for 7oz.  :/  For the $2 I spent I think it was worth it, but some more concentrated stuff would definitely be better! You have to time the spraying just right, so that it is dry by the time your cat wants to play, but not wait so long that the scent is gone. A little frustrating!

I just replaced my old sherpa carriers. I have two dogs that travel well in the Sherpas. They can look out through  the mess, have a soft pad and the dogs jump right in. I have a 3rd dog that is a chewer, so the Sherpa isn't a good choice. They have a zippered opening at the end or at the top, plus a zippered compartment at the back for leashes, bags, etc. They aren't overly bulky, the sides give so the dog can turn around in the carrier. The first two carriers lasted 7 years and were used frequently. They actually were still intact but they were accidentally sprayed with cleaner at the kennel and the zippers were difficult to unzip (best to take your carriers home with you rather than leave them with the kennel). Price is excellent on Amazon - I spent about $20 more when I purchased these years ago. I have one dog that is 20lbs (standard doxie) and one that is 14lbs and they fit a large.

I use it as toothpaste on Henry's toothbrush, so I believe it works in that regard, but I've never used it just by itself without brushing so can't speak for that.  I wish it came in a pump or easier to squeeze bottle.
my yorkies love these I give them to them in the evening and it keeps them busy for a long time

I absolutely like this rake scooper but I have a maltepoo(toy dog) and he poops like a cat. Therefore, when i pick up his poop, sometimes his small poop falls between the metal prongs spacing making it difficult to pick it up and sometimes i had no problems. Unfortunately, I had to buy the pan/rake pooper which is working out for me much better. I recommend this if you got dog that makes big poops.

Does the job but I could find a lot better quality for the same price.  The edges aren't sewn up very cleanly, and it keeps the crease in the middle.  Slips on the floor, I'd rather have it with a rubbery back so that it doesn't slide when the puppy is on it.
These small doggy dish bowls are perfect, just enough weight to make them easy to handle, not like those lightweight ones in the stores.

This harness has made all the difference in the world for us.  Our dog used to pull our arms out of our sockets trying to catch squirrels, rabbits, etc. while on a walk.  The very first time we used this, it was like a night and day difference.  She no longer pulls.  I mean you can tell she is excited about the squirrel and pulls a wee bit but it is SOOOOOO much easier to keep her under control.  The money I spent on this harness was well worth it.  We are very happy with this purchase.
My Cherry-Head Conure chews on them somewhat, then plays with them by throwing them off the top of his cage a hundred times a day! So we both get exercise, since I keep picking them up!

The design of it is flawless and all. Light-weight. &#34,Grass&#34, is removable. Whole thing is washable. Just the dog NEVER uses it. Not my dog, or my Mom's dog or the neighbor's dog. I've loaned this thing out to every pet owner friend I have and the dog always ignores it. I've tried placing it where the pet usually has an accident, I've tried sprays that are supposed to attract the dog. Never any success. On an odd note however, my cat was locked in my room once or twice and she used it! So your better off buying this for a cat and at that point please just stick to your litter box. Jeez.

It seemed to help 2 of my 3 dogs.  The dog it didn't help has cushing's and possible yeast/staph infection and that's the main one I was need to have the ears healthy again.  Glad I only bought a small bottle.

No complaints here. It works as promised and I've tested it out to about 300'. But dogs will be dogs and they can cover 300' before you know it. So other than wanting more range, it's a perfect product. The shock is pretty harsh to me, but the dog doesn't seem that bothered by it. I've actually only needed to use it a few times in several walks. The beeping seems to work well enough to get her attention, so I don't have to use the electric shock all that much. The dial allows me to dial it up or down. Most of the time I leave it at 4, but one time I did have to move it higher (but just one time, after that she now responds well to my voice or the beeping in the collar.)It makes training a naturally hyper hunter much easier and saves a lot of time.
healthy ingredients, made in the USA. Good for sensitive stomachs, breaks up easily if you want to use it as little rewards. Doesn't smell strong. Low calorie treat.

I used this on carpet where 4 male dogs had marked and marked!  It took away the odor by the next night, and lasted a few weeks.  The odor DID return, but I used this again, and it is masked again.  Helps if you have a problem urine area and can't replace the carpet just yet...
I love this collar .. it's thicker and nice fleece on the inside.. I live in a cold climate so having a nice soft fleece collar is nice for my pup!

There is still a little sweeping to do 3-4' past the mat, but I think my cats try their best to hold onto some of the litter just to keep me cognizant of who's in control. :) It's pretty stiff at first and kind of difficult to empty unless you have a large litter box. But after a few weeks, it loosened up, I got a bigger box, and the litter rolls out pretty easily. One caveat: if you use a dusty litter, the mat is going to look filthy all the time unless you're willing to damp dust it, which I'm not. I use Tidy Cat (with the blue lid) and that is not a problem. Just saying. Overall, I recommend this mat.

These are the kind of dog treats that take the dog a few minutes to chew up.  They break into safe pieces so they won't get lodged in the throat or further down, but they still take a few minutes to eat as they are kind of hard.  I thought they smelled sort of medicinal, but my dog seemed to like them a lot.

We used to have a DART but it was always breaking. The BOLT doesn't have as much laser control as the DART but the cats still love it. It's a little less noisy and the cats sometimes just want to lay near it when it's turned on. I don't really like the mirror control. It doesn't stay in place and slips super easily. So I had to tape it down. Other than that, it's a great purchase if your cats like laser toys.

I was really looking forward to getting these scratchers - I had been buying them for my cats for years - but when the box arrived and I removed the protective cover, there were so many shavings in the scratcher that neither of my cats were interested in them. I had to take both units apart and shake all of the access cardboard out. Only then would my cats use them. I hope this isn't a trend, since these scratchers have kept my cats from sharpening their nails on the furniture for years.

I love this stake for my beagle dog.  The only problem is that the latch that you hook it to your dog's collar with rusts.  This makes it almost impossible to use.  However, I love the blue rubber on the hand turn part.  The rubber makes it soooo much easier to put in the ground.  I just with the latch was rustproof.

I have 3 Australian Cattledogs who are now 9 & 10 months old.  They are VERY aggressive chewers!  I have bought pillow type beds for them, which lasted only minutes before the stuffing was EVERYWHERE!  What a waste of money and a huge mess to clean up!  I decided to give the Kuranda bed a try and bought one for the most aggressive chewer first.  As soon as I put it down, she started frantically scratching the fabric.  To my surprise, this resulted in NO damage to the fabric!  Jessie has given it a first class test drive, and this bed has passed the test with flying colors!  She loves her bed, which looks just the same today as it did 2 months ago.  I will be ordering 2 more for the other 2 dogs.  There is some assembly required, but if you read the instructions, it isn't too difficult.  The fabric is stretched tight as a drum at first, but with use, it relaxes to a pleasant, though not too loose, sag.  Jessie gives this bed 2 paws up.  Buy it!

These have a strong smell, so they are enticing when training.  My lab really loves them.  I break them up into small pieces during training.  They are soft and it is easy to break them apart.  Healthy and enticing--great product!  We may try the other flavors for fun, too!

My English bulldog has extreme food and skin allergies.  We bought, what we thought, was the best food on the market only for her to still get chronic ear infections and constantly scratch.  We did an allergy test and sure enough she was allergic to majority of the main ingredients in other dog foods.  Natural Balance sweet potato and fish was the only food I found that I could feed her that wouldn't cause an allergic reaction.If your dog is experiencing allergies I would try this food before you spend the money on the allergy test.

I purchased this to keep my lab puppy from eating too quickly.  The "Food Ball", as we call it, works as it is supposed to.  It doesn't hold a lot of food (about 1/4 to 1/2 cup depending on the size of the pellets) but it's made out of a pliable rubber and will not scratch anything as it is nosed across the floor.  It keeps her occupied for a few minutes but not more than that.  The main drawback is cleaning the ball as after one turn around the room it's now wet and has picked up hair and dust bunnies hiding in the corners.  I would purchase this again.

I really wanted this to work, but one look at it in the box and it was obvious it was way, way, way too large for my chiweenie. Bingo has a 10&#34, neck and weighs 10 lbs. This collar would have swallowed him whole. Maybe they sent me the collar for bigger dogs in the wrong package, but if the one I received was actually the YS300 &#34,For Small to Medium Dogs,&#34, all I can say is &#34,No way.&#34,Anyway, I wish I could review the product's performance, but I can't. I immediately boxed it up and requested a return. UPS came to pick it up the very next day, fortunately. Thank heaven for Amazon! At least you know, if you do take a chance on it, that you can return it if it's too big. But what a hassle for everyone...

The cats love it and it is a quality product from Purina. I have nothing but Purina for all my critters ever since being a kid and the pets (Dogs,Cats,Rabbitts)have always been healthy with no gastrointestinal problems.
you CAN trust KONG~kong is a quality product~ they work~!! i love dog toys, but they wear out fast & i wanted to get ones that would last long! i got kong! yay!

If you read Dog Food Adviser, you know they do the chemistry and the math to determine how much of a food&#8217,s protein content comes from meat (as opposed to vegetables or grains).  Their comment?  &#8220,&#8230,this looks like the profile of a kibble containing a significant amount of meat.&#8221,The downside of &#8220,&#8230,a significant amount of meat,&#8221, of course, is the cost.  Meat simply costs more, and the price of Nutrience Grain Free reflects this.  Since Grain Free&#8217,s ingredients provide better nutrition, you can probably feed less.  Some people are sure they also save on pet healthcare costs by feeding a very high-end food.I definitely don&#8217,t see enough of these &#8220,soft savings&#8221, to cover the difference in the price.  As far as that goes, though, I&#8217,m sure I could save a lot on my own grocery bill by dumpster diving instead of going to the farmer&#8217,s market.  I&#8217,m convinced that getting my food from the market is better than getting it from a dumpster.  I&#8217,m convinced that feeding my dog a food with identifiable, quality ingredients is equally desirable.Some pet owners believe that feeding the same brand all the time is the best choice, but varying brands makes more sense to me.  I don&#8217,t think a dog&#8217,s digestive tract should be constantly challenged by feeding a different brand every day, but I do think feeding different brands of similar quality every few months may make up for anything my dog might be missing from a single brand.  I absolutely intend to keep Nutrience in this mix.

I have a husky and terrier/schnauzer mix. The terrier/schnauzer isn't picky but he definitely LOVES these and was more motivated to do tricks and listen. The husky is a stubborn girl but for these she willingly does all tricks I ask/teach. i ordered the salmon and they loved it. I don't know why others complain about the smell its not horrible and nothing other than what I would expect for moist salmon treats, c'mon! I will be trying the peanut butter next.
he likes some and takes his time with others. for a very few, he just leaves them there. I may order less than 25 next time if I can
My dog has lost (or possibly buried) the original Kong I bought her, so this was purchased as a replacement. She absolutely adores it.

I have a German Shepherd that chews EVERYTHING to bits, tennis balls don't even make it back from one game of fetch.  I've tried all manner of balls, and they all either get chewed up in the first few minutes or they don't fit in the chuckit-which is the only way I have of running the energy out of the pup!  This ball has been going on daily playtime runs for over a month now, and there are STILL no signs of teeth marks (let me pause here and gasp incredulously).  I'm ordering more JUST IN CASE I lose this one, because there's no going back- this is the ONLY ball for me and my shepherd!Follow-up:  The "small" size is the same size as a tennis ball, and PERFECT for a chuck-it :D

I have a 3 lb Boston Terrier puppy, and I read all the reviews about how small these run - so I ordered a medium and she literally walks out of it.  I should have ordered the XS!  Too annoyed to exchange it at this point.

I borrowed this from a friend when my cats were cooped up inside for days due to snow and below zero cold. It distracted them from fighting out of boredom. It took a few minutes of skeptical observation from afar by the cats until one got interested and then the others. They tend to take shifts - one chasing while the others watch. No one fights over it.They like it best when the toy is on a shelf 15&#34, from the ground with the laser pointed down so it rotates in a long narrow loop on the floor (a hallway is good). Obviously it works best when its dark but you can see it in a semi dark room in the day. When you hit the on button it runs about 15 minutes then automatically shuts off.The cats were not interested when the weather was good and they could go out. So it makes for a good &#34,Rainy Day&#34, toy at my house.Safety Note: When you show it to cats for the first time they can be curious about the actual toy because it makes a small motor sound. I recommend supervision at first so they don't stare right into the laser light and hurt their eyes. Once mine began associating the motor sound with a laser light to chase on the floor they were no longer interested in the actual toy. I now feel confident about leaving them alone with it.

These simple chews are good for removing tartar buildup that accumulates on your dog's teeth. They have Calcium and Phosphorus in them that will help build and maintain strong bones and teeth while cleaning teeth as they chew.My 2 year old Chihuahua loves to chew and these make a good low cost and basic chew for daily use. Even if your dog only eats one every couple of days it will still remove a lot of tartar that might not be removed otherwise.  It normally takes our small Chihuahua about an hour to finish one of these. She doesn't go crazy for these but she has never turned one down.  We like to give her one of these when company stops by in order to distract her because she also loves to bark at anyone who comes into the house. One FlatStick Calcibone will normally give us about an hour of quiet time.  I am not sure these would be great for larger breed dogs because they would be chewed up very fast.

I love the Vittles Vaults! Just get the large one for my lab curs dry food and this one for my small dog. No insects can get in! The seal is tight and the food smells so fresh when you open it that you want a &#34,kibble nibble&#34, yourself! Comes with a 1 cup scoop! Plus, this smaller one stacks on my larger one. I personally think this is the BEST value to hold your pet food and I am even thinking about a smaller one for my flour! It won't fall apart!!

I was looking for a pet food can cover. Both of my dogs get a scoop of canned food with their dry food, but one gets regular pooch food and the other has a special diet from the vet. The only can cover I had was one from the vet, I've looked around in stores, and the one thing I can't seem to find is a can cover that's as good as the one from the vet. I was getting tired of covering the one can with aluminum foil.So... I looked on Amazon. Found bunches of lids, with varying degrees of customer satisfaction. This cover, though, it seemed like everyone who has this one is pretty wild about it. A tad expensive, but I thought, if it's that good...Wow, this is great. The lids are set up to fit three sizes of cans, my guys' cans fit in the second size. The lids are floppier than I'm used to, but they're very easy to fit onto the can, no fussing around, making sure it's on there. And the lids stay on well. They wash up nicely in the dishwasher (I put them in a small-items basket on the top rack so I don't find them flung onto the heating element).Now I can see why people are crazy about these lids.
These are long lasting, no odor. Most of the twists were of the 12 inch size. Our Border Collie puppy is a serious chewer and one stick will last a few days. Will purchase more.
I bought this for my pug and it seems to be a very comfortable alternative to a collar.  It is also adorable, and she looks very cute in it.

I rescued a one-year-old pit bull one year ago, and he, although completely awesome, has one issue--separation anxiety.  I'm sure it's tied to how he was treated and ultimately dumped, leading to him being rescued by me...but it's been a struggle.He has a standing Xanax prescription with the vet.  (The vet has witnessed this...it's so sad.)I was hopeful that this would help him.  I hate drugs, and really hate drugging him, because he gets so woozy on the Xanax.With two chew-tabs, there was no difference.  We found that giving him a shoebox full of papers, placed in &#34,his&#34, spot (atop a barstool) he can usually busy himself destroying the papers if I leave for a short time (bypassing the Xanax, and saving the house).  So, I left for school for just two hours.  I put the papers down, just in case, and well...upon arrival, every single paper was shredded, and he was in distress.  :(  I felt horrible, but glad I didn't leave him for a longer time.Now, my pibble is a special case, with a real problem.  I don't know how this would be for a dog with less stress and/or less bodymass.  He's 80 pounds, and ALL muscle.  His nature isn't hyper when I'm around.  He's really docile and sweet.  But when I am out of sight (yes, even if I am in the next room), he gets very upset.He's better than he used to be...but not good enough to have this be a help.So, if you have a big muscle-bound pibble with huge separation anxiety who is already taking Xanax, this might not be the best choice.  ,)Good luck, pet owners :)

My dogs seemed to really like these the first time I gave them one.  However, when I gave them a second one a few days later, I noted that my Lab and Boxer wound up with diarrhea and my Rottweiler was forcing herself to throw up until she finally brought up a huge piece of the filling.  It was hard like a rock and you could tell that many pieces of the filling had fused together.  I shudder to think what would have happened had she not been able to bring it up.  She won't even look at these treats - nor will my boxer.  My Lab seemsed to really like these so I cut them into smaller pieces and he did fine - but I will never buy these again.I have read a lot about these treats and realize my dogs may not have normal reaction to these treats.  It appears to be a love/hate - either the dogs really do well and love them or - like my dogs - don't do well and really hate them.

I got this for my chinchillas. It came in an ugly, nasty baby-barf green color (ew) and is a little bit bigger than the size of my smallest chinchilla. Would recommend for rats or animals of the like. Not for guinea pigs & up.It seems to be made well, and makes a nice crinkly sound when touched.3/5

Every evening my dog gets 1/2 his kibble in a bowl and 1/2 in a food dispensing toy. Believe me when I say we have a whole box of these types of toys for his enjoyment.These toys are very well made and hold up. They are not meant to be a chew toy and I pick them up once he's emptied it. They are not made of KONG rubber and aren't meant to be chewed. They're an interactive toy.This size is almost too small for my dog's kibble which makes it a real challenge for him. He eats Taste of the Wild, it is a normal sized kibble. Our puppy has smaller sized kibble and it basically pours out. But I think the XL would be too big and both dogs' kibble would pour right out so this size works for us.
Pleasant aroma and good clumping ability. Cat is happy to use litter whenever he is in the house. 2 outdoor cats have even come in the house to use it!
One of my little dogs loves these snacks but the other one seems to prefer the Duck strips. I buy both kinds.

I have 3 dogs and I don't know why but they love these bully sticks so every month I order them and every day they get one I highly recommend them and I rather them chew them my furniture and fast shipping I but the ones that are 4- 6 inches because I have small dogs

Our local animal shelter uses these exclusively and often requests them as donations.  Who would know more than an animal shelter about sturdy, non tipping, easily cleaned dog dishes? I sent them five.
I guess our dog doesn't like sweet potatoes, because she will not eat this bag of dog food.  It sounds good to me, but I'm not the one expected to eat it.
I've been using this product since I stopped buying the expensive penguin rite-sizeB cartridge. It's easy to use & you can save a lot of money.
I use these to keep the ants away from humming bird feeder. They work really well in fact last for a couple of years. It looks like they are discontinued so this might be the last of them.

We love this bowl. Its hold a very good amount of water that my dogs go through in a day's time. We were previously using an older tupperware plastic bowl that was the only thing large enough for them to have enough water last them in a day. The bad part was that tupperware isn't exactly smooth so it saved the grime and showed the grim at the water lines. We were constantly washing the water bowl and scrubbing old grime off. So I had about enough of that and went big on a bowl like this. So far after 2 weeks I don't get any slimy grime build up on it. If the water were dirty you can obviously see it right away too because of the shininess. It stays put in place and is very wide so both dogs can stick their fat heads in to get a drink at the same time. Its holds plenty of water as I said and with a quick rinse of some hot water and mild soap its no problem getting it squeeky clean if you just rub with your fingers. I like the bowl for sure and we shall see in time how durable it is. We are pleased.

I'm not sure why this litter has so many positive reviews. I recently got my cats and have been experimenting with a few different litters and this has the been the worst so far. It clumps fine but odor control is horrible. It looks like gravel and makes me feel like I'm at a construction site. It's dusty and I feel like I'm breathing it in every time I scoop. I probably wont even finish the bag I have. That being said, the cats were okay with it.

If you look at the hook for this it has a quite wide spacing, which allows the swing to slide off off the top of the cage and let your little bird plummet. Fix this by bending the wire close together so it won't  slip.

Our bloodhound puppy loves the plush egg toys toys from Kyjen. We have bought a few others animals too.If you have a dog who likes to find items and dig them up, get this. Our puppy will play with this toy for hours. All we do is stuff the eggs back inside, then she pulls them out. Then we play fetch with the eggs for a little while, and start all over again.The eggs are stuffed with the white polyfill, so be aware of that if your dog chews one up. Ours has and you would be surprised at the amount of white polyfill all over the room from that tiny egg.

My cats are very active and playful and they get into everything they're not supposed to. I've tried buying ssscat cans in the past, but after using multiple refills, all of them started to leak, and it was too much to keep up with. The scat mat sounded like a great idea, so I finally took the plunge and am glad I did. One of my cats got shocked by one the first night I put them out, and now neither of them will go anywhere near the mats. They are expensive, but after the initial investment, buying a 9v battery every once in a while is nothing.

I found two little girl puppies abandoned in the desert.  I scooped them up and took them home.  They have grown and have needed new collars.  These collars are perfect.  So, when one chewed up the collar of the other I bought replacements.

This is good cat food. I have two black and gray tabby's. They love it. With Amazon prime, I was able to have this delivered without a shipping cost. Really beats getting the boat going all the way into town to get cat food. And like I said, the cats love it. Prrrrrrrr.
The subscription is simple and easy to manage.  This is a lot cheaper than buying at walmart. This is the food my babies want to eat.
Love this little filter.  It is quiet quiet quiet and my tank water is crystal clear.  Between this and the snail in my little tank I couldn't be happier -- and my fish are happy too.

Purchased for my golden retriever after seeing a bulldog playing with it at the beach. My dog loves it. Easy to pick up in his mouth, soft enough not to hurt his mouth, and lots of fun. Good for the yard, the beach, or the house (providing no breakables in the room).

My dog loved his west paws frisbee for a long time, but it got a little cut in it from his teeth one time and the tear has just been expanding ever since with all the rough housing it gets. I saw this Orka one at Petco for around $13, but it seemed like it'd be perfect for him and his chewing, so I looked it up here on amazon as I do with many items to save money, and found it at half the price, as usual. We have had it for about a week now and it's held up nicely, he loves it we play fetch all day...

I carry this when I walk my two cane corso (Italian mastiff) to ward off any loose dogs (irresponsible people, strays, losts).  My dogs will bite strange dogs that are loose and approaching us, so I carry this to stop the loose dog before my dogs can react.....inevitably even though MY dogs are LEASHED and under CONTROL as the law requires, they will most certainly be blamed because of their looks (big and blocky).  It is not fair, but I have to take the right precautions to protect MY dogs from idiots who let their dogs run loose.  I rarely even walk in my own neighborhood because people's dogs run right out of their yards....it is frustrating and ridiculous.  I have only had to use this once, and while it DID stop the dog (I have horrible aim, and did NOT hit it on the nose as you are supposed to but instead hit her forehead) and the dog ran away momentarily, she did return.  Luckily I was in MY OWN YARD when this happened and was able to get in my front door before the dog had the guts to rush us again (she stayed about 5 feet away).  This is meant to startle and deter a dog, and will NOT harm them...which is why this is my first choice of defense.  I dont want to hurt another dog as it is not their fault that their owners' are irresponsible idiots.  BUT that being said, I also carry pepper spray JUST IN CASE the citronella does not stop and the dog is aggressive (Pepper spray can spray back on YOU or your DOGS, so be very careful...which is hard when all of this happens in an instant.  And in some cases pepper spray will actually aggrivate an aggressive dog MORE).  And in the event that I am truely scared for MY OWN personal safety from a charging aggressive dog, then pure lead is my third option.....and I hope to never encounter any.  I would not rely on this as protection, just a detterrant to give YOU time to get away.

It appears to me that my African Cichlids may be more at home with this product.  I feel that the closer you can get to the natural environment of your fish, the healthier they are. I do not know any way to prove it works, but I will continue to use it.

I bought this for my cats so when I go away for the night they still get fed in the morning. I was expecting the unit to be smaller than it is but overall it looks nicer than I expected and arrived very quickly. I am very happy with my purchase and I will update the review in a few months to let you know how it held up and if my cats figured out how to get to the food.
I like this leash a lot. Helps to keep my arm attached to my body instead of being yanked away by my strong pitbull mix.

Both of my cats love this squirrel and will hug him, toss him, beat him up, and sleep with him. His belly pouch actually stays firmly closed, which is grat as I don't want catnip all over the floor. Based on my cats' 5-star reviews of the squirrel, I bought a couple more for my mom's cat and sister's cat, who wholeheartedly agree. Four cats, 5 stars all around. I've never found another cat toy this universally popular.

This is a good product. Sturdy, well designed, and our cats love to use it. That helps keep our couches with fewer scratches but this isn't a perfect solution, they still scratch the couch. Think of it as part of the solution. Excellent product though. I think it is worth the money.
This is very large and sturdy. It requires a broomstick through the handle to work it into the ground, but it will not come out anytime soon. I have a lab and it stands up to her strength.

This harness is perfect for walking my 50 lb. 9 month old lab mix.  It is easy to put on and is not big and bulky like some harnesses.  After reading the reviews, I ordered the Medium/Large (which I most likely would not have) and it fits perfect with just a few small adjustments.  Reflective stitching is a bonus!

These feel more solid than any of the small terrarium water dishes I have found on Amazon.  They also look more authentic, not that my tarantulas really care.  I'd highly recommend starting with THIS ONE if you're trying to decide which brand to try.  I have eight of these (all small), and all have come in good, working condition.

Purchased this to replace the standard Fluval Spec V light.  Initially, I had trouble trying to figure out how to extend the legs of the light.  Thankfully, an Amazon review mentioned that they're tight, and you may have to exert a little to extend the side legs.  Since then, I'm up and running, with no issues.  My fish look beautiful, and my plants are thriving.I also connected this light to a Current timer, the dimming function won't work, but otherwise they work well together.

This is my second bottle of Water Clarifier. I love using this after my filter change to quickly clear funk that is released into the water after every cleaning. Also great if your child likes to (over)feed your fish.

This smells wonderful, and if you have a dog that doesn't actually have problems with their ears (like my Aussie) it's a great product. BUT if you have a dog that tends to get ear infections (like my Golden), you need a better cleaner.
This is the cutest cat bed ever. My cat loves to lay in it and play in and on it. It has kept its shape and was a great purchase

My dog loves this bed - it's huge. He is 75lbs and there's plenty of room leftover with the XL. The color is also great and is easily washable. However, since getting this bed, I also got a Big Shrimpy brand bed from Amazon and the quality on that bed is better but this shape works great for a spot in the living room. I'd recommend this bed but the other is my favorite. The dog, of course, loves both.

I love how this blanket looks, but it is soooo tiny. It's literally the size of three hand prints. My westie is only three months and it won't cover him fully. Many people who reviewed this product said their dog bite the head off, but my pup hasn't. He doesn't seem to be interested in the blanket especially after we bought him a bigger and softer blanket. This "blanket" should be use to dry dishes. ,)

A friend of mine had to put his cat down this week. He applied this flea treatment to his cat and it caused a red, open sore. He started to notice his cat was becoming lethargic and took him to the vet but it was too late. The cat's organs had already begun to shut down and it was too late to save him. The cat had suffered some sort of reaction to it and also, since the product did not work, his cat was infested with fleas and became anemic. Please, pass on this one.

No more need to pick up stuffing.  No more need to worry about your dog choking on yet another squeaker so surgically removed by the doggy.All you need is a supply of plastic water bottles.  Even if you don't use bottled water, you can find an empty bottle around.Dog crunches on the toy, with the bottle inside.  Not much more to say except, if you want a less messy toy, this one is it.
Our Golden Retriever hungrily scarfs down this product.  She seems to think it's "arfilicious."  We will be buying more of it.  Amber recommends buying some for your hungry dogs!

Have sisal scratching post on the cat towers of our home. Also have 7 (YES seven) cats, and have been finding thanks to 'Jackson Galaxy & My Cat from Hell', that I really needed more scratching surfaces for my babies. Our newest addition to our feline family, Buttercups Brittawnee Secret Squirrel, earned her name by finding out that she could jump and scratch around the SmartCat Ultimate Scratching Post just like a squirrel! For some reason, my other cats took their dear sweet time discovering that the post was not just for the baby, but they are all coming around. I also have a wonderful horizontal scratching lounger, the everybody loves, but this SmartCat Ultimate Scratching Post will soon be loved by all of my cat family! Smudging organic catnip into the sides of this scratching post drives our baby kitten wild and attracts the others as well! Love, love, love this product! Wish I could afford at least 2 more because I would make a window perch out them, and that would be the ultimate cat window perch because the height is perfect and it is sturdy enough to accommodate a piece of wood or mdf atop it! Hey, if you can afford 2, try my suggestion. But if you can only get one, you will not be disappointed...And your felines will love it!
1x1x1 inches?  What is this, a rubber snack?  Not going to buy it if I can't tell what I'm purchasing.  This needs a better description.

I really like the price, and the fact that these come as a combo pack.  My only complaint is that the daytime lights tend to burn out much more quickly than the night-time lights.  I always try to keep an extra box of lightbulbs handy, because they can be unpredictable as far as how long the lights last.

I bought this as a training aid for my pup.  We had been working on recall, but she is highly distracted and would take off at the sight of a bird or a plane in the sky or who knows what.  I was worried about her getting hit by a car  or running off and getting lost.  This leash gave her the ability to roam and play and gave me a piece of mind knowing that she was still attached to me.  My biggest concern with a long line was it being able to hold her strength.  She's a forty pound little tank, and when she takes off, she has a 50ft head start.  But, so far so good. It's held up great over the last couple of months.  Only complaint is it's hard to wash and seems to hold on to the stench of whatever it was drug though.  Soaking this leash in a tub doesn't seem to clean it, and throwing it in the washing machine resulted in a huge tangle that took forever to undo.  I haven't found a good way to clean it yet, which may be why it stinks so bad.  I still use it because I'd rather be safe than sorry, but the smell of mud, poo, and ocean isn't doing it any favors.  Definitely sits outside in a little box far far away from our noses.  I just wish there was an easier way to wash it.

The amount of skim the first week was amazing to see it working.  I did have a skimmer from Instant Ocean and it was crap compared to this unit.  Coralife's Bubble production from the motor is great.  I did have a problem two weeks into running... the motor starting making noise.  It was the plastic housing holding the motor shaft in place, was cracked.  I removed the cracked part of the housing so that it was wouldn't fall loose into the motor causing more damage and decide to sill run it.  Called their customer service and a new housing would be replaced, no hassle, no questions asked other than name and address.
Have been using WeeWee pads since I brought my dog home, these are great. The only thing, my dog needs two. He will not mix his business, #1 goes on one pad #2 goes on another. Oh well :)

I got this to mix with the chlorahexadine shampoo that my vet gave me for my dog's skin issues.  The vet's shampoo doesn't lather well, but this one does.  It also smells wonderful.  I'm not sure how it would work on itchy skin alone, but it blends well with the other shampoo I have to use on my dog and allows me to work up a good lather.  He looks clean and shiny afterwards and smells nice for days.
I have a king sized Dober-girl (100 lbs.) who has accidents at night sometimes.  This diaper does the trick! Excellent

I did a ton of research on raw prepared food for dogs before deciding on this product and feel happy about my purchase. My dog had a severe issue w/struvite bladder stones a year and a half ago and had been on Hills C/D to prevent reoccurrence, but due to the poor nutritional quality of the prescription food, I decided to go the 'raw route' which my research indicates is the way to go for the all around well being of dogs in almost all cases. (If your dog has struvite issues that have been diagnosed as GENETIC rather than bladder infection related, by all means LISTEN TO YOUR VET for the best course of action!!)The food was shipped very quickly in an impressive carton complete with dry ice, well insulated in Styrofoam. (My dog always seems to know when a package is for 'her' and crowds me when I open these boxes. She was super curious about the dry ice, so use caution opening the box on the floor if your pooch is the same way.)Medium size hockey puck shaped patties are frozen solid and come on a resealable bag which fit well in my refrigerator's freezer. (The bag is taller rather than wider so the space saving's nice!)  They take about 30 minutes to thaw at room temp, but since this is raw meat, I would recommend thawing in refrigerator if you take them out sooner than a half hour before feeding. This product contains finely ground bones as well as the meat, so if you have hesitated to feed raw due to the choking or piercing of insides from bones, this product is a godsend.I initially offered my dog a small taste of one before mixing with her other food and she rejected it, although when I mashed them up and mixed in with other food she's familiar with, she ate them with no problems.  I started her out with 1 patty for a 5 day period, then 2 patties for another 5 days and finally 3 patties - reducing her other 'processed' food accordingly.  No stomach upset whatsoever, even though I've had problems with that before when introducing a new food.The downside of this product is the cost to feed.  My dog's 40 lbs and if I fed her this product exclusively it would be a small fortune.  The guidelines recommended (for this product only) are as follows for my dog's size and activity level:40 lb dog - moderate activity level:12 ozs twice a day (total of 24 oz for 1 day of feeding)Do the math - The bags holds 56 ozs and I should feed 24 ozs a day.  This would mean less than 3 days worth of food for $20+ dollars!I have made my bag last a month by using this product in conjunction with other foods (canned salmon, red and sweet potatoes, another brand of dehydrated raw food).  The beauty of this is that it's raw meat, compliments other foods, and does not need to be fed exclusively, so for the piece of mind my dog is off the canned and the BHA/BHT laden kibble, it's well worth it.4 stars for the cost of the product.
My doggie LOVES this toy, which means I LOVE this toy.  He grabbed it out of my hands as soon as i took it out of the box and plays with it every day.  Great idea -- great toy.

My puppy loves to come with me pretty much wherever I go and he feels very secure in this carrier.  It is a good size for him...he is a Maltese.  (I got the medium and it is the black croc style...no flowers!)
My cat's sores are healing nicely.  He doesn't mind the daily application, he used to run away when I was using another brand.Happy cat, happy me!
This stuff works well but you do end up with purple paper around... we have to brush Buddy our guinea pig off before we can hold him...
I use these pads for the kitties that are in my enclosed sun porch. They love them. Aren't quite warm enough for outside use.

Ive actually been feeding our Doxie this for many months...I found this larger...better priced...bag to purchase.  I put about 1/8th. cup of water in her bowl with about 1.5 oz. (a heaping 8th of a cup) and let it sit 5+ minutes, so it plumps...she loves this and struggles with her patience for me to sit it down. She gets this 2 a day, morning and dinner time. It has kept her weight in check, plus her health is good...she also has a shiny coat.
We buy them often and will continue. Our cats love these more than any other toys. They wear well too.

I think if you are buying random dog food at the grocery store the Purina Beneful is probably one of the best available. If you're truly looking to buy the BEST dog food, then you're not shopping at the grocery store in the first place. For the average dog the Beneful offers the basic nutritional requirements of course and it goes a little farther than the generics out there. The three dogs in our house that tried it (mixed with their normal far more expensive organic food) ate with no hesitation. They seemed to like the flavor and only one of them had any digestive upset and that was very mild.I could not give the Beneful to the other three dogs though and this is the reason for the one star deduction....it contains corn. If you have a dog with skin allergies then you know you have to avoid corn, wheat and soy in their food and treats. Bottom line... if you're feeding a regular dog and your dogs has NO allergy issues, then Beneful is a decent choice. Just beware.. contains corn and that could be a big problem.
This is a great deal for a good quality treat. I use them for training and my pup loves them!

Premier Twist and Treat / B0002I0RLWThis is a nice little treat dispensing toy, but it's a bit tricky for humans to handle. The toy is shaped like a child's spinning top, with two halves (top and bottom) that unscrew from each other. You unscrew the top half, and try to balance the bottom half with one hand while you pour doggy kibble and tiny, cut-up treats into the bottom half. Once the bottom half is full, you use your "food pouring hand" to screw the top half back on. It's a bit of a balancing act, and I prefer theOmega Paw Tricky Treat Ball, because the Omega ball is much easier to fill. Maybe two parent families will have an easier time with the Premier.As for doggie enjoyment, my puppy likes the Premier Twist and Treat well enough, mostly because he's discovered that one really hard bat of the paw will cause the toy to spin on its axis and pretty much expel all the food right away. (My puppy is currently 4 months old, and 12 pounds.) Once again, for a better time-to-treat ratio, I recommend the Omega ball.Still, the puppy likes both the Premier and Omega and I like giving him a variety of toys, so this gets 4 stars from me. I have not had any troubles with toy durability, but I'm also blessed with a puppy that doesn't chew very much (yet!). I *highly* recommend filling this toy primarily with the dog's usual kibble, with a few treats interspaced in the mix as "surprises". There's really no need to stuff it full of treats - the puppy enjoys the toy just as much, and it makes "dinner time" a more interactive and exercising experience! I chop my doggie treats up very finely for training purposes and my puppy is always eager for the taste of a treat without filling up or getting sluggish or fat.~ Ana Mardoll
One can, and my kitten will no longer eat his dry food. My boy would rather lick around the Tiki Cat bowl, than eat his kibbles now. I guess I'll be ordering more Tik iCat.
No the best product for my money but it's and ok toy.  Some cats may like it but my cat was not crazy about it.

Sometimes, a really intricate and full-featured treat pouch just isn't what you need.  You're going on a simple walk, and you don't want bulk.  Also, sometimes your bulkier or more complex training bag can't isolate a really high-value (smellier) treat without mixing it up with something else.  This pouch closes easily (although it is sometimes a two-handed action to close it), holds a convenient small amount of training-size treats and is made of a durable fabric.Special highlight: the belt clip is super easy and yet doesn't come off with everyday use unless you want it to!  Some belt clips are sticky or extra-tight, this one is perfect, in my opinion.  I will sometimes wear this pouch in addition to my more many-pocketed training bag to hold a high-value reward or a simpler dry biscuit, or even a tennis ball.  An ergonomic, doggie-proof, spill-proof and comfortable little guy!

Gross, messy, time-consuming. You really have to thump it around to get litter clumps moving. It's really messy rolling the thing around. I went back to twenty seconds a day of scooping a normal litter box.
Dogs got diarrhea everytime I gave them one of these, threw them out,  will not try them again, sorry for the dogs.
My little man loves these but I will not be getting them again. Not until I find some made in the USA.
Good seal, no problems woith bugs in the food.  I keep it in the garage.  I like that you can see how much food is left, it helps to know when to re-purchase.Good capacity, too.
I love it and my poodle loves it. Now he can see outside when he goes for a ride. Good quality product, looks nice and a reasonable price too.
My cat doesn't seem to detect any change to her water and her tartar seemed to be getting better in the last month I've used this additive.

Works very well.  No leak when it's in the lock position.  For some reason my dog  prefers drinking out of this instead of his water bowl at home.  You can also twist it off to drink it and dispense it for your dog if needed.

Our cat went crazy over it. The novelty has wore off a bit but that is probably because it isn't something new anymore. She still plays with it though. At least for the foreseeable future, all we'll have to do is squeeze it a bit to refresh the catnip scent. When that stops working we will spray it with catnip oil.

Received this lounger from the Seller in excellent time, way before the estimated delivery date. Have 6 cats (in New York City!) and did not even have to coax any of them to scratch on it. Seller was prompt, courteous and offered the best price point on this particular style lounger. Its lines are as nice as a piece of Art Deco furniture. This product is easy to put away when company comes, as our placement for it is by the coffee table in the living room. Have noticed that our cat family have scratched less on things that they should not and it has only been a few days! Only one note of concern, and it is not about the Seller, have noticed that one of my kittens has been throwing up since the arrival of this lounger. Am not certain if it is product related, or what, but it coincides with the arrival of the product. Will keep you posted for an update to let you know, though.Would definitely recommend this product from this Seller.

I've long used the Angel Eyes powder for my Maltese.For some reason, she had a very bad attack of both tears and tear stain.  No matter what I did, we couldn't get rid of them.I ordered this product out of desperation.  It worked!One word of caution....I tried giving her a whole chew, but it gave her very loose stools.  I cut it down to 1/2 and it seems to work just fine.  My dog weighs 7 lbs.

When you get your fingers near a catnip toy and play with the cat, you risk getting scratched.  The longer tail is perfect for dangling it in front of the cat's nose and then letting them have it to scratch, chew, and kick the hind legs on.

We bought this item for one reason only - to get our lab to stop barking outside, driving us and the neighbors crazy.  She will bark, bark, bark and refuses to come in the house,totally blows us off when we call her.  Our results here are probably a bit unique because we already use the PefSafe Containment system so our dog is used to an electronic collar.  We've had great success with that fencing system with three dogs now, love it and now we LOVE the remote trainer.  I put it on her last night and let her outside, which usually begins the barking marathons and sure enough, she started.  I stepped outside and yelled for her to COME, and of course she didn't.  I pushed the sound signal ONLY on the remote, and she immediately came in the house happily.  She did not even require a correction.  This morning when I let her out, I made sure she saw the new collar and put it on her in addition to her fence collar, and she went outside to do her usual morning roaming without even one bark.  When I went out and called for her to come in she came inside with the first call.  Now, again, she is used to an electronic collar so if this is new for your dog you may not get such immediate results, but I can't say enough good things about PetSafe and their products.  They WORK.  There are cheaper remote trainers, but I stuck with the brand that has worked for us with the fencing, and I'm glad I did.  Barking problem solved!

I ordered one of these for the Hydro Pro sponges in my 75 gallon goldfish tank. This pump runs much more quietly than the less powerful Whisper pump I was using before, and it creates a good flow through my sponge filters. I purchased this pump last August. It's February now, and this pump still works as quietly and effectively as when I first bought it. If I have any major problems in the near future, I will update this review, but as of now I am quite pleased.UPDATE: My pump is still running effectively and quietly. It continues to work from both outputs (which is more than I can say for cheaper pumps that tend to give out within a year). I purchased a second one of these for another tank located in my bedroom, and it's running just as effectively and quietly as the first. These do cost a bit more, but it's worth the extra boost in performance and reliability, in my opinion. Unless something better comes along, this will be my go-to filter for my larger tanks.

I've used this stuff for years and it works great.  It drys out (as would jello) but if you just keep it hydrated it will stay in its form for several days.  I use a capful ever 4-7 days.  It's perfect to put with the Fluker's Orange Cube Complete Cricket Diet into a safe container for the crickets.  Add a thin layer of water to the bottom of it and it will stay hydrated.  Don't mix this product with anything that should be dry (such as cricket feed) because it will dry out quicker and crickets wont survive as long.

I've had this for our turtle tank for a while, it's a 50 gallon tank but usually filled about 30-40 gallons. One complaint is the top doesn't quite fit right. There were more times that it fell off into the water after replacing filters or didn't fit on right that we have stopped putting the top over the filter which makes it ugly and I suspect a bit louder than intended.For our 2 small turtles and the miscellaneous bottom feeders in the tank it's been adequate. Levels are good (after we got the tank established) and the filter and the bottom feeders keep the tank pretty clear. I haven't had any problems with the functionality and the tank even smells like fresh pond water (lovely out camping, wilderness, water when you're right up against the tank) I will probably not buy it again because I'm looking to upgrade to a higher quality filter and am planning to make an investment and not a cheap, that'll do, purchase.AS FAR AS WHISPERYea the filter is whisper quiet when the water level is right up to the lip, let evaporation do it's job and it'll drive ya nuts. Though when that much waters evaporated the noise has served as a good, maintenance and cleanup reminder.Perfect purchase to get your tank started then decide what you want to upgrade as the lifecycle of starter items is usually ~1-1.5 years, then spend the money on quality items individually since it's often tough to buy a bunch of high quality items up front.

As pet food, this Standlee Hay Company Premium Western Timothy Hay is a great buy. It is excellent quality hay (much better that I have seen in pet stores, etc.). It comes very well packaged, sealing in the freshness and it smells very sweet when opened. The hay is first packed in a thick plastic bag and then placed inside a sturdy cardboard box (see customer image I uploaded). The dimensions of the 10 lb box are: 16" tall, 15" wide, and 15" deep.This hay is also a great buy as inexpensive nesting material for Purple Martins. Martins prefer gourds/housing that look as though they have been previously used by other Martins and this Premium Western Timothy hay is an inexpensive nesting material for lining Purple Martin gourds/housing to achieve that look in preparation for Purple Martins returning in the spring. I usually put a level teaspoon of Sevins Dust and another of diatomaceous earth in the bottom of the gourds and cover it with a handful ofAspen Chipsfollowed by a layer of Timothy Hay and then sprinkle another teaspoon of diatomaceous earh inside the entrance along the outside edge of the nesting material and then jostle it a bit to settle it in. This will kill any mites that the birds might bring in with them. Mites leave the birds after feeding and travel throughout the nest where the diatomaceous earth and Sevins Dust kills them. Once this dust, chip and hay preparation is complete the returning birds might or might not remove some of what I have added and then happily begin building their own nest to their liking and I never have a problem with mites on my adult or baby birds and they all seem quite happy. I do change the nests once the babies are old enough, following the same procedure above.Timothy Hay and Aspen chips (a hardwood chip) are very similar to what Purple Martins make their nests out of naturally (when not offered other nesting materials) and they tend to attract new Purple Martins to gourds/housing. Purple Martins naturally start their nests with straw, dried grasses (hay), twigs and sometimes mulch if they can find it, and to this they build a mud dam right beneath the front entrance hole. They then will pick fresh leaves to line their nest and lay their eggs on. It is thought that they use the fresh leaves to keep their eggs moist.When using Timothy Hay or Kaytee Aspen Chips/Shavings, rosin and aromatic hydrocarbons (two allergenic/toxic substances found in pine straw/needles, and pine and cedar chips/shavings) are not a concern as neither contain them. Kaytee Aspen Chips/Shavings are made from the non-toxic hardwood Aspen tree.  Aspen chips and shavings are the only wood chips/shavings approved by the FDA and EPA for use by humans and animals and are suggested for use as nesting material by a US Fish & Wildlife health center.There are those that avoid using wood chips and hay as Purple Martin nesting materials believing them to be more susceptible to moisture retention and instead use pine straw/needles because they contain pine resin that makes them moisture resistant. But ironically, the very thing that makes the pine straw/needles moisture resistant, the pine resin - a.k.a. rosin, is also a substance that both people and animals might have or develop serious allergies to. One of my dogs is highly allergic to the rosin from coniferous trees and breaks out in a terrible rash (dermatitis) when she comes into contact with it on the bare skin of her under-belly. Rosin is also found in cedar chips (and other coniferous tree wood chips and shavings) and newspaper ink, two other items regularly used for nesting material for Martins, and so I wouldn't use or recommend using cedar chips, other coniferous tree chips, or shredded newspaper as nesting materials. Rosin might not affect adult birds with feathers, but new hatchlings' skin is bare.In addition to rosin, pine straw/needles also contain allergenic/toxic mold spores that gather in both the needles and bark of pine trees during wet conditions. And both pine and cedar wood chips and shavings also contain aromatic hydrocarbons, which studies have shown to have a negative impact on the health of both humans and animals. These hydrocarbons are absorbed through the skin on contact with these woods and then enter the bloodstream, or they are inhaled as wood dust particles, causing asthma and respiratory infections, impairing the liver's ability to detoxify, weakening the immune system, and possibly causing cancer (a study found that woodworkers exposed to aromatic softwood dust have a higher incidence of squamous cell cancers of the respiratory tract).

I have two cats and two litter boxes, side by side. I filled the smaller one with this litter and left the regular litter (Precious Cat Ultra Premium Clumping Cat Litter) in the other box. After several days, here's the verdictPros:Room smells great...even better than the full-time air filter.Smaller granules tracked from the panLess litter comes with the removed feces and urineCons:The urine clumps readily fall apart before making their way out of the box. This is awful really. It means only the feces truly makes it out. I think even the cats notice because after the first day, they would only poop in this box.All told, while I like the idea of this litter, it really doesn't work for me and the kitties. Urine clumps that fall apart and cats avoiding the box are not signs of a 'winner' cat litter in our house. That said it does smell great AND it tracks out fo the box much more discreetly than the other litter.Pick what's important to you as an owner.

I have been struggling to get my cat to eat after her diagnosis.  She does not like prescription foods! I still have to mix something else in to get her to eat it, but she will eat it most days and will eat more of it than any other food I try to feed her.  I will be anxious to see how her readings are the next time we go in.  At this point, the vet said eating is more important.  So I do what I have to do!I do appreciate that this food is way less expensive than prescription food. Overall, I am happy and will keep ordering it.  Thank you!

I've had this for a couple weeks now and i cant say i recommend it. Its a confusing product to learn, isnt easy to use, and is pretty limited in terms of space. If you still are interested in it, I do my best in the following to explain how it works and the issues.Firstly, if you dont use an retractable leash for you dog this definitely isnt for you. In this organizer you put the leash in the middle and wrap the velcro handles around it so the end result is the handle sticking out of the bag for you to hold. I dont use a retactable leash so i have to attach the velcro handles around my belt and doing that everytime is a hassle.Now that i tried to explain about that ,let me go through the usage:(1) the flap at the front is hard to open and requires 2 hands.(2) now once you manage to open the flap you are presented with just 4 slots. 2 on the left are really small and im not quite sure what useful thing can go in there. The middle slot is the biggest and for your phone, this one fit perfectly for my samsung galaxy s2. it also has an additional velcro handle to further secure your phone is place. the last slot is for the poop bags , with a slit in the middle to easily draw them out. but once again its pretty small, dont expect to have more than ~3 at one time.(3)behind the slots is the middle portion of the bag where you attach the retractable leash. you can also squeeze some extra stuff under this because there is access to that middle portion after you open the flap at the front.
