Aquarium filters remove many harmful chemicals, but nitrates do accumulate over time, and the way to remove them is by periodic partial water changes, usually something like 20% per week. The old way was to siphon water out into a bucket, which was dumped down the sink, commode, or in the yard. The bucket was then refilled and poured back into the tank.To change water in this manner was a little bit labor intensive on a small tank, and really time consuming on a larger tank.I stumbled on my pump in a Thrift store, where I found it on a shelf for $1. In all honesty, I'm not 100% sure mine is Lee brand, as it wasn't in the original package, and there is no name on it. It may actually be a knock-off. Mine is made of blue plastic, and looks identical to the item pictured.It operates by connecting it to a water supply, which can be either an outside hose spigot, or by using the adapter, a kitchen faucet.Water flows through from top to bottom, past a venturi located where the side fitting is, creating a suction which will draw water out of the aquarium through a hose. I purchased 50 feet of clear vinyl hose from my local aquarium store, attached it to this device, and put a suction strainer on the other end to avoid sucking small fish into the hose.In use, I drop the suction strainer into the tank, unroll the hose, and attach the pump to the water tap outside my front door. Opening the diverter (the blue collar) on the pump outlet, then turning on the water tap starts a siphon which removes as much water from my tank as I desire (water tap can be closed once siphon starts so long as the pump is lower than the tank, siphon will continue).Closing the diverter on the pump outlet stops the siphon, and opening the water tap with the diverter closed refills the tank.I can't imagine any way to make water changes any easier. I've been using this device for years now, and it still works great.There are also attachments which allow you to vacuum the gravel with the water siphoning out of the tank, if you feel the need to perform this task (I never vacuum because I don't use an undergravel filter, because I use EcoComplete substrate, and because I have fish which eat any food which falls to the bottom, so for me, the need simply isn't there).

the clips to go onto the collar are not the ones on the pictures, so I have sent them back. very disappointed as I have been waiting quite a while and really looking for ward to these leashes with my dogs. I hope they send correct replacements rather than the refunds.
Pretty simple really, I just put the mat under the litter box so when the cat exits, the excess litter falls into the mat, I shake out the mat once a week and there you have it.

I was hoping that mega-bucks Racael Ray would put out a better dog food then this. Out of the first 10 ingredients, five are terrible and should not be fed to a dog that you love. Chicken Meal,Corn Meal,Soybean Meal,Corn Gluten Meal,Dried Beet Pulp-research these products for yourself, they are the top 5 items that cause allergies and food intolerance in animals among other things-that is 50% of the first ten items.I expected better from Racael Ray! On the plus side however, her "Just 6" treats is one of BEST products out there, so I know she has the knowledge to make heathy foods for pets, just not willing to part with her money in her dog food line. My dogs LOVE the Just 6 treats and because they are super good for them I do not mind feeding them the treats but not the food.

I bought the 24" bed for my 12 pound, 6 month old Havanese puppy.  It's very soft and plush.  He's a rescue (he was slated to be a puppy mill stud dog-- please do NOT buy your dogs from pet stores and promote that horrible practice!!), so he's not used to such comforts.  But he happily climbs into his bed when his "parents" are on the couch.  He sometimes likes to lay straight, rather than curled into a ball.  When he does so, he hangs his head outside the bed, rather than on a side bumpers.  But he seems to like that just fine!  We haven't washed it yet, but I like that the bottom bad is removeable for easy cleaning.
These treats are one of my dog's favorites! I like this company, they make a lot of great treats, and the ingredients are from the U.S.

installation: i have an 08 A4 and the installation was a bit tedious. it seems that most seat covers are not designed for cars smaller than SUVs.touch: every time my dogs would move their paws it would this sound, and after an hour drive it began to sound like nails against a chalkboard.it does its job, but will i order it again, no.

I bought the Spotbot Pet because one of our cats pukes practically every day.  The poor guy just can't keep his food down a lot of the time, and we haven't been able to figure out the cause (most of the time it isn't a hairball).To use the machine, first pick up any solid part of the mess.  Then you just make sure the machine has water and cleaning solution in the tank, center the big round brush area over the mess, plug it in, press a  button, and walk away.  About 3-6 minutes later (depending on whether you pressed the button for &#34,fresh&#34, or &#34,set-in&#34,) you can empty and rinse the dirty tank and put the machine away.What I like:- easy to use- no excuse not to clean up the mess right away- works ok on fresh messes- completely automatic: start it and walk away- onboard hose and accessory tool storage works wellWhat I don't like:- doesn't work very well on set-in messes- leaves the floor much wetter than our full-size Hoover Dual-V carpet cleaner- just as noisy as our full-size carpet cleaner- power cord storage works okay, but could be improvedMost of my likes and dislikes above are pretty self-explanatory.  We've tried it with both hot and cold water, and the temperature of the water doesn't seem to make much difference in the machine's ability to clean up a set-in mess.  I'd recommend pretreating with a foaming or spray carpet cleaner if you have a set-in stain.Unfortunately, after using it on the living room carpet, I kept stepping on the spot that had been cleaned, and for more than a day it continued to make my socks wet whenever I stepped on it.A minor gripe is that the power cord storage isn't as good as it could be.  If you wrap the cord in a circle around the two storage pegs, the cord will get twisted and over time will become damaged internally.  It's too difficult to use the over-under cord coiling technique.  If you wrap the cord in a figure-8 around the pegs in an attempt to keep the cord from twisting, it starts to bulge out too much in the middle of the figure-8, and the loops of the figure-8 can come off of the pegs.The Spotbot also has a manual brush, and while it can be somewhat useful for trying to scrub in corners where the spotbot itself can't reach, the manual brush isn't anything special.  But at least it's on par with the other portable spot cleaners.
I like this crate.  I bought it for a puppy so really liked that you can divide it as the dog grows
My dogs love the duck treats.  Been buying them for several months. A great source of protein. Price on amazon is better than instore.

I use this with my 75lb golden retriever.  He's 8 years old and has mostly been a home dog but now we live somewhere with sidewalks so I like to take him out.  It works very well.  Prevents pulling and helps remind him to stay by my side.  He wasn't afraid at all but if we stand around too long he will start pawing at it.  He used one when he was a puppy so it could be that it is familiar to him.  Now every time he sees it he knows it is walk time and goes crazy for a moment, then sits nicely while I put it on.  It was a good purchase.

I got this to replace a dial gauge that came with my "starter kit for desert animals" that I bought for my bearded dragon. The dial gauge kept reading around 70% or higher humidity. This one reads 30% and is very quick to adjust to changes.I'm happy with this.

This is our 2nd e-collar.  I lost the remote to the 1st one we had (or maybe the dog hid it!).  We do a lot of off-leash walking, running, bike riding with our dog.  He's good 90% of the time but for that 10% when he picks up a scent or decides to bolt... this allows me to give him a buzz and knock his mind off whatever he's chasing.  I also use it for general training.  The 'vibration' button is typically all he needs.  Just a gentle reminder.  But if I need to buzz with more emphasis, this does that too.Pros:-Vibration button-Set up (can be confusing but once you read the instructions and understand how it works, it's great)-Customization of the 'shock' intensity and the 'boost' intensity.-The light feature is awesome!  Our neighborhood does not have sidewalks so from the remote I can light up our dog's collar and it's bright!  Great if you don't know where your pooch is at night too.-Range.  Not sure how far this really goes but in general 3/4 of a mile is really far.  Our pooch has been pretty far away and I know this has worked every time so far.Cons:The size of the remote is just a little large for me.  If you're holding it in your hand all the time it's very well setup.  But I like to carry it in my pocket and it's a little big. Not too big though (still fits in my pants pocket).  This is a minor complaint.Overall:Great product.
Well I had to send it back because someone tagged the toy as size Medium. I have a Yorkie and the toy was the same size as his head. I have reordered another. Hope it is the right size.

My puppy got a tick when he first got here. I got this and he hasn't had any fleas, or even a single tick. I live in Atlanta, and it's almost June and the fleas and ticks are abundant so this is very impressive. I was told to get FrontLine by the shelter that I got him from, but decided I'd try this instead.I'm a believer and I'll most certainly be getting it again. I HAVE heard that it's not always effective. My dog is black and it's working great for him, but if you have a light colored dog that fleas like more, you may find it's not as effective as some other brands.ADDED:We went hiking in the woods for his 6 month half birthday and were also around quite a few other dogs. He came back with fleas :( In defense of the product, his weight is right on the edge of the proper weight for the medication because he grew faster than I expected (shelter told me wrong mix of breeds) and I didn't want to buy more medicine. I'll be getting the proper weight size and using this again... it was working so well until we went into the woods, and his weight is right on the maximum of the weight.. so it might be too weak now.

Works great! Keeps my dog in his seat, out of my face, and not jumping out the window. That was my main intent and for that it's perfect. :)But I am skeptical how well it would protect him in an actual crash. It's paired with a &#34,car safe&#34, harness, but the metal on the actual seat belt doesn't seem very trustworthy to hold even my 55 lb Aussie. I wouldn't trust it for anything bigger, for sure.Also don't let your chewer get to it, obviously! He chewed right through the nylon of the first belt but hasn't messed with the second one because I'm careful to not leave him in the car with it. :)

Spud loves this stuff. Whenever he hears the bag, he comes begging for some, it's very cute. I do not like the recommendation they give on the bag to give 1-2 teaspoons daily. There are raisins and other sugary items in this &#34,cocktail&#34, that will upset a chinchilla's sensitive digestive system if given more quantity that he really needs. I generally give about 1-2 pieces during Spud's playtime and both of us are happy with that arrangement.

As a dog trainer and also having a large German Shepherd I LOVE LOVE LOVE all Kong toys, have several and recommend them to my clients.  They are amazing and great for tough chewers! They will outlast almost everything so they are worth every penny.  I have a special passion for helping more dogs stay in their forever home so I am offering personalized dog advice on my website: webDogTrainer.com, come on over and say hi!

When I first purchased the Green Killing Machine 3 watt uv sterilizer it worked fine.  It's cheaply made, however, given its price, this is to be expected.I am using this unit on a 20 gallon long tank, which is at the maximum of this uv sterilizer's rating.What is strange is that the red light on the control box which contains the electronics for the uv sterilizer lamp, is still on.  However, when the water becomes cloudy and I place the unit in my aquarium to clear the water, it remains murky even after running for several days.The problem must be with the uv bulb, which would mean that the circuitry in the electronic's box is not functioning properly, since if the bulb were out, the red light on the box should be off.However, since the red light is still on, yet the water is not clearing, perhaps the bulb is no longer operating within the spectrum it was designed for.If this is the case, then given that I have only used this unit in my aquarium a few times, this would relate to a quality control issue.As a stand alone powerhead, the unit works quite well, and is very cleverly designed, with the power head and uv sterilizer lamp having separate mains plugs.As such, once the bulb fails you can simply cut the wire from the lamp portion of this unit and still use it as a powerhead, or just toss the lamp and purchase a new one, which you then attach to the powerhead.Or for about $10 more, buy an entire unit.It's just unfortunate that there appears to be a quality control issue here, since the unit only functioned for a brief time.

My dog(pitbull)  loved it. Only he figure it out how to destroy so now I have rubber all over the floor. But  hey if he's happy then I'm happy. It last him like 4 hours, which is more then I expected. Usually he eats a big pork bone in less then an hour so for a toy it's more then enough.
They go flat fast. You have to go to the store and buy a couple of bags of poly-fil and puff it back up after about a week. But overall it's pretty awesome for my Rhodesian Ridgeback and Retriever.
I love this item. It is bigger than you think it would be but really, not a nuisance. Changing the litter box has never been easier. ALSO it really, truly does keep the smell OUT. I love it!

As stated, if you read the instructions, it goes together very quickly. The door I put it on is mostly glass with a wood frame. My only gripe might be the strong smell of the carpet glue but that's fading and the cats didn't seem to mind. I have a small, cat rescue and the cats are kept in kennels and let out to play. This helped my cats be comfortable on the drive from FL to CA. There was no crying and they were very calm throughout the entire journey. It has also helped them to become comfortable in our new home. I would highly recommend to anyone who has a cat that is anxious.

My dog loves these. Unfortunately they smell exactly like they are = a bull pizzle!! Due to the smell I won't be buying anymore. I have my dogs chew them outside, since they use their legs to hold on to, they come inside with stinky smell all over them.
Very good.  I needed refills for my Litter Locker and these fill the bill.

The food quality is excellent with little to no waste once the birds have eaten. I however switched to a different brand because I needed more than 2 pounds at a time, which this company doesn't offer.
The quality of cat food in Whiskas pouches is awesomely good.  The food smells, looks, and tastes great.  My cats love the natural juices too.  They consider these as treats.

I got this little condo for my kitten who was too little to stay out with the big boys and had to stay alone in the bathroom during the day.  9 months later she still plays with the toy on top, scratches on it and routinely knocks it over and rolls it around the bedroom. Her Mother plays with it too. They're still small and sometimes crawl inside.  I got it for a temporary problem but this little condo is much tougher and better built than it looks in the description pictures. It remains a good toy even though its purpose was well served a while ago.

The mattress fits an extra large crate.  It has a rubber pad on the other side so it doesn't slip around in the crate.  However, after having it spin in a washing machine, dog hair sticks on the rubber pad and gets clustered around the tufts on the front.  The hair won't fall off in the dryer either, so you have to swipe them off by hand.

This harness & leash system was recommended by our puppy trainer, & it has been great!  Latches on both ends of the leash provide various ways for the leash to be attached to the harness, giving us much more control of our Labrador.  The velvet lined strap that goes under the dog's chest is soft & comfortable for her.  I highly recommend this training system for any dog owner, but especially for those with large dogs.

if you've got a bird, you know what I mean when I say &#34,that stuff&#34, just won't come off.  Well, it comes off quickly and completely with Poop-Off -- makes the drudgery of cleaning the cage a little less hateful :-)

It appears all items such as this from this company, are made in China.  With the long history of China's toxic issues with pet food and children's toys, do we really want to give our adored pets something to chew on for days, that is poisonous?  Do we want to take that chance with our littlest, most susceptible family members?My issue is that it was not disclosed in the ad.  These things are expensive and to pay for something that has such potential for harm is wrong.  What guarantees we have?

I have an older cat who needs to drink alot of water for his kidneys.  I found he was always putting his paw in the water dispenser and either splashing or draggging the whole thing across the room, spilling water along the way. Sometimes he tried to drink from the toilet. In any case, it was clear he wasn't happy with his water.  Since I've gotten this, he no longer tries to paw or drag it at all!  He drinks from where the water spout, while my other cat prefers to drink from the trough.  We have very good tap water, so I only change out the water once a week and when I do so, there hasn't been much to clean. I'm also only changing the filter every month and am going to try cracking one open and refilling with my own charcoal. You have to get used to the humm of the filter and a little water splash noise but other than that it is great!  I don't think the stainless version is worth it.  It is just prettier but has all the same inner parts.
It was not that difficult for my fast eating cat to use this feeder, but it did slow her down a little bit.

I love what the company Zuke's stands for. I like their ingredient list, but their treats always fall short compared to other natural treats. I am a dog trainer, and I buy lots of treats for my own dogs and for students! These treats and their mini naturals are both rather dry and rubbery. They don't break well and don't seem to have a high value for the dogs. Tillman's Tips, Wellness Jerky, Canidae Tid Bits, those are some smelly, soft, easy rip, natural, dog-craze inducing treats!

Great price, and helps with keeping him restrained! He'd love to run all over the car which is dangerous. This however is perfect. PLUS, ( I have a seven pound yorkie) ..it is well made, plenty of room.... and we have peace of mind. We put it in the back seat...seat belt holding it in place! Super!
I am glad that I read other reviews, or I would have chosen the wrong size.  Buying too large of a bowl will defeat the purpose.  The medium size is PERFECT for a large dog.
poor ingredients, poor taste.  junk food for cats. neither cat will touch this food even if mixed with other food.  I did not even bother to donate it to the animal shelter, why torture other cats?
Kibbles 'n Bits Bistro Meals Oven Roasted Beef Flavor with Spring Vegetable is rated Number 1 by my two dogs.
This thing is Great!! Fits perfectly in my Filter. You can add whatever you wish into it. works great. i will purchase another.

The only thing I would like to see added to these....  Would be a 'tail' hole.  I'm going to add them myself but would be nice to see that already done.  They are light weight, yet, they do the trick.  Thank you!

This is a nice cat pan.  It is large enough for my 9lb cat to move around.  The door helps to keep mess inside.  I also like that I can lift the door to clean easily.  I wish it can with a scooper, but thats no big deal.

I'm sold on this limited ingredient dog food.The ingredients are :Lamb meal, which contains more protein than fresh lambBrown riceGround rice, or rice flourbeet pulppoultry fatCompared to other dog foods, this one does seem more healthy.Different breeds of dogs do have different nutritional needs, some need more protein than others, ect.My dogs love the flavor and eat it very readily.This dog food is made in the USA, which is also very nice. Since my dogs love it and my vet approves, I'm considering switching over to this food.

This is the only treat that will keep my American Eskimo puppy entertained for any length of time. Each bully stick lasts him about 4 days, so the price on these is great compared to in stores, especially since these are made in the USA. I wouldn't purchase the Chinese or Indian-made bully sticks, I'm too afraid they will make my dog sick.
Nice little addition to the cage. Can't say whether or not they play with it much but it's nice and colorful. Lol.
My one dog has very thick hair and has dandruff issues. I used this twice and it has made a really nice difference. Cannot wait to see what a few more washes will do.

...I have a feeling the can I opened the other day had mold.  Just to be clear, I have been buying Natural Balance on/off for MANY years. My cats love it. Its a decent food compared to the garbage like Purina etc.  I have bought my canned cases of Natural Balance from Amazon and many other companies before. I usually buy by what is cheapest.  That being said, I opened this can up and about a quarter sized area near the snap tab was green. I emailed some pictures to Natural Balance and chatted online with Amazon. Amazon seemed more concerned than Natural Balance. Amazon offered a refund right away or a replacement if I wanted to go that route. They also asked I report back to let them know what Natural Balance says to me. (To be honest, it didnt seem like the rep at Natural Balance, when she called back, was overly concerned about what I discovered in the can which makes me hesitate buying their food anymore). Amazon even said I could return the other 4 cases of food I bought. Since this is an isolated issue, I will keep the other cases of food, not use the cans in the case where the moldy food came from and rethink Natural Balance as my cat's wet food choice in the future).  I am happy though that Amazon took the initiative and responsibility as to the remainder of the food I have.
Item as described. This filter is pretty much almost the cheapest one I can find on amazon, it is quiet and doesn't take up much space. I have it on my 1g tank is it works well.
My cats seem to like them fine but they don't hold together very well. I am constantly vacuuming pieces up that have broken off.

Love the item. I wish the bag would last longer. So it a price of convenience, or how many store bags who have. Or even trying gallon size zip locks, messy. Until you get the hang of it. They must be the very cheap dollar store ones. Cost, is an issue, with how workable. Me I will buy the product, when I have the money too. And of course I will substitute the bag issue as need. Rightnow with 2 kittens I would like the bag liner last a least a month. Just me.

These bowls are very cute and the small version was a lot larger than I expected. They feel really sturdy and the designs have stayed on after washing. My only problem would be that the little pieces on the bottom (the &#34,feet&#34, to keep it from banging/sliding) came off after the first time it was washed but not a huge problem for me. I would buy them again :)

These are one of the few dog treats my dogs will chew for awhile and their breath still smells decent after they finish.  The ends on these are bumpy so I assume they are helping to keep their teeth as nice and white as they are.  I buy the regular size and for the golden retriever I feed these to, they last awhile.  I have bought these a few times and will continue to buy them.

I gave it three stars because it's good quality but the sizing is off. The site said &#34,XS fits 8&#34, length, 10-12&#34, neck, 12-16&#34, chest&#34,There is no way. It's very small. My 6lber has 9in neck and 13 chest. This thing was skin tight. Plus...what dog with a 16in chest needs an 8 inch sweater? Poor little thing would be round. It's feet probably don't even touch the floor.

This is basically just an open celled yoga mat, for a littler box.  I had high hopes, but one sick cat peed on it and the smell did not wash out, instead it got absorbed by the mat.  Also, their claws definitely scratched it up.  Maybe if it was more attractive and made in nicer colors with no patterns or better ones I would consider repurchasing.  I'm thinking of just buying a cheap yoga mat and using that instead.

It is really hard to rate dog food because I am not the one eating it.My dog is used to Purina One...  lamb or chicken.Beneful is much more colorful.  It doesn't have a particular odor.  It is softer than the food I am used to.  My mixed terrier has been slow to take to this.  This may say more about my dog than the Beneful...  He loves treats and I was sure he would see this as a treat with all the shapes and colors (ok...dogs are color blind but)I think dogs are slow to change what they are used to so I wouldn't take this as meaning your dog won't like Beneful.  Nutritionally, it looks like it is good but I can't tell how much of that is marketing.I'll revise if our dog seems to acclimate more to this.
Base is not large enough - have to fill it 2x a day or it starts to make sucking noises, and would eventually cause the pump to fail.
Works great! Pretty much just what I was expecting. There is even a guard on them so you don't cut too much of the nail.

It's off-leash time in the local parks after 9pm and my big dog and I go often. She is VERY ball-motivated, and with this bright glowing orb I always know exactly where she is. In combo with the L.E.D. collar tag we got her, so does every one else in the park (which I think is a good thing). One obsessed dog did try to steal it from her once, and in the process bit straight through her lip to try to take it from her mouth and wouldn't let go. So beware the envious pooch.
They like it best after I spray it with catnip spray!!!  Cute little toy though!  It holds together better than a lot of other toys I have brought for my little monsters!!  LOL

I'm not one to leave negative reviews but I have to on this one. I've tried this food on all of my tanks and even the pond outside, my fish just won't eat it! Maybe their spoiled...I feed them premium flakes, shrimp along with a variety of veggies and worms so maybe that's it...but ordinarily my pond fish will eat anything (including fingers) but they spit this out.
My cats love this food.I've bought it for years and it does not upset their stomachs.It smells almost good enough to eat!

I bought this for my granddaughter to use on her pony. She tells me it has become quite the hit at the stables and all the girls want one for their ponies. She also says the pony loves to be groomed with the tool and remains very quiet during the process.

I have a collection of really beautiful show quality Bettas, most of which are imported from Thailand.  These Bettas have really huge, heavy fins.  It's very important that the water flow in the aquarium not batter my fish around.  After trying several aquariums and being disappointed, I bought a Fluval Chi.  It worked perfectly!  I now have 7 Fluval Chi aquariums.  I love them.They have two negatives.  Because of the open top, the water evaporates fairly quickly.  The other problem is that my cats think the water fountain on the top is delicious.  They help make the water disappear.

Frontline stopped working completely, and both of our cats had a lot of fleas while we waited until enough time had passed to apply Advantage. The day after I applied it, dead fleas were literally falling off of our cats and have been under control ever since.

I purchased this product to minimize my dogs' gas and soft stool problem. The first batch was quickly used. However, one of my dogs dislike the smell and gradually avoided the food mixed with the product. Now, I occassionally add a packet to their meals.

This is the third wubba toy I buy, the first two went to my older dog who even as a puppy was not a very destructive chewer and it took her months to destroy this toy. The most recent one I bought did not fare as well and was destroyed in about 30 minutes. It didn't turn out too badly because then I ended up with two toys, a very sturdy chewy, squeaky ball and a raggedy octopus which is great for fetching. So while I don't recommend letting heavy chewers continuous access to this toy, for dogs that are not destructive it should last a nice while and be fun for them.

I purchased this Filter though Amazon and received it in just a flash shipping in less than five days! I've had a really bad green algae, cloudy water and worse, you name it and this Filter is a miracle that solves my problems. I used to make a frequently water changes almost every week, some time every two days and spent a lot of money for Chemical treatments with the resulted of my fishes dying in peace! now I have not changed my tank's water for over two months since I've got this Filter. Thanks a lot Aquatop! I think of buying another spare one just in case this product is being discontinued or something! Very comparable and over performed to those expensive ones on the the market today. I'd love to see many hobbies recognized this product.

They work fairly well.. not much else to say. If you have fat fingers maybe skip them, because the holes to hold on to are very small, but I have relatively large hands and manage to use them with no problem.

This tool works great to get out loose cat hair and you can use the flat side to scrape hair ofd the furniture too. We had one for many years and it finally got so awful we replaced it, they never really wear out but after ten or twelve years we noticed the rubbery material was just not quite the way it should be. An excellent investment and tool!
Really nice product but not big enough for 3 lb yorkie puppy. I would recommend it for any tiny pups for sure.

When Princess entered my life, I had to purchase a lot of cat-accessories. All my other cats had to do with whatever was in the house, but this cat I got from the SPCA, and wanted to give her a bit better standard. So I got two, one for her water, and one for her food.What I didn't realise was that my little kitty likes wet food more than dry, but also wants dry food. So I am one bowl short.The base is very stable, sits on the ground very well. The little kitty doesn't manage to push it around much. The stainless steel bowl comes off, so it makes it easy to clean. It's not very big, but neither is my little kitty, so that makes it just perfect for a cat.Edit: I did actually get another one of these. My cats eating tray looks very elegant!

My dog had no problems eating it. I guess corn syrup being the first ingredient helped with that. HA. My dog was diagnosed as slightly anemic from stomach ulcers from taking a steroid for his shoulder. I decided giving this to him was a little easier on his stomach than feeding him ground beef. He ate this with his dog food and within a week or so, he got most of his energy back, going on full walks again. I only put him on this for 2 bottles worth and he's been fine since then.
Nice to have a package of three.  They came quickly and my local pet outlet doesn't always have these in stock.  The price is OK too.

I have tried Four Paws Wee-Wee pads, Dynarex Under pads(worst),Simply Right Super Absorbent under pads(very good-still use) and Natures Miracle Advanced Wee Pads(still use)and find Natures Miracle Advanced Ultra is the best by far for doggie wee pads! I have (2) 4-lb puppies that share the same pads and I am impressed on how absorbent Natures Miracle Advanced turned out to be. They claim to hold 6 cups of liquid and I believe it, this is the only pad with Polymer in it, Polymer helps absorption and keeps the spread of the liquid to a minimum getting more use out of the pad, this pad is also fantastic at keeping odor absorbed. The funny thing is I bought this brand on accident, 50pads for $39 bucks at Petsmart which I find is the only place I can get these pads in-store in my area. The pad size is larger than the other pads 27x23, the others are 23x24 and Natures are truly the closest pad to the usable size stated on the package, the other pads can be up to 4inches smaller in usable area size(so your 23x24 pad is actually 19x21 inches)because the blue border is non-absorbent and not usable(Dynarex brand)!! I just bought Natures Miracle Advanced Ultra on sale at Petsmart, 100pads for $39 which is a great price but I only use these in my crate due to that high price. For daily use, I go with Simply Right Super Absorbent 23x36 under pads from Sam's club which is also very very good and not bad at keeping odor at bay with a very very cheap price tag, 120pads for $24 plus they are sold in-store, no need to order online. I put these 23x36 pads on top of crate replacement trays $14 bucks on sale at Petco free shipping at the time to help keep the urine for spilling when they use the edge of the pads. Even the Natures Miracle doesn't stop the half on half off the pad and you have to agree you can't catch them every time. I would def recommend these pads I am very happy with them, just wish the price would come down.

Bought this as a Christmas present for my spoiled Cockatoo. I wrapped it and hung it on his play gym. He had a great time shredding the paper Christmas morning. Then he discovered the toy! He hasn't left it alone since then. Usually a toy lasts him 2 or 3 days, but this one has so much to it that he is still enjoying it.

I have two cats that love catnip.  I grow it in the garden for them, and now I'm growing this in the house this winter.  It came right up in four days. ...To start positive, the price was fair, close to the others I'd checked out. This test also ~claims~ to have the largest data base of dogs, a little over 170. Some of the others have much less, as little as 60 breeds or less in their database, but claim those 60 breeds represent 92%+ of all dogs....Digression: I don't know enough to confirm or criticize either claim about breed numbers. Wikipedia (not the most expert source, but at least "a" half-way reputable one) only says there are "hundreds" of variations, and that the dog is the most variable land mammal. I suppose it depends what you decide makes a difference. I saw other claims that the total number of dog breeds was upwards of 5000. With a claimed population (worldwide) of over 400 million dogs (more than all the people in the US), that would allow for about 80,000 of each breed if they all had equal size populations.  but I went with the higher numbers. End of digression....Collecting the sample was easy. Two glorified Q-tips were enclosed, I swabbed each one around the dog's mouth sufficiently after he ate, so no food particles would contaminate the samples, put each in a tube to air dry, and then sealed and mailed them in the pre-paid envelope. No other costs to mail, to buy a mailer, to pay for processing, just the one cost to buy the kit. Okay, and a quarter for parking at the post office. If you drop your sample in a mail box, you can avoid that....Speed of acknowledgement of receipt was good, within several days, and speed of the report was also good, within 1-2 weeks of that. I wasn't in a hurry. I'm not going to quibble about the report coming by email, directing me to the site, where I downloaded the report as a pdf file, instead of sending the report by regular snail-mail. I was still able to get it in usable form and save it to reprint if necessary....The actual report was where they get docked a few points. The dog is identified by EVERYBODY (vets, neighbors, dozens of strangers, trainers, beach goers, a police officer,)as a pit bull. I figured that, as a stray, he could have some other stuff mixed in, so I wasn't expecting Aryan type purity. The report says he's only 1/4 "Am.Staff" (American Staffordshire is the commonly used fancy name for pit bulls), 1/4 Rottweiler, 1/4 "mixed breed" and 1/4 Whippet. I was a little disappointed that the 1/4 "mixed" couldn't be broken down further, apparently the test can only discriminate up to 25%, but would not show meaningful results if the dog was 24% or less of something. That part, and the "whippet" gave me a laugh. This dog is built like a Sherman tank: he has a huge block head with a huge neck, even bigger than mine, a super solid chest like a mastiff, and is close to 90 pounds, there is no way he has Whippet in him unless he ate one. (A Whippet is basically a scrawnier version (15-30 pounds) of the already thin greyhound. Apologies to Whippet/greyhound owners, I'm just trying to give a picture of my dog, not to insult theirs. I've seen some beautiful Whippets and greyhounds. Thinner dogs can run faster since they weigh less.)I'm not going to argue vociferously about the Rottweiler part, that may be true. At least it's a roughly similar build to an Am.Staff....Overall, if I have to wonder about the accuracy of the test, the other factors (cost, speed, number of breeds) don't really matter. I'm not really interested in sending in another sample from another address under another name. So, probably not the best test out there. I'll have to research some more before trying it again.

A possible bite! Canines are curious, smart, loyal, loving buddies. I treat my animal's health as if it were my own and try to not only find the best veterinarian care, but also the best foods.  I've had my dog Brandy on Eagle brand dog food for many years.  I remember when there was the melanine scare, but I didn't have to worry because all of the ingredients were natural and were grown in the United States.  Aside from that, once I changed from an inexpensive food with suspect ingredients, there was a very noticeable difference in her general appearance, especially her fur.  It became sleek and ultra shiny and her body slim and trim.Brandy is now eleven years old and although I cannot credit Eagle for her health, she has had only one minor incident that she's had to be taken to the vet's for outside of regular checkups.  My veterinarian wholeheartedly approves of her diet and is pleased that even though she's getting to be an old girl, she's amazingly healthy.  I used to use another Eagle brand, but since she's getting older,  I switched to the senior brand.  She's getting a tad chunky, but her activity level has changed.  Brandy still is frisky and I do believe a good diet has a lot to do with it.When my vet called me the other day with some test results from another dog, I asked her about the corn in this food.  Everyone is yelling about corn being a poor and unhealthy filler so I couldn't resist asking.  She simply said that she considered corn a vegetable and had little bad to say about it.  In other words, a not to worry situation.  My dog is happy, healthy, and I heartily recommend Eagle Pack Senior for all older dogs.INGREDIENTS:Chicken Meal, Ground Brown Rice, Ground Yellow Corn, Oatmeal, Chicken Fat (Preserved with Natural Mixed Tocopherols), Pork Meal, Brewers Dried Yeast, Dried Beet Pulp, Anchovy & Sardine Meal, Flaxseed, Dried Egg Product, Wheat Germ Meal, Potassium Chloride, Carrots, Peas, DL-Methionine, Vitamins [Vitamin A Supplement, Vitamin D-3 Supplement, Vitamin E Supplement, Riboflavin Supplement, Vitamin B-12 Supplement, d-Calcium Pantothenate, Niacin Supplement, Pyridoxine Hydrochloride, Thiamine Chloride, Dried Kelp, Lecithin, Rosemary Extract, Glucosamine Hydrochloride, Yucca Schidigera Extract, Dried Lactobacillus acidophilus, Lactobacillus casei, Enterococcus faecium, Bacillus subtilis, Bacillus licheniformis, Aspergillus oryzae and Aspergillus niger Fermentation Products, Mixed Tocopherols (a natural preservative).GUARANTEED ANALYSIS:Crude Protein (min.)  26%Crude Fat (min.) C)*Omega 6 Fatty (min.)  2.40%Acids *Omega 3 Fatty (min.)  0.60%Acids*Glucosamine  (min.)  340 mg/kgHydrochlorideTotal Lactic Acid  (min.)  100,000,000Microrganisms*(Lactobacillus acidophilus, Lactobacillus casei, Enterococcus faecium in equal amounts)*Not recognized as an essential nutrient by the AAFCO Dog Food Nutrient ProfilesEagle Pack Senior Adult Dog Food is formulated to meet the nutritional levels established by the Association of American Feed Control Officials (AAFCO) Dog Food Nutrient Profiles for maintenance.FEEDING GUIDELINES (from the website):Transitioning to Eagle PackIt is important to slowly transition your dog from his/her current diet as it takes a few days for the body to adapt to the new nutrient levels. To transition, gradually mix in the new food over a 5-7 day period, increasing the amount of Eagle Pack each day, so that you are feeding 100% Eagle Pack by day 7.Determining Feeding PortionsLooking at the chart, divide the total cups per day by the total number of times you feed your dog per day to determine the portion size for each meal. Keep a clean bowl of fresh water available at all times. Eagle Pack believes in feeding dry and wet food in combination whenever possible to help increase the level of water in your dog's diet.Recommended Feeding Portions(based on a standard 8 oz dry measuring cup)Every dog is different so optimal feeding amounts may vary with age, size, activity level, breed and environment. (4.5 kg) over 100 lbs.Combination Feeding: If feeding with wet food, reduce dry amount fed by 1/3 cup (34 g) for every 6.0 oz (170 g) of wet food.Calorie Content: This food contains 3,550 kcal per kilogram or 362 kcal per cup ME (metabolizable energy) on an as fed basis (calculated).

I was looking for something high in protein with minimal corn and byproducts for my new kitten, but it's hard to find it at a low price. I bought the OSTER GENTLE PAWS CORDLESS NAIL TRIMMER because I wanted to keep my Shiba Inu puppy's nails from getting too long. However after testing it out on her, I'll be sending the product back.It comes with the motor, 2 drill heads, 2 files that cover one of the drill heads, and cover guard. There's also a pamphlet on how to use the product with bare bones information. You have to supply the 4 "AA" batteries, which are easy to install.So I get the OSTER NAIL TRIMMER set up, let my puppy get used to the trimmer and the sound it makes, and then go to work on her front paws. When I finally get one of her nails into the cover guard it doesn't touch the grinding head so I move up to the next size. That goes in and it starts to grind but the sensation freaks my Shiba out. And it was awkward trying to trim the nail down with the guard on because it was hard to move the trimmer in an angle.I try to reassure her and turn off the TRIMMER, but she's having none of it, jumping and squirming to and fro. Finally she calms down a bit and I try for round two. This time I turn the switch to "on" and it doesn't turn on! I had to shake it, turn it back to "off" and then turn it back on again. Finally it starts up and as soon as I get a nail touching the grinding surface, my Shiba is now contorting her whole body to get away from the thing, she loses it again, freaking out with such gusto that I'm afraid she's going to break her own arms off to get away. Finally I gave up.This product might work for some doggie parents but it didn't work for me. I'm going to try the old fashioned nail clippers next.

Does it work, doesn't it work, who can actually tell, but I am not taking the chance of aching joints and sore knees by stopping.  The price of these "little" and I mean that, little pills is best on Amazon.com.  Sometimes stores have them one sale, "buy one, get one free", but that is not frequent and Amazon is consistent.  For almost two years I have been recovering from cancer and started these pills at that time.  I can only tell you that I am almost 60 yrs old and was totally sendentary during my recovery 18 months.  I currently have no joint pains and am starting to feel like my old self.  I cannot guarentee anything, but what's it gonna hurt?  PS, if you have trouble swallowing pills, THIS pill is very small and coated and that is why it probably costs more.  There is a style with a 1" long pill that is much cheaper, but if you don't like to swallow large pills, this is the easy way to lubricate your joints.
