my dog absolutely loves these. They were such a great bargain at amazon.Iwould reccomend these to dog lovers if they want to give their dog a nice treat especially after they have eaten.They reccomend giving them only one a day so this is a great buy. alot cheaper than I can find in the stores.

This is a decent quality UV flashlight, I purchased it for use with a leak detection dye and it works much better than the cheep 490nm light that was provided with the dye.Pros-Bright for a UV light-Give you UV light closer to that of a florescent tube blacklight then any UV LED I've tried before. It fully bring out the security features on my ID, something cheaper UV LED lights do not do.-Seems pretty sturdy and well builtCons-It has PeeDar etched into the side, I don't like the name &#34,PeeDar&#34, so this is a downside to me

The filter that came with the product is unable to let the water pass through it quickly, this makes it a pain in the butt to add more water. I end up having to unplug the unit, add the water, and then plug it back in (not convenient since the plug is behind a cabinet). Cats seem to enjoy it just as much as they have enjoyed previous models- will probably move away from this style of water bowl on the next one.
I have tried 3 other filters and none compare to this brand.  You can double up filter for an amazingly clear aquarium! I found out the hard way and have horrible experiences from other types.

Our vet asked us to not give our dogs these because they cannot digest them. Whatever they are made of does not break down once eaten, made my dog sick and when I cleaned his potty I saw entire chunks on the treat. They claim the new formula is digestable, but it wasn't for our dog at least...

We purchased this a few months ago along with the coupler for our 2 large dogs and have been very pleased. Granted, this is the first retractable leash we've purchased so we have no basis for comparison but found this leash easy to use and great for walking our dogs. Using the coupler with the leash has been indispensable in our situation given that we have 2 dogs, it's much better than our previous way of walking the dogs, which was through using 2 leashes. We just wish we wouldn't have waited so long to buy this!

My staffordshire/german shepherd mix puppy absolutely loves this. We have the Nylabone Wishbone too, and where he likes that bone, he likes this stick much better. I would highly recommend this to anyone who has a strong chewer or a teething puppy (I have both rolled up in one puppy).

Solid device.  Better than most of the junk out there.  Great range.  I can put this on my pitty and not worry about her getting too far out.  The Esky models are a crap shoot as to whether or not they will work.  The PetSafe just works.  I'd like to get a second for my male pitty.  However once you put a second collar on this remote, it can only be programmed as if there were three collars on it.  Which means the three buttons it has will only beep or zap the dogs they're attached to.  I'd rather it give me the option on the third button to beep, with zap on the other two.Still, I'd recommend it for one dog.

I have a female Shih Tzu that had chronic ear infections.  I used to buy prescription medicine for her ears from the vet, which became very expensive.  I decided to give this a try and it worked wonders.  The ear infections have stopped, but I will always have this on hand.  When I went to the vet for a check-up she was amazed that her ears were no longer infected.On a side note....I came down with an inner ear infection on a Friday evening and decided to give this a try myself.  I followed the directions and used this medication for 7 days and my ear infection is gone!  This is a wonderful product! Highly recommend!

I have a 2 year old rescue Chihuahua. I brush her teeth every other day with Nylabone toothpaste and Nylabone plaque removing foam, give her Greenies daily, CET enzymatic chews daily, and she has a Nylabone toy she chews on occasionally. I didn't want her to go under anesthesia again (when I got her spayed, they didn't tell me I should have her teeth cleaned too).Despite all this, she still had a bit of plaque remaining. She doesn't get new plaque but it never goes away. So when I read the reviews and online instructions for the tooth scaler, I decided to give it a try. It worked! Within two days, all of the plaque has disappeared! It was easy to scrape off because the metal is strong.My dog is pretty good at staying still during brushings but she didn't like the scaler at first. Lots of treats and praise made it possible to get it done in two batches in two days. Now, her pearly whites are shiny and clean! I'm so happy! This really works!
such a simple concept and design and it's amazing how great it works! It does seem funny to write a glowing review for a poop-picker-upper, but it's so good that I wanted to leave my kudos too!

I didn't realize how thick this rope toy was going to be when I ordered it.  It is a great toy for a big dog, like a Lab or German Shepherd or bigger.  My dogs are not quite that big and this was a bit heavy for them to carry around or play tug of war with.  I also had to cut off the fringe on the ends because my dogs will eat it.  I am donating this to my granddog, who is a Labrador Retriever and it will be the perfect size for her.  It appears to be pretty sturdy, but with dogs like mine who eat all their toys eventually, who knows??

My dog could eat these all day, but I can't afford them even as occasional treats.  And now I'm concerned about the quality of all dog treats.  May have to make my own.  Still...........he sure loves these.
This is a toy that my dog has been unable to destroy.  She usually will eat toys and rip out squeakers and stuffing.  This has proved durable thus far and we have had it since Christmas.

...Nice little hoodie, but does not run true to Casual Canine Sizing....I prefer the cotton blend of hoodie by this brand.  It fits better, and it is cooler for inside of the house.  Do love Casual Canine for it's quality, I have many clothing items, harness, etc. from CC.

My cats absolutely love this toy! They just cannot get enough of it! I keep it folded up in one of my bookcases and they sit at the base of it and cry at me begging for me to get the toy down so they can play. It's great for wearing down kittens so they'll go to sleep at night. I turn on a one hour show and watch tv while I bounce it all over the living room while they chase it. When my program is done=I have worn out kitties! Best toy ever!!!
Its great it doesn't have all of the additives and animal byproducts. Its definitely quality food! I highly recommend this!

I bought this toy for my African Grey about a year ago. She loves it. I leave it in her cage 24/7. Although I rotate old toys and add new ones I never mess with this one.It's her favorite. She uses it every day constantly. In all the rough play she has managed to crack the mirror but it still has all it's buttons. I can't remember where I bought the toy I think Amazon. I am so impressed how it has held up so well. Don't be surprised when you get the large mine was red. I am buying two more because I heard a rumor they were going to stop making them and  I am adopting another parrot.  I truly hope they keep these available. I will be so sad if I can't get more when needed. If you have smaller birds such as a cockatiel or similar in size don't get the large. Very happy with this toy!
I thought I would try this because the price was right and within 30 minutes fleas were jumping off of my dogs.

Ingredient: Freeze dried turkey breast. Period. Not even a smidgeon of any other ingredients.We put pieces of these freeze dried turkey breast pieces on the dried food of our girls' dinner. They go for their meal ravenously, eating the turkey first, their momentum carrying them to the dried food with almost as much gusto.  Mrs. Spudman occasionally cooks up a chicken breast for the dogs, but buying a bag of the freeze dried turkey is much more convenient and the turkey lasts longer than our cooked chicken. A little pricey, but for us it's worth it.
Doesn't work well.
My dog loves these treats and I give her the mini's even though she is a big dog as they are more of a treat for her.

My 11lb Shih-pooh fits inside nicely.  In fact she has room to spare, however, she does not really care for it to much.  She has been in a soft sided, canvas type crate but where we work it got very dusty and dirty, so we needed to switch to something a bit easier to clean.  She is still getting used to it and I think she'll love it (eventually)!
I like these because they break in half and get smaller. Great for IQ toys and they are soft and chewy. My little doggies love these.
These are fun for the kittens and cats that we foster. I also like that I can wash them easily and that I can use them over and over. The price is also right.

We use these for our incontinent dog every day. These fit her well, they are easy to put on, the velcro works very well.  She slides out of them often, I wish they stayed on but I think this has more to do with the way our dog drags on the ground ( hind limb paralysis) than  quality of the product.
This is a great little toothbrush for my 15 lb maltipoo. He doesn't really mind me brushing his teeth with this toothbrush, Thank God! Great product for a small dog.

It is tall and sturdy but even my six month old 2.5 pound chihuahua puppy can move it all over if she really wants to be someplace else in the room when I am not there.  The construction is really good but will only work with a small dog that doesn't mind a crate.  I have used it with washable puppy pads at one end and her bed and food at the other and as long as she doesn't mind being there she is totally and securely confined.  She has never climbed out but can push the crate around as she is a really determined chihuahua.  The crate itself is well built but easily moved.  The gate at first was a little difficult to open and latch back but after a few tries it was no big deal so not really an issue.  I had hoped to have a crate that didn't move and I thought this would be the one but I didn't realize this tiny bit of determination could move it so I guess this is a misjudgment on my part.  I would recommend this to anyone who wants a very well built crate and didn't mind if it could be moved but with a puppy pad in there the pad just gets squashed up and hence not much help in housebreaking.  However, she is mostly housebroken but didn't like hopping over the edge of the door to get to her pad so I just turned the pen upside down so the top is flush with the floor and the lip is just an overhead thing and the door still opens and closes perfectly.  She is tiny so that is not an issue with her being too tall and not wanting to duck to get to her pad.  I just leave the door open and she goes in and out to use the pad.  I have since made the pen smaller and taken her bed out and the pen sits well on a large dog washable puppy pad.  She loves that she can go right in and out and her bed is across the room.  Recently I tried taking the pen off the pad and she still uses just the pad but goes around the pad where the pen used to be before she does her business.  So now I am going to use the pen just for travel and outside activities where I need her more confined.
My guinea pig is afraid of this right now. Once she gets used to it, I think she will use it. Will be a great way to keep her cage cleaner and neater.
I got this for my Aquaclear 30. I needed something to pick up the finer debris that came from the substrate. This fits pretty well in the aquaclear. I put it on the top.

I really like the idea of elevating the water bowl in the kennels of my three dogs. My rambunctious and independent Yorkie has a fun time making huge messes for me to clean up after he takes a bath in his water bowl. I bought these to try out and for the most part, I really like them. They are easy to attach to the door of the kennel and hold a decent amount of water. My biggest issue is how difficult it is to remove the bowl. I imagine this is to keep a dog from yanking it off, but I often can't get it off without making a mess.  They do snap back into place relatively easy - it is getting them off that is difficult. Overall, I am really happy with the purchase and have three of them.

These develop quite a bit of head loss across them (very resistive) and have ends that are far too big for most air lines (not barbed, just big).  You can get them to fit better if you heat up the line in a cup of boiling water and then slip on...other than that, I'm not super impressed.

We normally used a regular measuring spoon for measuring Angel Eyes for our white dog but since using the scoop as the measure his eyes are completely cleared, so we apparently were not measuring correctly with the regular measuring spoon.

At first I was skeptical because my dogs are really obsessive about the orange chuckit balls and never thought we would find a better ball, but after using these balls I have to say I'm very pleased. One of our labs, Sheba, has suffered from seizures and has become partially blind. Sometimes it's difficult for her to find a ball when we throw it a long ways. (We have a fenced in acre which is essentially our dog park.) These balls really do help her to track it because they whistle when flying in the air. It's not very loud to me, but my dogs can defiantly follow the sound. These balls are harder and lighter than the orange balls and bounce better, too.When throwing the orange balls, Sheba would bring back only about 50% of the time and our other lab would go find the ball for her and bring it back. But with these she brought the ball back 100% of the time!So I have to give a big kudos to Chuckit for making ball time more fun for Sheba and thanks from our family!
pup was able to eat plastic...treats came out very rapidly...the pup did not have to work at dispensing the treat....
I don't know what it is about the Kong toys, but he really enjoys them.  Right after we got it, he was dragging it around the house and kick away.  He even sleeps on it sometimes.

I bought this as a Christmas present for my 6 year old Cavalier King Charles Spaniel. She loves her toys, and this is the largest toy she owns now. She loves squeakers and having so many on one toy just made her SO HAPPY! She went nuts over this great toy, it's her new favorite toy. It's really quality made and she is pretty rough on stuff. She has tried to rip it's face off and it's just as good as new. Great product.

One of my dogs usually gets bored of new toys after a few minutes. I was pleasantly surprised that he likes this toy! I've had it a week and it's kept his interested every day still. I think it's because of the unique squeaker design. It's not your typical speaker. It's like a rubber drone and it produces different tones of squeaks- and none of them are your typical the typical high pitch squeaks.

My cat ingests all the hair that she licks off of herself as well as any stray hairs of mine that happen upon one of her toys. I worry that down the line she will have issues and wanted to give her a digestive aid to prevent blockages inside her.I'm so glad that this gel is all natural. Although my vet says a LITTLE petrolatum isn't harmful to a cat, but to give a cat 1/2 tsp of it every day might be bad. It even smells good - not fishy, but like maple syrup.What I'm most glad for is that now I can take her off of Science Diet hairball formula. Why do vets recommend kibble that contains corn meal and corn products in general??I'm going to start her on a grain-free kibble and keep administering this hairball remedy.

My dog's breeder had recommended &#34,Purina Veterinary Diets Fortiflora Canine, 30 Sachets Per Box&#34,, and she sent me home with a weeks supply to add to my puppy's food.  I ordered a box from Amazon.  When I needed more I was looking for a comparable product that was less expensive and found this.  I just add about a 1/2 teas with her morning dog food...........  I've had it 2? months now and I would expect I have enough for another 3 months from this one jar.  Certainly more economical.  The only differences besides not having doses individually packaged, is that the Purina brand has a additive that kind of makes a light brown &#34,gravy&#34,, and of course..........the price!  I will buy this product again.

In the years that I've had my cats, the Friskies Prime Filets are the ones that they seem to love the most. between the one being reviewed here "Meaty selections" to seafood selection they can't get enough. No other will do it seems. I like the 24 can box since it lasts longer and with Amazon Prime is cheaper. Subscribe and its even cheaper and i don't have to worry about finding a place when there isn't any cat food and the cat gives you a stare of "Where's my food"Bottom line, They seems to like it very much. I'm sure if they can rate it it would be 5 meows out of 5.
This is AWESOME! It cleans up so easy and you can get it clean in all the corners. It keeps my dog's food bowl over-runs in one spot, easy to clean. I love this.
does a really good job on medium hair cat. Gentle yet gets a lot of hair out. Not for short hair cats though. Very reasonable and well made

I ordered this because it was a case of 6 which is supposed to mean you get 6 bags. I only received 1 bag. If you got the 6 bags for the price then that would be a great deal. But since you only get 1 bag it is a complete RIP OFF. You can get the same thing anywhere else for MUCH less. I love this bedding, NOT this seller. This is the first time amazon has made me mad, but they made me mad in a BIG way. I would recommend this product if you get it from some where else. It makes a great nesting material for a hamster cage. I know people who use it for the whole cage and it looks great like that.

I bought this cool bed to replace an old one of a different brand. But, this item did not reach my expectations. I read & followed the instructions. But, after only a few months, it smelled really bad and had mold growing on it. So, I ended up having to throw it away. I would not ever buy this brand again, nor recommend it!

I have two 8 pound Havanese who eat their evening meal in food puzzles.  I try to rotate the puzzles and am always on the lookout for new ones, as they get very adept at the old ones.  Although this is made to slow down a dog's eating speed, it was a great mind puzzle for my little guys.  They have to figure out where to push the food so that they can reach it.  It takes a long time for a meal but they are not frustrated (they let you know!), just concentrating and relaxed.  I imagine this would be great for a large dog also.  Sturdy, dishwasher safe, and a great price.

This review is for a sample packet of Stella & Chewy's Yummy Lickin' Salmon & Chicken Dinner. This food is touted as being made with raw meats which are pasteurized via hydrostatic high pressure then freeze-dried. The label also says: no grain, added hormones or antibiotics, artificial preservatives, sugar, salt, or colorings. The company suggests rehydrating the food with water before serving (cats are notorious for not drinking adequately).I like the ingredient profile (no grains/carbohydrates) and that the food is pasteurized. I figured my cats would be excited about it. I first prepared some nuggets as directed, in water. My cats wouldn't touch it. Another day, I offered them the nuggets plain. One ate them after examining them a bit (the other just sniffed them and walked away), and then he left pieces...which he later returned to and ate most of them, leaving some crumbs. --I will keep this food in mind, and perhaps, as others have suggested, try it as a food topper.Flavors that I may try later with my cats include: Duck Duck Goose, Chick, Chick, Chicken, and Tummy Ticklin' Turkey. I like that Stella & Chewy's offers several fowl offerings sans fish (fish is a common allergen in cats).The food is noted as being prepared in a Wisconsin manufacturing facility with poultry sourced from USDA-inspected facilities and fish sourced from FDA-regulated facilities. (That doesn't necessarily mean the facilities are in the U.S.A.) The sample packet, brochure, nor company web site list the actual source of the meat. I will contact the company and update this review when I learn more.This food contains bone meal. For many cats, bone meal is good in food. However, bone meal may be a concern if a cat has chronic kidney disease.Overall, I think Stella & Chewy's looks like a good option.Ingredients particular to this flavor include: whole ground salmon, chicken (ground with bone), chicken liver, chicken gizzard, parsley (a source of vitamin K).Ingredients in all the Stella & Chewy's freeze-dried cat food include: pumpkin seed, potassium chloride, sodium phosphate monobasic, choline chloride, dried Pediococcus Acidillactici fermentation product, dried Lactobacillus Acidophilus fermentation product, dried Bifidobacterium Longum fermentation product, dried Enterococcus Faecium fermentation product, taurine, tocopherols (preservative), zinc proteinate, zinc sulfate, iron sulfate, iron proteinate, vitamin E supplement, niacin, copper sulfate, copper proteinate, manganese sulfate, sodium selenite, manganese proteinate, thiamine mononitrate, pyridoxine hydrochloride, vitamin D3 supplement, calcium iodate, vitamin B12 supplement.

I originally became a fan of pouch-based cat food with the Nutro line of pouches. However, Nutro was especially hit by the nasty recall episode from a few years back where a number of pet food manufacturers had contamination issues, and they eventually pulled their pouches. I tried a bunch of canned foods afterwards, but my cats never warmed to any of them like they did the pouches.Wellness came out with their "healthy indulgence" line of pouch foods not too long ago, and interestingly the packaging is pretty much identical to the Nutro products, down to the notches to facilitate tearing. I can only imagine that they are using the same manufacturing facilities as Nutro did, but hopefully with a superior product. Everything I've read about Wellness suggests that they make high-quality pet foods. My cats seem to love these as much as they did their old pouch foods. They have now been eating pouch foods almost daily for at least 6-7 years, so I don't have any major concerns about long-term health issues.Overall, these pouches are great. Each single pouch is one serving for one cat, so the costs do add up fast if you have multiple cats and serve this twice a day. I give dry food in the morning and the pouches at night to help conserve costs, but they always finish the Wellness pouches within a half hour, whereas the dry food often sits around unfinished all day. Another plus is that no spoons or forks need to be involved, since you just tear each pouch and shake the contents into the bowl. No mess or debates with spouses about putting cat food forks into the dishwasher with the rest of the dishes!

These treats are a nice size, I believe they are 11 calories each, and my three dogs think they are awesome.I want to give my dogs healthy treats, not junk food, so these cookies are perfect. They are too big for training (as you would want something tiny and fast for the dog to eat, not sit there and crunch for a bit) but if you want something as a nice little reward for being your best doggy friend, these are great. The lower fat means they have less calories so you don't have to worry about your puppy getting fat from these.

This was just the right size for my 20lb bags of cat food (I kept debating between this and the larger size - glad I picked this one!).  The container looks good and seems very durable - definitely better quality than the really cheap plastic containers you see.I did take the other reviewers suggestions and am storing the cat food in the bag inside the container just to help keep it cleaner.I am a little weary of it being a foam vs. a rubber seal, but hoping that won't cause problems in the future.Overall, for the price this is a great container...the wheels go on easily and seem to work well on carpet.

I basicly bought this tool because I got such a good deal on Amazon and it was so expensive in the stores.  After trying it out, I think it does a superb job at removing the undercoat on my shepherd.  Used it on my Rottie and it works well also.

I have had multiple fountains/watering set ups for my 2 cats.  This fountain is by far the best.  I had one of these for a few years, and after a rough and tumble when the water reservoir was dropped which resulted in a crack down the back, and the motor for the water burned out and was overflowing the fountain, I decided to get another.  If the water reservoir had not cracked, I would have just looked into replacing the motor.But I just bought this fountain again, and I love it.  It also has the largest water capacity on the market for fountains of this size--and I travel a lot so its good to know that it can keep my cats watered for more than a day or two (it lasts about two weeks on a fill for my cats).I also bought the Drinkwell Pet Fountain Mat for the Pet Fountain, and I'm really glad I did.  Last time I didn't have one and my cats would spill the water over pretty often since they like to play in it.  This time, it'll keep it stationary, and catch at least some of the mess.It also comes with the attachment to mount cat grass on it.  Pretty cool, I'm still debating whether I want to try that or not.

My yorkie loves these,and she's very picky when it comes to treats. I give her one to two a day and definitely notice her breath is not as bad as when she's not eating them. She also has a very sensitive stomach and these don't seem to bother her.

I bought this harness so our recently-adopted and super energetic pitbull mix could go running with my wife. Her previous harness (one of those ubiquitous, cheap nylon ones) was causing some rubbing and irritation when she would run. We measured her according to the guidelines, and went with the Medium/Large size - it fit perfectly. With the ComfortFlex, there was no rubbing or redness or irritation, even after longer physical activities. The ComfortFlex works great for active pursuits like running, and it is super-easy to put on and take off.[EDITED 7/31/2013] The original harness broke after about 5 weeks of use. After I posted the initial review, I was contacted by the manufacturer. We sent the broken harness back in to be checked, and it turns out we had received one with a small manufacturing defect. They sent us a replacement, and it's been working like a charm! Our dog was really excited when we took it out of the box, and insisted that we put it on her and try it out right away.

This is the best Grain Free dog food that I could find that wasn't at such a ridiculous price.  Not saying that this dog food is cheap, but its the best deal when your looking for an upscale dog food.Also, for the record my dogs don't have food allergies or anything, but I do believe that they should be on the grain free diet because its healthier for them.  Plus, they don't need as much food as some of the cheap dog foods that have a bunch of fillers, so the cost to eating rate ratio decreases a little there.  Also, eating less food equals less poop....which is always a good thing! haha

My cat likes to sleep under my bed because she likes to have something over her. I live in a 550 sq ft apartment and all the play pens I found were too big. This is the perfect size and easy to ensemble. Just throw a couple of blankets in there, or if your pet is spoiled like mine, a memory foam bed.. anyway, this is perfect if you are looking for something small for a cat or a small dog. My parents have the large one for their chihuahua. I'm not quite sure why but she likes to too. For the price, you can't beat it!

This is a nice feeder, but it did not work well for our lab.  It could have easily been doubled in size and worked perfectly, but the height that it is now, its just not conducive for a larger dog that may suffer from eating problems and needs to  stand more erect when eating.  It would be perfect for a medium or small dog.

One of the very few hard biscuit treat my picky dog will eat. These are very small which is a good size for my dog. I also give her soft treats so Once in a while she's disappointed when she sees it's a hard treat and will refuse it but toss it on the floor and she'll pick it up and eat it so it must taste good.

This is a great value for quality food. I have three cats who each get a tablespoon or so of wet food a day and the larger size can option makes that easy. I bought some plastic lids and keep partially used cans in the fridge. My cats can be picky, but find this very palatable, and the quality of the food makes me happy.
I got results in 24 hours!I would highly recommend this product.I'm completing the ten day treatment as instructed.So glad I found this product!
My  two wiennie dogs love it, one is old, one is a pup. I am feeding half of what I was using the store brand beneful

We have 2 labs. They love to play together and race for their toys. From the first throw, they loved the ball. It fits perfectly in one's mouth, so the other chases the one with the ball and can't steal it. We haven't plalyed with it very long, so I don't know how long it lasts, but I'm excited to use it more as the dogs LOVE, LOVE, LOVE it.

My Betta Sammy and his community tankmates love these. Yummy for their tummies. I just wish that they floated longer and didn't sink so quickly. These are the perfect size for small fish, but I can't see why larger fish won't enjoy them.

5 Stars for the product minus two for the price mess up from the shipper...ultimately corrected...but I will now purchase the cans at the store....my dogs gobbled this down, mixed with their kibble---so I am very happy with the product

I have to agree with the other reviews...the smell of this litter, while smelling very pleasant and fresh, is very overpowering. I had to stop using it because that's all I could smell in my house...even our clothes smelled of it. Very good CLUMPING BUT extremely dusty....no way is it almost 100% dust free.

When we got a new puppy we really didn't want to go the puppy pad training way, but he was sick the first week and we had no other choice but to let him use the pads.  I tried 3 brands and the Out! brand seems to be the best.  I hate the fact that the puppy is associating white squares on the floor with acceptable places to relieve himself, because I have some awesome white throw rugs in my bedroom (which is off-limits, but he got in there once, and it wasn't good.)Hopefully this stage won't last long but these pads come in handy.  He only uses a pad once and then he's done - wants a clean one.  It's basically a waste of money.  A tip most everyone knows is to clean the floor real well under the pad after he's soiled it, and it has been removed, so he doesn't smell his odor on the spot anymore.I also recommend a puppy training manual.  We are using one from Cesar Milan, the dog whisperer, and it's helping a lot.

This works great.  I had a laugh watching my cat "investigate" this when I first set it up and put it where her old water bowl was.  For about a hour, she was cautious and would walk up to the water bowl and swat at the waterfall.  It was hilarious.  We've had this for about a month now, and so far so good.  She seems to drink out of it often and she has fresh water at all times, which makes me feel like a better mother.  I can work really long hours sometimes, so some days, I literally just come home to sleep before heading back to work in the morning.  So, having one less thing to do in the mornings (changing her water) is great.  I clean and change her water on the weekend and it's been working great.My own (tiny) complaint about this item is that because of the water dripping out, there's always a trickling sound coming from that area, and since her food area is close to my kitchen, I always think I left the faucet on, haha.  But this isn't a design defect or anything.  Since it's dripping out water, it's naturally going to make some noise.  I love this water fountain, so this is not a real issue, but thought it was worth mentioning.
My guineas love these. I have to buy them 2 or 3 bags at a time! I have 2 pigs and they eat one each per week.

We have a kitty cat who adopted US about four years ago.Despite trips to the vet, all her shots, etc etc, she had a problemwith watery eyes. The vet suggested that it might be allergies, andgave us a suggestion for an allergy tablet. Not a bad idea, IF we couldget it down her! While no cat likes pills, this one makes it her goal tobe sure there is endless drama if you try to give her one, includinggrowling, barking at us (yes barking!), hissing and foaming at the mouth.She is also masterful at making herself throw a pill back up if we managedto get one down her!We'd keep her weepy eye cleaned, of course, but she would also sneeze from timeto time, usually on us, or in the water dish - ew!  After reading so many otherpositive reviews, I decided to give this product a try. By the way, it was neversuggested by our vet, whom I suspect of being very pro-dog, and not fond of cats!Anyway, within days of putting the small amount in her food (I mixed it in - haven'ttried just sprinkling it on top yet), her eye has become much better, and not onesneeze to be heard!The only change has been the addition of this Viralys to her meals, so the credithas to go to this!  It is even very cold here, when she normally gets small sniffly colds,and nothing at all!  Yay!I don't know if this needs to be given daily or not, so once we were cleared up, I amgiving it to her a couple times a week, unless it seems like we need to go back to daily.It is too bad there are not other scents/flavors. This has a definite fishy odor, whichthey don't seem to mind. I have no idea how it tastes and don't plan to find out, but bothour cats prefer poultry to fish flavored foods, so wish they offered a chicken Viralys!Maybe in the future...Meanwhile, if your cat has endless sniffles, a weepy or damp eye, I highly recommend this one!

We live in northern NJ and every year at this time is bow-hunting season for deer.  I go hiking frequently with my two dogs off leash in the woods where hunters may be, so i purchased these vests.  Both of my dogs are about the same size and weigh about 45lbs each and the medium fit perfectly.  There are two adjustable velcro straps, one around the neck and one around the chest.  I tried them out today and they fit fine.  I put their harnesses on top of the vests, no problem.  Let me tell you, you can see these from over 100 yards very clearly as they run through the woods.  (posted some pics of the vests on my dogs)Not sure yet how they will hold up, but for the price and free Prime shipping, it's a real winner!

This collar does work.  It came in black instead of blue.  Also watch out because you have to remove other tags if the dog shakes its head the chimes of the ID tags sets it off.  The beep it makes can be heard with human ears and the vibration is low.  I found the dog repeller to be more useful for controlling barking than this because atleast with the dog repeller i can hit the button for a second to correct the barking instead of the collar which goes off for 5 seconds
My dogs love Buddy Biscuits.  When they hear those two words, they all come running.  Its the only brand we buy because they love it so much.
Colorful stick out in yard strong priced right cleans in dishwasher color stays puppy loves them ..beach toys for dogs

I purchased two of these for my 110 gallon tank.  They keep the temperature right where I need it.  My main issue is that there is a "do not place below this line" and it is about 1" below the "do not allow water below this line".  My tank evaporates 2 inches in a week... so if I didn't fully submerge it, it would overheat due to lack of water.  I've hard it submerged now for a couple of months with no problem, however, it is concerning that there is a max water level on a submergable heater.  It works great and is working fully submerged, but I gave it a 4 because I suspect this might void the warranty.

With 4 dogs in the house, I love the convenience of having several boxes on hand. These are some of the most healthiest treats on the market. Two of my dogs have bad food allergies, and these treats do not aggravate them. I continue to purchase these over and over again. My pups love these treats.

I've had this setup running 24/7 for over a year now and it&#8217,s been working very well! It does everything it is supposed to and works perfectly for my freshwater tank. The UV light is fantastic when I use it and can clear my water up overnight.Some issue it does have however are the seal on the top and putting it back together after cleaning. Once you finish cleaning and want to put everything back together, it's a guess and check game on whether or not you put the baskets in the correct position. I recommend making some marks on the canister and lid to help remind you how to place the baskets in the canister. As for the red seal around the top piece, you MUST push it all the way back into place around the entire top before closing the canister or else it will leak!Once I figured all that out I had a great canister filter for my 120g freshwater planted tank!

The bed has held up to my puppy for a few weeks now....she bites it, drags it and also sleeps in it. She is only 11 lbs, so maybe that is why it seems to be durable. Washed it once in the washing machine with no problem. My only complaint is that it could use A LOT more cushion...the botton barely has any.

This is a Purina dog food with what looks like funny shaped pieces. We usually use regular Purina, and my dogs seemed to prefer this dog food. The ingredients are not premium or anything and seem like what you would get with any Purina dog food.

My cat doesnt like the bristles this brush has so I dont even use it.  Waste of money :(  He actually prefers the cheap $3 one from Petsmart with the thin fine bristles.  The bristles on this one are like the ones from a regular hair brush and that doesnt work very well on short cat fur.

Not for a Yorkie.  This is a homemade outfit.  Not to keep any dog secure.  It is in its packaging, and not even worthy of giving to a shelter.  What should I do with it?  Cute.. But, not a secure method of leash/ collar for any pup or doggie.I rate negative.  A first time dog owner would not know any different, you should be ashamed.

Purina Pro Plan Beef, Carrots & Rice Entr&eacute,e in Gravy opens with a fragrant spicy beef bouquet with notes of ripe carrots and fluffy brown rice. On the palate, the texture is full bodied, viscous and balanced. The flavor profile is a hearty beef blend with notes of fish that lilts gently across the tongue.  The meaty tidbits are packed in a generous amount of delicious lip smacking gravy. The taste lingers for quite some time (i.e. I can re-taste it when I burp - I like that in a food). Whether your taste buds prefer beef bourguignon or fresh mouse, this offering will be perfect for you.  I suggest you pair it with bowl of tap water and perhaps a mouthful of crunchy kibble.Enjoy - Steve The Cat,,,^. .^,,, ~

We bought this for our dog when she was just under a year old and still had a high urge to chew. The one flaw is that she was able to bite a small hole in the toy. Thankfully, she hasn't managed to make it larger, or make any additional holes, however please note you shouldn't leave your dog unsupervised with this toy to chew on. That being said for tossing and playing fetch it's a great choice. I purchased this especially for playing in the house on rainy days because it's light and doesn't break anything if it hits furniture, bookcases, etc. All in all I recommend this for people with dogs who have energy to play. P.S. we have a 73lb. shepherd mix and it works just fine with her!
Advantage works very well on my cats. They tolerate it well, and it gets rid of fleas quickly.  I use this every other month on my cats and it controls the fleas very well

This thing can really move some water!  I use it along with the quick filters in my water dragon enclosure.  I have it submerged and mounted horizontally.  It sprays a stream up out of the water and drives up my humidity.  I love it!
This cute little giraffe has held up pretty well with my 10 month-old foster Aussie terrier.  Just the right size for him.

I bought this filter from Petsmart and I thought it was great when I first got it up and running.  I really like the fact it's slim and takes up less room and also has an adjustable flow on it.  The first week I had to keep looking at the water to see if it was running since it was so quiet.  Now two weeks later it makes a constant hum.  I've tried everything, taking the lid off, making sure it wasn't touching the hood or any cords, adjusting the angle, and nothing has worked.  It's driving me crazy!!  Not sure what I'm going to do about it but I do know I can only take the hum for so long before I yank it out.  What seemed perfect, isn't.
Duke loves it! It works great to encourage foraging.
Great leash for long walks. My dogs still have freedom to run and play together while on their leashes. Worth the money!!!

its not the most luxurious brush but my cat has a really long coat that is not fluffy (kind of like rabbit fur), so I need a brush appropriate for that, but that doesn't have too deep of bristles.  This works out quite nicely.  It's quite small and shallow, I can brush her without causing her too much annoyance.  It's kinda cheap but it's what I was after.edit: you know what I have to bump this up a star.  Its really the only brush my cat will tolerate.  It catches plenty of hair.  It is kind of cheap like I said and I will probably need to replace it a few times a year since I brush her every day and the pins will bend easily...but I can't imagine making it any more solid and keeping it light and tiny...so I can't fault them for it.  Its really perfect for my tiny kitty with long fine hair.
My cats love it and if they love it i love it. Easy to put together and GREAT price compared to the pet store.

This is a cheaper alternative to Wellness's single-serving pouches.  Kitty will eat some of it if it's drenched in water.  If your cat likes Wellness, try this and save yourself some money well still giving kitten good nutrition!

When our dog plays with this thing she throws it in the air and when it lands it sounds like she just threw a brick.  Minus the loud nature of this toy it is great, our dog is a powerful chewer and she can put bite marks into it but that's about all.  We have had this toy for about 5 months and it is still intact but with hundreds of bite marks in it.  I would strongly recommend NOT stepping on this.  Overall this is a durable toy that our dog loves.

I had polio as an infant so bending and stooping are harder for me now that I'm approaching 60 y/o (gosh that looks dreadful in writing).  This design is particularly helpful in keeping the scoop off of the floor and in a convenient location.  I purchased it to fit onto the side of the large Nature's Miracle corner box with high sides, which is also a dream.  Good quality plastic, very pleased with my purchase
Our cute little dog had the breath from hell! This product actually works! She loves them as treats and her breath is waaaaaaay better!
Sweeet makes my water changes that much quicker..

I loved the IDEA of this collar.  My Boston Terrier (20lbs) and I take a lot of off-leash walks on the city trails, and it's nice to have the option of a lease ready at-hand.  The thing I was most excited about with this product was the idea that I don't have to let his existing leather leash trail on the dusty, muddy trail while we're walking.  I still think this could be GREAT for larger dogs, and could do exactly these things.  However, the EXECUTION leaves some room for improvement.It's way too big and bulky for little dogs, and unfortunately, inappropriate for flat-faced (brachycephalic) dogs like Bostons, Pugs, and Bulldogs.  As the photo I posted shows, this is an incredibly large thing to be hanging off of a small dog's collar.  My dog keeps shaking his head and trying to pull the collar off when we leave the house.  I think this leash thingy would be very nice and appropriately sized on a larger dog's collar, but it's too much for a 20lb dog, I think.It also doesn't have the option to lock the leash in a certain position, which would be really nice.  It's so thin that it really pinches my hands if I try to hold it at a certain length (important if you are training the dog to walk by you at all times when on-leash).  A locking mechanism would be nice.  Addition length would also be really nice, since this seems too short to let the dog sniff more than a foot away from me.Lastly, I think this would be far better as something I could ADD to the dog's existing harness.  Flat-faced dogs should often avoid collars around the neck, since they are more prone to choking, reverse sneezing, and other neck/breathing-related injuries.  In fact, I inspected the collar and I think I'm going to slim it down to its smallest collar size and then clip it onto the back of his SENSE-ation dog harness (extra small).  Kind of bulky, but might be more useful for me.  If the leash holder were smaller, the leash a little longer, and it possibly included a locking mechanism, I think it'd be appropriate for a lot of smaller dog owners.
my shih tzu (notably finiky) eats/gnaws on these until they are nubs!  they smell good, too!  best chew I've ever purchased! thanks!

Picked up one of these for my 3 month old Pembroke Welsh Corgi puppy.  For the price, it can't be beat.  It's about as simple as they come.  The base unscrews to pop in a replacement roll.  It includes a clip and velcro to attach it to a standard leash.  The included bags have a light pleasant scent.  I have had no problem with tears or getting the bags to open.  I intend to refill it moving forward with the unscented compostable bags from the same company.  The rolls appear to be the same size so I don't anticipate any problems making the switch.  I would have preferred the old style dispenser that has the caribiner personally, but it's a minor detail in the grand scheme of things.  We find we have to be careful where we clip it on the leash as she is quick to mistake it for a chew toy when she notices it.

I have two of these for my cat and I purchased one for a neighbors little dog.  We live in Florida and our winters do get cold for this area and our pets aren't really used to cooler weather.  My cat adores her beds, sleeps in them all the time.  My neighbor was concerned her pet wouldn't use it.  Well guess what, she can't get the dog out of it.  Her cat fights with the dog to use it.  The animals love them.  Their little tummies are so warm.  Plenty of spread out room for a small animal.  Be aware if you have an animal that sheds (dog or cat) the bed does attract and hold their fur so you have to continually clean fur out of it but it is EASY to do.  Also cat litter that gets caught in paws also winds up in the bed but again, just shake out the bed once in a while.  Your pet will love you for purchasing this bed for them.

These little bones have two knots (one at each end) and will fit in the palm of your hand.  That said, they are loved by our dogs up to about 30 lbs.  After that, we switch to the Small Dingos instead of Mini.  The Big Dogs gets the larges!  Can't say enough good things about this company and about how many years we've been buying them.  Not a single dog ever turned one down.  Love in a bag!

My dog loves getting treats out of toys, but this one just didn't hold up to Kong's regular reputation. He had the ends of it (the 4 circles on the end of the bone) chewed completely off in less than a day. Definitely don't leave your dog alone with the toy if he's a strong chewer. He'll get the pieces off and could swallow them.

At it's current selling price, this is one relatively expensive water dish.  Is it worth it?  When I chose it, I hoped so. One of my two cats was becoming picky about drinking water and I hoped the bubbling design would peak his curiousity.  At first both cats were turned off to the motor noise but eventually the female started to use the dish, but preferred a standard water dish. I wondered why both cats would try to drink but got turned off to using the dish, I assumed it was the motor noise so I waited a few months to see what would happen (and held off writing this review).After careful observation I see now what's happening.  It's not the motor noise, it's the design of the bowl itself.  I wonder how a company can make a water dish without understanding one of the first basics of cats ... they don't want to stick their faces into places that are smaller than their whisker span.  Duh.  The artsy design of this dish makes the actual drinking area extremely tiny and odd teardrop shaped, with a high wall (the water slide) imposingly placed adjacent to the bowl.  The cats just can't get their faces close to the water without their whiskers being squished and an unfriendly surface blocking their view (cats also need to be in control for protection against the unknown, the high wall prevents that).Yesterday after cleaning the bowl I had the idea of setting the motor to the lowest speed and leaving the fancy curvy top off.  Success!  It is much more cat friendly now and still has the bubbling effect.  But that leaves me with a very expensive plain water dish.As others have noted, I suspect this is not really stainless steel but rather chrome plated metal. Even with soft, filtered water the surface stains and scales something terrible and is not easy to clean.  I don't know why, but as others have noted it also gets slimy very fast (faster than a standard water dish), I suspect it's because the water is trapped under the metal cover and can't "breathe".  I finally ran it through the dishwasher and had to spend a half hour scrubbing it by hand after that.Looking back at the other bubbling water dishes, most have a large easy to access water surface (like the same company's Big Max).  I should have seen the issue as soon as I looked at the photos, there is no logic at all for having such a tiny teardrop shaped water surface ... it's purely design over function and it makes this a poor choice for a feline water dish.[ADDENDUM] After I wrote this review I decided to remove the motorized pump entirely.  Now without the odd top cover and the whirring sound of a motor my cats love this dish. The picky one drinks from it regularly throughout the day. And the water doesn't get slimy. I could have (and should have) just bought a stainless steel dog dish for a fraction of the price. I'm leaving it at two stars which means "I don't like it" rather than one star for "I hate it".

I ordered this product to have around the house "just in case," and three days later my cat got an upset stomach and made a mess around the litterbox, up the stairs to the front door landing, and then came up another flight of stairs and scooted around for a bit (which is how I realized that we had a problem in the first place).Well, I made a batch of Fizzion (spray bottle, warm water, one tablet) and cleaned everything and the smell is SO clean, as are the floors, the walls and the little bit of carpeting that he also managed to mess up...and of course there's a ton of product left over because one tablet makes 23 oz. of cleaner.I never found Nature's Miracle to work that well. I used to use OdoBan because the smell is so pleasant. But THIS stuff, this stuff smells clean without being harsh. Costs so much less per bottle, there's no comparison. I'm a convert!

All I have to say is this litter catcher is a genuis idea!  Very easy to assemble the bag in the container and very easy use.  For multiple cat owners though you may want to consider purchasing more than one.  I have one cat and it does fine for her.It would be nice to be able to purchase a larger size one, especially if you have more than one cat.  I love how the scoop has it's own holder and you just lift the lid, place the litter in the top and pull the lever...all done!  Litter is stored in the bottom part of the container in the bag and there is no smell or mess.  WONDERFUL WONDERFUL WONDERFUL!

We bought the 3/4 inch leash for our 30 lb french bulldog and it's perfect. It's long enough to coil it if you need to reel in slack and long enough to let out without too much freedom. It's thin, but very sturdy and made of a nice smooth material with reflective stitching on one side. We're very pleased with this purchase.

My dogs love Beneful.  I have tried Science Diet and I had to put cheese on it for them to even touch it.  I have tried Kibbles N Bits, and yes, they love that too, but Beneful is somewhat healthier.  If you compare the two brands, Beneful has 25% protein compared to Kibbles 19%.  Beneful also uses mostly natural ingredients, for example- sugar rather than high fructose corn syrup.  While it is not the healthiest or recommended by vets, it is the best of the cheap options available.  Also noteworthy, my parents switched their dogs to the Healthy Weight Beneful and they both lost about 10 lbs over the past year.

We have three big dogs ranging from about 55 pounds to just over 100 pounds. Needless to say they can eat a lot.They seemed to like this food and we didn't have any problem getting them to eat it. We mixed it with their regular limited ingredient food so that it would seem like a treat to them. If you read the packaging however you will notice this is not a real high quality dog food. Our male dog (about 95 pounds) has skin issues and some of the ingredients in this would send him off to the vet quickly if this were his only food. So be warned if your dog has any kind of food allergy or skin issues this may be one to stay away from.The price is OK. It may seem high but when you are used to the price of limited ingredient foods this is much lower. You do get what you pay for some times though and this is not a food I can fully endorse. Do not be taken in by the name on the label.With that said I can say the Rachel Ray wet food is much better than most of what is out there and at last check did not contain meat by-products. Again, don't be swayed by the name and pretty face, instead read the ingredients and see if one of her products is right for your dog.Do the dogs like it?--A minusIngredients--DOverall Score--C or 3 stars
Seemed like a very nice and sturdy dog toy. It was free when I purchased another product. Much too big for my little dogs so gave it to my son who has a big dog.
My puppy loves this food!! She is a 12 week old morkie and she was it up. I wish they made more flavors of the puppy food. This is the only flavor I can find
This leash connected is perfect for running or walking with a large dog and not wishing to hold onto a leash.

I like these chews over rawhides. They're a little harder to find but I feel a little better handing him this than rawhides. They're about as thick as other chews so it ends up being a good alternative. They get chewed up a lot faster than rawhides, though--my dog is finished in like 3 minutes.

I have a bunny named Jose. He had the rabbit sickness known as the snuffles. I read a thread online and a person who raises rabbits suggested using this product instead of taking the rabbit to the vet. So I bought this product.I used the entire bottle on my rabbit and he was still sneezing, coughing, and had runny eyes. So I finally took him to the vet and they said that they see a lot of their patients attempt to use products like this but they DO NOT WORK. Sometimes it can relieve symptoms but it will not get rid of the bacteria or illness. I basically wasted $30 on this product. I should have taken my money and used it at the vet. My rabbit was on antibiotics that they gave me for two weeks, and I notice that he is significantly better already. If you really care about your pet just take them to the vet to someone who knows the issue. If you use this product you will end up wasting money and needing to take your pet to the vet anyway.

I order this from Amazon unless I find it for buy one get one free at a local store.  We use these for our 6 cages of gerbils... my wife breeds them.  It works good for all adults, but juveniles can get red nose from it.  For newborns and juvies, we use Kaytee Clean and Cozy bedding.  That being said, any cages with adults we use Carefresh Natural exclusively.

Bought this off the same seller on Ebay for cheaper and larger quantity. Not the actual Fluval Edge sponge and is a bit tighter I believe and differs a little, but still great. Fits just fine and works well for other small filters with smaller intakes. A lot cheaper than buying the actual sponges and since you get more for a lower price you can just switch out the sponges each time during maintenance and take your time rinsing the old one out. After using a pre filter sponge my Aqua Clear filter foams are a lot cleaner and the particles trapped by the extra mechanical filtration is great.

OK, I have spoiled my cats on the huge old 7/11 insulated cups I have 3 around the house in various areas that I refill daily with ice filled to the brim water.I know that cats will drink more water if it's not by their food bowl. (Our vet even took my recommendation and applauded me for the suggestion, she loves cats and has 2 of her own).So, I decided to try this as a treat for them as they love moving water from the bathroom faucet.Well, It works for my cats as a backup, but they still prefer my ice filled cups of water scattered around the house.The cat mate does not allow the ice to stay for very long as it melts it pretty quickly due to the motion.I would recommend this for anyone who has never spoiled their cats on ice water for sure, the waterfall is an attraction to them and my cats still drink from it, bit not after depleting the iced chilled water I had prepared for them 1st. Don't place their water by the food bowl, they will drink more water if it's placed elsewhere, and you will also notice you have to refill the water more than before.

My cats go wild for these chews and one cat is having a eye outbreak with the herpes right now- these seem to be helping but it is taking a while to go away hence the 4 star rating.  Like that they have minimal ingredients.and that the cats like them.

Okay, I'm rating these based on my cats' reactions to these treats. While one is the exact opposite of a picky eater (ANYTHING that is remotely edible that hits the floor is fair game in her mind), the other is a lot more finicky when it comes to snacks.  Needless to say, the feline garbage can literally inhaled these treats and was looking for more.  Cat #2 took a little more time/investigation when it came to the treat (that or she just likes for the other cat to be tormented while being held back from snatching up the treat as she sniffs at it for a minute, something I really don't put past her), but once she tried it, she was much quicker eating the second bite.  Finding a treat that both cats enjoy and is made of seemingly healthy ingredients/less crappy filler is a great thing.That said, these things are NOT cheap.  You do not get a lot for your money, though at least if you're buying them for cats,  you can break up the round treats to share them among several cats or get a couple of feedings out of one piece. I can see these being more of a special occasion snack than an every day thing - at least while on the current budget.

This little coat is just what I wanted - and I ordered 2 of them for my Miniature Poodle and MiniMix. Possibly it's my error, I don't know  - but I am so VERY disappointed.  My furkids have several winter coats and sweaters and every single one is a MEDIUM.Maybe I should have been leery that ONLY the mediums were reduced so low in price---as the size is all wrong.These sweaters are so huge that even my 20 pounder is wallowing in this coat---I can't even begin to pull the velcro tight enough on her to keep it in place.  Needless to say the 18 pounder is lost in this coat.I would like to return but I think all the cost involved is just too much. I guess I'll just eat it!!I am very disappointed indeed

All 3 cats like scratching cardboard, and particularly this incline scratcher. It is a bit flimsy under heavy use, but a bit of duct tape squares it up. Would prefer to buy the inserts in bulk and cheaper than a new setup, though.
Our barn cats love it.  We have a dozen of them taking care of the barn and this is an inexpensive way to fee them.

Purchased these wipes for quick in-between bath cleanups for my 9 week old puppy. He is constantly getting into messes and I can't possibly give him a full bath every time. These wipes are the perfect solution, and my little pup really seems to enjoy the attention he gets while I am cleaning him up  - leaves his coat soft, fluffy, and smelling good.
I have a small cat sanctuary.  Whenever a cat won't eat, FortiFlora is the first thing I reach for.  I sprinkle it on top of their canned food and they eat it right up.
works great pretty easy to do all the test, wish there was one more test tube, but everything else is nice well packaged, explained in various languages and pretty comprehensive.

I know it's just a heater, but I want to give confidence to whoever is debating which one to get for your tank that this is one very reliable product.  I am using this one for my 55G saltwater tank, and it works great !!  Hope you find this review useful.
My dogs don't like it. Because they like Dingo bones, I thought they would enjoy these as much, but they don't

I had always been curious about silica litters, but thought my picky kitty wouldn't tolerate.  She wouldn't do corn, wheat, pine. She has only liked A&H, brands. She drinks LOTS of water, which is wonderful for her health, but horrible for buying and throwing away clay litter. Not to mention, clay litters don't hold out long and she doesn't effectively bury anything.We decided to give this a try. IT IS AMAZING. While we sort of followed the transition instructions, she had no hesitation about switching. I no longer smell the boxes, ever. She is a huge fan (she used to inappropriately eliminate to show disapproval) we have had no incidence on this litter even after letting the box go several days too long. best of all...NO SCOOPING URINE!  This litter is great at drying liquids and solids out and eliminating odor. While the cost is a bit higher you use about 1/2 and it lasts 1.5-2x longer.I do use this in combination with a disposable bio-degradable box and I do find that the urine finds its way to the bottom of the box and soaks it more so than before, but the litter assists in this dry out. If you use similar boxes, you may want to make sure you have a water proof barrier between it and the floors.While my cat doesn't have any specific respiratory needs I did notice that she tracks this less and sneezes less. My only complaint is how difficult this is to find. Pet stores tend to be out and there isn't a reasonably priced distributor on Amazon.  It does come with a manufacturer coupon, if only I could find a place to use it!

We got this to supplement the diet of our Maine Coon but whether it was too "rich" or she just didn't like the taste, she ate it and then threw up on several occasions. Donated the remainder to my parents, whose dogs love it. So as with most pet products - your results may vary.
I received 6 capsules as advertised,and had no problem with cats eating them when added to food.I don't know if it worked as no worms were expelled. But there was no adverse reactions to medication.
This was recommended as a treat dispenser, but we use it as his feeding bowl everyday! Encourages problem solving and movement when eating... when will they make one for us humans! :)"

The balls are the perfect size balls for my Chihuahua, Maltese and Havanese, all small breed dogs. We have had others that are too small that they get in their mouth then they can't get them back out. These won't do that with small breed dogs, they are just the perfect size and are a huge hit with my dogs.If your looking for a ball to toss your small furry friend then you have found it with these. I know the frustration of having only the choice on large balls or too small balls being the only thing sold at the local pet stores, buy them here and from this company as the shipping was just as perfect as the product.

THIS IS CLUMPING LITTER!!!If you enlarge the photo, you can see it says TIGHT CLUMPS.This is great litter, if used correctly.. You just have to shake it and be sure to not scoop the dark part of a clump, and also not scoop litter as long it is stuck to the sides or the bottom, wait until it can be shaken toward the center. I have two cts who can share one box with this, I do scoop multiple times a day , and almost never have to clean the box. I just keep adding fresh litter as I scoop, and am careful to not break up clumps! It is not dusty and has a pleasant, not-too-strong odor. You may find it for less in your local super markt.

My sister had a $80 Petco version of this that she gave me and I bought this one for the dog to have upstairs. This one is just as high quality, just as durable, and has al, the same features. Great buy!

After reading the rave reviews for this product, I decided to give toothpaste a try before taking my recently rescued pit bull to the vet for a $300 professional cleaning. Petrodex Enzymatic  toothpaste has completely removed his rancid breath. I expect the yellowing will go away with regular brushings as well. I followed the instructions, I let Gunner sniff the toothpaste on my finger and soon he began licking it off. Next, I put some on a human toothbrush and turned it into a game. He began chewing on the toothbrush and I began secretly brushing his teeth. Now, he simply lets me brush his teeth whenever he is laying down. I simply pull back his lips and brush the exterior teeth. He eventually starts licking his teeth and I am able to brush the interior of his teeth. Thanks, Petrodex, for saving me a boat load of cash!
This laser toy kept my cats' interest for one day, too noisy. Cats are sensitive to sound, what is the manufacturer thinking?
I love the design of these little bowls! They are shallow so my cats can eat from them easily, have a nice solid feel and the colors/artwork are tasteful.

I used to feed my cats Fancy Feast, 'cause I really couldn't find anything better. Or so I thought. I wasn't happy about all the &#34,meat byproducts&#34, in FF. Then I found this food. My cats LOVE it, and I love it 'cause there are no ingredients in it that I do not like. This flavor is Sheba's favorite.

The size large turned out to be a little too big on my husky/german shepherd mix. She has a long chest, but she's thin so it's hard to get things that fit just right. The quality of material is very good. It is strong and sturdy. I will use this in winter when she is wearing her sweaters to make up for it being slightly large. Her chest measures 29 inches, and her neck is 17.

Have been giving dog a bath every day for the last four weeks and he seems to be healing very well from the skin infection that he had.  I think I will order another bottle just to make sure this nasty skin infection has been obliterated from this great pet.

I actually bought this product to line the floor in my rabbit's pen. While they do use their litter box, they're prone to accidents every once in a while but I've never had to worry about the urine leaking through to my carpet. I was also pleased with the texture. It's very comfortable for my rabbits to lay on and I would imagine that it would be great for young puppies, as well. I can't exactly vouch for it's use as a whelping mat, but if anyone needs a good liner for a bunny pen, I can highly recommend this product!

I have four cats, and one of the four has problems with throwing up almost every kind of cat food we've tried. For the past year or so, we've been feeding her Purina One Sensitive Systems, which she tolerates better than other foods but still throws up once every 2nd or 3rd day. Needless to say, we were willing to try something new.Overall, I was really impressed with the quality of Nutrience's Grain Free cat food, and the fact that the ingredients are US-sourced is definitely a plus, too. As for the cats, all four absolutely love it - even the pickiest one, who often gets canned food instead - and the one with a touchy stomach seems to be tolerating it at least as well as the Sensitive Systems. Definitely recommended for picky eaters as well as cats with other dietary concerns!
I don't necessarily hate this ball but my dog never ever picked it up or played with it. May be i should write a review about my dog's lack of playfulness instead???
The double row of teeth on this comb is great. It works so well and helped get rid of our fleas. Thanks!

I have two cats, both domestic shorthair. The boy cat is 16 pounds and the girl cat is 9 pounds. Long story put short, I got tired of meowing at my bedroom door and got tired of getting up to open the bedroom door. So I had this installed and I just love it. The boy cat who is 16 pounds easily fits through with no issues at all.I went to local pet stores and the cat doors they have available are ridiculous, so expensive, no big sizes, and not many features. So I purchased from Amazon instead.The cat door is really easy to install, just follow the instructions. Or just trace the provided template onto the door and measure no more than 7 inches from below the floor + door. This is so the cats can place their paws onto the floor as they exit or enter.I use the lock features because sometimes I don't want them in my bedroom messing around and knocking things over. The lock feature is also nice if you want to trap them and get them into a pet carrier to see a vet ,)My only complaint about this is that the magnet is sometimes messed up, so as they leave or enter the room, the door swings back and forth and then stops right before the magnet. It happens occasionally, but not too often.Overall a really nice product and I highly recommend it!
My cat loves them but I can't tell that they've had any effect on her sore joints. Worth the try though.
Just the right size for my tea cup Chihuahua! I have always fed my dogs Milk Bone treats, and they love them! My Australian Shepherd has her medium size bones, and now my Chihuahua has his!

I bought several Drinkwell Platinum fountains because I have a multi-cat household.  All my cats prefer a fountain with a waterfall,even the ones who lap from the pool rather than drink from the falls.  I highly recommend the fountains and recommend filters be changed regularly.I am now very careful what my cats get as food and water.  I have had two of them develop a problem with gingivitis, so filtering the water is even more important.  I highly recommend pet owners (cat and dog)  to have a long talk with their vet about gingivitis and other teeth and diet problems.  I got careless and my pets suffered, now that I am being more careful with diet and water they are healthy and happier.  (And yes, the two who had gingivitis have recovered).

I had high hopes for this matt, but while it may be a great size it doesn't capture cat litter. I still had to sweep and/or vacuum my floor and didn't see any value this matt provided -- ended up returning it and bought a woven cat matt at PetSmart that works great
Thought this was cute, but only lasted a couple of months.  the printing of our phone number just wore off.  Had to replace with a collar that had embroidered numbers - worth the few $ more

I give the same version of this for canines to my dog.  But no more.Just watched Dr. Oz and they had Consumer Labs on who tests ingredients in vitamins/supplements for humans and animals.  Here is the report for this:NOT APPROVEDCLAIMS 50% VITALIN C, FOUND 42%FOUND .60 - 1.79 MCG OF LEAD PER DAILY SERVING - OVER THE SAFE AMOUNTPet - Tabs was approved.Not getting all the vitamin C is not a problem in my opinion, but heavier doses of lead that are dangerous to our pets is a problem.  I'll be switching.

My kitties love this little hut.  They have similar items and I figured this one would be a hit.  It certainly is.  It was easy to set up and does not collapse easily.  Had it a week and it has only collapsed one time and it has had lots of use.  I do with that it came with a mat but I believe one is made for it but costs about as much as the hut.
my dog is absolutely addicted to this toy. my dog is still young and likes to chew and tear up things so the longevity of this item is not that long, but still worth the money.
