This is artificial grass which doesn't fool my dogs one bit.  Of course, if it were the only rug in the house it would be no problem but they still prefer the cushy feel of carpet under their feet.  If you buy this be assured you will have to spend some time training most dogs to use this.  Just like in the wild they would not come running at the sound of an electric can-opener, they aren't going to automatically know this is the appropriate reading room.I measured the tray and it holds a little over 4 cups, probably 5 cups if you have really steady hands but I don't, so you have to take into consideration the size of the bladders in question and how often you can come to empty it.  Probably a small dog could use this all day, a larger one once.  Solid wastes aren't going to fall down between the fibers into the tray so if you will have to manually pick that up or flush it with a hose.Obviously you would want it to be where it can't be accidentally bumped....

My dog really likes the taste of these!  He's a large dog so I give him 2 at a time, but I can tell he wants more.  My cat seems quite interested in the smell of them and seems to want one as well.My dog can be choosy about treats and it's a great testament that he enjoys these.  I love that they contain probiotics and enzymes to help with his digestion.  They do contain different flours and meals, like rye and oat, but they are very small in size, almost like a large cat treat size, which is a bit teasing to give a big dog, so I consider them more like tasty medicine than a treat and give him other treats for being good.The ingredient list looks wholesome and designed to help with digestion. It would be good to give these to dogs without digestive problems after they have to be on medications and antibiotics too.
Well, my title says it all. I filled it with water and fortunately put it in my dish rack to test it. It leaked instantly and continuously. Nothing I did made it stop leaking. A totally useless item.

I have an older Walker hound who has had many hunting miles put on. I noticed him getting stiffer in the joints each year. I started him on the Missing Link and it has him feeling much better. He is still ready to go when it is time to hunt! He will be on Missing Link until the end of his days.
Oxbow is a good name in cavy foods.  Our guinea pigs eat these pellets avidly and the nutrition provided is solid.

I think we love this more than our Chihuahua right now. This was very easy to put together with a power drill, about 10 min tops. Its light weight, but made very well and smells fantastic. Our living room smells like Cedar which is awesome. So far out little Chihuahua has chilled out on the upper deck, but she doesn't like the ladder. I may have to modify it and make it more of a ramp instead of mini stairs. Not sure most dogs will enjoy the stairs if at all. Oh well, that's why they are dogs. Our chihuahua has only camped out a few times in it right now, but I think that is because she is used to living on our couch and being spoiled. Eventually she will get used to this as her home. I think this is an exceptional little house for a small dog and it looks great and smells great as to keep pests out of it for sure. I have no complaints.....its a cool little dog house and if you're dog is scared of the upper deck...well put a plant on it as it doubles for a nice plant stand too. Right now I have a plant on top...just because I have to modify the stairs so our dog is more comfortable going up and down on it. Good product, good design, super fast shipping and made very well.

I know there is no litter mat on the planet that will do what I want it to: stop all the litter that gets tracked out with the help of my adorable, but litter tracking champion, cats. This does its job far better than expected, and I think the high pile of the spongy stuff is what the trick is.This mat is totally waterproof, as well. One of our cats vomited on it (they're also puking in horrible places champions), and when I cleaned it off in the tub, the back stayed dry. My normal cleaning of this is to just shake it out on the back porch and rinse it with some Dr. Bronners once a month or so.I have been pleasantly surprised by this litter mat, and highly recommend it to any multi-cat home.
She climbs it and hangs out on it daily. Great product! I would recommend it to anyone with a small or medium sized bird.

This was recommended by a friend for my very frightened rescue dog, and she does love the taste.  I keep gradually increasing the dosage, and I can't see that she is much calmer when awake, but she sure takes longer naps.  I also have a very skittish rescue cat who likes them, if broken into small pieces, and he does seem a bit less &#34,ready to run&#34, a while after having a couple of them.
my dogs like it, what else can i say?  i will buy more when i need it. that's all i

I have a 90H discus tank which I bought off Craig's List.  It came with a Jebo filter which is a knockoff of an Eheim.  The Jebo is of very acceptable quality but the booger rattled like a coffee can full of rocks.  While many people claim to be able to mend these problems on the fly, my problem is what I believe everyone else experiences with magnetic impeller drive power filters - the hole in the impeller became eccentric over time and the only way to really fix it is to the buy a new impeller.  Well, that was reasonably priced at $20 but the company website states a  location in GuangDong (sp?) Province in the PRC and having had our identity stolen a few times, that ain't gonna happen, PayPal or not.  Might as well just mail my SSN to the Russian mafia.So I waited for a special on Amazon and got this guy with free shipping (I could live with the death rattle for a few more days) and it was almost $60 cheaper than my LFS.  I'd like to help the little guy out but that's ridiculous.Got the filter in record time, even with free shipping, very well packed.  Set up took about 20 minutes and it worked perfectly upon plug-in.  The priming mechanism sounded cheesy but worked perfectly.  Very nice results (my Jebo was as good) and the flow rate is much easier to adjust that my old filter.  Very quiet.  The only funky thing is the outflow nozzle - looks like the choppers from the Alien creature.  I'd much prefer the standard 90* fitting with a dispersion bar.  The fish could care less and the more than ample power is keeping the plants happy.  The angels (which have grown to be monsters) will just point into the outflow for hours on end.While the subjective performance of the filter is essentially the same as my previous filter, this is better made, more powerful and likely quieter when compared to a new Jebo.  This was a real good purchase for me.

Seems like this company/brand is falling apart. They used to be great but they're just okay now. These used to be thin long strips that actually looked like achilles tendons (two points of insertion at 1 end and one point of attachment on the other end) as pictured. The new one is just a giant slab thats 2-3 inches wide and doesn't interest my dog at all.

Look, dying anything in these colors is going to be a bit messy. I used to pay $80 to get my dog dyed every 3 or 4 months. Now I can do it myself at home for a fraction of the cost. It lasts a few months for me if you include the fading time. I go with a bright pink and in the end, it is bubble gum pink. All pretty. My dog is black and white so the white takes and it looks fantastic. I don't follow instructions exactly. I wash in the laundry tub for her regular bath time, MASSAGE (happy dog) the dye on (I wear disposable latex gloves), leave for 5 mins while she sits quietly in warm garage/tub, rinse and MASSAGE IN a leave-in conditioner. Best tip I can give you to make it easier on the dog - give treats off and on through out the process. Just little bits of something to make it worth their while. Everyone loves seeing her, grumpy people brighten up, she's in photo albums all over the world. I did it once on a lark but she is such an ambassador for happiness with the color that I have continued for years now. I forget what she looks like w/o color. If the process isn't fun for you, the dog will pick up on that and it won't be fun for anyone. Make it fun or skip it. Of course the dog shouldn't suffer. So for clean up, what's the big deal? It's clean up, did you expect not to? I use bleach (after the dog is out of the area (don't want her to breathe fumes) or a scrubbing cleaner with bleach. It comes out fine. Sometimes I even do it in my marble shower - again, a little scrubbing (not bleach) and it comes out fine. Anyway, love the product and will continue to buy it. If you hate the process, groomers will do it for you. If you want less permanent, use the easter egg dye (food grade, non toxic) and it will wash out in the first or second washing. Or skip it completely and go for a walk.

I think this has to be one of the best ear cleaners on the market.  It is recommend by my vet. I have a German Shepherd with floppy ears who tends to get yeasty, smelly infections quite often and if we clean his ears with this cleaner every couple of weeks, his ears stay very healthy and happy!  Whenever either of my German Shepherds start scratching at their ears, all it takes is one good cleaning with this product and they are good as new for at least a couple of weeks.  This product has to be used as a preventative, because once your dog has an full blown ear infection, Zymox makes another product for that, which also works fantastic. Their products have saved me trips to the vet for ear infections!! I would highly recommend their products!

For brushing our cat, this item is basically useless. For bathing our cat, this tool is indispensable. The comb gently works the shampoo through the fur (much better than my fingers alone could do) and also works well to make sure to remove the shampoo too.
This is just the best toy invented for cats. mine loves it and knows where i store it and will ask to play. Good exercise great for tiring out the kitty.!!

I have purchased both the 120 count bags and the 315 count bags.  I have a 22 pound Boston Terrier/Italian Greyhound Mix that is 6 months old.  She produces a fair size movement (about the size of a fist) and have never had to "two bag" her using these bags, but sometimes the dog wants to go twice.Pros- The rolls are convenient and come in standard sizes that fit dispensers.- The 315 count bags come in a box with a dispenser making them easy to control.- The bags are pretty durable and can be inverted to put your hand in to grab the load.- The bags are light and can be put in the pocket or on a leash dispenser.Cons- The bags can rip, especially if the perforation between the bags pulls rather than coming apart cleanly.  They are also sometimes difficult to extract from the dispensers.- The bags in the 315 COUNT BAG PACKAGES GIVE YOU SMALLER BAGS THAN 120 COUNT BAG PACKAGES, on the order of about 2 inches shorter.  If you have a dog that produces larger excrement you are SOL if you purchase the 315 count bags.  Sometimes you cannot tie the bag if the movement is bigger than a fist.- The bags are "biodegradable" in a sense.  No where on the materials, packaging, or the Bags on Board website is there a mention of being biodegradable.  The only claims made are that they are leak-proof, and that they help the environment by allowing owners to pick up after the dogs and not spread bacteria.  Numerous sale sites such as Amazon state they are "biodegradable" but there are varying definitions.  Some users note that these bags are OXO biodegradable per company inquiries, but again it does not state that on the materials, packaging, or the Bags on Board website.  I would feel better if the company would disclose this on the package.Conventional polyethylene (PE) and polypropylene (PP) plastics will typically take hundreds of years to degrade, such as grocery bags.  If you want biodegradable bags it should meet ASTM D-6400 specification for biodegradation through composting as well as California compostable product claims.  ASTM D6400 standard requires 60% biodegradation within 180 days.  Companies such as poopbags.com produce these products, but they are very expensive. Otherwise, companies such as Green N Pack produce biodegradable bags that are OXO biodegradable.  OXO is a mix of polyolefin plastic to which has been added amounts of metal salts.  It biodegrades in about 2 to 18 months. Green N Pack Eco Friendly 200ct Green Dog Waste Bag Value Pack area available on Amazon, and are more expensive than Bags on Board, but the company does clearly state they are OXO.- There is no statement on the plastic rod that holds the bags whether it can be recycled, but I try to put in the recycle bin anyway.---------I really wish bags on board would produce a red stripe on the last bag or two.  Sometimes I have gone out with my dog and not realized it was down to the last bag and had to improvise...not fun.

Our six year old 92 pound Old English Bulldog  Harley and his partner in crime our 6 month old puppy, Elvis of the same breed - are the certified kings when it comes to destroying even the toughest toys.A long time fan of Nylabone products - they design toys with the dog in mind and not humans.Nylabone has been producing some of the finest, most durable dog toys here in the United States for over 50 years.That said, the Classic "Wish bone" has been a staple in this house for years. Our dogs just never tire of it.Our oldest Bulldog "Harley" is finicky about toys and loses interest after a few minutes but he'll keep this chew bone in his mouth for hours - even walking around the house with it, or holding it in his mouth while he haul his near 100 pound behind into bed.Elvis, our 6 month old Godzilla chewer can't  leave these alone either and can inflict some serious damage in record time.Nylabone is an excellent alternative to Rawhide which is processed with Formaldehyde and is fundamentally unhealthy and dangerous for dogs. - we stopped using rawhide toys years ago.Like most all Nylabone products these toys not only provide hours fun and hold up to even the most aggressive, hardcore chewers - they clean their teeth of tarter and plaque and help keep them healthy and white. When our Vet asked how we kept Harley's teeth so prefect - we answered Nylabones!This toy is just Great and offers the Following benefits to Pooch and Human Alike:1) Molded in a shape dogs just love2) Surprisingly strong and resilient.3) safe and Non Toxic Material4) Quality construction5) American made 100% Safe6) Great  size for most dogs - big end knots dogs love to chomp onIf you're looking for an excellent, time and dog proven toy that can stand up to big time chewers - you can't go wrong with the Wishbone from Nylabone.Like any dog toy supervision is key and an effort should be made to enjoy this toy along with your pooch under a watchful eye.5 PAWS UP!
Very helpful and efficient. Helped discipline my dog. Did what it said it would do.I will recommend this product to dog owners.
I don't use carbon very often, but its nice to have on hand, these packs are pretty good sized and polish up the water quickly.
The cats like it mostly, but they would prefer if the food were softer.  I mix and mash it up for them, but my cats prefer sloppy food.  Nothing wrong with the food...just spoiled cats.

After switching my dogs from a food that I ignorantly assumed was a high quality food (Science Diet) I started feeding them this food. My dogs absolutely love it! Before I would put food in their bowls and throughout the day they would slowly eat it but with Chicken Soup they beg me to feed them first thing in the morning and eat it up like I'm feeding them milkbones. The quality and finish of the Parka is very good, but the size was not. It was too small for my small dog and should probably be an extra small. The stuffed toy doggy is now wearing it.

Let me preface this review by first pointing out that my cats have been known to eat garbage. And like most cats, they aren't too proud to groom each other's...ah...delicates. Yet when presented with fresh lovely bowls of Bora Bora Luau Sardine Cutlets, glistening with lobster consomme, they both regarded the offering with looks of pure disgust. One, the larger and braver of the two, attempted a taste, but immediately recoiled in horror, after this they retired in disdain to lounge on the sofa and stare angrily at me. Knowing how fickle my spoiled brats can be, I tried putting this out a few more times, but on each occasion I incurred the same reaction as that first time:  cold, imperial refusal -- clearly both cats are at this point trying to understand why I don't seem to get the point.  I'm giving up, with a nearly full box of this nightmare stuff still left over.  I will be donating it to my city animal shelter, where hopefully the kitties have not yet reached ultimate prima donna status and are still willing to suffer through a lobster dinner.* SIDEBAR: curiously enough, although I do mock them openly in this review, both of my felines are decidedly socialist in their food choices, and will happily eat the cheap brands of wet foods with no issues, other than preferring certain flavors over others.  This was the first time I have ever seen them both turn down the same thing.  What's in this food, anyway???
Good product.  It was quiet.  It didn't splash.  It was great... except my little dogs didn't care for it much.  I gave it to my sister who has three cats.  I don't know if the cats are using it yet.
I CAN ONLY SAY IT'S OK, AS I AM NOT 100% SURE WHETHER IT WORKS AS IT SHOULD OR NOT. SOMETIMES THE DOG WHINES & BARKS WHEN WEARING IT & SOMETIMES WE DO NOT GET A 'BEEP' OUT OF HER (SMILE).

My cat is seventeen and in the early stage of kidney failure. She barely eats anything, mainly justs sucks juice out of her canned food. She barely touches her dry food or treats. She was getting so bony and I worried about her. So I decided to try the whiskas cat milk and she loves it! She also put on weight and looks healthier. She likes it cold from the fridge, I keep it in an empty pb jar and use disposable paper bowls, because she begs for it all day. Yes, if you need some extra nutrition or hydration or just a tasty treat, I'd buy some whiskas cat milk. Dogs love it too!
the bell doesn't make much noise and the fork, spoon, knife are all plastic so it doesn't make much noise either.

Washed and dried the windowsill, put the window perch up, instantly the perch was occupied by cats! I held my breath a bit as both of the cats hopped up on it (20 pounds of cat), but it stayed put. The perch stayed securely mounted and the cats looked very pleased. Looking at it I think I should have mounted it back a little bit further, but so far, it is holding fine. Moved the tape back a bit further, and perch is still staying out with my two cats on it. In fact, I am buying my second one.

I bought this feeder for portion control as one of my cats overeats on dry food until he throws up when being free-fed. Having an automatic feeder allows me to make only a limited amount of food available at a time while I'm at work, sleeping, or out of town and having a pet sitter stop by just once a day. The cats like the predictability of knowing when the feeder will spit out kibble, so they no longer act as desperate for food as before. So far it works fine and the batteries are lasting much longer than I expected.There are a couple of issues though that I've noticed while using it:1) The programming is bit counter-intuitive and it sometimes seems pressing a button does the opposite thing of what you expect. I have to get the manual out every time I need to reprogram it.2) It is not theft-proof - two of my cats have figured out how to go kibble-fishing by sticking their paws up into the dispenser mechanism. I don't know if this kibble-thieving has to do with it, but the wheel got stuck a couple of times resulting in not going off at the programmed time.3) My main criticism though would be that you can't thoroughly clean the apparatus as it is not supposed to get wet and the base unit cannot be submerged in water. I wished it would come apart for washing the parts that come in contact with cat food and over time develop a slimy/dusty layer of food particles. If I could redesign just one thing on it, I would at least give it a removable, dishwasher-safe feeding dish. I like to eat from clean dishes, and I know my cats do, too.(Note: This is a review for the old Petmate Bistro that I bought a while ago. I just noticed on the product page that they changed the design of the feeder and it now includes a removable feeding dish!)
I've had this tag on my GSP for a year and it still looks great! He runs and plays in the woods or dog park, the tag has not come off the collar once. I recommend the tag for any type of cat or dog.

Have had several of these filters on different tanks. I like them. They have great flow rates per gallon and the large space in the back can also be used for other media. I just got my fountain in today. It is replacing a Petmate Fresh Flow that broke down at the beginning of the summer. Id been using a regular water bowl and since I'm taking classes and working full time and ive been catching my kitten with her head in the toliet, i figured it was time to buy a new one.I can already see what people are saying about the resiviour, it's huge, but akward sized, and if you dont put it back on exactly right it does leak (found that out the hard way!) Silent as can be :)I love the size, i feel like with two cats I could easily leave this alone for a few days and not be concerned it will run dry.So far so good, just waiting to see my picky cat take a sip, if she doesn't in the next 12 hours as much as I like it, it goes back. I have two very picky fuzzy children (black cats, lol) and they only eat this flavor and one other. It's very hard to find them in my local stores for such a good price. I will probably order again when I need it.

I was buying these at Whole Foods before I thought to buy them on Amazon.  Our dogs go nuts for these and they are by far their favorite raw hides.  I highly highly recommend these!  Also, one other brand of rawhide gave our dogs diarrhea and puking, but they're always fine chewing these.

I was hoping this would be &#34,it&#34,.  I have a one year old APBT who is not much of a player but loves basketballs.  They only last about 30 seconds.  This ball only lasted about three hours over two days.  I'm giving it two stars because it was the best three hours ever.  He had so much fun and I had so much fun watching him have fun.. I just wish it would have lasted.  I don't want to get the harder balls because of what I'm reading about tooth wear.  This came not very inflated to begin with.. not sure if that was part of the problem?  I wish they made a larger size that may be harder to grab ahold of.
I have a one year old boxer. She liked this toy and loves to chew. Definitely have to watch her because she has chewed some small pieces off already. I would not recommend for an aggressive chewer.

Didn't work on my schnauzer at all, she allergic to flea so had to go to vet for antibiotics, steroids and script for flea tabs. $222. Ouch.My chorkie doesn't seem to be effected like the schnauzer was so using the rest of the bottle on him. Price was great just wish it worked better.
My kitten has never been terribly comfortable on this cat tree but now it is totally unstable. He has since outgrown this and I will be looking for a new cat tree very soon.
Now it will just take a long time to train him to walk on the leash and then go out with the dogs.

I've been using three of these mats for about six months, and they are working fine.  One thing you must pay attention to is the battery pack.  If anything touches the mat, it activates the batteries.  If  you're going to use it on a sofa with pillows, make sure the pillows don't rest against the mat or touch it or they will drain the batteries.  I had this happen the first month I used the mate on my new sofa.  The batteries lasted only two weeks. After making some adjustments and making sure the mat was clear of interference, the batteries have lasted going on five months.If you set the mat to its highest setting, the shock is a bit painful.  I fooled my brother into touching the mat I have on a chair, and he almost jumped out of his skin!  It was funny watching him jump around like a little kid, and he's 66 years old!  Another time a neighbor sat on the chair without waiting for me to remove the mat, and his hind parts got a nice blistering.  Not literal blisters, but he hopped his ass off my chair in a jiffy.  I've gotten shocked myself, and it is not pleasant.  It is like a very strong static shock.  I'm speaking of the highest setting.  The lower setting is a little milder.
My rottie pup, also loves this chew toy.  She chews on this and the others all day.  Haven't seen my older dog chew on it, but then she's not teething.

Still trying to figure out the cause of my joint pain, but this product did not help.  I think I may have RA, so am working on reducing inflammatory foods which seems to be helping.  Maybe that's why it doesn't work for me.

What can I say?  My amazon swords are growing just fine!  Best root tabs I've used so far.  Would recommend, especially if you are planting in regular substrate instead of a specialized plant substrate.

I've kept female rats in this cage for a few years.  The bar spacing is about 7/8&#34,, so very young and very small rats can escape.  I've got a very small adult female who's a bit of an escape artist, and I can't keep her in this cage.  She's the first out of seven females and four males that's been able to squeeze between the bars.  I'm not going to deduct one star just because I have an abnormally small rat.All in all, it's been a fantastic cage.  Plenty of room for four rats to run around, but everyone still have their own space.  The spacing still lets the rats climb the cage, so they're pretty happy.  I've never had a problem with the shelves or ramps.  They do get chewed some, but replacement parts are very easy to find from the manufacturer's website.
It's a good size especially for the price. The cat's love it! Also, shipment was received on date given which is always a plus in my book, especially so close to Christmas...

Got 2 medium size balls - one for each of my girls (keeshonden).  We fill the balls with Cheerios, kibble or anything they like that is small.  Sit back and watch the girls go to town.  Each has her own style of getting the goodies out and it's so much fun to watch.  Some people actually feed their finicky eaters by filling the ball with their kibble at dinnertime.  I would highly recommend this.

My lazy bones cat LOVES this toy! The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because within the first 3 minutes of play, one of the feathers got chewed in half. Now it doesn't 'fly' as well, but I plan on buying replacements. My cat is SO excited that she would give it 5 stars.

All are picky eaters and all approve of tiki cat (specifically tiki cat Ahi Tuna). I've tried several varieties but Ahi Tuna is the only one they all beg for over and over. One cat is long hair Persian/something mix, other two are American short/mix, and when I feed them Ahi Tuna the plate is always clean.
Has no bell on it, instead it's a plastic sign saying &#34,meow&#34,... & that sign is not even anything reflective, so it has no purpose.

We had bought our lab mix a crate like this but a few sixes smaller. We had thought it would be the perfect size for him when he was full grown, but he's grown like a weed. Our first crate only had one door which was fine, but the second door has proven to be very helpful in just the month that we've had it. We put it in our bedroom for him to sleep in and its nice to have the longer side against the wall so we aren't tripping over it. We haven't put it in our car for a trip yet, but if he's going to be riding in it, the second door will make it easier to get him in and out. It also does fold up pretty easily so if you are packing to take it somewhere it doesn't take up the whole car.
This is a really high quality shampoo that smells delicious and I can use too (and I have!). It is a nice shampoo. Does not kill fleas or tick or anything, purely for cleaning!
Our cats love the shredded chicken! They seem to like the shredded type better than the solid pate. Either way, this is good stuff!
These harnesses pretty much are my go-to for small breed dogs or young puppies. Anything bigger than 25 lbs doesn't respect that movement of the harness and will continue to pull.

This bottle rocks! Does not leak, easy to throw in the car, backpack, purse, dog pack etc. I requested and received the color I ordered, unlike one review said they were unable to request a color. I will be ordering more of these so that I will never be without one. Shipping was very fast. I fill the bottle with water, put a regular water bottle cap on it and keep it in the fridge. When I need it, I grab it, attach it to the tray part and I am good to go. I use it even when taking my pooch anywhere in the car with me so that I always have fresh water for her. Highly recommend this bottle in either size that fits your needs.

I bought this because our dog broke the last treat dispensing ball that we bought.  That one came apart in two pieces to load the treats and was an excellent toy&#8230,until he broke it open and started eating the plastic itself!I bought this one as a replacement because it doesn't come apart like the other one so he can't break it open and eat the ball itself.  So far, he's loving it!  The kibble and/or treat pieces aren't terrible difficult to get out, but it does take him a little while (long enough to give us break from him pushing toys on our laps for a bit!).  I recommend this treat ball.Our dog is a 50 lb collie mix and can fit the entire ball in his mouth, for reference.

I wanted to like this product.  I wanted it to work.  But after 3 weeks of very upset cats, who found many other places besides this litter box to poop on, we decided to call it quits.If your cat has ANY fear of water, do NOT buy this.  Good test--pick up your cat and hold him over the toilet.  Does it freak out?  Our cats are super afraid of the toilet, so there was no way they were going to poop in it.

Kittens love this, but it is not something that will last more than 2 or 3 months.  The balls fall off very easily and there is no way to put them back. I have just bought a second one, because they do love it, but it is an expensive toy for only a few months of use.

Our 20-25lb terrier managed to destroy this toy in about an hour. The thread came undone from the sides and the toy had to be thrown away. Although this toy looks and feels like the KONG Wubba it doesn't seem to hold up as well. Our Wubba is still surviving but this toy is long gone. Maybe we received a flawed one? This toy would be great for a less determined chewer but if you have a strong chewer I would suggest you save your money.

NOT TOO MUCH CAN BE SAID HERE. HAVE USED THIS BRAND OVER THE YEARS WITHOUT PROBLEMS. MY DOGS HAVE HAD NO ADVERSE REACTIONS TO THE PRODUCT. EASY TO APPLY. NO DISCOMFORT TO THE ANIMAL. NO FLEAS HANGIN AROUN !!!
I have a large dog so I had to buy the 4 gram sets. You just have to make sure that you have wet food in which to &#34,hide&#34, the granules for the dog's discerning palate.
These bags work as expected, they are strong enough to hold a good size load.  I also like the dispenser, very convenient.

I used this product while switching a little of puppies from nursing on Mom to "real food". It certainly helped the transition and didn't cause diarrhea, which so many of these products do. Two of these bags took me through the weaning process for 6 large breed puppies.
This was an awesome substitution to the annoying occasional barking of the neighbors dogs. It worked for about two weeks before the dogs didn't care about it anymore. Just wish it lasted longer

I have a rescue dog for whom overeating is not a problem.  She's very slight and I've never had a dog care less about food.  No issues, no nothing.  But - she knows what she likes and she LOVES this food.  She was sent home from the shelter with another brand - she seemed to lose a little weight and didn't seem to care for the food at all.  Shortly after her coming home, she had her first vet checkup and I asked her doctor if he agreed that she was a little too thin.  He did.  He recommended this food.  As I say, she loves it, eats it eagerly, and has put back on the pound or two that she lost initially.  Her stools are good, her skin and fur are gorgeous.  No allergies.  I have had a lot of dogs with a lot of food issues.  I wish I'd known of this food when I had those pups.

I have gone through many brands of cat food for my Maine Coon mix female. She's about five years old now. I discovered this food first at a boutique type pet store... I was looking for our regular Eukanuba brand. This fancy place only had some pricey food, including Royal Canin, which I was not familiar with. I bought it anyway since I had never seen food especially for the Maine Coon breed. Well, our cat Vita loved it. She can't just scarf this food down and then throw up like she does with other food! She eats it properly and, amazingly, does not leave food in the dish. Her favorite trick is to always leave food behind and then complain that it's stale. For instance, with the Paul Newman food, she eats a few bites and then walks away. Then she comes back and camps out by her dish waiting for a few more "fresh" morsels. When I give her Iams, she gobbles her food like a little demon. Then I go to work or do some chores and voila, I find a pile of thrown-up kibble on the carpet. Of course, I try giving her small doses of kibble... boy, does this cat eat a lot. She is very healthy though and not too fat. The main point of my review is: so far Royal Canin Maine Coon 31 Formula is proving to be the right food for this big girl.Other important points: The price through Amazon is much better than through the pet store. The convenience of finding it online versus not knowing where the heck it might be stocked is wonderful. The most surprising thing was shipping was super fast. I ordered on Saturday night and got it Monday afternoon. How did they do that? I've never experienced such fast FREE shipping with Amazon. Also, I paid no extra sales tax. I really hope to keep this up and have the same experience. You can't beat this.

Wow I wasn't paying attention to the item description because i was shocked at how large it is, But this is a good thing!!! My dog absolutely LOVES it. I love the scent of it, not personally but i believe its something that my dog will enjoy unlike the other chew bones you get in the stores that you can't even smell at all (Pleasant for me but not so good for my dog who likes things with interesting smells). It looks like a moth flying around and my cats leap in the air to get it! A great, cheap toy they will love.

Needed - change once a week.I bought the stainless steel fountain and it needs thoroughly cleaned regularly -- and, these need changed..
