Allowed a substantial amount of hose for easy-hookup to a 45 gallon aquarium to keep fish during winter months. Thanks

I love love love these harnesses I got this on the recommendation of the teacher at my dog's training class to help with his pulling and he was right. I don't even need to use this harness anymore because my dog stopped pulling all together after about 6 months of using this harness.

I'm so happy I found this brand of play yard and these extension panels have been great.  The panels are light weight and easy to set up and reconfigure as needed.  This kind of play yard  won't work for a large dog but for an indoor play yard for a small dog they're the best I've ever found.
I've been searching for a toy for my Chihuahua puppy. She's so tiny that's it's been next to impossible. She loves this toy. For those who have a larger puppy this toy is not for you.

My collie does not like to be brushed because it involves pulling out that undercoat. This de-matting rake cuts through the tangles and pulls them out in a way the dog doesn't mind as much as the brush. I've used other brands but they weren't as good. This is my second time purchasing this brand, the old one lasted 5 years and stayed sharp but then I forgot and left it outside for a few weeks and it rusted.  Now I have a pyrenees/collie mix and it works great on him too.

The leash was as advertised, Good locking mechanism and belt glides easily as dog moves about.. Nice looking and handle big enough for hand. Solid snaffle to harness or collar. Delivery and packaging without any issues.
Easy to use and it lasts a long time.  My dog seems to like the taste! Great way for your pet to get good stuff for their digestion.
My little puppy loves this toothpaste and doesn't mind at all when I use it to brush his teeth! In fact he actually enjoys it! What more can you ask for? ,)

i bought this for my dog and he loves it, he sleeps in in all of the time and if i tell him i am gonna sit in it when he is not in it, he runs and lunges into it...a great buy and well worth the money.
perfect toy for my strong chewer!  Its still around after a few months unlike most of her toys!  good for fetch and tug.

I have a small ball (green).  My puppy likes it.  She likes to observe how it rolls, she likes to get me to tug with her, and she likes to chew on it.  I cannot guarantee it will hold up when she gets her adult teeth, but for now it lasts.  I'm happy because it's gentle on her mouth and teeth.  Highly recommended, especially for puppies.

My cat tend to used a bit but they are older cat so they are not as motivated as a young cat would i guess,  We used to have a cat house you know those thing where the cant can climb up and scratch away, that had one scratching area the cats used to tear that thing apart, I'm guessing due to the fact that they were used to using that post, is harder for them to used this or is just not as appealing,  The make of this box is simple is just a box with scratch pad,  In my opinion after looking at it I'm pretty sure the making this item didn't cost them more then 7 bucks maybe 10, but is sold for 28 almost 29 dollars,  So it's a bit overprice if you don't believe me on being overprice go ahead and order one, and then take a good look at it, is just basically the scratching pad surrounded by the box.

I installed this in a  flower bed that was being visited by a dog who kept digging up the plants. In addition a squirrel was digging and planting acorns. The hook up was easy however there are some pointers I wish someone had let me know about. You mush have a crinkle proof hose that will take water from you hookup to the unit. There must be adequate pressure to make the water  spray the water. The spray unit is just like the ones you may already have or have seen. In order for the water to spray out horizontal we had to place the spike in the dirt at an angle. If you do that you will have to play round with the sensor as it too will be pointing toward the ground. After a few minutes of getting wet we finally got the sensor unit in the desired position. Then we had to move it far enough away so it would not spray people coming close to the flower bed. We now have the unit spraying about 15 inches off the ground and horizontally. We also adjusted the radius of the spray so that we are covering about 180 degrees. You will eventually get the hang of it so just be patient. The water hose screws into the bottom of the unit which uses a plastic hose piece. This in my judgment should have been brass as we have found occasions where the water may leak a little form that hose connection. Just a quick adjustment and the water stops leaking. Caution----don't use a set of pliers to tighten as that could damage the hose connection. We purchased a new short hoe in order to alleviate the water leak as much as possible. Don't forget to have your water on otherwise the unit will not work. We have seen the unit spray a dog, a squirrel and a bird. It does not hurt any of them and helps preserve our landscaping. Good but not perfect product.

This is the perfect sized Chuckit for my Maltese puppy.  He can fit the balls in his mouth which he cannot do with most because of their size.  Even though it's a "mini launcher" it still sends the ball a fair ways, especially for a small dog.

We used to get the Petite size Greenies for our Cairn Terrier but they used to be a little big for her and we had to break them apart for her. So Instead, we've started ordering the Teenie size Greenies and those ones are the ideal size for her. She goes absolutely crazy when it is time for her Greeny and if we forget to give her one she will make sure to remind us. These must be our dog's favorite treat ever!

I had a hard time deciding what to write because I can't get my beautiful long hairedtuxedo girl to take ANY chew and this was no exception. It isn't this particular chewshe won't eat any. I feed her only canned cat food to help her cough up those hairballs.
I have a couple of these sitting on top of a terrarium screen.  I love the compact size, and they work well.  No complaints, I would buy another if I needed it.

Again, I love KONG!  They make wonderful pet toys.  As in my last review of the medium size, same goes for this.  Durable plastic gel and really cute!  This is a decent size but again I am going to have to test the waters to make sure Rusty can't swallow it.

I have been using toenail clippers to cut the nails on my cat for years. This was not a good idea in retrospect because it would actually crush part of the nail, though she never complained.  A few months ago my cat started developing a black coating on 2 of her nails. And she was obsessively licking them. I took her to the vet and it turns out that she had a fungal infection in her nail and that the saliva actually turns the fungus black. He did not recommend any treatment at that point because it hadn't spread to all the nails just to clean it every two weeks with some liquid ear cleaner. I bought these clippers so I could sterilize them with alcohol after cutting the infected nails so it did not spread. They work great!

My bunny will actually thump in the middle of the night if his food bowl goes empty of this rabbit food. It's his favorite and the most healthiest. I live in a rural area that has feed stores and farms. This particular bag was $4 more in the local feed store than it was on Amazon. I know it's important to support local stores but Amazon has the best price for this food! (Don't worry I still buy plenty of other items from the feed store so I am still supporting them with other purchases.) I've even ordered this food from another website before but in the end Amazon is the cheapest.Get this food for your bunny if you love them. It's healthy and has want they need to stay healthy. Also the price is another plus.

My dogs absolutely love this food.  And the fact that it has great ingredients makes it a winner for dinner in our house!  I am also using it for "treats" for agility training, in place of hot dogs or other special tidbits.  5 paws up!
My 2 cats absolutely LOVE this little chirping bird!!  They toss it around to hear it chirp.  The first time I heard it I thought there was a real bird in the house.  I might have to buy a few more.
We disconnected every panel and used them to "line" our upper deck so puppy wouldn't fall off.  They work great.
These are real good. My dog loves them, but they are on the softer side and don't last very long.She's always looking for more 10 seconds after eating one. It's kind of disappointing for her, really.

Great toy for short periods of observed play.  My adult cattledog figured out how to removed the ball almost immediately, while the puppy took several minutes.  Even so, they have not tired of playing the game.  After removing the ball quickly a few times, they will complicate the puzzle by tossing the cube around, batting at it with their paws, pouncing on it...and only then remove the ball.  They wait for me to put the ball back in, and wait until I tell them to "Go find".This is not for the dog who runs off with a toy and plays keep away, as the thin rubber "bars" of the cube could be easily chewed and ingested (my puppy had to be told not to chew it).  Of course, all of the Kyjen puzzle toys are designed to be enjoyed by dogs playing in the company of their owners.  They are excellent training tools for "wait", "go find", "give" and the concept of taking turns (one dog waits while the other finds).  I work my dogs on them for about 15 minutes, then put the toys away.  They stay new and exciting that way.

Great ball to add to Bergan turbo track set. My cat plays with the track more when this ball is added, and it's even more fun to play on the track in the dark too. Brought another ball for my friend's cat so Highly recommend.

The product works great but for the price it's nothing special... I went through it WAY too fast. Luckily I've found the same thing at my local Tractor Supply store, horse bedding which can be purchased at $6 for a 40 pound bag, literally the same freaking thing with a picture of a different animal on it. The price for this product is robbery!

Only my younger kitty likes this (the same kitty who favors Da Bird feather toy)--but she likes it a LOT. It is a well-made toy. If your cat likes to chase after quick-moving objects, then this is a great toy for your cat--the wiry string doesn't tangle and is long-lasting, the usual Da Bird lobster clasp makes the mousey wiggle very temptingly (though sometimes I worry about it striking their eyeballs), the wire is nice and long so you can cover a lot of ground without having to move much yourself, the mouse itself is really cute and small and made of a bristly material that my cat enjoys carrying in her mouth. She's been playing with it roughly for a week now and it's in good shape. And since there are no feathers to be pulled out, I have every hope that this one can last a while (I don't leave it out for her to play at will, though).EDIT: Did they switch factories?! The first two of these that I got lasted a decent period, but the last two have lasted less than a month--the wire has separated from the tube twice in a row now. I am ordering one more, and if workmanship has indeed dropped, I doubt I'll be ordering again!

Pros:- Soft treats can be broken up into small pieces- Don't smell terrible- Dog enjoys themCons:- The treats will dry out if they are left open or in zip lock bags overnight. We keep ours in a air tight glass jar.
My kitty loves these treats. they are like kitty crack. Also the container makes a nice sound when shaken which my kitty has learned to come to.

Of the various Beneful flavors, this is the one that wins the doggies vote.  It even beat the Iam's and Nutro Max weight management foods out.  It seems to have a lot of corn, corm meal, flour and whole whet. It only has chicken by product meal.  Buy hey - the kids like it that's what matters

Can't afford chiller, so in the warmer months this actually helps to stabilize the water temp and keep it from rising too high. Quiet too.EDIT 5/21/14:Junk. Broken. Loud. Waste of money. No real cooling at all. I jammed it together but it just falls apart  over and over again. It's total garbage.
Looks much better on the little dog in the picture. I bought one in the right size for my Golden Retriever but her fur poked through and the arms didn't stick out quite as much as I'd hoped.

I have four cats and I was looking for something they could all get on and be up high, seeing as how they all like to get up high as possible on the furniture in the house.  I decided on this one and I could not be happier that this was my choice.  The instructions were very easy and went together pretty quickly.  The cats loved it from the moment I opened the box.  I had their "help" putting it together.  They are always on this condo and there is enough room for all of them to sleep on it at the same time (which they do every day).  The favorite spots on the condo are the highest platform and little brown bag-like bed (no surprise to me because of their love of heights in my house).  My puppy even likes this condo.  She lays on the bottom and chews on her toys while the cats play above her.  This is a very sturdy cat tree (sturdier than I have even seen in pet stores).  It holds all of my cats at the same time and has held up to the puppy chewing on the bottom poles (you can't even tell she has touched it).  I recommend this to any cat owner - it is sturdy, doesn't take up much room, has sleeping places from low to high and is excellently priced.  If I could give this more than five stars, then I would!!
I have a Shih-Tzu.The capsules are rather large. Also, he is a picky eater. As a result, I had to open the capsules and pour the contents on to his food. It works, He does not notice the fish oil.
my cat  has to take medication twice a day and it's been a fight for years until we found those wonderful pill pockets, now  he  wants them ! great product .

I have five dogs and all five liked this treat.  It's a little sticky coming out of the container, but it doesn't smell bad.  The main ingredients are poultry meal, palm kernel oil, brewers dried yeast, cod liver oil.  Since all my dogs are at least 60 pounds, that means they should each get two of these. This packet would not last long, and therefore that translates into a very expensive supplement.  It's a supplement the dog should do a trick for!Made in Israel.

This dish is just what I needed for my 70 pound Labrador Retriever.  It holds just the right amount of food and she can't tip the bowl over. And,  its very easy to clean.  The opening near the bottom helps me to pick up the bowl from the floor.

I love this product and can tell if I skip a few days by accident.  I am much more mobile and have little to no pain in my knees when I take it regularly.I am an archaeologist and rely on my knees and legs (ok, an old archaeologist, but still kicking!)...Cosamin helps me feel better and keep up with my work without having to rely on younger knees to do the things I want (and love) to do myself.

This is very lightweight, yet very powerful for its size. It came with extra sanding drums and the adjustment key. It has 2 speeds- High and Low. I would recommend using it on the low setting until your pet is accustomed to having his claws trimmed with a power tool. It's not very noisy, but it can be a bit scary the first time you get your claws ground down. I have hard wood floors and don't like the sound of clicking nails on it, so this keeps the claws short enough to not be pesky or do damage to the floors.

This thing works and removes a lot of hair but I'm not sure exactly which layer of fur this tool removes. It doesn't seem to remove loose hairs but instead, it pulls straight hairs off of my cat! I use this tool in conjuncture with the Kong Zoom Groom and the Safari Self Cleaning Slicker Brush. The Zoom Groom loosens the outer coat and the Slicker brush gets the undercoat that is more fuzzy, and the Groominator gets something in between the two. I don't use this tool too much though because it definitely pulls off hairs that are not ready to come off. If you use it too much, your pet will go bald.

My Mumzy uses this particular manufacturer's products...if they are manufactured in the USA. This particular product, the coat wipes, is made in China. At least, that is what was printed upon the package once it arrived.  Therefore, Mumzy promptly returned it. My Mumzy does not purchase pet products from China. This is why a higher star rating could not have been applied. This company does make good products, however my Mumzy only purchases the one's which are made in the USA.

We have 3 cats weighing 11, 10 and 9 pounds.  As soon as I put this together, which was SO simple to do, they were each on it.  I wondered if it would be stable being on one post, but it is completely stable and the perfect height for them to look out our living room window at the birds in our bushes.  I haven't seen them try the curved ledge for scratching yet, but I'm sure they will.  Each one of them could easily stretch out on it and scratch away.  Totally pleased with this because it is a nice compact size, sturdy and very well made.  The top perch is smaller than the base, but plenty big for my cats.

Oh boy, does my pointer/lab love this crate! It fits perfectly in my living room, is easy to move around and clean. She pretty much just walks inside of it at night when she's ready for bed. She did not do this in her old crate.

I purchased this because it said it was for extra large dogs.  When it arrived it had a 50 pound weight limit.  Really? that isn't a big dog, that is a medium at best.  That being said it did slow my Newf down but that is only because she knows that when a leash is on she shouldn't run.

This is an amazing product which I have been buying for years and there's a few pumps left of the last one I bought. When I opened the box I saw that this new bottle didn't have the plastic seal around the top. Further investigation into the product itself shows me that the oil in the new bottle is runnier than the current bottle I have! It smells different and when I squirted each one into separate clear glass bowls, I can see that the richness, the color, the smell and the thickness of the salmon oil is different! The quality of the Salmon oil in the new bottle is not like anything I have ever seen from Yummie Chummies. This bottle has either been watered down by another oil or it is something completely different to what Yummie Chummie makes. My pet has serious allergies, Yummie Chummies is the only fish oil my pet can consume. I cannot know if this is a watered down version of yummie Chummies Salmon oil or it is something completely different, because of this I cannot give to my pet cos of the sensitive skin my pet has.Shame on you seller!I tried to upload a video but the file is too big. I will retry in the morning, to me the difference of product is clear and I want you to see the real vs the fake (or watered down version) so you know to look for that rich "sunset" orange color in the future. I am contacting Yummie Chummie HQ to report this company and I shall update you.I will request a refund, this is the third time recently where I have had to ask for a refund from Amazon and I have serious doubts whether I want to continue buying products from them. In store the 32oz is for sale at $20 very reasonable pricesSellers are taking chances to sell a watered down product !

I have a very hairy wolfhound/husky mix. This worked great on grooming her long hair. I would definitely recommend, but watch the instructions first so your dog isn't walking around with an uneven haircut like my poor dog is.

UPDATE APRIL 27:  I used the vac to clean carpeting and found the suction acceptable. Let's put it this way, I found a significant amount of dirt collected in the dirt canister. My carpet also looked better after running the Bissell vac over it. My only complaint is how heavy this vac is to push around. This is common for inexpensive vacs, so it is not a true complaint. I've been spoiled by my MieleMiele Polaris S4212 Canister Vacuum Cleaner with SBD450-3 Combination Rug and Floor Toolwhich only weighs about 10 pounds. Of course the Miele does not clean my carpets as well as the Bissell so there are trade-offs.The Bissell Premier Pet vacuum cleaner is a good inexpensive vacuum cleaner. Upon arrival I had to remove the vac from its packaging and read the user booklet on how to attach the handle, hoses, and attachments to the vac. I did so.Putting the vac together was not difficult as the only thing I needed to do was attach the handle by inserting the handle onto the vac. I then pushed down on the handle and it snapped in place. For extra security a screw was provided to insert and screw into the vac body. I did this. I then attached the hose and combination dust brush and crevice tool. The hose was attached to the upper port by clipping it into the right hole. I then attached the pet cleaning attachment to the front of the vac.As to cleaning:  I did a quick sweep, using the low setting, to sweep my laminate floor. The vac demonstrated reasonably good suction.I then tried the Pet Cleaning attachment which worked very well to remove black cat hair from my chair. This is the best part of the vac as the Pet Cleaning attachment works like a charm.Noise:  The vac is a bit noisy especially after I have grown accustomed to using my Miele canister vacMiele Polaris S4212 Canister Vacuum Cleaner with SBD450-3 Combination Rug and Floor Toolwhich is quiet and lightweight. The Miele does very well for cleaning bare floors, but not as well on carpets. I have not tried the Bissell vac on carpeting, but I will do so and update this review.Weight:  The Bissell vac is heavy and handles like most upright vacs meaning you have to push the vac around a bit to get where you want to go. This is typical for almost all upright vacs so this is not a poor comment concerning the Bissell vac.Motor:  The Bissell Premier Pet vac has a 12 amp motor.Cord:  The cord rewind feature works very well.Overall, the Bissell 67F8 Rewind Premier Pet vac seems to be a good inexpensive vac for home use.Recommend with caveats given.
This cat pole has a relatively small &#34,footp[rint&#34, so it fit right in. It was easy to assemble and the cats love how high it is.

I purchased the refills along with the Litter Lock.  I had one of these type of containers a long time ago, and loved it.  This one is easier to use and I experience no smell.  I only wish this refill lasted longer.  But then I have four cats, so it goes fast. Scoop, deposit, lock it up and walk away.  So easy and the scoop is hanging right on the litter lock.  The refill is so easy to replace, the only hard part of all this process is scooping up the waste!!  Who ever invented this whole system, well thank you!!5 pack of Litter Locker Plus Refill Cartridge

These adult dog food cans are smaller than what I normally buy for my dogs. And a bit more runny. But I gave both my dogs, an Australian shepherd and pit bull mix, dry food and then pour this over there dog food. Because of the more wet like consistency it poured out of the can very easily and I didn't need to use a utensil to get the dog food out of the can.You can see beef chunks and rice in the gravy. And the smell wasn't too over powering at all. My dogs really loved it and both ate a can each in one sitting, dry dog food and all they licked their dishes clean.There are recommended daily feeding amounts for dog size based on pounds on the back of the can but I mostly give my dogs a can as a treat and not as there daily food.  But for a 50 lb dog it says feed 3-1/2 cans of this a day, 75 lb 4-3/4 cans a day, 100 lb 6 cans of a day, 150lbs  8-1/4 cans a day. So that can really add up if you take there recommendations. It wants you to feed this amount to the dog into 2 or more feedings in the day.Overall my dogs loved the tasted, and I do like the Purina brand

My English Bulldog loves this toy and it entertains him.  We don't put a lot of treats in it we use his dog kibble and it doesn't take much.  He chews on it a bit but it is a bit big for him to destroy (THANKFULLY). When it doesn't have treats in it he uses it like any ball playing fetch and rolling it around the house.

I bought this as a lightning deal, without really looking at the purpose of it.  I foster dogs, so I frequently buy dog toys. This is a ball, with a circular hole through the enter. My pitbull loves it.  I shoved a few dog bones in it that I knew would stay and she plays with it until she gets them out.  The only thing I hate, and I hate about all sphere shaped dog toys is that they role under the couch and the dog scratches the hard wood floor trying to get at them! For that reason, this might have to be my last ball type toy!  This is the tough, high quality Kong material Kong buyers are used to, and should last many, many, many years.  Aside from specifically shaped treats, I'm not sure what else you could put in the center though.  That is why I am giving this only four stars.  I guess you could probably put a rope through it and tie it on both ends, or just use it for catch outside.  If you want a toy to stuff treats in, stick to the classic. (Oh, there she goes, scratching my floors again!)

it doesn't love them as much.This worked better for them than the fishy kind, but not as great as I'd hoped. We use this as a snack, but not as a meal, their bellies just can't handle it for some reason.

My vet had put one of my cats on the Hill's prescription c/d diet for urinary health, so I thought I'd switch my other cats to the Hill's Science diet for senior cats. Long story short, they couldn't keep the food down! (And yes, I changed the food gradually.) It was awful, an I immediately retuned both foods. The cat with urniary isses is now on a Royal Canin urinary health food from my vet, and the others are back on their previous food (Earthborn Holistic, grain free). My Akita was also on Earthborn Holistic, but I thought I'd try the Hill's. This was at the same time as the cat food, and once I saw how badly the cats reacted, I decided against giving this to him. I didn't help that the bag was torn open and there was food loose inside the shipping box as well. After the poor reaction from my cats I researched the Hill's food (there's not a lot of info on cat food, but lots on dog food). It turns out that the earthborn is rated a 4-star food (out of 5), while the Hill's food is only 2.5 stars. Your experience may differ, but I am steering clear of this brand.

The dog loves these but finds them a little tricky to eat.  They aren't exactly strips, more like tough, flat squarish hunks of jerky.  They seem to be slightly scored but aren't easy to tear and there's the rub.  For my little doxipoo they're hard to chew (and he doesn't have bad teeth) so I have to tear them into smaller chunks.  My dog hasn't choked on them, but he's dropped pieces that are too big for him to swallow, rather then gnaw on them.They come divided in four baggies which is kind of nice, AND I JUST discovered there IS a resealable bag included, which is great since once the baggie is open it's supposed to be refrigerated!So they're OK, and maybe a BIT better than OK, but like an awful lot of dog food they seem pretty pricey to me at $13 (currently) for a 12-oz bag.  However I do prefer these to treats that can't be divided, like snausages.
Great shampoo for my guinea pigs when it's bath time. This stuff really is awesome! I totally recommend this stuff.

I love this spray.  It smells great and I think it's gender neutral for pets.  I use it withCologne Drops Floral Scent for Dogsand they work great together.  Once the spray has dissipated, the drops keep it going.  When my dog gets damp, it revives the drops.  If your dog is stinky when clean, switch to a meat first dog food and see if that helps.  It doesn't have to be expensive.  For Hounds try Eukenuba Lamb & Rice.  It worked for my sisters beagle, and beagles stink!Eukanuba Adult Nat Lamb and Rice for Dogs, 30-PoundFor my english pointer, Purina One Lamb & Rice did the trick.Purina One Lamb & Rice Dog Food, 4-Pound Bags (Pack of 6).  I don't bathe her and withFresh Dog Dry Shampoo Powder for Dogs and Puppies, All Natural, 12 ouncesa dry shampoo once a month or so, she never smells and is soft and her hair is very white.

This is a cheaper dog bed, so I didn't expect much. The fabric cover rips very very easily at the touch of a dogs nail, so the bed looks pretty awful even though my dogs only use this on very rare occasions. However, for the price, it still deserves 3 stars.

These tubes are a bit tall for my 2 cats to use. It would be nice if they were a little shorter.I have a Siamese with long thin legs. He is not ready for the tubes yet and I've had the food puzzle for several weeks.I think in time these may work. I wish I had waited on purchasing these instead of buying both items at the same time.

My cat loves this stuff.  She has diabetes and these are the best treats for her because they are all protein and no carbs.  I test her blood for glucose and have to prick her ears.  This is her reward and she knows that if she puts up with me she gets a nice, fat free, carb free delicious treat.  Take care of your pets and give them nutritious freeze dried meat/chicken rather than the junk food treats that are loaded with uneeded carbs.Also, this is a great price and a large bag lasts for a long time.  Cat and dog Pure Bites are exactly the same with larger pieces in the bag for dogs.  Just break them up and kitties love them too.  I also use the crushed treats to top off a meal and make it tastier.When my friend's bring their dogs by, they always get some too.  All of the pets love this product!!!

Four rats have a lot of excretions.  We got these to help line their cage. They use a litter box for #2 but will pee anywhere and everywhere. Rat pee smells disgusting and it is a lot of work to keep the cage clean. By using these pads we hoped to lure them into peeing on the pads instead of randomly going wherever they please.  They did pee on them, though I think largely by coincidence.  They mainly tore them up and used them as a comfy bed.  So for entertainment value alone for the rats, I have to give 5 stars. I would get them again but not with any hope or expectation of wee wee control for rats.

I've purchased this litter twice now and will be trying it a few more times just because it is so cheap. Both bags that I have received have been extremely dusty and cat urine tends to stick to the bottom of the litter box. On the second bag, we mixed this with some of our regular litter and it seemed to work better because the cat urine did not stick to the litter box. This litter also tracks more than any other litter we have used. I'm not sure if we just need to try different litter mats or if this is just the nature of the litter. With all of the great reviews on this litter I was hoping for an amazing product. The only reason why I give this litter 3 stars is because of the price.
good product

Our pug/boston mix puppy really loved this toy, which is probably why it was completely destroyed in about 1 month. She was in a &#34,chewing&#34, phase as evidenced by the hole in my sofa, but dog toys should still last a bit longer. Overall though, for the price it was fine, and she really enjoyed it.

Our cat loves these treats! The moist and soft texture is a joy for our cat every time she feasts upon them. This is also used when we want our cat to do some cat tricks.They look so delicious for our cat that I wish human food made us that crazy!

I much prefer the regular Nature's Miracle to the Urine Destroyer as the Urine Destroyer has a potent, long lasting scent.  With the original NM, the scent is light enough that one can take a whiff to see if the urine odor has been eliminated but the Urine Destroyer masks any remaining urine scent so it's difficult to tell if more product is needed until after the treated area is dry.The scent is too overpowering and rather unpleasant.  It reminds me of Febreeze products, which I find obnoxious.I highly recommend the regular NM but can't say the same for the urine destroyer.

Molly Mutt has outstanding products, and this is no exception. As a bonus, this not only products your duvet stuffing from spills, drools, or accidents, but all helps block odor. I'd suggest just the armor and duvet, rather than the mesh, armor, and duvet... the armor takes on both the role it's designed for, and that of the mesh.

At first my old cat wouldn't have anything to do with it, but after my younger and much bigger cat went it once, the older one just took it over and it's now her house. The younger cat is now relagated to the other open bed. Seniority rules.
Do not buy this silly little piece of junk.  Drop the whole OCD routine and just let the hay fall where it may.

My dog is a bit shy about eating in front of people, so I should have known that he would not like these.  He didn't.  He looked at me like I was crazy.  I tried to make him try it, but he resisted and then I felt bad about doing it.One time during a bad storm he was hiding under my desk and he licked it and seemed to like it, but I haven't got him to do it since.I think the product is probably good - and there's a lot in it and it looks safe enough - it's like a deodorant roller ball - but my dog is just too shy.My cat liked it.  I wasn't sure how good it was for cats though so I didn't let her try it again.  They should make these for cats though - I had a cat that would lick her fur off, this would have been great to help divert her.It's a lot neater to keep in your pocket than regular treats.  It would be great for training a dog if you had a dog that would lick it.

My dog has worn boots for quite some time and we have tried many other brands, but always seem to come back to Muttluks - they wear well (they will not last forever, but neither do human shoes) and keep his feet clean and dry.  He does not mind these at all (there have been others that seem to impact his walking).  Usually these are for the really cold or snowy days, but it also works for the times when the snow is melting and things are getting ugly out there.  Another plus, they do bring a smile to almost everybody that walks by when we are out walking :-)
My Rottweiler has joint issues and I can throw this ball and it doesn't go far and he can exercise without hurting those joints.

He freaked OUT about this toy.  He's never loved anything this much.  But after a few hours he had one of the nubs off and then it was just easy pickings.  I"d say it lasted a total of maybe six hours of solid chewing over two days.  They give a money back guarantee but I think I have to mail this mess in the end probably not worth my time.
All my dogs love these.  There is a caution on the box, however, about not giving the regular size to smaller dogs and puppies, and I do not know why.

These test strips are good for getting an overview of a tanks status.  Once you know your particular tank(s) well you know what the values should be and with these you can check several parameters at once quickly and easily.  The price makes them economical enough to use regularly, rather than only testing when you suspect a problem.  You may want to have more precise liquid test kits for monitoring things when making changes, or if these indicate a problem, but dip strips are handy and these have proved quite consistent and reasonably accurate.These do not indicate the presence or level of ammonia, and I don't trust dip strips for that in any case.  If ammonia may be an issue I suggest a good liquid test kit.
He loved these things, but he was allergic to something and we had to find out what. Not real sure if it was these or not but he loved them

I have many different clickers, but this is my favorite so far.  It is a pretty loud click -- drives my housemates bonkers when I train inside.  For outside, it is always my go-to clicker, though.  My dog hears it easily above any background noise (even highway traffic) and it is the most consistant clicker I have tried.  The button is very easy to find, so I am never fumbling, and it clicks with exactly the same pitch, timing, etc., every single time.  It is easy to double-click with, too, if you want a slightly different cue (the dog has to be pretty in tune to pick up on a click vs. double-click, but if your dog does then it is a cool thing to have).  It is also a very comfortable clicker to hold on to, compared to bulkier or squarish clickers.  My only complaint is that StarMark hasn't figured out a feature like another company has that allows me to attach the clicker to one of my fingers so that my hands are almost free while working.  Still, I recommend this clicker hands-down over anything else I have tried on the market today (and I have tried a lot).
This was great for my Boston when she was only a baby.  When she was about 5/6 mos old she started chewing chunks off.  A Boston chewer will go right through the rubber toys in a matter of minutes

My dog loves this. I gave it to him as a replacement for his nylabone puppy bones. He loves the type with some flex. It is the perfect size for my 7 month old Frenchie/Pug. It is a great alternative to treats and edible chews. My dog does well with a monster mouth chew toy filled with treats, but not so much with an edible chew. He will chew on those for awhile and then try to swallow them while they are still too large. These are better, because he doesn't always need treats and it is safer for dogs like him who could choke themselves. It also encourages constructive chewing. I recommend using these for moderate chewers like my dog.

My boys are two brothers from the same litter, now about 9 months old. I first tried feeding them in a free-feed style. Wonderful for one brother, but the other scarfs down the food as though he hasn't eaten in weeks. Over time, he became overweight and more lazy. The healthy-weighted sibling became restless, as he had more energy than his overweight brother. This restlessness led to destructiveness. I had to do something quickly - a combined diet limitation along with this active food ball appeared to be worth a shot.This feeding ball solves the problems of both of my boys. Picasso, the healthy energetic one, loves tossing the food ball around. He bats the bits of food across our wood floors and pounces on the kibble as though each were a tiny mouse attempting to evade him.Vincent, my overweight one, was a bit more lethargic at first. He did not want to toss the ball, but he would walk around and eat the kibble bits that Picasso had knocked out of the ball. As his weight has been declining, he is starting to bat at the food ball more and grow more proactive in getting his own food. I was worried at first that he didn't "get" the food ball, but with Picasso's help he seems to be fine now.RESULTSThey do not cry for food as they used to before. Sometimes they'll leave some food in the ball, and they know it is there but not worth their effort to get it out. Later - either from boredom or hunger - they finish off the food in the ball. Vincent seems to be decreasing in weight. I have not weighed him but his body shape is improving to a healthier look.Picasso exerts a lot of energy playing with his food. His behavior is vastly improved when I feed him with the food ball. Sometimes I'll feed him early just to distract him while I'm trying to do something he would normally try to get his nose into.In the mornings I'll often just feed them in their bowls, and the evening is food ball time. This is purely because my boys start scratching at my door at 6:30 in the morning - an hour before my alarm clock - and so I'm half asleep and lack the dexterity to get the food into the ball at that hour. They don't seem to be confused by the different feeding methods.I had bought them two food balls thinking each would have their own. Well, through their playing with the ball, I can't seem to find the second one. Now I feed both through one ball and it seems to be working out fine.EASE OF USEThere's a handy notch to help change the amount of food that comes out. There are 3 large and 3 small holes, and you are able to show only the large or small at a time, or fractions of each. My kibble is shaped like a 3 sided ninja star, so I leave it on the large setting, but slimmed down to about 75% open. Just keep an eye on the cats - if they start to get frustrated, open it up a little bit more.I use a measuring cup to pour the kibble into the ball. A liquid measuring cup would be best with the pouring spout, because the opening is relatively small and sometimes I get kibble everywhere if I'm in a rush or not paying attention.TO SUM UPI highly recommend giving this food ball a try. I have paid this price for some of their cat toys. It keeps the boys more active, satisfies Picasso's hunting desires, and is keeping Vincent's weight in check. At the worst case scenario, you have another cat toy for them to toss around the house.

After 1 year my cat STILL plays with this on his own, compared to most other toys the cats got bored using & stopped using (even using rotation method), so I suggest this toy is a must for any cat owner.Don't worry if this toy's string isn't the right length - use your brain(!) via either shorten or lengthen the string (duh!).  I used this atop a hall-cubbard door which the top of that door is 4 feet above the floor, the mouse dangles 6 inches above ground which is perfect because cat grabs it & lays down clutching the squealing mouse because the string STRETCHES(+).  So I didnt hang it from a tall door but if I did then I would simply insert kite string up near the top of this toy, make the cut/knots up high so the cat wont focus on the knots.Its been hanging & squeaking for a year & still squeaking strong as new so I guess it's a good battery inside.  This is one of the few toys thats been worth buying.

I bought the Large for my 65lb dog.  It fits right but the elastic straps in the back are uncomfortable for him.  He refuses to pee when the straps are linked around his legs and he walks funny like he's trying to shake them off.  But they're not really necessary for it to stay on so I just don't bother using them.The hood is a little ridiculous.But in short, it keeps him dry and is durable and does what I need it to.  The orange is good when we're out in the woods so that hunters can spot him.
This is not very powerful.  It barely runs two  small bubblers in a 3 gallon tank.  I'm quite disappointed in this pump.

I have an 82lb Great Pyrenees mix and I wanted something cute for him to wear to match his red collar. The tag feels nice and heavy and the engraving seems just as good as any other tag I have owned. The writing is clear and correct.
Fish love to eat these. Although its better to break up and feed smaller portions otherwise it'll sit there and dissolve into the gravel.

I give this filter a 5 but with some understanding that it will not be for everyone.I will list what I like and don't like.Pro: Super quiet, less noise then what it replaced.Fantastically clear clean moving water, my fish love it.The fact that I can change water less often.Cons:It's big and outside the tank, I hope it never springs a leak.While unhooking it to clean and change filters is easy, carrying the huge thing to the sink is not going to be for everyone, it's a bit heavy.You really need to know where you're going to put it, as you have to cut the hose yourself for height of your tank.I really like it, I have another tank that the filter on it is about to go and will be looking to get another one of these.update, I did buy another, it works so well, so quiet and still the fish love to swim in the under water stream it puts out. I admit it works so good I probably don't clean it as often as I should. Filters last with rinsing, replacements are easy to do. I have one running in the bedroom now, the bubbler makes more noise than this. Very satisfied.
Our GSP loved this but promptly destroyed it within around 10 minutes. Not worth the money for such a short life.

Cats love investigating holes, so this toy looks like a great concept. One out of my four cats will actually play with this toy regularly on his own, so it is getting used at my house for its intended purpose, but not a full success. Two out of the other three kitties at the house completely ignore it and one will play with it occasionally when I'm in the same room and interacting with it, so I guess it very much depends on your cat's temperament how well they will interact with it. The one that does play with it regularly mostly does so at night, "hunting" for his toys and bringing them to my bedroom for me to find and place back into the box in the morning.Based on other reviews, there may be some safety issues with this item, though I haven't had any with my particular piece. It is made from solid wood, very sturdy and (at least the one I have) nicely put together with no nails sticking out like some other people have reported on theirs. None of my kitties ever got their paws stuck in it either, but they are all adults and not kittens any more.I see some reviews are cautioning that the rubber balls that come with it can get chewed up and swallowed, causing expensive trips to the vet to have them removed surgically. My cats haven't chewed up the balls and as soon as I saw those reviews I took them away, so it hasn't been a problem for me, but I can see how this could happen with the balls that come with the toy. Instead of the rubber balls, I'm using fluffy pompom-style balls with it, which my cat loves to carry around. He will dig them out of the box and bring them to me one at a time, meowing for attention and looking rather proud over his "catch." Putting their favorite toys and/or some treats into the box can increase their interest in it.

Had it for around 2 years. It seems very stiff when it first arrives but like all leather gets better over time. It shows a little wear but I like the aged look and am not worried about it snapping or anything. It's a good length as well.
dogs used as a chew toy and destroyed it in a few days. this ended up being a hard plastic and not a rubberized material. would not recommend this product.
lol what can you say about a catbox other than its sturdy and does its job if the cat does its job . Pleased with purchase.
as isaid in my review for the harness, this is by far the best product i use for my big dogs.

I've never been one for supplements... I dunno, sometimes I think it's all "in your head." So when my Siberian husky, River, was diagnosed with a luxating patella (slipping kneecap), I was worried I'd have to put her on some damaging long-term medicine (it wasn't "bad enough" to warrant surgery). Surprisingly, the vet recommended a joint supplement, but the one I got from him was a chewable meat-like treat, and River ate it at the beginning, but after a few days turned her nose up at it.I didn't want to just give up, because River had gained a lot of weight from lack of activity.So I looked for either a pill or something less "treat-like" (yeah, she's strange like that!). I found this. After about a month of giving her two chewable pills, (which she readily eats!), one in the AM and one in the PM, she's playing almost like her old self again. Not 100%, but she PLAYS now instead of just laying while the other 4 huskies dance around her.Now, to get that extra weight off... :)Cosequin has made me a believer!
Used it on my new 10 wk. old  puppy and he lapped it up, and wanted more - Great value for the price.
This is exactly what we needed for our pets.  Our Vet recommended the ingredient that kills the fleas and this product met his recommendations.  The price was right, too.
This is a gift for a person who has several dogs. I think she will love them. It is really cute and looks well made. The seller completed his portion of the transaction well.
I think it is a fun and good toy.  The cats go crazy.  They try to climb the walls chasing it.

Holds a 32-pound bag with room to spare.  Will hold more food if used without the original food bag.  Seals pretty well and does keep food fresher, though not sure about the &#34,air-tight&#34, claim.  Would like to see a version without the wheels for less.  Don't have ants so can't comment on this.

I have 2 very, very lazy cats. To make things worse, my heavier cat doesn't seem interested in a single toy I bring home for them. I was desperate for something to get the both of them moving and losing some pounds when I found this toy. From the reviews I read and the price, I figured it was worth a try. I can't believe something so simple turned out to be just what I needed! My cats go NUTS for this thing! It is true to its name, as it really gets them dancing. They can chase it for hours. As soon as I pick it up, I've got their immediate attention. They both just love it, and its fun for me to watch them jumping and diving and running like a couple of kittens again.It is also very sturdy. This toy takes quite a bit of abuse and I've seen very little wear so far. I would definitely recommend this toy!

We have two adult, female dogs: a 28-pound, 13-year old cockapoo (Brandy) and a 21-pound, 12-year old miniature schnauzer (Rosie). They suffer skin problems, gas, indigestion and irritable bowel syndrome.Isn't getting old grand?The days of eating rich and juicy table scraps are past. Come to think of it, the days of our family eating rich foods has past as well. Anyway, we buy dog food and treats that won't upset Brandy and Rosie's stomach.On the advice of our veterinarian, we switched to theNatural Balance Potato and Duck Formula Dog Treatsafter our dogs developed skin problems. We also purchased theNatural Balance Turkey, Oatmeal and Cranberry Dog Treats. Our dogs liked the turkey, oatmeal and cranberry treats but our mini-schnauzer continued to scratch away.Next, we tried Nature Balance'sSweet Potato and Fish Formulaand the Sweet Potato and Bison Meal Formula, which is a grain-free treat with no corn, soy, or wheat. We now alternate between these formulas and thePotato and Duck Formulafor both dogs.Brandy and Rosie receive a treat after relieving themselves in the back yard, so they get 4-5 of these treats per day. The Natural Balance dog treats are smaller than most of the other brands we purchased before. That has been a nice change since we do not want to feed the dogs too many calories outside their regular evening meal.In summary, we recommend all of these Nature Balance formulas. TheNatural Balance Turkey, Oatmeal and Cranberry Dog Treatsis the only formula we no longer buy for our mini-schnauzer, although our cockapoo can still eat them.Rating: Five stars.

I use this in quarantine tanks and I am not totally convinced that it works as well as the manufacturer claims. I have not had it reduce nitrates, but it does help with other issues to some degree. Of course your best bet is to use a high quality carbon and GFO in a reactor and build your biological filtration (biopellets have worked wonders), however, in quarantine tanks and hospital tanks, this is a little difficult. I use this, carbon, and prime with large water changes to keep pollution down. However, when medicating, all you have are the water changes.

I am breeding ramshorn snails for my turtle.  They are so messy and it makes cleaning a tank tough stuff once the tiny snails start to hatch.  This is perfect and it is certainly not taking up any room in my 125 gallon tank.  It's large enough for a few snails and live plants.  The water stays fresh,the old food and waste flows out of the bottom, but the snails stay put.  I'm considering drilling some larger holes so the waste flows out even faster.  I'm not sure if the baby snails can get through the openings, but that certainly won't be the end of the world as there are a ton of them and they are going to be snacks anyway.I love how instead of floating about the tank, the side &#34,suctions&#34, itself onto the wall.
I LOVE this laser, perfect shape to hold in your hand for awhile & doesn't strain your hand like others. I got it for a little cheaper at a local store, and would definitely recommend it!

Best litter box ever! I have two cats and I keep two boxes. One of my cats is, how shall I put this...ok, he's fat! But I adopted him when he was 11, and he was already fat. Anyway, he is a big fellow, but exceptionally neat. He loves these huge boxes, as he fits all the way in (no sticking his head out of the opening while he is going) and he can really move around and cover everything when he is finished.  My other cat is very long and skinny. He likes these too.With a regular hooded box, you have to unlock and remove the hood to clean (and I clean twice daily). Because of the way my big guy urinates, he often hit the seam where the hood met the pan, so there would be nasty stinky cat urine in the seam and I had to be very careful not to get any on my carpet when cleaning. With these pans, you just open up the &#34,sun roof&#34, to clean!I did remove and discard the clear plastic flaps that cover the entrance, but that was very simple to do and required almost no effort.These are well made and a great value as well!

I got a puppy with a picky appetite. I went through the food the breeder sent him home with (Taste of the Wild Grain-Free for Puppy) only to find he refused to eat it. Same thing withBlue Buffalo Wilderness Puppy- and both of these are excellent, well rated foods with high end ingredients.  I tried wet foods, no dice. I triedCanyon Creek Ranch Natural Turkey & Barley Dry Puppy Foodand while the puppy ate it, the ingredients spooked me.Finally, I went with the brand that my cat has been thriving on, Wellness. I was happy to see that the ingredients list is full of good things, no grain, no fillers, or other things that would make me worry. The puppy also dances around the food bowl when he sees the kibble scoop come out. He's now in danger of becoming a pig, so I supplement his diet with fresh peas and carrots, which he loves.Another review mentioned gas, which my puppy does indeed have once every few days. This was the same on the other two high end foods, TotW and BBW - I don't know if it's just something common to puppies on high quality kibble. It's not a constant weapon-of-mass-eruptions gas bombardment, but he will issue a silent but deadly at least once a week.  It's not very noteworthy, but all dogs are different and have different reactions to foods at times.The primary ingredient is chicken - and some dogs need a more novel protein to avoid stomach upset and gas, so your mileage may vary.[Edit] On that note, let me add that the Barkspawn's poop never quite firmed up on this food. Finally, in some frustration, I switched again toBlue Buffalo Dry Food for Puppies, Lamb & Oatmeal Recipe. I'm glad to say that the poop report is now clear skies, with chance of clouds (gas!) - that hasn't changed.  Entirely possible that I managed to get yet another dog with chicken allergy, and Wellness does not seem to make a lamb based puppy kibble.

I'm not sure if there are more effective anti-barking products out there, but the HAVAHART ULTRASONIC BASIC does get my Shiba's attention.For the most part, she's quiet but whenever a stranger comes into the office or the doorbell rings she'll start barking. I figured this might help and it does, somewhat.First of all, it's easy to set up and comes with 2 AA batteries. You put it into auto mode at first and it will cycle through the 5 different frequencies until you find the one that your dog responds to. They'll look up or at the device and then you just press the "frequency selector" button to set it.You have a choice of manual or auto correction, the auto only works for barking. I've haven't used the auto mode because there aren't enough outbreaks of barking for me to keep it on.When she does start barking I use the manual setting, I just hit the power and press the "Manual Correction" button on the unit. It gets my Shiba's attention for a second and then she goes back to barking. I'll also issue the "NO" command together with HAVAHART, and that will sometimes get her to stop.In my case, it works better then my just saying "NO" and a lot less messier than getting a spray bottle and squirting her with water, which I've read is another way to stop unwanted behavior, so I'm giving it a solid 4-stars.According to the directions, there is a small percentage of dogs that will NOT be distracted by the HAVAHART ULTRASONIC BASIC TRAINER so keep that in mind.

A long time Fan of rope toys by Booda Bones, Flossy and a few other makes - we hadn't tried the Hagen yet and are glad we did.Rope toys in general are much safer than other toys, especially if you have an aggressive chewer at home.We have Two Old English Bulldogs Harley, our nine year old 92 pound Chew-Monster and his partner in crime our two year old Elvis. Both just love to chew and play Tug - o - War and this toy at the XL size allows plenty of room for them to go wild. Plus I can get in on the lunacy too - without worrying about losing a few fingers.They're both hardcore, take no prisoners, aggressive chewers. These guys saw through nylabones and Kongs like a beaver buzzing through a 2 X 4. Few toys hold up very long with exception of the good quality rope toys. The rope is quite stiff because the weave is so tight. I know from experience this means the toy should hold up well.Both seem to adore the Mint flavor and the bone shape lends itself to all kinds of interactive play like fetch. Plus the size is manageable allowing our dogs to carry these aroundAfter hours of fierce tug - of war crazy time with me getting in on the fun there's hardly a single strand out of place.Rope Toys Have Lot's of Benefits:* Cleans your dogs teeth and massages the gums* Provides a Great work out (for pooch AND owner)* Doubles as a chew toy and tug toy* Non Toxic - Cotton even with some synthetic floss can't obstruct the intestinal tract like rubber, Polymer and Bone.5 PAWS UP!

First I will say that my cat absolutely loves this stuff and will devour an entire can in a day and look for more.  Second, I will say she usually eats a half to two-thirds of a can, not a full can.  Like most cats, mine is a huge fan of tuna but I also believe this is due to the can being mostly water.  This was a problem I noticed in some of their other flavors.  I'd rather my cat's food was not watered down, I can provide water at a much lower cost.I'm also concerned about the mercury content in tuna, particularly because of reports that recommend you don't consume tuna more than once a week and pregnant females should avoid tuna altogether. While this flavor also contains pork and pork liver, I have no way of comparing the tuna content in this cat food to a regular can of tuna.  Needless to say, if humans can't consume tuna frequently, I'm not comfortable feeding it to my cat except on as an occasional treat.Like another reviewer hinted at, some enterprising pet food producer should start to sell variety packs containing their different flavors.  It would help people determine which flavors their pets like as well as provide an easy way for us to rotate their diets.  You wouldn't want to eat the same food every day, so why should our pets?

In all honesty, I'd rather not use this type of chemical product on my dogs.  I resisted for as long as I could but the so-called natural products were, sadly, ineffective.  I was pulling off a tick a day from them and I found a few of the little suckers crawling on me.  That was the last straw, so enter Frontline.  Bottom line, it works better than anything else I've tried. There's nothing more to say about it, except if someone knows about an effective natural/less chemically product, please let me know.

I had given this a good rating originally but not now.  I bought and used two of these last year for a few months, put them up in the shed for winter and brought them out this year.  Within this last week they both melted.  The first one I luckily noticed and was able to remove from the pond before anything happened and I thought it was a fluke.  Unfortunately, it was not a fluke and the second, within days of the first, caught fire and burned down the pond tent and melted the waterfall basin.With others reporting this same issue this is  not an "accident", this seems like a flaw in the heating element or thermostat of the deicer.UPDATE:  I have contacted the manufacturer with great dissatisfaction. They don't want to believe that my units' heating elements were in the water and not exposed to air.  BEWARE:  these units will catch fire when used properly.

This fence is a great height for small dogs and pups. However, it is not very adjustable because sizing involves adding/removing sections that are about 6 inches wide, or further expanding out the pressure screws/wall cushions, which can then lead to gaps large enough for the pup/dog to squeeze through. With all the enclosed sections it was too wide for my doorway. However, when I'd remove one of the sections, then it was too small unless I adjusted the pressure screws/wall cushion things out to the point that there was then big enough gaps on both sides so that my pup can squeeze through. (This is very hard to describe, just know that it isn't very flexible for adjusting the width, but there is another one that is much better that does adjust millimeter by millimeter.) To correct this, because we couldn't wait for the good gates (below) to come, I ended up having to duct tape the large openings on the side (see pictures I posted) - what a pain! Now they can't easily be removed if needed. I really wish we'd have pre-planned a bit better and ordered the wood ones in time (we'd used them previously with great success and assumed these would be similar).A much better option is theWalk Over Wooden Gate (30-44" W, 18" H)This one is fully adjustable to any size within the given minimum and maximum width, so you can fit your door exactly w/o gaps on the side. Even better, this one is less expensive.So, buy the wooden gate discussed above instead of this one. It is much more adjustable and easier to use.

I have been experimenting with different biological filter starters and so far this one is the worst of them. I've been through Jungle Start Zyme (Walmart), Seachem Stability, Tetra Safestart, and Nutrafin Cycle.All of these products seem to have decent Ammonia->Nitrite (Nitrosomonas) bacteria, but only Tetra Safestart and Nutrafin had effective Nitrite->Nitrate (Nitrobacter) bacteria. In fact, I was able to get a pretty solid cycle going on day 3 with Tetra Safestart. Stability had very little effect overall and the bottle is perfectly within its shelf life.Not impressed.
