Another favorite of my Dane.  She loves chasing these and then runs back squeaking the ball furiously, wanting me to toss it again.  This is our second set because she is a little rough with things (her size plus her aggressiveness in her play).  We like these because our dog loves them, we can toss for a while, and when we are tired of throwing it, she is happy to just squeak it.

Our Gray was nearly naked and has been for quite a while.  I had tried changing foods, moving her cage, changing toys, vitamins, and everything I could think of except a collar.  She acts fine, talks, eats well...just like she used to, just no feathers.I added Pluck no More to her water every day for a couple weeks and the plucking slowed, I cut back to every other day and then a couple times a weeks.  Reviews here talked about how bad it could be but I have no plan for long tern use...the next step is a collar if she goes back to plucking.  I also had people telling me that homeopathic remedies don't work...well that seems not to be the case.She hates to be sprayed so I didn't do that, but she does take her baths in her water bowl so she did get some on her skin.I am very happy with the results I have seen so far.  She doesn't look ready for the stew pot any more.
We keep this on the dog leash now. It makes it easy to clean up after any messes and keeps the bags neatly contained without having to fumble in my pocket. It's very lightweight and functional.

I usually buy these for my foster dogs from the South as when they come to live with me, the Vermont temperatures and weather is much colder than that which they are accustomed. The coat is cozy as it is flannel lined. I would suggest if you have a heavy or pudgy dog that you order a larger size.  The dogs do not seem to mind wearing them and they are easy to put on due to the Velcro closures. I was pleased with the purchase, product, and quality.

I puchased this at a local pet store, and they no longer carry this stick.  Our dogs LOVE this stick, and gnaw it down to a nub.  Would much rather have them shewing on this than actual sticks from the yard.  Very well made product.

Bought two of these for our two lab mixes. They're good looking tags, nice bold colors and clear legible font. The laser etching may look like printing but it's very durable and won't scratch.These look nicer than a similar set we got at the DIY kiosk at the pet store.

These small treats are perfect for my 14-1/2 year old Siberian Husky.  The only thing is that she wants more and more of them.  Now, when we go for her daily walk I put a few in my coat pocket and it is amazing how much better she walks when I give her one of these peanut butter flavored bones.  She gets so happy that she bounces when she walks.  I will keep buying these as long as I can get them.

Product really works. Recommended by vet for those cats who are susceptible to herpes/calici virus. Easy to administer. Granules adhere to dry food. Undetected by cats. Wonderful preventative/supplement. I apply daily to both dry and wet food. Noticeable improvement, haven't seen an outbreak in over a year.
I have a very picky cat, who won't eat any food! I tried many cat food brands until I tried this, she loves it! I even bribe her with it to leave birds alone :)

I accidentally bought the wrong size training slip leash for my 5 lb. yorkiepoo. However, I kept it for my parents Springer Spaniel, and it's perfect for larger breeds. My mistake became their benefit because that spaniel will drag anyone on a regular leash, and this slip lead helps train her how to walk properly without pulling.

I absolutely love these treats and so do my dogs. I have one on daily medication. I used to try and hide the pills in hot dogs or cheese. He got good at eating everything but the medicine. With these, he doesn't have a choice and yet loves them. Highly recommend these treats.
what can you say about pill pockets.  the pill pockets arived quickley and it was a good price.  My cat needs them

I have used Feliway for years and find if I discontinue it (I get the cheaps) I will see the result in my cats' attitude.  Since using it my life with my guys has been extremely better.  I use at least 4 diffusers in the house at all times.

My pooch loves this stuff. We live overseas and it takes our mail about 3 weeks - this does not have to be refrigerated until it is opened. We normally shred it and mis it in his food daily but you can also cut it up and give it as a treat.

The dog certainly didn't say those exact words but her actions certainly indicate her satisfaction with the Grizzly Salmon Oil.  I like the ease of distribution - three squirts every morning in the kibble mixture and she evidently likes the taste.  It is kept stored in the refrigerator's top shelf within easy grasp for the daily dose.  Her coat has always been pretty decent and continues to be easily manageable.  Does the product contribute to that?  I can't say for sure but it certainly doesn't appear to do any harm.  I've just placed another order - three squirts a day goes a long way but does eventually need re-stocking.  If it makes any difference, the dog is a female Golden Retriever, aged 18 months, weighing in at a healthy 60 lbs.

I bought this bed to put on my desk so my kitties would sit on it rather than on whatever I am presently reading. It works perfectly! It is non-skid, has never slid off the desk. It is also very attractive. The cats like it. I like it. :)

Did not purchase from Amazon but from Petco and paid ~ $16.00.What caught my attention was not having to worry about the other combs we have that have round plastic tips at the end of wire combs that can become detached.  Also figured that it would have the benefit of brushing furniture and clothing to remove fur due to the electrostatic charge.Well I started using it and it seems that the majority of the cats seem to prefer this comb.  It seems like it provides a slight drag on the coat and gives them that "stroking" / massage feel.  Also the amount of fur seems to be a bit more than what we got with the wired comb, we believe the electrostatic charge keeps the fur on the comb versus falling on floor.I don't believe it was my imagination but after combing the fur seems to just looked groomed / combed look...hard to explains but it looks nice.In my opinion, this comb seems like it would work well for shorthaired cats (all our cats are shorthaired). The longer fine tooth combs may be better for long haired cats since this may pull too much for long haired cats.Haven't tried it on clothes yet, but that's secondary to the cats liking this comb!

We had an older cat recently adopted from the shelter and we soon learned she had intestinal cancer. Because of her illness she was inconsistent with using the litter box and vomited almost 2-3 times a day. The dumb cat immediately got rid of the urine and vomit smells and stains (they were treated immediately).Something noted was that she wouldn't urinate or defecate in any of the spots previously treated with the dumb cat. She literally moved 10-12 inches down the hall the next time. So I soon just randomly sprayed the entire hallway and eventually got her trained to go back in the box consistently until she lost control of her body. So I can say this worked in help train our cat until physically impossible for her and it also successfully cleaned up the messes if they occurred.
need a backup for our fish.  great price and product  better air supply for the fish and helps the tank
No complaints at all. It works exactly how you'd want. It was much sturdier than I expected. I'd always imagined these collapsible bowls to be flimsy but the materials in this are top notch.

My boxer dog is gonna love this toy for christmas.  I let them &#34,preview&#34, their gifts before christmas to get them excited and Reese loved it.  He is a 2 yr old boxer and loves to play with toys.  It looks pretty durable and they give you 3 extra eggsto replace? the other eggs when they wear out?

I carefully observed my dogs for 3 consecutive days on these stress management pills.  I didn't notice anything different.  To make these tablets effective, I suggest doing something more than merely observation as I did.  For example, one could try dog training lessons at the same time.

I became a Pet Guardian to an older dog obtained from Animal Welfare.  Her teeth were full of tartar.  This product was recommended to me by my friend at ridgwoodpoodles.com who grooms, breeds and owns show dogs and has champions in Brazil and the U.S.  She told me before I spent a heafty amount of money for a dental cleaning at the vet to try this and see how I liked it.  Since she's the expert I purchased this product.  It was very easy to use.  You just put a small amount of this product on your finger - rub it on the dogs teath every day - or whenever you think about it and the results are phenominal.  My friend at ridgewoodpoodles.com is a genius.  I was astonished at how great the results were and so was my vet!  I would absolutely recommend this item.

I've been using slightly more expensive ones (lately, Arm & Hammer and Ever Clean, both with odor control), and decided give this cheaper option a try, and looks like I'm here to stay.ODOR CONTROL: Weirdly enough, this product is certainly not smellier than the aforementioned ones (even though it does not boast odor control), If anything I have less of an odor problem now.CLUMPING: As other reviewers, said, the urine clumps tend to stick to the bottom and form giant clumps (more like a clay layer), but you can break those in 3-5 seconds into smaller clumps and put them away, Honestly, I don't see how this ended up being a big deal for some.DUST-CONTROL: Yes, this is probably a primary reason why I I'm intending to stick with this litter, this is the least dust-producing litter I've used.PACKAGING: I prefer this products packaging to others too, especially to the flimsy cardboard covers. It is very thick plastic that does not arrive damaged, and you can cut a small hole to easily pour controlled amounts each time.
Works great for the car for my 50 pound dog.  Folds up to take with us.  He is older and needed this set of steps to continue rides in the car.

Expensive, but our very picky dog just loves this stuff.  The only problem with it is that other dogs that play in our yard find out about it and try to sneak their way into our kitchen to get to it.  We went out of town for a few weeks and lost an entire bag and a half to other people's dogs as our dog-watcher was feeding our dog outside where the others could find it.  In any case, good stuff.

I've found mulitple stains using this. As soon as I got it I put the batteries in, closed all the blinds, and started hunting for hidden stains. It's amazing what happens when those stains are actually cleaned properly.  The house smells better already!  I'll probably get this as a gift each time a friend gets a new puppy.  Great product!!

Just bought another of these as they're simply a joy for cats to live in.  Because of the 3 tiers, cats have something to do and readily interact in this environment.  I've used them as a cat home as well as a necessity for placement situations where the cats have to be calm and interactive.  The Midwest offering is not only sturdy, but foldable and easy to maintain.  Plusses all the way around.

We use this bed outside on our patio.  I got it in hopes one of my dogs would stop lying in the flower/dirt bed and on this instead but no such luck yet.  My other bichon does lay on it all of the time though.. he is more the type to sit on the back door mat or the concrete.  I have been finding him on this bed every time i go outside to let them in.  Its durable enough, easy to put together, and seems like it will hold up well.  i wish they had one my size!  I like the fact that it has a 3 year warranty on the cover and replacements at a minimal cost.
This product is good. It is a hydrocortisone so good for itching etc..smell is okay.  only thing is bottle is quite small, but not a big issue.  Good to have on hand for dogs with allergies.
It is hard to control its movement, and where/how to store it when it is not in use is problematical

I got this leash for it's lightness for my 4 pound puppy and it does the job well. Just the right length. He is still chewing on it alot and it has not frayed a bit so it's pretty durable too. It's a little stiff from the newness of it, but I hope it will soften a bit with lots of use.

I have a shitzu yorkie mix and he completely ignores this or doesn't hear it, I have tried using it for the ridiculous barking he does at imagined sounds, or when one of my kids enters my bedroom, and you would swear he never knew my kids for the past 4 years...I was going to throw mine in the  trash, but maybe I will try it again since a lot of reviewers say it works well for them. when my dog barks because the next door neighbors dogs are up at 6 am barking, I find the best thing for me to do is close the .window and instant quietness.

Bought this to supplement our dry food for our german shepherd and shih tzu.  It smells pretty bad, but that's tripe for you and the dogs love it.  Once we open the can the dogs go nuts over it.  The cans come in an easy peel lid which saves on time of using a can opener.  We keep it in a plastic sandwich sized zip lock bag in the fridge and it does a good job keeping the smell in.  Dogs love it.  No doubt.

This is a great expansion for any cage!  It does not come with instructions but if you look at one of the pieces it has extra plastic rings in the middle of it, put this in the hole you are adding the expansion on too, take the J shaped piece and from inside the cage with a O ring on it, snap them together (WARNING) it will be hard to get them back apart without taking the top of the cage off and alittle work.  But the top of the lookout comes off and allows you to have even easier access to play with your pet.  As bad as a pun as it is, I really wanted to say play with your little critters, LOL.  Oh and if you try to put it on the side of the cage, OFCOURSE you are going to have issues with keeping it upright.  it does not really attach that way, it is mean to the top, or for adding into a more stable section of a expansion.

For many years, I was a staunch believer in Everclean cat litter, which is pricier than the Arm & Hammer brand.  Trying to save some money, I tried this A&H Super Scoop brand, and it's wonderful.  The litter box is so much easier (and not as unpleasant) to clean since the Super Scoop really hardens up like a rock, never sticking to the bottom of the litter box and no clumps falling apart in mid-scoop.  The unscented version is terrific for those who suffer from perfume allergies.  I ordered a monthly subscription, since it's much easier to simply carry the 40-lb box from my front porch to the bathroom, rather than lugging the heavy box through the store, out to my car, and then into the house to the bathroom.  A win-win-win situation!

This is a great alternative to plastic e-collars, but I wouldn't use this for weeks as the only e-collar for my pet. This is a good solution for dogs recovering post-op, or for pets with skin problems like hot spots or licking granulomas. But you should provide a second, lighter e-collar option occasionally when you will be present to watch your pet.Pros:* Sturdy, good quality, stands up to heavy use* Strong enough to resist bending of edges, more rigid than flexible nylon-fabric e-collars* Long enough to prevent licking of wounds (follow manufacturer's measuring guide)* Collar loops allow it to be attached to pet's own collar, prevents removal* Washable fabric stands up to cleaning, food and water* Fast removal, adjustment using Velcro strip* Manufacturer provides protective Velcro cover strip to keep exposed Velcro clean* Reflective strip edging is night-time safety feature (though consider removing for walks)* Length adjustable, can be folded back for eating/drinking when owner presentCons:* May be longer (deeper in small-to-medium sizes) than desirable for smaller dogs, measure carefully** Slightly heavier than other e-collar materials, may be fine on larger dogs, but monitor smaller dogs' use* Narrower cone angle than normal e-collars, restricts side airflow if worn long-term (see reviews re ear problems)* Solid fabric can limit pet's vision, so consider removing for brief walks or substitute a clear collar* Less adjustable in outer width than cloth or plastic e-collars since Velcro determines closure* Length may make drinking more difficult when leaving pet alone, but can be folded back for eating/drinking when owner presentIn summary, the Comfy Cone e-collar is a comfortable alternative if your pet is an aggressive chewer or licker of wounds, hot spots and needs longer protection. Just be prepared to give your pet breaks from wearing it (monitored during walks outside?) or have a second lighter fabric or plastic collar on-hand for those times (like the VetOne e-collars, as backups). Long-eared dogs might need breaks from wearing it long-term to prevent ear infections (as noted in other reviews) since its shape is long and narrow. But it resists the abuse a strong-willed dog can give to more lightweight e-collars, and should be usable for years, if cared for. See the customer photos here of different pets using this collar to help you decide if it will work on your cat or dog.*Note: the manufacturer's measuring guide says to measure your pet from neck to tip of nose to decide which size will work best, ideally, it should be longer than nose length to protect the pet's wound.SIZE CHART in inches: Small 12.5 cm =  4.9 inches, Medium 20 cm= 7.8 inches, Large 25 cm = 9.8 inches, Extra Large 30 cm = 11.8 inches (refers to depth of cone)Example of a second clear e-collar for back-up use with Comfy Cone:Cardinal Laboratories E-Collar, LargeCardinal Laboratories Pet Botanics E-Collar, XXL, Clear
This toy is very little..........but so is my miniature poodle puppy.  She loves this toy.  I have machine washed it once, and it came out of washer in good shape.

The should make this in a sqeeze bottle or easy pour with a &#34,medical type measuring cap / top&#34,.  Would be a BIG improvement. Went to my local CVS drug store to see if they had one that fit. They did not. Hope the makers and or distributors read this!

I bought two for my 85lb shepherd and my pit. They are not a favorite toy but they are holding up great with hardly a bite mark. My dogs are LOVING the Ruff Dawg peanut right now. It smells like peanut butter and they fight over it. I will probably have to get another one. Ruff Dawg toys are my favorite so far for durability.

I have returned this! There are some hard pieces that will not allow me to crumble to put on pets' food so they had to be thrown out. What are they? Wood? Not acceptable! Returned and will not order again!!

...is like Mikey, he hates everything that looks or tastes like hard dog food. It took him forever to finish this bag but he is a rotten picky eater. Has he been spoiled? Yes. Would another dog like this food, maybe so. Just not Buster.

The pups loved these--well they're peanut butter so who wouldn't love them?  They went through the package of 7 bones in about 3 days--fighting and growling over them as if they were protecting a fresh killed antelope on the Serengeti.
This product was quickly consumed by my dogs----they loved it. My only complaint is they went &#34,too fast&#34,----I think they need to be a tad thicker so they will last longer.

i try to clean my chi's ears and brush teeth biweekly.  this works for keeping them clean and smell free.  a squirt in each ear,rub lightly and remove excess with a cotton ball.  simple healthy maintenance.
and that is the important thing.  i bought three types and they like all 3 of them, i have an older cat who need a soft food, and she is happy with it, so are the others

We have 9 rescued cats here at work.. needless to say we go through cat food ( along with other supplies) a lot!We use Fancy Feast for special needs cats.. cats that are getting medicine, (we mix he medicine in with it) cats that are new and awaiting veterinary care ( to get tested, spayed/neutered) and for our older picky eaters.While Fancy Feast will never be the least expensive option, it is a very good quality food, we use both the "classic" (Pate) and this style. This particular blend does NOT have a "cat food" smell to it, it actually smells like grilled food - real food - not pet food!All I know is when I open this can up ALL the cat's ears perk up and come running.. it is a winner.. no matter what flavor in the mix you try ( although they seem particular to the turkey)Since we have so many cats, Fancy Feast in general is not a cost effective food to use for all of them daily, but if you have one or two cats, they will go nuts for this!****Jim

This is on the intermediate size.I have 2 of the dogs pictured. They are no where close to the 15 - 20 lbs this item is to be able to fit and carry.They will fit in there but not comfortable enough that I would want to leave them in there long. I consider a goodfit when they can stand up and turn around without knocking all the food and water out of their bowl. Can't bedone here. The bowl they give you is pretty much worthless unless you have a pet gerbel.I wasn't an A student in math but I don't get the dimensions they advertize to add up. I got up to 4" less on lenght.The width appeared accurite at 16.7 ". I got 13 " at best on heighth rather than 14.5. Granted the differences aren'tgreat but when you are on the edge of fitting or not fitting every inch counts. Luckily the 4" on lenght doesn't effectmy dogs but it would many 15 - 20 lb. dogs.The storage compartments are pretty much useless even for miniature dogs or cats. They would hold some trainingtreats ( out of the bag ) but that is about it. They are so small it took me awhile to figure out they were the " storage compartments ".For the price paid it is a well made crate. I will use them to carry my dogs back and forth to the vet and on vacationbut that is about it. I would never put one of my dogs on an airplane in one of these crates though !I use them mainly in the house and they would be great if they were as big as indicated. I can stilluse them though. They are close enough not to send back. If I had it to do over I would have bought a large for my malethat weighs all of 10 lbs. soaking wet. My female is getting use to it but she was not a happy camper. She wanted moreroom also. She has her ritual of getting her blanket just right to lay on and that is harder for her to do than she prefers. :)It is a sad state of affairs when you need a large carrier for 10 & 11 lb. dogs. I guess they get claustrophobia too ! Or mine anyway.

This is a great little dog harness. The clasp is somewhat small, but I have big hands and still had no issues with it. I also didn't have major issues adjusting it though I did have to fumble with the small adjusters a little bit and that is the only reason I took 1 star off.Aside from that, it looks nice and is easy to see, which is a bonus when you have a small dog. Definitely would purchase again if I ever lost this one.

We have all different styles and materials of scratchers for our two cats who are both 2 years old. I recently bought them another cardboard scratcher and they loved it. I saw the PetFusion on moderncat  and thought I would try it. Both cats loved it right out of the box. They have so much fun running thru the middle. We play games with it with their wand toys. They make up their own games.  They love sitting up on top like it is their throne. I think they got their moneys worth in just the first couple of days.  The best thing as they love to scratch on it.

My dog really loves the Stella and Chewy's freeze dried dog food. She ate her previous food a little at a time, all day long. I can give her a patty and it is gone in a matter of minutes, sometimes seconds.  Before I was worried she wasn't eating enough and now I am much more relieved knowing she is getting plenty to eat each day.

I had bought this along with a scratch mat from target to put catnip inside.  The catnip that came with the target mat drove my cat crazy!  She absolutely loved it.  However, when that wore off I tried this cosmo catnip and... absolutely nothing.  Obviously some catnip works for my cat, so I don't get why this stuff had no effect at all.  I'm not sure if it is my cat, but now I have a whole tub of this stuff and she is completely unimpressed.  It might be worth a shot for others though.

I once had this toy some months ago, but my dog lost it in the backyard. I really like this because the dogs can play their favorite game (tug of war) and it squeaks. Although each time the puppies have ripped off the green felt on the outside and the purple lining on the side, the toy still holds up to abusive play.
have tried several kinds, like all of them even though they don't last very long.
NO INTERESTED IN THIS PINK PIGGY AT ALL. THE DOG WILL RUN TOWARDS ME WHEN HE HEARS THE SOUND, BUT HE WOULD NOT EVEN TOUCH THIS TOY FOR SOME REASON. A WASTE OF MONEY. NOW IT JUST STAY UNDER THE BED.
I put this on my puppy and she loves it doesn't mind it at all gotta say it's awesome and I will be buying more products made by Zack and Zoey

My pup goes with me most everywhere and I wear sunglasses to protect my eyes, so I wanted the same for him.  Doggles fit him perfectly.  I measured him twice before ordering to make sure the fit would be correct.  The lenses are orange and brighten everything up while deflecting UV rays.  They weren't bought with a cute factor as the main objective however they are cute.  Super cute. Everyone who has seen him wearing them loves them. To get him used to wearing them I put the doggles on him several times a day, a few minutes at a time, for about a week.  He still tries to take them off every once in a while but he is adjusting to them.  For the most part they stay on him as long as he isn't trying to take them off.  Very happy with doggles.

Leaves my dogs soft and shiny...the smell isn't very strong, but in a good way. They've felt clean for days since bathing them with this stuff...so far I have no reason to look for any other shampoo for my pups.

We ordered this collar because we were having trouble finding a quality leather collar that fits our lab/pit mix's 16.5 in neck. She had already broke one of her cheaper collars because she pulls so much when other dogs are close, so we were willing to spend a little extra for a high-quality one. We were very pleasantly surprised with the quality for this price! It is nicely padded, the buckle is sturdy, and the leather is flexible to avoid the creasing we saw with other leather collars. If I am being nitpicky, it is a little difficult to hook the leash one because of how close the loop is to the buckle, but it wouldn't stop us from ordering another one (though I doubt we would need to!).

Kong catnip is the best catnip I have used!  It is strong, it keeps it's intense scent and the cats love it.  I bought a large jar to make cat toys with and I had all my cats on the table fighting over the jar!  I highly recommend Kong catnip.
I have a 1 year old puggle.  He loves playing ball and this ball he can not figure out how to rip it apart.
My new kitty loves these and the size is great until he gets bigger. But expect to use these for quite a while because he really loves the flavor and texture. At least that is what he tells me.

There are some very well-written reviews that explain the set-up and use of the toy, so I'm not going to try to duplicate that. I'll just tell you how it was received in our home.We have three dogs: A four-year old German Shepherd mix, a eight-year old Siberian Husky, and a year old Australian Kelpie. They all have differing needs in terms of indoor entertainment. But all three find the Wobbler entertaining.Our German Shepherd mix was afraid of it at first. When he started using it, he hit himself in the head with it, and it can pack quite a punch (literally and figuratively) due to its weight. But the lure of treats kept him coming back, and he now knows how to use it without getting hit in the head. He neatly smacks it around in a gentle manner until it's empty.Our Kelpie beats it with reckless abandon, knocking cats over in his travels. We actually had to suspend using it during the holidays because he's almost knocked over the Christmas tree repeatedly while he's beating it up.Our husky will only use it in private, so we suspect he hires someone to come in and empty it for him.The greatest part about the Wobbler (Large) is that the hole allows for different-sized treats, so nothing needs to be uniformly-sized for it to come out. We can even put bits of chicken jerky in it, which is a great high value treat to get the dogs coming back for more.It's a great toy for dogs to work with. Just make sure you don't have anything valuable on the floor (or can fall onto the floor)!

I already have a in-tank breeders box but I decided to check this one out because my current one is a bit small and only has passive water flow through. I also I thought I can use this one for an overflow by drilling a hole in the bottom of the box.First of all, it's a very nicely made item. It has a lot of parts, is well thought out and well built, it's not a cheaply made item by any means. You hang this on the back or side. You will need an air pump for water circulation. And once you've put it together and attach the air hose it's as simple as that, nothing else needed. There are two separators so you can make it into a 2 or 3 compartment breeder. There is also a hole on top for feeding.Other uses: After I got it I realized that I cannot use it for an overflow tank because the intake hose is too small and this type of acrylic is not the best for drilling holes in because it's pretty brittle. However, this will make a great wet/dry filter. The box is pretty big and you can fill it with bioballs or biomax, slip a pre-filter sponge over the inlet and you've got mechanical and bio-filtration! This would be a great wet/dry filter for a 30g tank or less.Anyhoo, it's a great breeder box and wet/dry filter, I highly recommend it.

I have ordered this item many times from various dealers. This was by far the quickest I ever received the delivery. As for the product, It is as good or better than other brands such as Sonovi. My dog has been taking them for 6 years. He is almost 10 yo and 116#. He still plays like he's a puppy with pretty good mobility.

We really liked the 12 &#34, that is discontinued, our little girl pug had the squeaker out of this in less than an hour but continues playing with her &#34,blue doggie&#34,. We tried the 18 inch but she doesn't much care for it...bring bag the mid sized 12 inch Loofa Ruff!
My cat loved it and when she got used to the scratcher she liked digging her paws in it. She also liked the infinity ball.

I love this heater! always good to use and has no problem with anything.it's black and fully submersible. Also, when you do water change, that's really have to move away not like others because its' glass heater.

I had an older version of the sport dog brand. This one holds charge must better and the connections for the charger work much better. I wish it had the audible beeb rather than the vibration but it works great and I have had no issues like I did with the sport dog brand.

"More common in mid- to smaller-sized dogs, but occasionally seen in larger dogs or cats. Scooting is also common in overweight pets and those with loose stools. Animals that are overweight have less muscle tone and sometimes additional fat tissue in the way of proper emptying of the sacs"Now I feel really bad that over feeding our 14 year old miniature fox terrier has led her to need to scoot on the carpet.The scooting started a year ago, probably a combination of age, over eating and her small (should be under 10 pounds - but she weighs in a 12 pounds) stature.So we take her to the vet to express the glands.We spotted this product a couple months ago and now use it as a treat.She has twice daily bowel movements but they are a variety of colors, shapes and sizes - lol.We will keep her on these for a a year and hope the combination of expressing and these chews will make her senior years a little smoother - so far so good - instead of monthly we have been going every 3 months.She loves the duck-flavor and she has had no gastrointestinal tract issues with the blend (larch tree extract, maltodextrin, pumpkin powder, brewers yeast, canola oil, citric acid, glycerin, mixed tocopherols, duck flavor, oat flour, oat meal, propionic acid, rosemary extract, rye flour, silicon dioxide, sorbic acid, soy lecithin, vegetable oil.)She has half a chew each day

We have a young Jack Russel and one thing we learned quickly was stuffing and squeekies were not only a waste of time, but dangerous.  This toy has lasted longer than any we have bought her and is still a working toy,  good for fetch and tug of war.  Can't thank the people who recommended this for our JRT enough.

There are a lot of similar play pens out there, but most have a bottom that attaches with scattered pieces of Velcro. I knew that wouldn't work for my rambunctious min-pin and curious ferret. This play pen has not only a zippered mesh top, but a ZIPPERED BOTTOM as well! They can't get out! It's spacious, easy to open and close, and super lightweight. The bag comes in handy too.

Dog loves these, especially when we hid the squirrels in the acorn.  Being able to replace &#34,dead&#34, squirrels is also great.  Probably too small for very large dogs but small - medium will enjoy.

I thought this was a great toy, but my shepherd mix (supposedly very smart according to several different trainers we've worked with) never really got into it.He likes tug toys, but this is not a great tug toy because the dog will grab the rope end, and you'll grab the plastic jug end. If your dog is any good at playing tug at all, you will lose every time.He did not seem to enjoy chewing the purple spiky part either.There was some interest in getting the treats out, but it never lasted very long. The treats have to be fairly small to come out. I spent nearly an hour cutting up treats to make them easy to get out, and that helped perk his interest a little, but he always went back to other toys.Maybe its too complex for him. He does LOVE another puzzle toy we have. Its like a buster cube, but its a tough rubber ball (melon sized) with a maze like center. You put treats in one side by pushing them through a crossed slit, and after some rolling they fall out a hole on the other side. He loves that toy. I think its cool, too, but I fear what might be growing inside it, and the only way I've figured out to clean it is to soak it in vinegar and then put it in the dishwasher and hope.This toy is at least easy to clean.I ended up giving it to a neighbor to see if her dog might like it better.
My little dogs love the Smokehouse Duck Tenders and they are a good weight conscious treat for them!  I'm glad Amazon usually has them in stock.  they are worth the price!

These are nice and long and made plant maintenance so much easier.  I haven't see any reason to believe these will rust.  I'm not a rustologist but the material doesn't seem to be the kind that would rust.  I like them and glad I got them.
It is a good dewormer because it treats 4 different types of worms: round. flat, ring and whip. The whip are one of the more difficult to deal with. I recommend this product.
If you have a strong chewer, you already know this is the best and virtually only toy that will survive.
I change about 10% of my water on a weekly bases. I have not had any problem with losing fish.

I also originally got one of these from Walmart and then they quit carrying them and was thrilled to find them on Amazon.  To say our Catahoula is an aggressive chewer is an understatement.  She destroys every toy she gets, usually in under an hour or two.  The first pig we got lasted a good 3 months before she chewed through the leg and while it no longer grunts, it rattles.  She was thrilled when she got a new &#34,grunter&#34, and at the same time, still loves the one that rattles.  It stands up to alot of constant chewing with no parts coming off.  I would give it a 5 star if it could last her 6 months =)  Will definitely try to keep one of these in the house at all times.
I thought this was ground pine, my fault.  My 2 cats hate this.  One of them is going outside the box so she doesn't have to touch it.  I wish I could send it back.  A waste of money.
The item is useful, however the net dettached from the rod after only a month of use.  The parts seem to be glued and really brittle.  The quality is cheap.
The product is as advertised but the trouble is my cats won't go near it for scratching as they seem to prefer sisal.

I really like this particular massaging shampoo brush.  I was searching for a good one and ordered this one because of the ability to grip the brush between my fingers, which keeps the brush from slipping out of my hand.  I will use this brush to distribute a dry shampoo through my dog's coat when I want to freshen him up between visits to the groomer.
I figured this wasn't going to work all that well, but turns out works great. It's not the best quality of plastic, but it does the job. Was kind of impressed.

This is my fourth order of Nutramax Dasuquin with MSM.  Our Border Collie, Holly, has had joint problems for several years and was to the point of not being able to get up from a lying position which made us very worried.  I gave these a try after reading the reviews and after a month could see such a difference.  She's been on them for a year and a half and is still doing great.  The harsh winter temperatures here made no difference to her except she wasn't willing to go out as often. She is such a picky eater that I have to hide the tablet in her evening meal but she eats it without spitting it out (which she will do to peas and corn). They ARE expensive but the alternative was to have no Holly.  So yes, I would recommend this product to anyone with a crippled up animal.

These are probably The most durable dog toys I have.  My pit bull mix goes through toys that are guaranteed to last (yes, I got my money back) in one day.  She has yet to get through these.  They still whistle too, even after all of her chewing (she chews on them like a piece of gum).The dogs quickly learned to follow the whistle noise when I throw them until the ball comes back down into their field of vision.  If I pretend to throw it and there's no whistle, they whip around because they know I didn't throw it.
This is just the right thing to use to convert our regular harnesses into car seats. I have one in the front and one in the back. Doesn't interfere with people using the seat, just push it aside.
They played with it for about 5 minutes  the first day and have not touched it since. I  try to get them to come over to and they just walk away.

Can't beat 700 bags and a bag holder for this cheap. I will be purchasing more when the time comes. I typically double-bag when I clean up after my dog, simply because 1 bag does not usually mask the smell in the trash can.

I thought this would be a great water bottle for our newly purchased guinea pig. I liked the top fill feature and the secure attachment to the cage (which are really good features). However, it dribbled and leaked a ton. So I returned it and got aLiving World Eco + Water Bottle, 26-Ounceand haven't had great luck with that either. This also has to be held until installed once you fill it. The bottom is not flat so if you lay it down, it leaks out of the top.I finally purchased a bottle that does not leak: Lixit Quick Fill Flip-top Water Bottle.Pros on this bottle: attaches securely, fills from the top.Cons: leaks.

It says it has four squeakers, but it has to have more!  My dog can get the squeaker out of any toy and destroy it.  This is the best toy I have ever bought for him.  He doesn't give up either, so there is squeaking non-stop and it is just the funniest thing.  Talk about entertaining for both of us. My dog has a really tough mouth and he weighs 13 lbs.  I bet a bigger dog will have a great run at it too.  Thank you so much

So extremely easy to use, and easy to clean.  You just turn it on its side, then back to the floor, then dump the bucket.  Only recommendation I have though is to use a good clumping litter.  The cheapo store brands break apart instead of clump, so it breaks apart on the grate.  It becomes nasty because you're just mixing around crumbled up pee litter.  Spend a few extra bucks on higher quality clumping litter and it works great.
My dogs really like this stuff.  But it's really not the healthiest.  I use at as a treat every once in a while.

My 2 year old Lab loved all the squeakers in the feet, tore ever limb off, tore all the stuffing out, and shredded the entire cow apart. I expected as such, so other than having to pay for it, I had to give it 4 stars. It lasted 1 month.

My cat had been scratching herself constantly.  She doesn't have fleas or mites, just constant scratching.  Then I thought she might have allergies to her food.  I tried this product and have seen a dramatic reduction in the scratching and her course greasy looking coat is now so soft and fluffy.  It's only been three weeks but I can see a lot of difference.  It's a little pricey but the benefits to my cat are worth it.
Good product with a good price and works well. Would buy again.
I love the crackle ball, and my mini dachshund does, too. He loves the crackle and I love that he's having fun. He has a couple of these. They are durable and keeps him entertained for quite awhile.

It took a second to get the automatic setting to work (give it a tap!) but this toy is AMAZING. I cannot wait to bring it outside during the spring at night! My cats (1 year, 2 7-month-olds) were actually tired out by it. It's so much fun, easy to use, and made them really, really happy. And I don't have to worry about me getting tired out before they do! Highly recommend this for houses with cats (or dogs)!
My dog seems to like this bed, not only for the coolness but also for the softness.  feels like a memory foam mattress.  I put a sheet over it for easy washing.
Did not work as well as I thought it would. Maybe I just need some practice.

This is a nice size container and very easy to open/close.  Gives a nice tight seal to maintain freshness.  I purchased with the KONG hedgehog cat nip toy and my cats LOVE it.  Pleased with the purchase

I didn't wanted to buy anything that was made with rawhide but a friend gave my pup a Dingo and he loved it. So I forced myself and brought my first bag of Dingo Dental Bones a month ago. Stitch loved it! I loved it too because he actually spent a good 45 minutes~2 hours on a Dingo Dental Bone. I didn't really like the red dye in the chicken meat but it wasn't overwhelming. If you actually crack a piece of the chicken off you can still see some non-dyed chicken.So I ordered a second bag of Dingo, just the original red package. The red dye was so strong that the whole piece of chicken was blood red and it even DYED the rawhide pinkish red!! It's kind of ridiculous to dye something the dog can smell! It's not necessary as long it tastes delicious.Anyhow I am on the search for something else, hopefully a better alternative other than Dingos.At least it wasn't made in China.
A great training and encouragement tool. I try to always have some in my pocket. All it takes is for my hand to move toward my pocket and the dog wants to know what I want it to do.
I have a 5 month old Maltese and she loves it.  She can grab it and toss it and it keeps her busy plus she gets exercise.

Why Bake-a-Bone?  Why not?  I've got one dog who is a "special needs" dog and I definitely like to control the ingredients in his food as much as possible.  He fares much better without a lot of odd ingredients and preservatives.  I'm much more comfortable with the fact that I do have some control and there's nothing in these "cookies" that I couldn't or wouldn't eat myself.  I opted for peanut butter (recipe below) because both my dogs are wild about the flavor.  I've purchased Paul Newman's organic peanut butter treats, but in time I'm sure I'll come out ahead by making my own.  I've listed some ready-made packets you can purchase below and also have listed the recipes in the booklet at the bottom of this review.Bake-A-Bone Mixes:Bake-A-Bone Peanut Butter and  Banana BlastBake-A-Bone Triple Peanut ButterUndoubtedly, this "cookie" baking experience was one of the most fun experiences this family has seen in some time.  My two dogs knew something was up when I got out the Bake a Bone, the ingredients, and a mixing bowl.  My dogs instinctively know when they will be included and Brandy, who would be Holly Housewife if she were human, was especially excited.  While they danced around underfoot, I decided to make up the recipe for "Peanut Butter Dog Treats."  Both Brandy and Liam adore peanut butter and knew they would be getting something out of this mess.I've tried making dog cookies by using a cookie cutter and baking them, but I've never been particularly satisfied with the results.  I got everything from ever-so-slightly overdone (burnt) to overly soft.  These cookies were perfect!  The recipe I chose to use was very easy to mix and, unlike a similar recipe for peanut butter balls, was much faster.  One real plus is that I can use organic ingredients, which I did with the exception of the baking powder.  Within a couple of minutes I was good to go.  When I looked at those four little slots I knew I'd be making a mess.  I was pleasantly surprised when the cookie dough seemed to slide right in.I was waiting for a green colored light to come on, but it was actually an orange color.  There are two lights, one on the left and right of the unit.  The outer casing of the one on the right is green in color, but when the unit is ready, it is orange.  It took ten minutes to make four large cookies, but the whole process was lots of fun.  I couldn't find my cooling rack so simply placed them on my dish drainer, a perfect solution. Cleanup, considering I made a mess, was actually relatively quick all things considered.  I put the whole unit back in the box it came in to protect it.  Brandy and Liam had a great time and loved the event.  I'm sure they'll remember it when we decide to bake again.SAMPLE RECIPEPeanut Butter Dog Treats~  2 cups whole-wheat flour~  1 tbsp baking power~  1 cup peanut butter (chunky or smooth)~  1 1/2 cups milkPlug in Bake-a-Bone, when the green light comes on, it's ready to bake!  Mix all ingredients together in a bowl until the mixture is like a paste.  Using a silicone spatula, transfer the batter into each lower bone mold (fill the mold completely, and approximately 1/8" above each mold's side walls).  Close unit and bake for 10 minutes.  Cool on a rack for 30 minutes.  Store in an airtight container.  Refrigerate for longer lasting treats.  Freeze extra treats for later!RECIPES:1  Apple Cinnamon Bones1  Bacon Bites2  Banana Bones2  Banana Biscotti3  Birthday Bones3  Bowser's Beef Biscuits4  Breath Mint Bones5  Buddy's Beefy Barley Biscuits6  Bharlie's Chicken Treats6  Chee Chee's Chicken Treats7  Cheesy Bones8  Chick n' Bones8  Cookie's Cottage Cheesy Bones9  K-9 Carrot Cakes9  Lucy's Liver Treats10  Molasses Cookies10  Nora's Oat Bones11  Parmesan Herb Bones11  Potato Puppies12  Peanut Butter Dog Treats13  Salmon Snacks14  Sammie's Soy Biscuits14  Honey Cinnamon Swirl15  Traditional Treats16  Thanksgiving Treats16  Tuna Treats17  Uncle Jack's Southern Dog Bones17  Vegan Bones18  Vegetarian18  Veggie Bagel Bones19  Wesley's Wheat-Free Treats19  Zeus' Canine Cakes20  Icings, Frostings and Glazes20  Ready-Mix Flavors

The seller was great and very quick shipping. This harness is very easy to attach. It is padded so it is also very comfortable for your dog. It snaps right in place using your current seat belt in your car/truck/mini van/suv. It also snaps around the dog with no problems and can be adjusted to fit. The dog doesn't even seem to mind it or even know it's their. I got the Large for my German Shepherd. I put it on, snap her in the mini van and off we go. She can lay down or sit up, turn a little from side to side but it keeps her in place so I don't have to worry about her in case of an accident. It is simply wonderful. My vet saw it and gave it two thumbs up.  Highly recommended.

I have two Siamese cats, and I really like this food.  It does help with hairballs, and I like the larger size kibble that forces them to eat more slowly.  The larger kibble also serves to help clean their teeth - it's similar to the size of the SD Oral Care food.
...that won't fall apart.  Quickly became a favorite.  It's nice and long and you can wiggle it like a snake or make it go way up...both cats love it!

I bought this for my chihuahua and love that the hook is appropriately sized for small dogs. Don't worry though - the larger sized leashes have larger hooks for big dogs. It's lightweight and secure. No worries about losing my little girl!

Our plastic scoopers were breaking so we got these.  Bought two of these - very happy with them. They are very strong and have the right size of slots for sifting cat litter. I recommend these, they are well worth the price.
I always order this for our bob whites, and they seem to love it, I would recommend this brand to anyone interested!

Works great for 2 of my cats...the others will not use probably due to design and they're too big for this opening.  But I love that there's no more litter outside of this box or overspray outside the box. Awesome product!

I was really surprised at the brightness of this light.  Now it's not like a spotlight or anything, but I expected it to be pretty dim with the led lights.  There are 6 lights on it, and they create a pretty good light.  The light extends past the 25 feet of Haley's retractable leash.  I did aim it a little too low, so I have to angle the handle up into the air when the leash gets extended all the way.  The light is a little bulky and may get in the way for some people, but I haven't had a problem yet.  It velcros on, so you can remove it when needed.  I leave it on so that the velcro doesn't pick up fuzz, dirt, lint, etc., causing it to lose its effectiveness at sticking.  I don't need the light very often, but it does come in handy for those times when it is needed.

I have owned three Dogtra training collars and three Dogtra No Bark Collars, the YS500 is my least favorite so far for two reasons.#1 The collar does not recognize and stimulate my large dog while he barks in a higher pitched, constant nuisance tone, perhaps the vibration sensor is only for deep throated barks, in this manner it worked fine.#2 Dogtra's actual collar has failed and my dog escaped on one occasion, a Dogtra Customer Service Agent e-mailed to explain the collar is not meant to have a leash attached, but I could not find this specific caution in any of their warranty, or product manual verbiage. My collar failed at the buckle, the metal actually snapping off and revealing cast metal that has been plated with a rust-resistant shiny metal, perhaps chrome, at any rate this breakage led to a complete collar failure and release of my dog.Though these collars are not for continuous usage, when you are paying hundreds of dollars for a training collar and close to $100 for a No Bark Collar I believe Dogtra has an obligation to provide a collar capable of functioning without fail if it is necessary to occasionally attach a leash to the Dogtra unit.
The dog thinks these are great. She recommends them highly and thinks we need more in inventory. Guess I will do as told.
This thing is just adorable and sounds like a real chimp. My puppy loves to play with it. I have nothing more to say but I needed 2 more words to complete the review. Who knew they were counting.

The hole in the middle is a great feature of this.  Never thought my cat would like one of these, but she LOVES it.  I actually had to hide it at night because she made so much noise all night running into it and rolling around.  It makes a little crinkly noise which I think she loves.  The ball is actually still attached also (impressive after 2 months...)  It does take up some room in the apt, but worth it because she loves it so much!

I've been using Zero Odor to remove my dog's urine stains and odor on the carpet. It is expensive so I decided to try FizzIon. A package of two tablets cost me around $5.50 and only one tablet is needed to equal to a 16oz bottle of Zero Odor. FizzIon has done an alright job removing the stain but I noticed that a muggy urine smell still lingers despite me following the instructions for odor removal (spray to remove stain, spray again and wait to dry for odor removal). I had to go back to purchasing Zero Odor but using it in conjunction with FizzIon to save product. Since FizzIon is so inexpensive, I can use it for stain removal, which requires a lot more product, and I finish it up with a few sprays of Zero Odor to remove the odor.
They are made differnetly and that attracts my cats. Someone is hiding them and keeping them for special occasions. They still are clean. The string does come off and unravals. Great fun until then.

I have 3 lab mixes and we seem to go thru tons of toys. This is the only toy I have found that my lab/golden retriever puppy cannot destroy. This toy is thrown all around the house and 2 of my dogs even play ball by throwing it at each other. I cut off the feet before I give them a new one just to keep them from eating the feet. If you have a chewer this is the toy to buy.

This is easy to put together and a nice product overall.  The only problem I had is that they supply rubber feet that push into the bottom of the panels.  On two of the panels, the holes were not drilled into them in order to fit the feet into.  I had to drill the holes, myself.

This toy was much stronger than most of the other dog toys out there that &#34,guarantee&#34, not to break for heavy chewers. The fact is, they all fall apart at one point or another. This toy actually lasted quite a while surprisingly - about 4 or so months. Then one day I came home and there was a million pieces laying around my house. I'm not sure if my lab never really chewed on it much over those 4 months, or if it deteriorated to the point of destruction.
nice size for my American terrier.....so far has held up well. She loves toys that squeak and keeps her busy.

FIRST REVIEW:  My kitten really, really liked this toy.  I didn't use it every day because I didn't want her to tire of it, but I did use it frequently when she got in one of her "hyper" moods.  It was easy to carry from room to room, which I did since she likes to be where I am.The batteries have only had to be changed once, and so when I turned it on for her today and it didn't send out a beam, I assumed it needed new batteries again.  No!  I tried many new batteries, not believing that the toy itself could be damaged, but still no beam.  It turns on, makes it's regular sound, but there's no beam.If it's worth the money for the length of time this will last, buy it.  If you want something that's going to last, forget it.I give it 2 stars instead of 1 because it was a lot of fun for a while.EDIT:  after contacting the seller, he sent me a brand new one and it's worked perfectly ever since.  He didn't even want the old one returned, so I'm raising my star count to 5 and recommending the seller.

We have two dogs and the larger of the two was just barely too big for the small sturdibag. After reading some online reviews, we sized up to the large to use for a trip back home for Christmas. This was very roomy for her and she seemed comfortable, but it was hard to get under and out from under the seat on the plane-- and kind of stressful for my dog. Otherwise, this is a great carrier, sturdibags are very well made, I like the top vents so I can see my dog from above and the fact that they flex down. I would definitely recommend this carrier, although if you're going with a large (rather than the small), get it in black so it's less obvious that it's slightly larger than regulation. The small is awesome, so if you're dog fits in it I DEFINITELY recommend it.

I bought this toy and the "hide-a-squirrel". Though my dogs like the squeakers on the bees, they don't "dig" into it like they do the squirrel. Not sure if it is because there isn't a hole in the top like the squirrels....If you are looking at this toy, look at the squirrels first. All 3 of my dogs go NUTS over them, the bees are left for whomever didn't get the squirrels fast enough! (This is still a good toy....I would just recommend it 2nd to the squirrels)
Much better than the old one that i had which would leak and was not made well. This one has really thick plastic and a very good cage hanging system.
My cat ate the Classic for years, but this product has gravy which he just loves!  And the solid pieces seem easy to chew for my older, nearly toothless cat!
Best cat litter on the market!  It works wonderfully and is extremely lightweight.  Easy to cleanup and the cats seem to like it as well as the traditional sand.

I've tried a few different kinds of dust - weighing price vs quality i decided to give this a try over oxbow. My chinchilla LOVES this dust bast and spends more time rolling around in it than others. I also find that it doesn't stick to his fur as much - and therefore doesnt transfer everywhere immediately after a dust bath. I dont find myself sneezing as much with this product as well. Its great value for quality and price.
My dog will grudgingly take this.  He often leaves it for days before giving in... I don't think he likes them...
One of those things to have on hand in case ph goes nuts! Does its job.

Scooter, my son's cockatoo, loved this Wesco shreddable toy so much that once he started pecking at it, he couldn't stop.After about an hour of constant action it was totally gone!  I will order this again soon but next time I will only allow him at the toy for 15 mins. at a time so it will last longer.
Thi is a very nice crate which fits my maltese very well. She loves to go take naps in it and eats her dinner there undisturbed.

Quality ingredients at an attractive price.  Bag is resealable so food stays fresh.  I give this to my dog with additional salmon oil and warm water or some carrageenan-free canned food (Weruva or Nature's Instinct) and she woofs it down.  (Without the oil and water, she eats it, but holds out a little to see if she can get the extras...)

These larger crates were the size we needed and we wanted a door on the front and on the side.  We have 2 dogs that are in the 80 lb. range and we move the crates in different parts of the house as the seasons change.  The rubber skids on the bottom are great for keeping the crate from scratching your floor when you lift to clean underneath.  The trays are cheaply made and were cracked on the ends when shipped, took photos and sent to company. They shipped replacements, took about a week to get them.  Wire is flimsy and cheap as well.  If you are on a budget and do not have a dog who will try and get out, this is for you.  The latches need to be tweaked and sometimes you have to fight to get them to latch correctly, again if you have a dog that will not try to get out, this is not a big deal.  I have only had these for a month, so time will tell how long they last with being moved allot and taken outside and cleaned. Also these types of trays will warp if left out to dry in the sun.

I had bubble bars all over my 30 gallon tank - probably 3 10&#34, bubble bars - but the pump was still so effective water was spraying into the air. Also, the vibrating buzzing noise didn't seem worth it and my fish have been just fine without. Generally I like the shape and will hang on to it in case I change my mind and need an air pump again.

Used this product to get rid of giardia, which vwt neds could not.  My little dog got sick on meds, so I found this product because i prefer natural solutions.  I have saved so much on vet bills, plus I know what to look for when she shows signs of tummy issues.  Some dogs have recuurent bouts with giardia, coccidia, etc. and this is so helpful.  Also, use products by Homeopet, and they are also very good.  I like using products that do not have unsafe side effects and actually help.  highly recommend.

This works a heck of a lot better than having to put your mouth on the tube (yuck). The self starting ones usually work well, until the water level gets too low and then you're SOL. With this one I was having trouble getting it started when the water got too low, but if you put your hand over the base when you squeeze, you get a lot more suction and it starts no problem.

I don't have any goats.... but I do have dogs.  We rescue dogs and first thing we do is get rid of the bad critters the dogs may have picked up.  Very safe product that is effective.  Not a toxic product to dogs so no side effects.  Due to our dogs having lots of contact with other dogs in dog parks etc. a treatment on a regular basis is the norm.  Much cheaper then the same stuff packaged for dogs.

Bught this for a foster cat who was being very aggressive towards one of our cats.  Had wanted to consider adopting this particular foster boy.  Unfortunately, neither these treats nor anything else I tried has worked, he still wants to attack the other cat when he gets the chance.  Having said that, I'm guessing this is individual, based on cat and situation.  Feliway, for instance, has made the world of difference for some of my fosters.  However, it didn't help my current kitty at all.  I think sometimes you just have to try a few different things and hope you come across what works.
I purchased this item as a supplement for my show dogs.  It helps maintain beautiful fur and skin.  It is easy to put in their dish and for them to swollow without a problem
my cats love it and spend hours playing with it.  I would say buy it if you want active cats.

I have 4 indoor cats, and 4 litter boxes.  Two of them are the Breeze litter boxes, and two are regular litter boxes.The deal on the 10 pack of pads is cost beneficial (I buy at Walmart and they are $4.98 each plus tax) and free shipping on Amazon Prime.  Often the store is out, so I figured I'd stock up.

I have a Black Russian Terrier who is almost 2. He loves water bottles. This toy works great. Easy to take out and replace the water bottles. He hasn't torn it as he chews it and does not even try to rip and tear. When he has a water bottle I worry that he will cut his gums on some of the sharper edges, with the cover there is no worry about that. He has 2 of these and loves to chew on them.

I first purchased the EarthBath Grooming Wipes from our local pet supply store. I picked the hypoallergenic unscented wipes because I imagine that dogs--with their sensitive sense of smell--must go nuts when humans insist on spraying them down with scented products.Even though they're unscented, these wipes leave my dog smelling clean (she doesn't smell like Bath & Body Works...she just smells clean). They leave her coat shiny and soft (she's a beagle-daschund, so she has short hair), and she actually enjoys being wiped down with these.The problem with the 100-count box of wipes is that the package doesn't keep them moist. I had to add a bit of water to every wipe in the first half of the container because the ones on the top were so dry. The first time I bought these wipes, I purchased the smaller 28-count pouch, and the wipes stayed moist in the package. I'll buy the smaller package in the future.

Our kitty is 5 months old, and we got him when he was 11 weeks old. Since day one, he's had terrible gas! We were using the cheaper dry cat food because i was convinced cat food was cat food, but after trying Purina Kitten chow, Meow Mix, Purina Kit and Kibooble, Whiskers, I've realized they're not all the same and that it really is worth spending a little more for a good quality dry cat food. After researching all kinds of dry food online, and being desperate for this cat to stop with the terrible, smelly gas, I decided upon Blue dry kitten food because of its high quality, all natural, no junk added ingredients, and after about a week of him eating this consistently, NO MORE GAS!!!! It's a miracle! His coat is beautiful and shiny, he's lively, energetic, and just a very healthy, non smelly cat! Fabulous product!! Highly recommended by our cat, Tom, and his owners who are no longer afraid to have him sit on their laps or even be in the same room as him :)
Got three  two pink and one  green love these you can see at night these are my summer collars since they are bright and beautiful colors. Will be ordering this brand again!! Very well made!

I thought I'd try this first without anything in it, just to see if my cats liked it.  They will eat anything that doesn't eat them first, so imagine my surprise that they wouldn't go near this.  Not much use if they don't like it.
Having a chunky bunny, my vet told me to stay away from Fiesta bunny food. Like everything that I put in front of my ravenous rabbit, he loves this food and his weight management had improved.

I really like this nail trimmer. Its really smooth cutting and doesn't split my dogs nails. Her nails are never sharp after using this tool. Never seems to hurt her either. Highly recommend this trimmer

I switched to this food, Taste of the Wild, from Orijen puppy food.  My pup was having foul gas and frequent stooling. As Orijen was so highly rated, I was not so sure it was the Orijen food, but after reading some other reviewers stating that Orijen had caused the same in their dog, I decided to switch foods.  Well since the switch, the air quality has improved and the stooling seems more normal and less frequent. The pup  is very healthy, robust, and has a shiny coat. We do alternate with homemade meals, but he does enjoy his meals with this food. I think it is a great choice of food for a grain-free diet.

This is so much better than a regular litter box. I'm noticing  less litter on the floors which means less sweeping/cleaning than needed. Cats love it too and considering that we have 4 cats, that's definitely a good thing.
I have an 11 pound Couton De Tulear.  Small sharp teeth.Dog loves them.These don't last long.  From a value standpoint, I prefer "Checkups," when Costco has them in stock.

I wish I had found these before I spent so much money on other toys for my cat. All I have to do to give myself an hour or two of alone time is to drop one of these babies on the floor and walk away. He will play with these things for hours! I bought three packages of these, and gave one to a friend who lives down the street from me. His cat loves them just as much.Get these. Your cat will thank you.

What a great little bubbler!  I have to say, if you don't follow the instructions and soak it for an hour or more before hooking it up, you deserve for it not to work properly.  I did so, and it is blowing out so much air that I had to tone it down a bit with the gang valve.  Have two of these hooked up to a "60-100" air pump in a 150 gallon tank, and it is an amazing show for sure!  The fish love it and the tank has cleared up more that it was before hand.Great purchase, take your time and follow the instructions, and you should have a fine air bubbler in your tank.Yes it floats just a bit, be prepared to cover it with your substrate.  I completely covered my two and they still bubble like they were sitting on the top of the substrate.

Most litters are made for human convenience but can be quite a bit of pollution for your cat's lungs with the dust and the heavy perfumes. Many stick to paws and with their clumping, can actually cause digestive issues when cats lick the litter from their paws.Consumers are becoming more aware today about how heavily perfumed items or artificial items collect on our pets paws...from floor cleaners to  perfumes to litters and in going more green and all-natural, new items are being developed to fill the need to stay healthy yet convenient.Fortunately this litter remains affordable as well, and clumps just as well as any artificial heavily scented litter. There is no cat smell left behind and quite frankly our household feels it works better than old school litter.We have a Maine Coon cat who is as large as a dog, he is a real test to any litter box but he took right to this new litter and it's one we'll stick with for his health and ours, as well as the fact that it simply works.  Easy to scoop.  Simple to clean.

Bouli, my 50 lb. street rescue and power chewer, loved his Kong Extreme from the minute he got it, even with nothing inside. So far (two months) it is holding up great. He loves the bounce, and I love the smooth edges when he shoves it against me or drops it on my bare foot. It's also easy to keep clean. The downside is that Bouli, being a water dog, expected it to float like his other rubbery toys do and kept dropping it in the pool. When it sank straight to the bottom, he'd either stand there and bark until I fished it out, or jump in and try to dive for it until I thought he'd drown from exhaustion. This got old real quick, and the solution was to stuff it with something that floats. So far a piece of packing foam works best, because he's not all that interested in digging it out. The only other issue is that black is hard to see in the garden, under furniture, or when you're heading to the fridge or bathroom in the middle of the night. But I'm delighted to have found another toy that ... so far ... hasn't ended up in pieces in the trash before the debit was processed at the bank.

I have three Persian cats. One of my cats is a little over weight at almost 14 pounds so I opted for this Bolster cat bed as it is sturdy enough to hold a lot of weight.  I bought this a while ago and my cats love it, the only problem was is I only had the one so I just bought another one (the same kind) recently. Now I have two bolster beds.Its easy to install, fits perfectly snug on the window ledge and looks very nice. The bed is soft and the outer cover unzips so you can pop it in the wash. My cats love these.
I had high hopes for this since it was a Nylabone..my dog won't even give it a second sniff...

This product is not cheap, so I thought twice before purchasing it. However, no regrets. It does its job well and it makes my life so much easier. I clean litter once a day now instead of 2-3 times a day in the past. We've had Litter robot for about half a year. The wiring got loose a bit at the back of the robot and sometimes (rarely) it stops in the middle of the cleaning process. We put some tape over there and seems to help. Another little problem we've experienced is that the sensor that reacts when the cat steps on the step to get into the box has been malfunctioning, so I have to press it manually occasionally, so that robot can spin. Despite some imperfections mentioned above, it is a really great product, especially for the household with more than one cat.

My dogs love these items.  I can tear them in half to give to my smaller two who way much less, than my other one.  They have never thrown up, which is something common they do with other oral chews.  Well worth the price.
My two cats love these springs.  Thing is.....they are all over my house!  It keeps the cats playing, active, and looking for trouble.Recommended.

Works great, but so disappointing to find one in the Dollar store a week after buying this one.  So I bought that one too and am saving this expensive one for when the cheap one breaks...a lot of use and still going great.Feel a bit foolish for spending so much here.

Aug 5th, I bought it,Aug 8th, I recieved it,Aug 16th, first day to place the training kit on the toilet, (I was waiting for the flushable litter during 8th-16th), and my cat successfully used it on 16th, in the begining, he Meowing and walking around the room to looking for litter, and not confident to jump on the toilet, so i carried him and place him there so he finally learned to use it by himself in the same day,Aug 20th, I open the first little hole, he been curious about that and touched the water through it, and he successfully used the toilet also in the same day, but he pee and shit on the litter but not into the hole,Aug 24th, I open the circle #2, he has no problem to use it at all in the same day,Aug 26th, I open the circle #3, still no problem to use it in the same day, and I first time hear my cat pee in the water, that is so exciting and cute,Aug 28th, I open the circle #4, its the last circle, HERE, I met some little trouble, the first 4 steps are too nice, so i was a little bit rush into this step, and the circle is kind of big, my cat may not feel so comfortable with it, so he peed and shitted on the floor, I am not so sure if that is the reason, or because that is the day i took him a shower, but anyway i decided to slow down a little bit, but I didnt do anything to help my cat yet, I heard he pee in it right in the Aug 29th morning,So since 28th, I let the kit on the toilet with the litter inside, and let it there for many days already, never add litter in it again, and my cat became mastered on it. I even took Videos of it, and all my friends are so suprised to that.I am so proud of my cat, He already ready to use the toilet without any help, but i just left the last piece on it for longer to be very very sure.The totally days I used to train my cat is 14 days, two weeks!! TWO WEEKS!!!! So great!! Now, no more litter needed. I will start to train my cat to flush now!!

If your dog is a vigorous eater and pushes the bowl all over the place, then this is the bowl for them. They are virtually "no slide" bowls on floors or carpeting.  I wish I knew about them before I bought tons of other bowls.
It's fine, holds up well, but it doesn't get very much use.  The dog doesn't have any interest in it.
will be reordering soon, cats can't get enough or I can't grow it fast enough but they know where I keep it and if I just walk by they come running to see if I am going to put it on the floor them.
My girls love the treats from Wilderness and I have to say that I enjoy buying them for them but I just wish they weren't so expensive.

This keeps my boy nice and cozy and I love the fact that it's easy to take on and off . .not to mention downright cute and reversible. We live in the Midwest so during the nasty winter months, I keep him warm by putting the fleece side against his coat.  I highly recommend this product.

I like this well enough, my dog is a little hesitant with it and I think it is because she is used to the bacon or meat type paste. I brush her teeth every day and while she isn't thrilled she will sit for it to get a treat.

I wouldn't say that I am the most uncoordinated person on earth, but I sure felt like it when I was trying to scoop up after my dogs with a claw-type scooper. Actually, only of our dogs poops in inappropriate place, and she's a chihuahua, so the size of this scooper is more than sufficient, and I find it much easier to handle and operate than the claw type.

One thing I like about this leash...the pattern!  Silly, I know.  But I like that it's a little different from the plain red or blue retractable leashes that I always get.It's a sturdy, well made device.  I don't worry that my pug (about 22 pounds is going to break the leash...he's a strong little guy) even though a small is only supposed to be for up to 14 pounds.  To be honest, I think a medium would be just too big for a dog his size.There are a few things that take some getting used to.  In the past the retractable leashes I have used, you simply move up the little button to lock the leash, but this one you actually have to flip it-sort of like a light switch-and that took me a few tries to get used to.  I would say anyone with larger hands, so most men, would find this rather uncomfortable.  I can't really get all four of my fingers around the handle comfortably, so I know my husband and older sons' can't either, making this difficult to hold securely.And then there is the price.  If you have ever bought a leash like this, you know they can be pricey, anywhere from $15-$30 dollars.  This one is at the top of the price point.  So, while I love the little graphics, I am not sure if that makes it worth $30.

I'm very pleased with this product. I wanted to find Da Bird that had the &#34,full pole&#34,, not the kind I was seeing that had the pole in two parts, that you had to put together. I felt that one solid piece would be sturdy, rather then a weak spot where the two pieces were joined.  I finally found it from the seller CoolCyberCats,  They shipped it super fast and it came mailed in a hard tube, which was a really nice touch, since I was concerned that the pole might get snapped in shipping.  The cats absolutely love it, even the kitty that only really likes the laser toy, was jumping around and joining in. I have bought the cats poles with feathers on the end but this one by far is the best, they have a level of excitement with this that the other feather poles don't come close too. The sound it makes fluttering through the air really gets them jumping, playing and I'm glad they are getting lots of exercise. One of the cats likes it so much, she stands near it and meows to me, asking to make the feather fly!  I will only buy this kind in the future.

I bought this when I pup was only 2 months old (only about 3 pound ish). At that time, he was kinda too big for him to handle, right now he's like 8 pounds, he can make it squeaky easily and carry it around with his little month...

I am really impressed with this leash. I love the handle as i'ts really soft especially when you have two dogs pulling. I like to that the leash does not get tangled up when the dogs start doing circles around each other. Really adjustable too.

My dogs love to rip apart tennis balls and eat them. Having already had one surgery for eating something he wasn't supposed to, we try to keep them away from tennis balls. It's a good size pad.  The problem is the urine goes through it and onto the floor.
