Blue Buffalo Spa Select is great! Top of the line ingredients, human food grade-- in addition to the indoor cat formula there's a chicken version and a fish version. This food meets a very high standard. No yucky meat "by-products", meat and meat meals are the top ingredients, plus a host of wholesome and varied ingredients and probiotics.On top of that, this is an incredibly palatable food. My cat LOVES it. In fact, she scarfs it right down, when she typically has just grazed on a piece or two at a time of other premium foods. I have to be careful to use a measuring cup and not overfeed her, 'cause she will seek me out and meow for more!Blue Buffalo uses a unique process to manufacture "lifebits" which are added to the food. These smaller, darker pieces are cold formed in order to maintain nutrients. I don't believe any other company incorporates this kind of element into cat or dog food.I came across this cat food at the local Tractor Supply. I'd never heard or read about Blue Buffalo, but I respect what they are doing, and I've changed to Blue Buffalo dog food for my golden retrievers, too.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Here's a summary of the nutritional information:-Recommended daily feeding chart-- amount varies based on age, activity level, breed, and environement, but in general a 5-9 pound cat will eat 1/4-1/2 cup, while a 10-14 pound cat will eat 1/2-1 cup.-One cup contains 478 calories-Major ingredients:Deboned chicken, chicken meal, whole ground barley, fish meal, oatmeal, whole ground brown rice, whole potatoes, chicken fat (preserved with natural mixed tocopherols), natural chicken flavor, dried egg, dried cellulose, whole sweet potatoes, whole carrots, cranberries, blueberries, flaxseed (natural soource of Omega 6 fatty acids), barley grass, dried parsley, alfalfa meal, kelp meal, taurine, l-carnitine, l-lysine, ycca schidigera, green tea extract, turmeric, salmon oil (natural source of Omega 3 fatty acids), black malted barley, dried chicory root, fructooligosaccarides, oil of rosemary, the expected vitamins and minerals, and several probiotics (lactobacillus acidolphilus, bacillus subtilis, bifidobacterium thermophilum, bifidobacgterium longum, enterococcus faecium).I hope this helps you evaluate whether or not this food is a good match for your feline friend.  My cat and I have been really happy with it.

We bought these for German Shepherd to use when we were treat train him. Every little cracker is a perfect size for treat training. They are small, and they are very easily handled in a treat pouch. There really isn't much mess. Our German Shepherd loves these things, and will do just about anything for them. If you're looking for new treat for your dog, these will work out nicely.
My daughter's cat is an incredibly messy eater. The cat is fed inside the crate, it is big enough for her to pace while eating. The 'floor' slides out easily for cleanups. Problem solved!
my dog loves these.  they are about the size of a 50cent piece.  easily broken up if you have a smaller dog.  they do have a very powerful fishy smell so dont breathe!

I live in Florida and my 2 mini Poodles get very itchy skin in summer.  Started bathing them every 2 weeks in Tropiclean Aloe on the recommendation of my groomer.  No more itching and their coats are beautiful!!!  The shampoo has a very light, pleasant scent. I have recommended this product to several of my dog owner friends and they have been just as pleased with it.

My Whippet/Aussie mix likes this bed only when I put her Pet Dreams Plush cushion on it, as she needs padding to be comfortable.  She looks pure Whippet except for the Aussie merle coloring - her body frame just needs more cushioning.  I thought the elevated bed would be nice and cool in the summer, but that doesn't matter to her.  This bed would be great for dogs that have more body padding and enjoy sleeping on a cool surface.  Depending on your dog, it can be a great bed.
I bought this to prevent the water from freezing for the feral cat who adopted us. We had a cold snap in the late fall, and temps went into the teens, but the water was not frozen. YEAH!!!!!

These Enzymatic chews continue to come way too small in size.... These are for large dogs... only a small per centage of them are actually the right size... the others are too small which is as CET says... risky to give to large dogs.. my cats would not touch this can food. must be something in the product. i have nothing more to say.
full size. very absorbent.  Not disappointed with this product.  I would not hesistate to purchase this product again when need to reoder
My cat absolutely loves this.  She really does not use the scratch pad, but the toy part is a big success.  She plays with it for a long time, and sneaks up on it when passing by.

I am unaware if it fits the door space of the smaller cages, but the nest box isn't large enough to attach to theVision Bird Cage Model L02 - Largewithout leaving a significant gap over the top. Even if it does fit the door space on your particular model, it's a horrible constriction of cage use because you will have to remove it every time you need to gain access to the inside of the cage to handle the animals or change food and water, which will disturb the birds and anything inside the nest box. The Vision cage, unlike almost every bird cage, comes with no breeding doors to allow placement of a nest box on the exterior of the cage, which is essentially an industry standard even in cages designed for companion birds.This is too large to fit inside a cage as it needs to be placed in a top corner for most species (excluding budgerigars), which uses valuable real estate, and makes access to the nest box difficult. I had to cut several bars on the left side of the cage in order to give access to the entrance hole of the nest box which I placed on the outside. This is something no consumer should have to do and it is a grievance because it causes permanent damage.For the nest box itself, I find the plastic material to be preferable to wood because it discourages chewing and it is much more sanitary in addition to being easier to clean than traditional wooden nest boxes. It's relatively easy to get together the first time. I don't like that it isn't completely "airtight" except for the entrance hole because it allows light to intrude and could be a risk for even the slightest drafts to chicks (which are dangerous in a bird room anyway). Regarding the green door that slides up for observation, the lip around the bottom connecting part is not high enough to contain a good amount of nesting material inside, which is yet another design flaw considering how close the round nest bowl is placed to this observation door. The box is apparently designed with the slick plastic trays so nesting material doesn't need to be used, but if something like shavings is not used a breeder risks producing chicks with splayed legs.In short, the use of plastic in this is a very good thing, but the way it comes together in the end with both nest box concept flaws and a complete miss as for use with the Vsion cage, it is not a good investment and I will not recommend the product or purchase another. It may perhaps be good with cages that are quite large or even in an aviary, but for use with a Vision cage it is a failure.

I buy chews to keep in the cage and spread through the house. Every now and then I'll see him nibble at a puzzle crisp but he doesn't want anything to do with the apple wood chews. Thankfully these were not that expensive. I may order the puzzle crisps if they are sold by themselves otherwise I'll be looking into other chews from now on.
My kitty actually likes the taste and licks it off the brush! This is great since brushing your cat's teeth is important in order to help prevent tooth decay.

Life has changed in our household because of this product. Give it a chance to work. On one cat, it worked within a week. On another cat it took a few weeks to start calming him down. It works on scaredy cats, tough/angry cats and alpha male cats. I have 8 and all have very different personalities. I am currently using them on 3 of my cats and our house is amazingly different! It's worth the money. And for those of you who state it smells funny, that's the whole point. Excellent price on-line versus in the stores - 65% cheaper for same product!

I have a 7 pound yorkie who's always used pads to go to the bathroom. These are the worst ones I've ever used. Not worth the cheap price! Any liquid quickly spreads out on the entire pad and if it's near the edge, it can spill over onto your floor. I usually only have to change my pads twice a week but I feel like I'm changing these every few days! Will not be buying again.

After reading some reviews that their dogs didn't like them, I was a bit worried as my dogs can be picky at times.  But no worries here, my dachsund and sharpei mix gobbled these right up!  My big mix practically woofed it down to the point I'm not sure he chewed much so I'm not sure he got the full effect, but my little guy enjoyed it, so I'm glad they like these treats and they're good for them, so thats what matters to me!  I am always looking for new ways to get some healthy into my boys as I'm sure most dog owners are so when I seen these I thought they were worth the try, and the boys like them so I'm recommending them!

This is a terrific product for my skin sensitive dog and my cat too.  My dog doesn't really like his food when I put salmon oil in it, so these gel caps are a great alternative.  The gel caps are shaped like little fish.  If I want to feed my dog the entire gel cap, I hide a couple of them in his food and he eats them up like he would eat his normal food, especially in wet food.  Sometimes he'll spit it out if I put them in his dry food, so I wrap the little fish gels in a slice of roast beef and he swallows them right down.  If I want to sprinkle the fish oil in my cat's food, all I have to do is twist the tail off the little fish gel cap and squeeze into the cat's food and he eats his food up enthusiastically.  The fish caps seem to be doing wonders for both animals.  A great product by a company (Animal Essentials) that I'm really becoming a fan of.  A great idea that works.

Tommy the Cat does not want to eat them. So I have to camouflage it with other treats so that he does begrudgingly eat it.I am not sure if the Daily Best are doing anything, but they sure do smell powerful! Yes it has a powerfully strong icky smell for such tiny bits. This is powerful for my nose, now imagine a cat's sensitive nose??I bought a few of these bags with high hopes based on the reviews and the dissatisfaction and regret happens to us all at one time or the other doesn't it?It just goes to show how individual and unique each cat is!So, now I am just slowly going through the bags (not daily because Tommy the Cat will catch on and decide not to eat anything that seems to be camoflaged in goodies).Sadly I am not likely to purchase these again and they were not cheap.

I bought this for my 75lb lab, and ended up returning it because it was so heavy. It really is for the largest dogs out there, my poor guy didn't want to drag it around with him. It seemed very durable and like it wouldn't break, but it was way too heavy.

This is the second time I have bought this same harness (not because it wore out but because my dog lost weight).  My dog has very sensitive skin and other ones would rub him raw around his chest and armpit area where his hair is a lot shorter.  This one with the fleece lining works great for him.  And the color is nice.  I would say it is a little closer to a bright orange coral color than true orange.

We got this for our two guinea pigs to give them more room than the cage we already had. We have had this for about a month and love it. They seemed unsure about the ramp but I put one guinea pig on one side and the other on the other side. When one of them came across to find his friend he realized how much fun it was going over the ramp and kept running back and forth over it. Now they run all over the cage and love all the room they have.For the most part they only pee in the room with the bedding but occasionally they do pee in the corner of the other room but not often. Overall I am very happy with my purchase and so are my cavies! By the way the plus has the ramp cover, divider wall and the top along with the cage and bottom.

Adams Flea and Tick Spot On for large dogs has work well for us since we switched from the vet's repellant of choice: Frontline.We have 3 dogs, all in the 50-80 lbs. range.  As you can imagine, price is a factor for anything that we buy for our dogs.  However, we never wanted to change from our high-priced repellant because it worked and we knew, from experience, what it's like to live in a house with fleas!!Since we switched to Adams (about 4 months), there have been no flea sightings and the few ticks that we found on the dogs were dead.We're saving about 40% on the cost plus the convenience of having it shipped to our home is a big plus.Great product and great value.

These are thick, high-quality bully sticks - not the cheap, thin ones you find elsewhere. Those familiar with the product know they do have a bit of a smell. We stick with bully sticks for my two pugs because they last through three evenings of serious chewing before they get down to 2" nubs that I throw away to prevent choking. The company, Best Bully Sticks, is excellent to work with and prompt.

my dog just loves.  Thought I'd try this bacon flavor.  Gosh surprise surprise she loves them.  I now have tried all the flavors of Pet Botanics training rewards and have gotten doggie approval on all.I particularly like the size since I don't want anything huge in my pocket while walking but need to carry a bunch for training purposes.  These are perfect for that.I don't think you can go wrong with this product.

This toy is very dangerous for kittens. My kitten was playing with this and was having fun, then a few minutes later I heard the kitten crying and howling in a panic. My husband and I ran to see what was going on. The kitten had her arm stuck in the toy, she had reached her arm all the way in to get the ball and could not get her arm out because it was pass her elbow, and the bend in her elbow couldn't get back out, she was stuck and in great pain.We could not get her arm out because the top part was already locked into place (something you do when you build it) so we could not slide it off, and meanwhile the kitten is crying in pain and now we are starting to panic, so my husband pulled the plastic top and just cracked the whole piece off to get her arm free. She limped around a little, but she is thankfully okay, no permanent damage. This was a really scary and upsetting for all of us.Maybe this would be okay for adult cats since they can't fit their whole arm in, but I'm never going to take that chance and use this toy again, I'm sending it back.

My little Pug Dog is in training as my service dog. I get around OK but often can't bend by the end of the day and some days I can barely get off of the sofa so her jobs are to pick things up for me or to collect and bring things to me. Kevin works hard and she plays hard. She has an acrylic addiction so her trainer said to "keep her in new toys as much as possible" and that she'd probably go though "a lot of them". So far the Kong Brand has held up best for us and this one came with spare squeakers too!

got this to treat my dogs' pads from this really bad winter we are having. I don't know if it made their feet more slippery on the hard wood though. didn't really make a mess. I got this for conditioning of their feet from being outdoors. I have three cats, they all love catnip. This catnip mist spray did nothing for them. They were interested in the spray as I was putting it on something but after the item dried they showed little or no interest. They like the dried catnip much better. This didn't work for my house.

my 55-gallon community tank is not planted, but not for lack of trying (insufficient led lighting). so i didn't buy this product to keep fighting that losing battle. the reason i picked this up is because the tank has been infested with hard-to-kill black beard algae. at first i tried a couple different types of algae eater fish to clean it up. they cleaned the tank up quite nicely, but they didn't touch the black stuff. then i started reading help forums, and it was mentioned that seachem flourish excel can reduce and even eliminate the dreaded black beard.i went to the local petsmart, and they wanted $18 for a bottle of this stuff. i thought, surely i can get it cheaper on amazon. so i checked it on my amazon mobile app, and it was $9.24 - almost half the price. i placed the order through amazon and had it two days later via prime.i have been adding it to my tank at about half the recommended dosage on the bottle, every other day. i figured if it didn't start to produce results i could up the dosage after a couple weeks. but within 5 days, the algae was starting to disappear! it's been about 3 weeks now, and almost all the black beard algae is gone. the fish also seem completely unaffected by this new chemical in their environment.will the seachem assist in plant growth? i would imagine so. but with the added benefit of controlling some nasty types of algae, this product is definitely worth keeping on hand from now on. maybe i can even give some new plants a shot...
This tubing is easy to work with, and I really like the color and the flexibility of the tubing. Word.

My cats loveDa Bird Cat Toy - Easy Store - 2 Part Pole, but there was an incident where one of my cats got the string wrapped around her leg.  She flew all over the house in a panic until she could finally be untangled.  They absolutely love Da Bird, so I wanted to get something similar that would be less likely to cause a repeat episode.  Unfortunately, they just aren't as enthralled by the Cat Dancer as they are with Da Bird.  I assume that it may have something to do with the way the feather on Da Bird bounces around like prey. For ten years, we used Nature's Miracle and a similar liquid product from Drs. Foster & Smith. Both worked well, but both were fairly expensive. Then I found Odormute. Same benefit, just much cheaper and more flexible.Here's how to use it with carpets in a house with dogs:IF YOU HAVE A CARPET CLEANING MACHINE:We have aHoover SteamVac, highly recommended if you have dogs and carpets! For a few years, I pretreated stains with Natures Miracle in a garden sprayer, then cleaned using regular or pet carpet detergent. This worked well, in that the carpets were clean and odor free the next day. Now I mix up six tablespoons of Odormute to a gallon of water for pretreatment (at 10% the cost of Natures Miracle), plus a teaspoon of Odormute in mixed with regular carpet detergent. This formula works well. Another hint: Use boiling water in the carpet cleaner.If your carpets are soaked with urine, use my pretreatment formula instead of detergent in the carpet cleaner. After deodorizing, clean the carpets again with detergent to remove stains. Yes, this is two cycles, but it works.NO CARPET CLEANER:Mix a teaspoon of Odormute in a cup of hot water. Spray this on the carpet area to be treated and rub in well. If the spot is still wet 30 minutes later, blot it up.The concentration I recommend is stronger than the instructions give, but according to the instructions, using a higher concentration just speeds the reaction without adverse effects.Five stars for a superior product that costs less than the competition. Well done!

This is our young Maine Coon's favorite food. Okay, she likes snacks, and eats odd things like potato chips and green onion stalks. But when it comes to her primary diet, Hill's Ideal Balance Hairball Natural Chicken & Oats Recipe is her absolute favorite. For some reason, we've nicknamed them &#34,Peeblers&#34,. Believe it or not, she likes it more than canned food. I can't be more happy that we found a healthy food she enjoys, that helps keep the inevitable hairballs to a minimum. I know that this intended for adult cats, but don't tell her that!We have two older cats that like it, but not as much as she does. They'd rather have soft canned food, but won't turn their noses up if it is in the bowl. So as dry food goes, it gets high marks. The bag with a velcro closure is a nice touch as well. I just wish it wasn't quite so pricy.~ Kort

As you probably know, since you are looking at this product, squeakers die in pet toys.  Prematurely probably, but the stuffing coming out is usually a concurrent event.  So getting these made me think life would be grand for the pet again. Wrong. There is nothing wrong with these squeakers, but what you are putting them in is mostly likely on it's way to the island of zombie rag toys (trash).  So here is a quick suggestion and my puppy seems to love it.  Take a pair of short tube socks, put three squeakers in one, twist once, then stuff it in on itself.  If you have ever folded socks you are right up to speed so far.  Then take that sock and put it into the other, and tie off the leg.  The squeakers are now 3-4 layers deep into tube socks.  That's more protection than any pet toy I know of.  Now get out those 12 colored Sharpies and draw a funny face on the sock.  Puppies can squeak and not puncture the squeakers.  Dogs don't chew tube socks very easily and tube socks are cheap by the dozen.

I have Bulldogs.  I buy a lot of Kong toys. Too bad, because they really did love the multiple holds and nubbins - but the design is flawed for tough dogs - there is no way that much stitching is going to hold up.

Calming is a needed product for both you & your overly hypertensive pup only.For your fur pal, it's so easy to feel a flight & fleet response,if the pup doesn't feel safe, or some outside influence has him, or her literally freaking out, & acts they're fear out, by trying to comfort themselves, by excessive chewing, or other destructive behavior as they're humans can't understand it.Calming helps.But it's meant to calm the nervous system, not knock your poor pooch out.So please, take care when using Calming to comfort them.Suggestion: Use varying  portions at a time, I recommend no more then two little halves, of the small bones, for stress preventive doses.Given only, as occasional treats, two times a day, for real stress filled days, or only one half as needed.Your the one who should learn, when to give as much as required, to your pups needs.Again, sparing is the key with any preventive.You want a well adjusted pup, then give them lots of love, patients, treats, & plenty of chewing toys, to prevent destructive behaviors, make it fun for your pet. & he, & she, will learn over time, not to chew your things, or fear an ant crossing the street.Remember they are more acute to sounds, we can't fathom or hear, so take this to heart, before shouting at your pal, for making a toy out of your favorite pump, or worse.Sometimes redirection can even help. Like a new, sweat sock, tied with a knot, to assist with bitable grip, for a smaller dog. Tell your pal, this is your sock, let's have some fun!Your dog will love you for giving him, or her the love & attention. & the more they chew on things you make clear, are theirs they will want to leave your socks, & other stuff alone.When giving dental chews, tell your fur buddy, to chew them good, & concentrate on praising your fur pal more often, for completing a small task, you expected of them, so that they know they did good.Positivity, stay positive! That's key, less scolding, & just don't blame your pet for everything.You need to rationalize, how would you feel if you couldn't get through to anyone, what would you do, to tell your pup you wanted something, water, food, toy?Sounds silly? Maybe but not to your fur pal...Just give them love & don't forget to take personal time for them as well.Pup's need lot's of guidance & care. So just put yourself in their paws so to speak.& only Use Calming with a lot of thoughtful consideration for your fur pal, other wise you might end up with an unhealthy result. Always check instructions, & ask a Vet if this is the right comfort aid, your particular pets needs. & Good luck. -BB

Come my chinchilla's bath time, I cannot imagine it without using this superior product as most chin insiders will state.  It is very soft, very fine and chinchillas love it.And it is safe.  Many dusts sold for chinchillas are not.  They are scented (not natural for a chin) and simply made of outdoor sand.  The best chin dusts are made of ground pumice stone.This particular chin dust comes highly recommended by long-time chin owners like myself who have been caring for these delightful crepuscular rodents coming on 18 years now.  My chin, Danny Boy, loves it (see my Profile for a glimpse of him) and has a marvelous time rolling around in it.  Inside a good plastic chin bath house, it doesn't fly around everywhere, and it is easy to maintain and store.I cannot imagine using any other chinchilla dust.  In fact, it will never happen!

I was looking for a less expensive alternative to Wellness Core. After doing quite a bit of research, I decided to give Hi-Tek Naturals Grain Free a try. I liked that it's protein-focused, but at the same time not ridiculously high in protein like some foods can be. I liked that the food is sourced and made in the US. (The company answered my email in under 20 minutes when I asked them about it.) I also liked that it has probiotics, and I've been able to tell from past experience that my dogs really seem to do better with foods that have probiotics as opposed to those that don't. Far fewer loose stools and upset stomachs in general. But most of all, I'm pleased that my picky dog actually likes the food. The nuggets are quite small, about the size of peas, which is fine for us but something to keep in mind if your dog likes a bigger nugget.

As this is radial-shaped (i.e. round), you need a square shaped property for this to work well.  I had originally ordered this to use at the in-laws but when we got there we realized that their property is long and narrow so the dog would get shocked at the door.  However, we recently moved house and our new house in on a square lot and this wireless fence just fits in the boundaries.As with all training devices, there needs to be a period of training, association and correction.  So far, we don't have any sheds or other large obstacles or metal structures that would alter the performance of this fence.  Our dog learnt once and never got near the boundaries of the property.  We now use the collar without batteries and have had no problems as our dog does not go within 3 feet of the property line.This wireless fence has a choice of settings and we used the incremental increase setting which our dog turned-out not to need.  There is a more brutal setting which is a single large shock but we felt that our dog did not need that nor did we feel comfortable using that particular setting.Recommended only if you have a square lot, no metal structures and no large structures outside of your house that would alter/disrupt the signals.

Milk Bones have always been my dog's favorite hard treat and now they have additional ingredients which makes them even better for him then before. The best by far in sofa throws/covers. Don't buy the less expensive ones, it may be tempting but you'll regret it. The minute you open these deluxe covers you will see the difference in quality. I bought them for my 2 living room leather loveseats due to the fact that I have an 8 month old puppy in the house. I also have 3 cats and they occasionally want to sit on the sofas too! I've been using color coordinated throws that I've tucked in and around the cushions which worked pretty well except they didn't cover the arms of the sofas or the seat backs. For those people who felt the covers slid around on leather, that may be but for the heck of it I kept the existing tucked in throw in place and put the covers over them. I tucked in between the seat and back, the sides fell perfectly over the arms and I tucked them into place too. To keep the front looking good, I tucked what was left on the sides into the side of the seat cushion. They may need fixing after a person or a rambunctious puppy sits on it but in the long run I know the covers will protect more of the sofa than the throws I used. Very very happy, don't hesitate to buy these they are fantastic.

I bought a few teething toys, and I guess my maltipoo just doesn't like the ones that have ridges and such on them.  She likes the flat ones with not a lot of bumps on them and I think this one was softer plastic than the other ones. She chewed this one to death.  She's not an aggressive chewer so it lasted a few months, but I would definitely NOT recommend this to anyone that's got a big time chewer, because this won't last a day for you.Also - just a friendly reminder - watch your dog chewing on this - the plastic pieces do eventually fall off as they chew through the toy.  Mine clearly doesn't like them after she chews on them because I just find pieces after she chews on them, but I know some dogs love just swallowing it.

I know its responsible to get your dog neutered but I have to think it was particularly tough on my little man. Changing his vet supplied cone with this soft oneComfy Cone Pet E-Collar, Xlarge, Blackhelped a lot but between the cone and the surgery he seemed fairly bummed. When I saw these were available I got them knowing that a good treat always cheers him up and that he would get something special during his recovery. I'm not giving these treats credit for him recovering physically but they did help his mood during a very difficult time.Now onto the treats. I don't want to sound gross but these might be the first dog treats I've used that smell like real food. They make me think of a very thin and very dry chicken tender from McDonalds. They aren't fried but they  look it. There's no comparison with other chicken jerky type treats I've had as far as look and smell. Plus they are Made In The USA which I require for all treats now.Overall these are great treats. I went through the tub in the time it took for him to recover but as a once a day treat they would last a while. I will end up getting more of these at some point after he eats his way through all he other treats I already have!

This little beaver is really more on a par size-wise with the kong &#34,extra small&#34, dog toys than their &#34,small&#34, toys. The body of the toy is only a couple inches long plus an additional couple inches for the unstuffed tail. It's great for small breeds, like shih tzus but I would hesitate to give this little thing to bigger dogs as I would be afraid they could shallow it. Just like with other Kong toys, the back is sealed with Velcro to replace the squeaker if need be and an extra squeaker is included. All in all it's a good toy and my dog does play with it (although it's definitely not on her short list of favorites) but be prepared that this is a tiny tiny toy.Just a note - the pictures show two different toys. I received the one with the dark, flat tail not the one with the fluffy lighter tail. I can't imagine that matters to anyone all that much but I just wanted to let you know which one I received.

I bought my own diffuser set a few weeks ago and I love it!  I bought this set for my sister who has two cats that don't exactly get along well.  The female cat will hiss and growl at the male cat and if they are in the same room.  My sister has had the cats for a couple of years and she has tried numerous things to see if they could get along better, but that hasn't happened.I bought her the Feliway to see if the tension between the cats would ease and after a couple of days of being plugged in, there is harmony in the household again!  The cats no longer hiss at one another and can be in the same room without any tension.  In fact, one cat will be on my sister's lap and the other on my brother in law's lap and they are all sitting on the same couch!Feliway is absolutely amazing and really works.
The catnip drives the kitties crazier than usual.  Put on your leather gloves and try and get it away from them.

From the moment that my cats saw a running faucet and probably thought &#34,what is this mysterious clear, odorless, running liquid&#34, and couldn't get enough of it, I knew that I had to get a drinking water fountain. I originally bought one of those plastic water fountains and noticed that it constantly got dirty, was hard to clean, the pump/motor would get clogged or die. After going through a few of those, I decided to get a better replacement. Upon searching I noticed that cat owners were describing UTIs and chin rashes on their cats when using the plastic ones. This is when I decided to go for a metal one. While there are quite a few out there and I tried two of them, this one by Pioneer Pet is by far the best one that I found to satisfy both my cats needs, and health as well as my maintainence of the unit itself. The other one was just too big, and noisy.Speaking of big, I bought the 96 oz metal version as oppose to the regular 60 oz smaller one since I have 3 cats (one being a kitten). Eventually all three cats will be together and felt a bigger basin for water would be best.The unit arrived very well packaged, and the instructions were simple. Although it is the 96 oz version, it really did not look that big (compared to the Drinkwell and all the other plastic ones before it).It is not all metal though. The pump and filter housing is made of plastic but is basically underneath the top metal lid so it doesn't contact the cats drinking from the fountain.Cleaning the unit couldn't be easier. There are 6 pieces (top and bottom metal basin and cover), top and bottom plastic container that holds the pump and filter. The plastic pump container snaps apart easily and the tiny pump can be easily dismantled to cleaning. There is a youtube video showcasing how to take it apart to clean, just google &#34,Pioneer Pet Raindrop Fountain Pump Maintenance 101&#34,.The filter can be easily replaced by buying another one or splitting it apart and buying similar charcoal. So far since getting this last month, I've cleaned the pump about every 4 days for the first 2 weeks and weekly thereafter.Again, can't stress this enough, the pump is easy to clean. It is also not that loud, sort of a hum. It doesn't bother me since I need sound to sleep anyway (air conditioner in the summer) and this motor puts me to sleep too. lolThe cord is hidden and set in a way that the cats won't think its a play string. It is also long enough to reach a power outlet.The water that comes out of the top is more like a small bubbly at the highest setting and comes out in such a way that it doesn't spill anywhere.The motor will stop working if there isn't enough water in the basin. It looks like I refill (or add water) to the basin almost every day or every other day but that could be because I have 2 cats using it.I pretreated the unit by first placing the filter under running water for a few minutes. then placing the filter in a bowl for an hour. Then putting th unit together and let it run for an hour, replace teh water, and do this about three times before actually letting the cats start drinking from it.The cats were used to the older plastic one and the male cat took a bit longer (about an hour) to get to it, the female cat immediately took to it. male cat loves the pond like basin, the female likes the fountain bubbly part (now watch the kitten like the river portion of it).I'm truly satisfied with it and my cats drink more water too.
Fits well, rugged construction, good materials. Coming up on 2 years and going strong - that's saying something for a critter vest. Absolutely recommended, well worth the asking price

Bought this to test the water in my marine aquarium. It's way off! Said the specific gravity was 1.022 when it was actually a extreme low 1.015. Lucky for me it's a new set up and no fish yet or else I'd be out a lot more money for sure. And yes I rinsed very well before and after use.

This is the BEST cat litter I have ever used!  There is no waste, no smell and NO DUST!!  Which means no more tracking and messes to clean up after the cats leave the box.  I can not believe the waste that came with the other leading brands that I have used in the past.  A MUST TRY!!  After you do once you will never go back to any other cat litter!!

I have a doxie who needs to lose a little weight...this is a good quality dog food that is lower in calories.Her vet said no grains...this is grain free.  She gobbles this food down so I will give it 5 stars!

This item seems like a great idea...a convenient, and non-messy way to carry treats for the dog.  It is like a roll-on deodorant container...a bottle of fluid with a rolling ball top that brings the fluid up to the top of the ball as it is spun.  It has a rich, bacon smell smell to it and my little dog (7 lb. Maltese) was interested in it, but I couldn't get him to lick it beyond the first tentative taste.  I think that it was the novel delivery that threw him off, not the taste.  I believe that with a larger dog, where one tongue swipe would clear off and refresh the ball, it might be better received.I'm back after trying this with a larger dog with no success.  He just wanted to take the whole thing in his mouth.This seems like a good idea and it might work if you started using it with a puppy as a training device.  Perhaps you could "train" older dogs to use it properly, but it is certainly NOT worth the effort to do that.
I thought this will be useful to keep the tooth of my cats in good shape, but just 1 of 10 cats like to chew them, the rest don't care about this product. (I have a shelter of cats)

She wont even eat her fancy feast anymore, now its Natural Balance and Wellness! Before she couldnt go a day without her fancy feast, now she turns her nose up at it. Spoiled brat!!!Above is my old review, below is my new review.I am currently feeding my cat natural balance and another brand. my cat can be picky, she rejected one flavor from the other brand, she would spend hours crying to not eat it.this one she liked, in the beginning. BUT these past few weeks, she just does not want to eat this flavor, out of all her flavors it is the only one she whines about. she will cry and cry until i change it. i give her from her other options and she is fine, this is the only one she rejects.i gave three stars, as my cat likes other flavors from this brand.
I'm sure the dog would prefer I just never give her a bath but this stuff works great. She smelled clean and it looks like it will last quite a few baths, which is nice.

I thought it looked ok, with big chunks of real fish... but for some reason, the kitties both hated it, despite their love for fish. I managed to not let it go to waste by mixing 1/4 can into each of their bowls of other canned food. Maybe they just don't like sardines? Nothing wrong with it, cats just didn't like this flavor. :-)

We bought this because our little kitty broke her hind leg and needed a protected area while healing. We have a large plastic kennel but as she healed wanted a place that she could move and exercise to build her strength back up. This was perfect. When she was not in the plastic kennel for the night she could be under our watchful eye in the living room in the Soft Side Play Yard. As it seems the only negative I have seen is regarding the bottom panel being held in place by velcro tabs, never once did she try to escape by pulling up the floor.Soon after the female kitty was well enough to be independent again, her male brother was neutered and again we needed a place of calm, peace and seclusion for him. Once again the Soft Side Play Yard came in handy.It is nice to know that when we don't need an enclosure, it folds and fits into a very small carry case (about the size of a laptop computer).This is a very well made product, with very high quality construction, and worth the price. The "small" size I purchased fits nicely under my desk so kitties can have company during the day, and in other places like the bedroom for comfort at night.

The dead mouse in the walls test. That's what I bought it for and it works. I know it does because I put it where the smell was the strongest and came back later and the smell was gone, but when I moved the Odor Genie away from that spot the odor came back. I'm going to buy a few more.
My dog is a heavy chewer and usually starts destroying rope toys in minutes, but this one seems to be holding up pretty well.
It is not to heavy, they both can fit in it for now and I love the side pocket. I also like the easy carrying, a good buy

Finally a wet food that my cat is willing to eat when he feels like it.  No fault of the product.  My little guy just likes crunch.  He will always lick the broth of all the Tikis but he'll only eat the solids of this one.  I do have a bit more success mixing in a little of his dry Instinct Duck although he has been known to pick out the dry bits.  The things our cats have trained us to put up with, I swear.

Taught my black barking pug to stop barking and scares the crap out of her and all the other animals. I don't even have to spray it anymore. Just show it to them and they all dash :) Worth every penny!

My dogs love this octopus toy!  I bought one for each of them.  It's pretty durable and the little dogs love all the legs.  This is literally fun for them for hours, and my Brandy even sleeps with hers!  I would recommend this toy for medium to smaller dogs.

I have no idea what goes into these things, but to my dogs they act as if it is heroin. They live for these things.I have a small dog, and a medium sized dog, and feed them both these teenies.For the small dog, that works - but for the medium dog, I think he really should have larger ones.When he was getting larger ones, they actually made his breath less horrendous, but these little ones seem to do nothing for his breath - but he still loves them.

I have this in medical ear irrigation unit mixed with warm sterile water to clean my dogs' ears. Work very, very well.Be careful to use ONLY with sterile or distilled water. Tap water will introduce particulate matter and bacteria that you do not want in your or your pets' ears.

Don't ask me why but this product does a better job at mellowing out my cats then the feliway pheromones. Even though they are both by comfort zone the feliway product actually makes me cats more grouchy. The comfort zone product is much better and my cats have a much more preferred reaction to it.
It is so cute that I'm sure little Jasper will love it.  Bright color and seems very well made.  It's in his stocking now for Christmas surprise.
Dachshund puppy is not interested in this toy. It smells like rubber and no matter what I stuff it with or rub it in, it still smells like rubber.

This is my dog's favorite treat.  He doesn't care for the Dingo bones.  Dingo balls are hard to find in Hawaii, well, at the stores that I go to, so, it's great that I can get them through Amazon.com.  Delivery is very fast!
Two of the three cats really love it.  The dog chases them in there.  Apparently its a lot of fun.

It's OKAY - love the idea behind the toy, but it's a little akward to put together for me, and easy to take apart my my cockatoo.It's work outs fine with my larger conure - but she's not too interested in it.

I use this product as one of my dogs has a food allergy and only eats venison.  It's great that there are natural products available to give as a treat instead of dog treats loaded with artificial junk.

I read the great reviews and had to see for myself.  I used this on my lab pit who always runs when I brush him.  Well I started brushing him and as usually he quickly walked away, but wait, he looked back at me and came back to be brushed again.  Then he left and came back over and over.  It removes hair and he sheds less too!
My 6 month old cat refuses to eat any of these. I don't know if it's the taste, or the texture. All the cans are just mush with no chunks or anything at all, and my cat doesn't seem to like that.

I am happy with the ingredients of this product, manufactured in USA (don't get me started on what other brands that are made in US are actually made of though)The cats like it - apparently tastes good and they like the small kibble.Happy cats = happy mamma

We have two rescued pit mixes who are a a year old and a 15 week old APBT. They have made short work destroying two remotes, countless cardboard boxes, dozens of squeaky toys and nylabones and any stray paper, pens, etc. they can sink their teeth into.  We went in search of the truly takes-forever-to-gnaw-away- chew toy and discovered antlers. Previously, we bought from a local pet supply store, but on a whim, we ordered two gigantic antlers. They cost twice as much, but I kid you not they are at least 4 times the size of what we were buying. One is close to the size of our 15 week old puppy! I don't think we will be buying locally anymore!

Let's face it--picking up after the dog is not fun.  It's even less fun with a cheap plastic rake, or using the old hand-in-the-plastic-bag trick.  I have been looking everywhere for a wire rake pooper scooper.  I had purchased something similar years ago, and it is just now starting to show its age, so time to be replaced.  This one is even better than the one I had:  it appears to be sturdier, with heavier gauge tines, and the metal is coated so it won't rust.  I also like the plastic cover on the metal handle.  I find it works best if you hold it so that the tines are pointing towards you.  No mess, and you don't have to get anywhere near the smelly dog bombs!
Not sure who likes it more, the dog or the kids.  Holding up over a week and for this dog that is good sign.  No marks on it yet and he sure has tried.

I ordered the large size for two dwarf bunnies I was picking up from a shelter. I didn't know that bonded bunnies should travel together and unfortunately, two dwarfs would not fit in there comfortably and still have room to move. However, it's a perfect size for one dwarf. For reference, my bunnies are 2 and 3 lbs.Hope they create larger carriers that are just as cute. I don't like the big hefty dog carriers, this carrier will not cut you like those carriers and is much easier to handle.
I love that it's grain free, and we have never experienced skin or stomach issues with our cat since switching to Halo Grain-Free Hearty Chicken.

My dog is a 9 months old 60 pound boxer and he is a big chewer. We give him antlers, buffalo horns and stuff and they last him about a week to 10 days. Thought I will try this based on the numerous good reviews it has. My dog never liked it. He chewed it for like 10 mins and just rejected it and never tried it again. The problem I think in our case is, this bone is a big piece of plastic and does not ooze out any juice upon chewing. So if your dog is used to chewing traditional bones, do not buy this product. Bottom line is buy this product in the pet store for the first time where return is always hassle free if you dog doesn't like it. Buying online and return is a pain now. Now all I have is an expensive piece of plastic laying in my backyard.

Our dogs really liked these at first.  It does keep them occupied, but as opposed to other &#34,puzzle&#34, or &#34,busy&#34, bones, this one is pretty easy to master and I think they got bored with it.  High quality material and they love eating the discs (rawhide)

This  Omega Paw  self cleaning litter box  is NOT sturdy!  The parts that snap together do NOT fit, and  if they fit  would be very easily to break off.  and  to operate the box, you have to turn it...  and it just is NOT a good product!

I've been through many kitty water fountains (I've had 4 indoor cats for 8 years now). Every last one has always gotten clogged with hair, motor burns out, or some other issue. I know it's bound to happen (I mean, come on, these fountains work 24/7), but so far this is the longest I've ever had a fountain last! I love that the cats enjoy drinking out of it, it's a pretty low maintenance fountain (easy to clean, easy to change filters on), and the filters aren't a million dollars. Additionally, the filters don't need to be changed as often as my previous fountains' did.

I've had this filter for a month and it does an amazing job! I have a 5-gallon tank with an African Dwarf frog and a mystery snail in it. The filter is being used with the spray bar fitted just above water level, I have positioned it so that the waterfall makes absolutely no noise and you can often see Slowly, our snail, climbing right under the water to twist and turn in it as if he is taking a shower. The filter itself is well made, the only comment I would have is that its casing is no longer made transparent, it is now black. The water is clear and all the readings from it make me happy. I do a partial water change once every two weeks and that seems to keep everyone alive and well.Cannot say enough good things about the filter's sleek design as well. My tank is square and it fits nicely into a corner. Sometimes my frog will climb up to the surface and hang on to it while it sleeps, but it has never gotten stuck and the filter is built in such a way that I don't even worry about it.

Briley cannot get enough of her " Banana Chicken " ( name reversed in my household merely for amusement ) - Briley is conspiring new ways to get another treat out of that bag of pure nirvana. She is somewhat of a picky eater but she would devour all of the contents at once if we let her. I would not eat this myself but to be honest, it SMELLS like a snack food that humans COULD eat. You cannot say THAT about every dog treat on the market! Healthy, Affordable and an A+ from Briley Victoria who certainly gives the Vitalife Chicken and Banana Recipe Wraps a 2 PAWS UP!

I thought these were going to be a gimmick but they work really well. We tried all the home based wraps such as peanut butter and hotdogs on our Beagle but she almost always found the hard pill and spit it out. I had taken to putting the pill at the back of her mouth and holding her chin up for pilling. Then my wife decided to try this and sure enough it worked like a champ every time.

Had high hopes that this comb's blades were sharp. Not. At. All. It had the sticking quality reminiscent of a tin can lid being dragged through my dog's hair. Definitely not sharp enough to cut without discomfort. My dog doesn't even have heavy matts and this comb couldn't slide through her hair. Soooooooo dissappointed.

I use catnip to coat the scratching post for my indoor cats.  I feed two strays on my front porch.  I used the catnip to train them to go into a dog house that I put out there for winter that was loaded with blankets and sweaters.  I sprinkled it on a path leading to the dog house and also on top of the blankets.

If you have a cat that likes to dig and get litter everywhere, this may really help!It really  is great for keeping the litter inside. However, a few of my cats wont go in it with the cover on ( could be because they are a little chubby and it's too cramped for them...?) otherwise, it's a good size and it's also helped keep my fox terrier from poking around in the litter!
Great deal, good quality, still using months (and months) later. I would definitely recommend buying online in bulk instead of the expensive in store purchases.
It's the best food my cat has loved for a long time, there's nothing left after I put it down and she craves it, I've a very happy cat!
This is a very solid leash hook that was exactly what I needed. The black finish on the metal frame looks good too.
Good for the price but not a  real top quality lead.  A better quality nylon wood make this a 5 star.

My brother has a kitten that's all over his countertops. He uses several of these as a deterrent. Does the job... Only problem is kitty still goes up when they are not down. Hoping this gets better with time and age.
This is perfect for my parakeets.. I use them mainly when I go away for a week. I put a few up and they are fine. The're not tame so as long as they have food and water they are happy campers.

This carrier fit well for my three pound  puppy, she only whimpered a little bit, with the mesh windows I was able assure her that I was there.  There is a hole where the zipper meets the sides of the carrier, my puppy was able to squeeze her head through it.  I will hand stitch this area closed, that is the only reason I  rated it with four stars instead of five.The carrier has a zippered area the length of the carrier in the back, I can easily fit in a large wallet, keys, and misc. in which it makes it very handy carrier.  We went to five different stores and not one person noticed that there was a dog in it!  Very discreet carrier.

I have a large dog & a very furry cat that use a water fountain. My cat likes to play with the fountain more than drink & leaves all her fur in the fountain for the filters to trap.  Needless to say I got through filters quicker than I'd like. So when I came across these on amazon I was thrilled to find such a great price.  Trust me this is an amazing deal for a great product!

My active, adolescent cat loves this toy. However, its annoyingly loud (I think for both of us). I may have a broken one (it works fine, bu who knows whats inside), but the motion comes with lots of cranking, etc. However, you cant argue with an entertained cat.

This is a much better place for Harriet to play while I clean her condo.  She has a ball, but it gets caught under furniture and there have been times when I've lost her and it was hard to find her.  I love the mat, and the playpen is also where I give her the bath.  She runs around it and I know she's having a great time.

My Standard Poodle could only have tennis balls for brief periods and then I'd have to pick up the ball, because he would chew off pieces that I certainly did not want him to swallow. I saw that the company rated this ball a 5 out of 5 on toughness for chewing and bought one. He loved it, and it held up. So I bought him 4 more. So far no damage to any of them, and they have been greatly loved.I do have to keep hunting them up, because they wind up in the strangest places! But that's just because he so loves to play with them. Dogs can learn to chew things up that they haven't destroyed before, so I will be ever vigilant. But so far, I am thrilled with this toy.I also have a thing I do with tennis balls where I put a piece of braided nylon rope through it (involves a bent coat hanger and a utility knife), for a training toy. Looking at this ball, I see two holes and a hollow ball, meaning it is not too heavy for a dog to catch in his mouth, and I can put the rope through, tie knots to hold it, and voila!!!I really like this toy! THANK YOU, Planet Dog, for coming out with it!
Cat rating 3 or 4, my rating 5 for the quality.  I may try a different flavor next time.  They will eat this, but didn't love it.

The shampoo is very thin and watery,but the end results are great,and the scent is one of the best I have smelled,so all in all,i really like it! The price is great for such a large bottle and lasts a long time!

This may seem a bit expensive for a wooden stick that has an apple in the middle of it, but for the most part I thought it was good. It (the apple) lasted a good 1.5 - 2 weeks and it's true that it's healthy for rabbits, but the only bad thing is that my bunny (dwarf bun-bun ^^) didn't seem to want to chew on the stick itself after the apple was gone. There are maybe like...2 minute bite marks on it but hey, maybe it's just my bunny? :P I'm still keeping it in the stick but for 4 bucks, I personally think its worth a try :)

Nothing what so ever to complain abut with this order.The leash is a BRIGHT red and great quality nylon with a leather stopper.Super hand to just throw over chest while walking dogs and is very effective.
The little terrier gets all kinds of attention at the horse show and stays very comfortable in the chilly mornings. Washes up nicely.
The dog toy ball is as good as how Kong makes all their dog products and on Amazon, the price it so worth it

I have two dogs and one of them always has fishy breath and her teeth were horrible (she never lets me brush them). So I tired this and her plaque is breaking up and her breath isn't nearly as bad as it was. Both of the dogs still drink their water and don't seem to mind the taste.

As I waited for this to arrive, I was thinking about giving this a negative review.  I went out on day 11 and bought one locally thinking I would just return the amazon one, but I kept the amazon one for the following reasons.- The engraving on the amazon one fits a lot better.  It goes out further, and you can control the capitals so it's just a better engraving for a long address.-It's a lot easier to see.  The silver on black is very recognizable and it's a nice font, the one from the pet store was indented silver on silver which is fine, but not easy to see.-It looks sleek, (I really like the look with a black nose) and is very sturdy.  Of course the first thing I did when I got it was try to scratch the letters off and bend the name tag to see what type of punishment it could take.  I was pleasantly surprised, I expect this to last longer than I will need it.SummaryIn the end, I was frustrated that it took so long to get, but it's a much better product than I can get at the pet store and it's less than half the price.  Will purchase again, already recommended to a friend.

No matter how many times I washed my pup's bedding, she'd still pee on it. Someone then told me about this laundry boost product. It evens out the odors that we can't smell, but our dogs can. She hasn't had an accident since!
Cute toy.Not doing this any more as what can you say about a puppytoy.The stars should be enough!!

I ordered the black bone for my puppy and it looks perfect - exactly what I wanted! The laser engraving is very clear and easy to read and the shipping was incredibly fast. The being so low is just a bonus. I'm considering getting new tags for my cats now :)

I purchased these pet stairs to allow my 3-legged cat to get up on my bed.  The stairs are easy for him to use, plus, they were very easy to assemble, are made of decent materials, and are very sturdy.  I imagine that the screws may loosen up over time, but tightening them is very simple.  I would definitely recommend this product to anyone with cats or smaller dogs that are older or amputees.

I like this Bin. It holds alot of food, an okay amount of hay. Looks very durable,easy to refill, doesn't take up too much space, looks nice, will take some serious effort for my guinea pig to get droppings and bedding mixed in with his food and/or chew it apart.FEEL FREE TO SKIP THE NEXT FEW PARAGRAPHSSo recently my guinea pig, Kasper, has been tipping over his food bowl several times a day. My solution, push the bowl into bedding to keep it secure. It didnt tip over but Kasper walked all over his food, and tracked bedding in it.Another on going problem is that he would contantly tip over his other bowl for hay and he would run around and kick it out of his cage. There my pup would find it on the floor and attempt to eat it but he would start gaging instead.I tried using a wooden feeder on the inside of the cage.Super Pet Natural Large Hay MangerIt didn't work, he had trouble getting the hay out and basically ate the wood instead. Tried a plastic feeder on the outside of the cageLixit SLX0169 Hayrack...75% of hay would fall on the ground, 20% would be pulled out by Kasper and fall on the bedding... leaving a small percentage to eat. I tried the rolling ball thingSuper Pet Rabbit Rollin' The Hay Holder, the lock wouldn't close, and broke in a week.
Our puppy chewed right through the tabs on the sides of the bowls in less than a month.  Maybe ok for an older dog, but not a chewer.
MY CATS GO WILD FOR THIS!!! THE CHICKEN AND GRAVY IS SO GOOD I'VE ALMOST BEEN TEMPTED TO TASTE IT..

This is an excellent pet carrier. I can carry more than one cat in it to the vet and receive a multiple pet discount. The top doesn't leak, so I remove the gates and use it to feed outdoor cats. This is a safe method to prevent any TomCat fights and helps feed stray and feral cats.

first I bought the brown version of these mats and was quickly amazed as to just how much water and debris they pick up.  Then I noticed that my dog kept lying on the mat and using it as a bed so I purchased a 2nd one to use as her &#34,travel Bed&#34,  Now whenever we are away from home I have a nice soft place for her to lie as well as collecting any dirt.
Glows in the dark, reflective and good quality. Gave it 4 stars because my cat's long hair covers most of the collar. Wished the collar could be more thicker.

I use this for a bath for new additions to the tank. They get a five minute bath, then acclimate. The bottle I received a bottle well packed and sealed with tape. I received it quickly as well. The bottle was fresh and with a long expiration date. It came in the new packaging. A few drops in the bag, and bye bye nasty. Great for highlighting Ick on a fish that it is hard to see.

The product did not work at all.  Seizures persisted and did not even lessen.  I went through half the bottle and then went to the vet.  She needed more water under her skin injected more often, to dilute and wash out her wastes, toxins (kidney failure).  She's almost 22 now. She also needed FortiFlora to destroy the bad bacteria in her colon.  That worked like magic.  No more smell.  We brought her back from her deathbed literally.  I give her 200 ml of water every other day and it was my husband who bought FortiFlora for her.  EaseSure might work for other problems, but not for my cat's kidney failure and toxic colon.  I believe the reason for the kidney failure was too much bad bacteria and it destroyed her kidneys.  Wish I knew earlier.  Her breath smelled for two or three years and the vet didn't address the issue at all. Again, Chiropractors come out way ahead of MDs and Vets who cover up with drugs or cut it out - that's basically all they do, and the Chiropractors and Naturepaths get at the root of the problem and fix it.  I probably said too much.  But it is so true.  I'd rather fix her from the inside, introduce more good bacteria to eat the bad and get the water she needs to flush the toxins.  After months of seizures, each one taking more of a toll to the point of almost no return, she is seizure free with the water under her skin and FortiFlora on a regular basis.

Dog Loves these vitamins I got some other kind and he wouldn't eat them. These are like TREATS for him he looks forward to getting them and I think they help him feel a little better too (as he is a senior)Overall very happy with the price and they way the dog likes them
My dog got this and practically as I was pulling it out of the box she was very interested...but, as usual, it was an absolute waste of my time and money..without a doubt!
Not a bad one in the bunch well built I am very happy with the purchase I greatly recommend these.

I have 4 cats and sometimes they go when they should not.... I LOVE this stuff.  Great for fur ball upchucks - anything that can come out of them!!  I also have used it when I upset a plate of spaghetti on the new light grey carpet - worked FABULOUSLY!!

This dish is too deep for cats but what really annoyed me was the 45 minutes I spent trying to get the label off. I tried peeling it off, using soap and water, then Goo-gone, and then Goof-off. I scraped and rubbed and there is still a ton of adhesive stuck to the side of the frame. Now there's cat hair stuck to the adhesive. Lastly, when you lift the feeder up you have to make sure you hold it by the frame, otherwise the bowls pop out onto the floor. I threw it in the trash after about a week.

This is a great product, well made, good size, exactly as pictured. Purchased this for my boyfriends dachshund that is quite old and she loved it! She always chooses this bed over the others, so precious :)

Our Maine Coon loves the variety of balls that came with this bag and switches between almost all of them regularly.  They are a really great size too - smaller than some of the other balls we have purchased.  He loves that he can pick these up and carry them around in his mouth.His favorite is the mylar crinkle ball - one warning about those if they get in the water bowl (or wet at all) the dye will run everywhere and if they get in the water bowl he will no longer drink from it.  We make sure not to leave this ball out if we will be gone for a while.  This seems to be the case with all mylar crinkle balls we have tried so far.

I bought these with the hope that they would outlast what I can get at the local pet store. While the dog seemed to like the treat, she wore it to a nub in just a few hours. Elk antlers far outlasted this. To be fair, you really can't put a time to live on such an item. It looks like I will be heading back to the elk antlers to keep Fido occupied.

Not very exciting when they work.  Nasty when they don't.  So far have been through 6 rolls and have never had a single problem with the bag tearing and causing an issue.  Not crazy about the smell of the bag but it beats what the load would otherwise smell like.  Will definitely purchase more when this supply is gone.

Nothing special here, these are no sharper than my old clipper (9 year old clipper!) in a pinch they work but was hoping for something sharper to make the process a bit faster and easier on my doggies. They are for sure for large breed dogs.

A few months ago, I bought a Scoop-free automatic litter box to replace one of two regular litter boxes.  Initially, I used the litter cartridges that came with the box.  The litter smell in the house decreased immediately. Previously, when I used regular clumping litter, it left a noticeable litter odor in the house. So I purchased the re-useable "Forever Tray" and the "Just the Crystals" from Amazon to avoid the expense of buying new pre-filled cartridges.  I use the crystals both in the new Scoop-free automatic litter box and the regular litter box.  I add a little extra when I stir & scoop out the dehydrated feces once or twice a week.  I throw out the old litter once a month and hose out the boxes. The smell in the house is gone even after moving both litter boxes to another room near the living room. Keeping this litter in a dry place allows it to better absorb moisture from cat urine and feces.  I will buy a 2nd Scoop-free automatic box because my 3 cats use it. "Just the Crystals Premium Cat Litter" is a great choice for my 3 cats and me (and my nose).PROS:Grocery store scoop litter costs: $11.99 for box.  3 cats used box & 1/2 per month.  Cost $17.99Just the Crystals costs: $17.89Store scoop litter smelled even when scooped every other day.Just the Crystals took out the odor, even when used in regular litter box.Using litter from store meant more trips to various stores to buy cat litter.Delivery of Just the Crystals via Amazon lowers the amount of trips to grocery store.CONS:There is a bit of the larger crystals scattered, but using a microfiber dust mop easily clears floor.
This dog food was very good and full of real meat and other healthy ingredients. I recommend it and our dog loves it.

I have used this on everything from furniture to the fence in my backyard. My dog has been mouthy since a pup, and this spray has been well worth it for the household items it has saved from his destruction

Neither of my dogs are that picky of eaters though the older Chihuahua has hard time eating harder, bigger treats.  Thankfully, these are nice, small, and very chewable and a full bag that will last a while.  It is just a bonus that that are healthy with a hickory bacon smell that almost make my mouth water.
it states colors are assorted, I received a beige one , is a good litter box for the money, comparable at Wal-....  is $19 plus tax, would order again

We got our 2 cats (a senior female, and an adult female) this for Christmas this year, and it is the best toy we have ever gotten them. Our normally aloof senior cat can hardly leave it alone - she plays with it for 30-60 minutes several times a day. They both love the scratcher in the middle, but can't seem to get enough of batting the ball around the track. As a bonus, our two huge dogs don't chew this up like they do catnip toys, and it also keeps our senior cat busy so she doesn't terrorize the dogs - which used to be her main hobby, until we got this. So the dogs are pretty happy about it, too. The one tiny downside is that she loves it so much, we sometimes wake up in the middle of the night thinking "What is that NOISE?" - and it's just the cat toy.
My dogs love these and the pig skin is easier on their systems than the bleached rawhide. I would get these again - the price is really good.

I saw a noticeable improvement in dental health after giving my dogs this product for ~2 months. It will not make your dogs teeth perfect and sparkling clean, but it DID dramatically reduce the accumulation of tartar for all my dogs (and even made it easier to chip away build up). I still brush teeth and use tartar liquid in their water, plaqueOff isn't a substitute for brushing your dog's teeth, but it will definitely help keep them clean.

We recently got a Mini Aussie puppy and I was determined to not feed the Science Diet my pets had been eating for years now.  My vet had recommended the aforementioned kibble and I was horrified when I actually took the time to read the ingredients.  Shame on me for not looking at them before now, but I suppose it is better late than never. I started to research the best dog foods available and this one came up on several different lists.  I tried Wellness and neither my Pug or the puppy would touch it, this food however, has been a winner.  It provides a grain free, nutritious meal for my puppy and he loves it as well.

Our pup LOVES this Frisbee so much we bought him 2.  Murphy is a chewer too, and this toy has held up the longest of all of the toys we've purchased for him.  He will go through an average toy in about 2-4 weeks before completely mutilating it, I think he thinks it is a game...  He could spend hours outside retrieving this frisbee, and when we aren't playing fetch, he just chews and tugs on it for fun.  VERY durable.  LOVE this product!!

This chew toy is a good texture for my dog- not too hard so that I am afraid of him breaking his teeth but not so soft that he is chewing pieces off. My dog is a very strong chewer and he has not, as of yet, taken chunks out of this toy. I have not yet left him alone with it, though, as I have read other reviews which say strong chewers can take this toy apart. The main downside is this toy only moderately holds my dog's interest. He was pretty excited about it the day I got it, but since then his interest slowly declined and now he hardly looks at it.

I have this seat covering the back seat of my 2014 Mazda6, and I am definitely pleased with how it fits.  Obviously the manufacturer is trying to get the cover to fit as many vehicles as possible, so it's by no means a perfect fit.  However, I do believe that this cover is significantly better than any of the hammock style seat covers - especially for larger dogs.One of the consistent complaints I read about the cover was that it would shift when a larger dog would get into the car.  I found this to be the case as well, but usually I'm able to give it a quick tug and get it back into place after my dog gets in the car.  It's a 2-second adjustment, and not something that I mind at all.The major plus for me, and the reason I gave it five starts, is the access points to the seat belts.  I have a six-month old that rides in a rear-facing car seat, and thanks to the access flaps I can strap in the car seat base without having to remove the cover.  This allows me to keep the cover in place all the time.  More than likely I'll keep the seat cover in place as my child gets older, and it will serve double duty by protecting my seats from the dog and from the kiddo!

My 12 week old pup finally outgrew his travel crate and so I set this monster up.  I have to admit that it is HUGE!  I am surprised that it was so cheap compared to local pet stores and I bought it when it was on sale months ago through Amazon.  I think I bought the wrong size but I read so many reviews that this is the size to get.  I am sure my dog will never get that big. (He will be 65 lbs full grown) My pup is an indoor dog. He is outside in his covered 10 x 5 x 6 kennel when we are at work several days a week.  It doesn't get too cold here in Southern California but I guess if I had to leave him for a few hours in strange weather I could keep him in this.  I am only using it for his bedtime.  It is so big that there will be no way on this planet I will use it to travel.  It is too big and heavy for me to lift.  I may have to get a smaller airline carrier type of crate but I am not worried about that as I prefer to have one in the SUV and one to stay put in the house.  I keep it in the downstairs bedroom since it seems so massive to have in a living area to me.I set it up last night and it truly is a snap to set up for as bulky and big as it is.  I like the double doors.  I added a big towel in the smaller divided section and threw a quilt over the top to make it more like a den. My pup got in and fell right to sleep which was great.  My pup has never had an accident but even with the divider in the cage it is so tall that it would seem any dog can just squat and pee.  I had a hard time sleeping in fear that the pup would go in the crate.  But...he didn't.  :)I will have to do a follow up review after a week to let you know how it goes.
My cats enjoy it, and my 15 year old kitty, who has digestive problems, tolerates it very well.  She's even gained a little weight!

My name is Charlie, and I am a dog. I am the official gourmand of our dog family. I am also a very discriminating eater. My mom asked me to write this review, since I am the real expert. A great labor saving device. I got into the fish hobby a few months ago with a 10 gallon tank.  Then, I added a 40 gallon tank.  Then, I added another 40 gallon tank.  Hauling 5 gallon buckets of water was great exercise for the first two tanks.  When I got to the third, I decided it was time to look into a water changer.  I was going to try to build one myself since I already had a gravel vacuum.  I figured with a few parts from the hardware store and about 50' of tubing, I could save myself some money.  After a LOT Of searching for the right parts and tubing, I finally broke down and bought the Aqueon Changer.  Even if I could have found all the parts I needed, it was going to cost me as much or more than the Aqueon.  So, I bought it.I'm happy with the construction of the device and the adapters it came with.  It easily fits onto my bathroom sink and I can reach all three tanks with the 50' hose.  A couple of slight drawbacks are the tubing itself is very thin.  I keep mine in the garage and it's hot this time of year.  I realized when the tubing is hot it gets VERY flexible and therefore kinks easily.  A couple of times I have been draining the tank and wondering why it was going so very slowly, only to realize yet another kink had appeared in the hose, almost as if by magic.  That problem goes away as the tubing cools. The other thing is the way it's designed, you use water running from your faucet to create a siphon to pull water from your tank. If you've ever drained a waterbed, you might be familiar with this.  Well, this uses a lot of water for one thing.  And, secondly, my sink doesn't drain fast enough to handle both the water running from the tap and the water draining from the tank.  Third, I like using the waste water to water my plants rather than running it down the drain.  So, I use a method I found on YouTube for starting a gravel siphon and remove fitting from the end of the line and drain the fish tank water outside. Then, I re-attach the fitting and fill from the tap.I haven't used the competing brand of water changer. But, I'm very happy with the Aqueon.p.s.- after having owned the 50' version of this for about a year, I'd like to update my review. I keep my changer in the garage where it gets warm. The hose tends to kink because the wall are too thin. I spend 5 minutes or more each time trying to get all the kinks out of the hose and I'm afraid I'm going to spring a leak in one of those soon.  I wish the hose were thicker.p.p.s- After using the water changer for about a year and a half, finally one of small cracks that had been appearing in the hose broke all the way through.  I could not find a replacement hose anywhere.  Now, the good news. I called up Aqueon with the intention of buying a hose from them. They told me there is a lifetime warranty on the device. They not only replaced the hose, they sent a whole new water changer. You cannot beat that. I am going to store it inside now though and see if that solves the problem with the hose kinking.
Thirsty little &#34,big&#34, towel that gets my Chi-Chi and Shitz dry much faster! I only ordered one just to try it. So now I will have to order another so they don't have to share!

THE TOY WORKED GREAT FOR ABOUT 15 MINUTES. MY DOG IS A CHEWER AND THE TOY HAS A VERY PLEASANT SMELL AND AFTER SHE GOT THE TREATS OUT OF THE TOY, SHE CHEWED IT UP. I STILL GIVE IT HIGH MARKS BECAUSE MY DOG STILL ENJOYS THE TOY VERY MUCH, EVEN THOUGH I CAN NOT PUT TREATS IN IT NOW.....
