First, some background on my dog. He is a rescue dog whom I got in May 2013. After a month of having him his true nature started coming out. I found out he can be a puller and did not like other dogs. He would lunge at dogs and bicycles. I was using a regular collar on him but he would pull and would go after other dogs on walks. He also developed a habit of barking when I got to a house that he knew had a dog. So, even if other dogs were not barking at him if he remembered the house he would start barking which made it hard to walk him in the morning. My dog is 30 lbs, I am over 200 so it is not like he was stronger than me. But I knew this was a bad habit of his.I got the Easy Walk in hopes it would keep him from pulling. With the Easy Harness he did get better in not pulling as much but would still pull at times. But, it did nothing to curb his lunging at dogs and bikes. It was getting frustrating walking him as he would bark at no apparent reason. If you know how to use it, this collar can be helpful in training your dog to not pull as much. But, don't expect miracles, you still need to do your part to train your dog.Fast forward 3 months to the head halter. I heard about gentle leader but was apprehensive in getting it. In putting on the gentle leader my dog did fuss and not want it on him. He would try to take it off by pawing at it and rubbing his face on bushes. It has been 5 days and still does it but he is getting used to it. Reward him with treats after so he associates as positive. So does it work? YES! But, be sure you know how to use it. Watch the DVD! it is important you don't send your dog mixed signals by keeping it tense. On our first walk the dog did pull and lunge but he did not like the feeling, especially when lunging. But on our first walk I could tell he was staying by my side much better. I did not expect it to prevent lunging but it has. I think it makes him think twice. I have taken him past houses where dogs will bark it him, in the past he would try to go to the barking but now he just whimpers and keeps walking. This produce truly is working wonders (the gentle leader).So in short, I would recommend both the Easy Walk and Gentle Leader. If you have a problem it does not hurt to try both and see which one works better for your dog. But keep in mind you have to do your part to still train your dog. These products are meant as tools. For my purpose, Gentle Leader has done wonders.The only complaint i have on gentle leader is i wish there was padding on the part that goes over the snout. After taking it off you can see the impression it makes on his snout when removed. But not sure if padding would render this product less effective or not. But, no I do not consider this product as abusive or cruel. It is a tool to help him understand what is expected of him on walks.

My cats love these treats and I know that they are healthy for them! There are so many kinds to choose from now. They also have the Mega size to help save money. Check them out I'm sure your kitty will love them too!

The first thing I do whenever I get any pet treats is checkout the back of the bag. There are a few warning signs that stand out immediately for me about this product:1 - Ingredients are all grain or additives. Zero meat, only flavoring comes from byproducts or "flavorings"2 - Zero "Country of Origin" information. Lots of stamps about quality control and about how the company is called "of Vermont" - but zero information on where this is made (note: "Distributed By" is not the same as where its made).3 - Very prominent "for animal use only" warning (ie: not for human consumption).Taking these one-by-one -Meat does not need to be in this item because it's not really the dog's main meal. However, quite a few dogs do have gluten allergies, just like humans. Generally speaking, quite a few grains are known to be allergenic to dogs. If you can stay away from processed grains, it's not a bad idea to do so. Unfortunately this does essentially rule out any "biscuit" type of treat for dogs.This is a biggie for me.  Many of your major pet food manufacturers have used ingredients from China or have made the entire item there. As we all know, China currently has a pretty bad reputation for... well... poisoning our animals. Most of your pet food manufacturers who use all US-based ingredients in US-based factories are pretty proud of this fact and will prominently label their products as "Made in the USA". I think that treats fall into a separate category from actual dog food, so the manufacturers are probably not required to post this information, but again, if it's made in the USA, why wouldn't you include it?  Even when made in the USA, we're not always great about keeping the salmonella away (as the latest recall in Feb 2013 proves). Knowing factory of origin is a real bonus here.Whenever things are labeled "for animal use only," it usually means that there are non-human grade items in the product. When you're looking at feeding your pet things like probiotics, Omega-3's and so forth, often the human-grade version ends up being cheaper. Since the human grade versions usually have to pass more stringent tests than the pet variety, "spiking" treats with non-human grade ingredients just doesn't make much sense.So about the product - after using this for about a week, I haven't seen anything significant with my pups (Malamute / Shiba).  My Mally is a pretty calm dog to begin with so not much difference there. My Shiba plays the alpha and generally likes to chase squirrels, bark at/with the neighbor dog, yell at the UPS man when he's dropping off packages and so forth. These chews haven't really changed any of those behaviors.

The vet gave me the topical tapeworm treatment and it was like trying to treat a flopping fish in the bottom of the boat.  Plus when it dried it turned to a white powder that lasted almost a month.  That's not to say the product didn't work but I just wasn't sure.  I decided to give this pill version a month later (and THAT was no picnic!!) just as a precaution.  My cat is definitely feeling better with more energy and better appetite.  Plus there's 3 treatments in the bottle so it's much more economical.

I have owned and fed three different cats this food and they have all loved it. Highly recommended!

When I introduced my new kitten to canned food, I bought about a dozen different brands and flavors to see what she liked. This one won out, hands down. I like that it has a variety of meats in it, and she likes the little chunks in gravy rather than a pate.

Little things to know - these biscuits are rock hard - if your dog has fragile teeth avoid them, if your dog devours everything in sight you might find they work.  They are about 1" square and 1/4" thick with a 2 biscuits stuck together - they even put a score line in the 2"x1" pair so you can break them with your hand.They don't have a strong odor - in trainging my dog right now we've had several tests where we put down yummy treats and teach the dogs to walk in an oval avoiding the treats.  This particular one was ignored by all dogs - it doesn't smell good which seems to be the key to a treat working well - hot dogs were preferred 10/0 over these biscuits by the dogs in the class.I am presently training a purebread (3 generation 1/2 german 1/2 american) german shepherd dog and treats are an essential part of the process when your dog is food motivated.  The Lamb and Barley flavors don't really attract the attention of the dog when working with it and build attention span.  This dog is spoiled rotten getting a kong stuffed with peanut butter frozen overnight and fed GSD dog feed designed for the nutritional needs of a GSD.Training involves repeating the command and holding the treat in front of the dog's nose to get them to learn the commands - these worked the first time then not so well- I had to find something that smelt better as the dog would igore the treat.  Presently my dog is 6 months old and in a weekly training class with other dogs - we use chicken pieces, turkey pieces, and hot dog slugs to entise the dog into behaving well.  These were nowhere as motivating as the hot dog pieces which seemed to get the most attention.I am pleased that they are organic in nature but they lack a strong odor for the pet.  The pouch they come in is helpful to keep on your belt when training as well.  I don't see a real value in the product for dog training - they are almost too big for even big dogs, so hard to break they are pre-scored to 1x1, and just don't get the interest of the dogs - we tried a malamute, a husky, and my dog and they were only effective if the dog was really hungry!  Also the price is kinda high - I found a 10 pack of hotdogs next door for $2.50 which included a zipper pouch too.

I've been giving this to my Toy Fox Terrier for about a week now and she just loves it. She'll pick this out of her dish first and then when this is gone she'll eat the old brand.  So funny watching her be so picky.  She hasn't had any stomach upset which is great so thumbs up there. I try and keep her on a food that has less crude fat and more protein but here is the clincher.Crude Protein: 42%Crude Fat: 22%Crude Fiber: 4.5%Moisture: 8.0%Omega 3 Fatty Acids: 0.3%Omega 6 Fatty Acids: 2.6%72% pure animal ingredients and nutritious oils28% vegetables and fruits, fortified with vitamins and minerals0% grain, gluten, and potatoSo as you can see there are some pros and cons to this food but there is with all of them.  I would feel better if that crude fat were lower but we'll have to wait and see.  I try very hard to watch what she eats so she won't gain weight as she has bad rear legs so time will tell if this will work or not.

My two kittens and I were visiting my sister in August. They were 8 weeks old when we arrived, and very good at using the litter box. Unfortunately, my boy, Chance, began adopting the &#34,dig to China&#34, method of litter box use. The boxes I had brought and the one my sister had on hand were getting too messy that we were vacuuming the carpet every day, and it was a waste of litter. Plus the kittens began to out grown the small one (we were there for a month). I realized that I had no boxes at home for when we returned, so I looked on Amazon and was thrilled to find this one! It comes with a scoop that is not gigantic but is strong plastic and it has multiple places to be stored, plus the shield would (I hoped) block all of Chance's digging from covering my floor (at least on 3 sides)! On top of all of that, I couldn't believe the price! I probably looked like one of those cartoons that gets really shocked & their eyes pop out. It was great!Having two kittens who will soon be cats, and Chance was already pretty big by nearly 12 weeks, I ordered two of these litter boxes (2 cats, 2 boxes). My apartment is long so I figured one at each end is the best. They arrived while I had a friend staying so they were here when we got home. The kittens both took right to them, and Chance taught his sister, Kismet, the &#34,dig to China&#34, method (she's not that big on it though), but they've been so good about keeping it in the box, even with one side open They even use the edges of the shield to wipe their paws off before exiting the box.Of course cats will track litter, but this had reduced how much they kick out of the boxes while still allowing them to dig to China! Some people like the totally enclosed kind, but I've had only very large cats that end up not fitting inside those, so this should not be an issue no matter how huge my little boy gets (they are almost 7 months old & he's about 10lbs. Kismet is maybe 6 or 7ibs, if that!). These seem to be very sturdy plastic and I expect they will last a long time. I highly recommend this to messy cats, but do suggest getting a table that can be above it so nothing falls in the poop pile, or putting it somewhere that wouldn't create that risk.PROS:Keeps the floor cleanIncludes scoop & places to store the scoopIdeal size & shapeCost is AMAZING!Easy to clean0 CONS!

Although my 11 pound sensitive Shih Tzu hates this, it's a five star dog toy.  TheKong Wobbler Treat Dispensing Dog Toy, Largeis heavy and much larger than any other "small" dog toy and the principle is great.  Insert the treats or dry food into the lightweight top with the hole, screw on the weighted base, flip it over and the dog will be able to knock it around, releasing the contained kibble.  This dog freaked out and would walk several feet around the Kong because of the sound it makes.  She would rather not eat than have to knock this around to obtain the reward.  Being a sharing dog, she gave it to another less fearful dog who loves the thing.  I'd strongly recommend checking the toy out in a brick and mortar store before making a purchase if you're on the fence because it's so much larger and heavier than other Kong dog toys.  Being able to wash this in the dishwasher is a strong advantage for those who actually use it to dispense food.  The red color also makes it hard to miss when on the floor.

We adopted a puppy and I've been comparing prices online vs. in store. This bed got some great reviews. I did find at a local pet store and it was $35 more expensive. Ordered online and while there was a big box to recycle, it was a great deal. Can't wait to introduce the puppy to it.

So while I was getting ready for my new corgi puppy I purchased this from Amazon. I thought, "Hey--good for strong chewers and he'll be teething! Perfect!" Add to that the fact that I love dinosaurs and this was a must.At a checkup for my cats before the dog came home I talked to my vet about some of the concerns with the new puppy, and her recommendations for good chew toys. She warned us against the white Nylabone toys specifically. She didn't want our dog to have anything harder than a tooth to chew on (including bones and hard plastic toys like this) because of the potential to crack his teeth. Even though he's a puppy, she was concerned about the possibility of infection and abscess in a cracked tooth and the dangers of putting a puppy under for oral surgery to extract the cracked tooth/teeth. I'm glad she did warn me because I never would have known.As soon as we got back from the appointment I returned it and Amazon gave me a refund no problem (five stars for the customer service there), so that was good. In retrospect, I can see she was right. If nothing else I could have kept the toy to beat up any intruders in my apartment--it really is that hard.

Works very well so far. However, I've been using the Simple Solution Triple Oxy spray bottle, which actually has stronger cleaning power (spray on stains to clean) but gives an awful smell that takes awhile to go away. That was the one thing I couldn't find about the Simple Solution Extreme was what kind of scent it would give off. I went ahead and bought the gallon anyways since it's much cheaper than buying the smaller spray bottles every time. I am quite pleased with the SS Extreme's scent which smells like baby powder. Overall this was a great buy and I will continue buying the Extreme gallon refill.
I have a Sphynx cat that loves these treats. Sphynx are a smaller breed, and he chews these up with no trouble after playing soccer with it for awhile.

I love the quality of ingredients, not to mention a great price.  Living to a ripe old age of 15, my dog was quite agile and energetic until the very end, I attribute considerably to eating this product.  In fact, until the last month, he was still begging me to take him for our 2-mile walks every morning! Granted, he could not see or hear as well at the end, but, his body and joints, especially, really kept in good shape with these walks, natural dogfood, and supplements, this made all the difference in the world to us both! Everyone, even the professionals, claimed he would get feeble and have a hard time even getting up the last couple years...NOT.  In fact, even on days he did get a little wobbly, after the next walk, he was walking fine. Thanks. Merrick!I recommend this highly to everyone who love their family member the way I did mine! If ever I get another such precious companion, I will certainly buy Merricks's organic dogfood!

This is a good deal and the clicker really works, don't know why.  My boxer hears the clicker, from just a pup, and sits right to attention, not taught to.  The whistle is good too.  Love the stretchy band.

Great calorie control for dog.  I have a Cardgian Welsh Corgi.  Corgis in general can gain weight very easily and this stresses their joints tremendously.  These are small, low calories, and very tasty.  I use them as rewards for training.  Perfect.

Excellent! Super heavy duty. I do not fear that the dog will rip or dig it out of the ground. He cannot bend the top loop, either. It actually wasn't hard at all to get it the whole way into the ground. I thought for sure it would take much longer and much more strength, but it was done in 5 minutes or less. Definitely plan n using some sort of rod or pole to stick through the top loop to turn. We used a prybar and were done in no time.Take the black tip cover off and there is a point on the end. Push it in until the 3 blades touch the ground and then start turning it into the ground with your rod/prybar. Make sure to get it the whole way into the ground so that the top cap piece is as tight on the ground as possible.I am very happy with this purchase. The price was so much better than the stakes I have seen in any store and the quality of this one is 100 times better. I bought it along with Prestige Super-Beast Dog Tie-Out, 30 feet and it is the absolute perfect combination for our strong and determined pitt bull. I have NO fears of him breaking or chewing through this combination of cable and stake!!
Nice and convient to order got here fast. Product is what it is and a great supplier no problems with the store.

We were having troubles with our Scottish Fold kitten's eyes when she was 1.5-3 month old. Tried to use medicine prescribed by our vet, it helped of course, but the cat was really nervous about the procedures. This liquid works perfectly with her eyes - sometimes it seems to be working better than medical staff, and it doesn't irritate our cat.

This works great for when the crabs are molting, and they love it otherwise. My only problem is that it gets a bit soggy because sometimes they spill a little of their salt water or drinking water. It absorbs plenty of moisture in my tank, and rarely ever gets moldy. It worked so well for mr hermit crabs and I will continue to buy it!

For the price, this toy was great for about an hour.  It is a foam puzzle you put together and then push the 2 &#34,pedals&#34, down in the back that will slide a piece of foam with a fish sticker on it out from under the little fringed door.  After an hour of play, both fish permanently stick out about 1/2.  The most intelligent of my 2 cats, turned the toy around to pull the fish out from the back side.If you want a special toy/treat for a cat and do not mind that it is good for an hour, this is your toy!If the fish were hinged better and would fully retract, I would give it 5 stars because both of my cats loved this toy.

After my cat had a nasty UTI a few years ago, I decided to try putting him on Purina One's urinary tract health formula to see if it would keep him healthy in the future. It gave me peace of mind to be taking a proactive step to protect my cat's health. And it seemed like a fine food. But my cat was definitely unexcited about it. He tolerated it, but he clearly didn't relish it. He only ate it because that was all I gave him. Plus, I started hearing through the grapevine of cat owners that there were better products out there for urinary tract health.So, I asked my vet, and he recommended a high-end urinary tract health food that I decided to try, and my cat loved it. So it was bye-bye Purina One. I have nothing against Purina One - like I said, it seemed like a good quality product - but my cat just didn't "dig" it for some reason. Too bad, because the Purina One was a lot cheaper than what I give my cat now! Oh well...
My kitchen is dusty rose colored and i keep the cats food and water in the corner so this is perfect. I like that its made out of rubber easy to wash. Great size too

We got these for our 5 week old puppy, who we knew was too little to leave alone for 8 hours (during the workday) without a potty option. These worked very well. They contain the moisture, are a good size, and were by far the best value for the $ that we saw. Would definitely recommend to other dog or puppy owners.

Cause of death: lobotomy.My dog ate the eyes first, then the ears, then pulled all the stuffing out of the head. She loved this thing day in and day out until there was nothing left but the strong rope body (which remains in her toy box). I will probably buy another one soon. :)
My lab absolutely loves the lamb lung.  It is his favorite treat.  The pieces are reasonable size, typically about 1/2" cube, and there are typically only very few small bits so little wastage.

This is pretty good food.  While this doesn't contain actual meat, there is plenty of protein in it.  Via dogfoodadvisor(.)comChicken meal is considered a meat concentrate and contains nearly 300% more protein than fresh chicken.  The other ingredient are also quite good as well.  The food is small and my little dog can eat it easily.  There are better foods out there, but for the price this is a much better option than some of the grocery store foods you can buy.  Overall it's a nice quality food for a good price.

The scoop works great for getting things moved around in the tank, the algae scrapers are pretty much worthless because it's very difficult to get this thing at the right angle to scrape the glass when you have ornaments and lights in the tank. If you're buying it for the scoop - go for it. If you're buying it hoping to reach hard to reach places to scrape the glass then forget it, you're going to have to take everything out of your tank to get this thing at the right angle to use it that way.

I have had Outward Hound jackets for over 15 years. I still have my original one, which had a better design than the current one, including pockets on the sides of the jacket. They changed to the current design a few years ago. It's a great jacket but will get waterlogged eventually if you do not treat it with fabric waterproofer. Wash it first with Grangers waterproofing cleaner, then when it's wet spray with Grangers fabric waterproofer and dry on warm for about 15 minutes (do this to your own rain shells also!). My only beef with this XL is that it is too big and long for my dog, whereas the large is too short for him. He is a long German Shepherd/Collie mix, about 75 lbs. He is 28 inches from the back of neck to the start of the tail. the large is about 25 inches when it's pulled up all the way on the dog like it's supposed to be. The XL is about 32 inches long. I have to return or sell one of the two jackets I got at a very good price. I am going to try and alter the remaining jacket since I paid so little for it.

I ordered the Timothy Hay Cubes because our two piggies seem to love the loose hay that we always get them and these would give them the fiber plus something to chew on. They were pretty affordable and my pair of guinea pigs definitely seem to enjoy them!

This exercise pen has been a God-Send for our dogs and for us! We have a 2lb Yorkie and a 7lb Poodle and they love being in this pen outside or inside. It's very durable  and has stood the Texas cold and hopefully the hot! It hasn't fallen down or even been knocked down. No rusting even after being left out in the rain and is easy to put away  and take apart, along with reassembly as needed.

My mom and dad have a gorgeous Norwegian Forest Cat who adopted them as parents several years ago. His only bad habit is occasional clawing of one of the chairs. I have the tall post version of this and our cats absolutely love it, so I thought one of these would make a good Christmas gift for their furry formerly stray boy.It arrived a few days before Christmas and Mom cracked it open for him. She wasn't sure if she should prop it up on the wall or what, so she set it down on the floor until she figured out which option would be best. Not long afterward, she found said cat sitting on one end of the new Combination Scratcher and blissfully clawing his fool head off at the other end -- he LOVES it! The latest report from Mom says that she hasn't seen him clawing the chair since the Scratcher has arrived.So their house is now closer to global peace, at least between the big furry kid and the defenseless chair. This Combination Scratcher is an excellent product, and I can attest that sisal twine is extremely appealing to nearly all cats. Two of our cats are declawed and they still stretch their bodies and &#34,claw&#34, with their nubs, seemingly very happy with the ritual.My opinion is that it's an excellent product for nearly every cat!(because nothing is perfect, but this is darn close)
All natural, naturally renewing, not bleached or dyed.  As advertised.  My dogs love them so much they each have to have their own

Well there is no question that this is excellent cat food nutritionally speaking.  Comparing it to the ingredients in something like Meow Mix brings about quite the separation of ordinary commercial blends and something like this that takes it all very seriously. Unfortunately all that work, research, and quality that the bag talks about has not translated into something that merely taste good.  Not to my cat or others I have offered it too anyway.  My own cat that is going on 22 now tried a few morsels and then just walked away.  And the couple of neighborhood cats that come around occasionally for a free meal ate a little more of it but have since taken to looking at me with a disagreeable look on their face.  I've tried it several times and just cannot get them interested in it. (And mixing it in with my cats regular meal has also proven to be a failure as well.  She just eats around it).  I think I will feed the rest of what I have to the raccoons and possums that prowl around my yard at night who I am sure will be far less particular.  I would have really liked to have seen my elderly cat chow down on this stuff for I believe its much better for her than the regular store bought mixes she loves.  And I have given this brand an extra star for their efforts.  But unfortunately I cannot recommend it with the high price it carries, and more importantly with it not appealing to the number of cats I tried it with... : )

I adopted my Dexter September of last year, he is a five year old male, mixed pooch Jack Russell Terrier and Chihuahua since he has been with me he has gained a considerable amount of weight I wasn't concerned in the beginning but now I am. So onto the internet I went on the hunt for an automatic feeder with portion control. Finding what I was looking for was easy, trying to find out which foods are causing his allergies is another review altogether. Maybe another reviewer will have pity on me and offer up some sage advice. I just want to help my Dexter!I bought the Petmate LeBistro portion control automatic feeder. It works very well, unfortunately due to the nature of Dexter's formidable years, he tends to shy away almost run from anything that makes loud noises. And as LeBistro is dispensing the food Dexter runs and hides, I cannot get him to feed. I have to take the food out of the bowl and put it in his old bowl as per the instructions. But it has been a few weeks now and I have made no progress. Please, this is no attack on the product as I said before, it works well. But not all dogs are created equal and mine is special in every way.

In a household with three adult cats I was constantly cleaning the litter box.  With the Littermaid LM900 I need only empty or replace the waste container about twice a week.  The litter is kept clean and smoothed by the automatic raking action.  Odors are minimal since waste is stored in a closed container and the exposed litter is continually cleaned.  Make sure you only use premium, clumping litter.  That's the good news.Now for the not so good news.  The unit is noisy with a capital "N".  Don't plan on placing it near the living spaces in your home if you value your peace and quiet.  Waste frequently lodges between the teeth on the rake so I'm finding myself visually checking anytime I'm near the unit and using my scoop to clear the rake.  About every other day I need to use the scoop to scrape along the bottom of the pan to loosen anything sticking to the bottom so the rake can catch it on the next pass.  Lastly, the included ramp which is supposed to keep your cat from tracking litter is a joke.  It simply isn't big enough and my cats usually jump over it rather than walk down it.  To solve the problem, I continue to leave a small area rug in front of the unit.  That seems to catch about 75% of the tracked litter. the unit isn't cheap.  Taking into account the noise and the other problems, I would still buy the unit if I had to do it over again primarily for the conveninence.
This leash is great for allowing your dog to exercise in open fields. It extends really far so could be dangerous for walking on sidewalks. Retraction of the leash is slow at times.

Hard to rate dog food if you don't eat it!  My dog loves these and I actually use these as treats rather than food.  Saves me lots of money over those expensive dog treats.  The texture feels like ground beef... and it doesn't smell too bad.  I wish the bag was resealable.

I'm not a vet but I've worked in health care most my life.  Antibiotics should never be used long term, never.  Not in humans and not in animals.  PLEASE READ the directions on the bottle.  It plainly states the amount to give according to your dog size and that it should NOT to be given long term.  Also, use common sense.  If you have a puppy that has just teethed or had teeth pulled recently, understand that the tear staining may be greater than usual and you may want to wait awhile before administering this product.  Additionally the absolute BEST thing you can do for your dog having tear stains, is trim the hair away from the dogs eyes (I trim my maltese hair from his eyes every three or four days) and wash the dogs face at least twice a day.  Also using an eye rinse to wash the eyes out every day, is a good idea, certainly not going to hurt, and may help dramatically.  This product does work but it should be used only as described and for no longer than stated.  I gave a quarter teaspoon in peanut butter to my dog for 4 weeks.  There was dramatic improvement and I consistently trimmed the hair around the eyes.  I then discontinued use and I do wash his eyes out every day and wash his face, all the while trimming any new hair that comes in around the eyes.  He has only a slight apricot color at the eyes and that is fine.  Finally, Angel Eyes SHOULD include a measuring spoon with this product and to charge people for a cheap less than one cent to make spoon is pretty low down.
Very small for a medium thought it would be larger the sizes run small soif you want a medium order large

I can tell when these run out because one of my males starts spraying the house every move he makes.  It doesn't stop him from spraying, but definitely slows  him down.  The bad thing about it is it doesn't always last a month.  I started circleing the day on the calendar that I replaced it and once it lasted almost and the next time it only lasted two weeks.  Really sucks when they are so expensive, but I can't stop using them so I guess I will hope the rest of them last closer to a month!
The cats love it. My kitten wants to play and chase it all the time, she wears us out. wouold recommend to anyone with cats.

I have a new kitten at my mothers house and I order this for him...he eats it with gusto and is growing like a weed. His coat's beautiful and his energy levels are as high as any young cat I've ever been around.

These are large tablets.  I heard some dogs eat them like treats.  Not my spoiled boy.  I would break them in half and make a game out of eating them but he really hated them.  I switched to a liquid I could put in his food.

We have a family of feral strays that we care for. We bought Snuggle Safe to tuck into their outside bedding to keep them warm during freezes this past winter.I was skeptical.Following directions, then placing the heated disk underneath their blankets in their &#34,cat house&#34,, I was AMAZED to find that, 15 hours later, heat was still generating from it.We used this disk all winter and it still works great. The heat will last much longer if you make sure to wrap it in a towel or keep it insulated in some way, so that it emits a low heat all night through.
I just started using this disposal system a month ago (2 cats) and really love it. I'm glad I bought this extra refill and now I am going to order the 3 pack.  This one is 14feet long and not 10 ft.

my Catahoula loves these.  I give her one when leaving her alone to keep her out of trouble.  She uses it to entertain herself when we are watching tv.  this is a great price for the number of rawhides provided.

I have just adopted a psycho kitten. He was abandoned at 3 weeks old and left to die next to a lake where bugs and worms chewed at him. He was not able to have the love of a mother or siblings and was therefore not taught how to act with other cats. Once he was rescued, he spent time at the vets and was then placed in a rescue shelter. I have another adult male that I had adopted 6 months ago who is a 20 pound ball of love. He has tried to &#34,mother&#34, this kitten, but he is absolutely crazy. He bites, destroys everything in site, kicks the crap out of my other cat...the list goes on. I have had him now for a month and I have been working with him daily and he has improved. He is starting to show affection but is still a bit aggressive with my other cat and still has psychotic moments. After reading the reviews, I decided to try this. After putting the collar, it took about 24 hours before I noticed anything. He was SLIGHTLY more affectionate and calm. Yes, there has been a very small change in him, but I don't think it's worth the fifteen dollars every month. I will see in a month after its time to replace it and decide whether there is a big enough change in him or not. At this point, I'm not real convinced this is going to be the cure.

The thought behind this was good.  First they don't stay stuck together at all.  Very thin and tore easily.  Cost too much for such a poorly designed product.  Would not purchase again unless they make some big changes.

My dogs absolutely love this food.  I did a food test by putting each dog food we have at home next to the Orijen, every time, our dogs chose the Orijen bag! Thanks, The Cohen family, and the three fur-kids

After reading the reviews on this, and having looked for a similar item for a long time, I decided to go for it. So far, I am glad I did. I rated it four stars instead of five simply bc it's made in china. I should've noticed that but I didn't. That's  the only thing I don't like about it so far. It was easy to wash, assemble and fill, and it's very quiet. There is virtually no sound to it but I know the dogs can probably hear something. Even if they do it hasn't stopped them from using it. Both took to it right away, and I have already noticed a decrease in the amount of spills and drips/drools on the floor. Normally, I have to fill and clean and refill the dog and cat water bowls two or three times a day, so I am pretty psyched not to have to do that. It holds a lot more water than I expected it to, and it's lasting longer than I thought it would before needing a refill. The water stays really clean and just pools at the top of the bowl - there isn't a true fountain or a lot of water movement, which I expected for some reason. Given that many similar products are much more expensive and have far fewer positive ratings and reviews, I would consider this a great deal, so far!

These bowls do the job.What I like about them:- They are made of hygienic stainless steel so they can be cleaned easily- The rubberized bottom prevents the bowls from sliding around- They are shallow enough to where cats can eat comfortably.What I don't like that much:- The stickers attached to the outside of the bowls are extremely hard to remove, even when soaking them they require some Goo Gone to remove all traces. This could and should be done much better.- We own several of these bowls and it is amazing how different in quality they are. There seems to be no consistency. Some are shallower than others, some heavier, some more light-weight. It seems as if the quality has gone down over the years...Summary:They are OK but overpriced for what they offer. I would only buy them again because there are no alternatives that I have seen.

My 27 lb feist Annie is pretty high energy, smart, and food-motivated, and this food dispenser toy is great for her. She figured out quickly just how to move, roll, or drop the toy to get the kibble out, but hasn't gotten bored with it yet (after 3 months of daily use). Most of her meals are dispensed this way, and unlike many dispensers, this will hold her full serving (total capacity is probably about 2 - 2.5 cups, but she eats about 1.25 cups per meal). It's nice that it's easy to see from across the room how much food is left in it.I like that I can adjust the difficulty so when she's not as high energy I can make it easier and when she's hyper I can make it more challenging. Even on the easiest setting, it's slow enough to dispense that she can't wolf down her meal. She will generally keep at it until the last few pieces of kibble are left that are too large to fit through the holes, then bring it to me to unscrew for her to earn those last few bites with tricks. It's also quite durable and stands up to her biting, carrying, and dropping it, though I don't leave her alone with it as the plastic could potentially splinter and hurt her.The only drawback to this item for me is that sometimes the lid unscrews instead of the neck, and I don't really see the point of having two separate points to screw and unscrew the toy.

We have had this feeder for over 6 months and it works as expected. It is easy to assemble and mount. For those picky people it is a bit noisy but it does not bother turtles. You need to be careful to dispense not too much food if you leave it unattended not to get aquarium dirty.

I have two orange tabby cats that are large and due to the time of year, they're shedding like crazy!I misplaced my other Furminator and had to return here to get another - that's how badly this is needed!It works SO well - it immediately removes any dead or loose hair and makes petting them an enjoyable activity again.I HIGHLY recommend to any cat owner - you won't believe the amount of hair you can remove just by brushing for a short while.

[...]This was the first Nina Ottoson toy i purchased for my two dogs, an 10 year old jack russell an a 3 month border terrier. THEY LOVE IT!!! as soon as i take it out of the closet they go absolutely nuts! i had to train them both to take turns because they would attack the puzzle like kids in a candy store. Even though Nina Offers other puzzles that are on an easier level i thought this would be better to star out with.... and i was right ! after a lot of pawing and digging they finally started to develop their own techniques to get to the treats and are super successful. I love this puzzle because it really enriches their minds and makes me super proud to see them finish it.

My pugs love the Wubba dog toys ------- they hold up better than most dog toys ------  they are especially fun for dogs that like to play tug of war with it.  Nothing lasts forever ------ and if you have a dog that is only interested in chewing on a toy, this won't last long. Good for interactive play with your dog, or between several dogs that like to compete for everything!  Fun toy.
We keep these in our car for when we take our dogs hiking. They hold water great and are easy to store and the price is perfect.

I was thrilled when my older and very particular cat took to this right away.  I knew she would never accept a new bed, she's just that bad.  But with this, it slides underneath her favorite blanket.  When you first plug it in, don't be concerned if it is not as warm as you think it should be.  It gets there and when combined with their natural warmth, you will find quite a toasty spot left behind when they get up.  It is small, but they tell you the measurements in the description.  My husband plugged it in to a timer and we are good to go.*update*  2 months in and still going strong.  Her new favorite spot.  I think she would only like it more if we put it on our bed and added a remote control holder for her.  ,-)*Update* Well it's over 1 year later and the pad is still working great.  We put it away in the summer and when we brought it out again it worked perfectly.  The cat we bought it for still loves it.

I have three cats and not one of them would eat this.  I don't know any other way to review cat food, so I have to trust their taste buds.  The food just sat on the floor going bad while they howled for something else.  They eat regular cooked chicken, chicken cat food by other brands, they eat human grade canned chicken, but they wouldn't touch this.  My friend also ordered this food because it is supposed to be made of great ingredients and her cat wouldn't eat it either.

Small jar but full and a very little goes a long way. I can't give it all 5 stars only because it didn't help our dog but then we weren't 100% sure that his hair loss on top of his nose or around his eyes was indeed Demodex. We thought we would give this a try since it was much less expensive than a $100 plus skin scraping at the vet. I put it on at bedtime followed by a treat for 3 weeks with no change but again, we weren't sure. It was worth the try anyway.

These pads worked no better (or worse) than the $70 green grass trays that I got to entice my three miniature dachshunds to stop going on the carpet.  The dogs ignored the pads entirely.  After two weeks, I managed to catch one pee on the pad.  Nothing works with these guys.
My dogs liked the edible one. The other broke off in pieces so I had to throw it away. The third one just sits there and is never chewed.

He just chomped it into a thousand pieces. I was hopeful that the strong plastic would hold up, but not even close. On the bright side, he did love playing with it for the few days it lasted. Perhaps this will fare better with dogs that don't have such strong jaws.

Buy this one instead of the expensive ones that are on the market....it's soooooo much better......made the mistake of getting really cute expensive ($16.99)step-in harness and it's a pain.....all twisted up and harness clip broke....very hard to adjust.  This one is very easy to adjust....NEVER gets twisted and clip has not broke yet.....I should have gotten 2......will send for this one again if the old one breaks...... Great Buy!

I have six cats and I thought there is no WAY I would ever buy such a pricy cat food.  Still my cats were leaving the other catfood half eaten and I would have to toss it and feed them new stuff.  They finish this every time, its not buying half the food since half of the "bigger" stuff went un-eaten. (Tried many brands, many flavors, one can at a time in many bowles, nope) I also did a little research and as brands go this one is one of the best for your cat for common brands. Shredding is my parrotlets' favorite activity of all time, and the carnival kabob swing is their favorite kabob-type toy.  Days of shredding entertainment, completely worth the price (usually $12 or so).  I buy these regularly for my birds.

They float as promised, and my 2 6-inch RES boys will chase them around nipping at them and playing with them. My aunt has nine dogs on her hilltop property, some from friends, some adopted from pounds, and a few strays.  The dogs are have voracious appetites and will eat anything.  Two dogs are inactive and overweight so I decided to let the hefty dogs try these Pet Naturals K9 Slim Down Chicken Liver Flavored Chews.Likes:*Easy to open and resealable bags.*We followed the instructions of feeding the two hefty dogs 2 chews each 10 minutes before each meal.  The 60 dog chews per bag equals a 15 day supply for two 51-100lbs dogs.*The dogs gobbled up these chews without hesitation.*After 15 days, we did notice some appetite suppression with the pre-meal dog chews, the two hefty dogs ate less of their daily dried dog food.Concerns:*Although the brand is "Pet Naturals", these weight loss chews contain a wide variety of artificial ingredients such as "proprietary blend" (maltodextrin, sodium alginate, and calcium sulfate), silicon dioxide, etc.*Per manufacturer: NOT recommended for pregnant animals or animals intended for breeding.Overall:Consult with your vet first before attempting to put your dogs on a weight loss program with these Slim Down Dog Chews.

A short summary of our problem cat's life....We have the sweetest, friendliest cat ever. He's part of a multi-cat household. His problems, and ours, began when he was 4 yrs. old. He began showing dominance by chasing our 14 yr old cat until she'd hide from him & he also started marking his territory in our home!! If you're wondering, yes, he was neutered. He's lucky, very lucky, that we are so kind-hearted. Instead of doing away with him, he's been banished to our closed-in porch.Through the years, I tried a couple different enzyme products, but got frustrated with them because I'd have to mix just the right amount of enzyme with just the right amount of warm water, pour on the urine spot, cover with a damp cloth and make sure the urine spot remained wet for a required amount of time. I grew tired of that, and started using white vinegar, but it didn't get all the smell out. Now, 13 years later, I read an article about Anti-Icky-Poo, and decided to go for it. The deciding factor was that it doesn't need to be kept wet. Off and on, in about 6 weeks time, I managed to use a quart of it on some urine spots on our closed in porch. Imagine my surprise when that nasty smell was finally gone from the porch!!! This stuff works! I recently ordered the gallon size & haven't had to use much because I'm also usingFarnam Comfort Zone Feliway Electric Diffuser with 48-Milliliters Imitation Cat Pheromone.  My vet sold me some Feliway (75mL) Spray several years ago. I used it a few times but stopped because I wasn't comfortable spraying my furniture and walls with it, & you need to spray often. So, that's when Raskal was banished to our closed-in porch.Using Anti-Icky-Poo and Comfort Zone Feliway Diffuser has almost eliminated our problem...our home is intact and finally our porch doesn't stink. Poor, sweet Raskal is still banished to our porch, which we've made very comfy for him through the years. He even has his own cat house with an incandescent bulb we use to heat it in cold weather. We just can't bring ourselves to trust him in our home any more. Maybe someday I'll be brave, plug in a Feliway diffuser, and give him another chance, after all, I can use Anti-Icky-Poo to clean up his mess. *but I really don't want to be cleaning up that kind of mess in our home**After purchasing Anti-Icky-Poo, I found out that if you have a stubborn or old urine spot, that Anti-Icky-Poo will also work if it's kept wet. So just cover it with plastic, wax paper or tinfoil for a while. You'll use less A-I-P & have quicker results. A.I.P. can also be diluted with up to 3 parts water.Taken from the label: " Engineered to eradicate urine, it will digest any malodorous decay including liquid or dried fluids from vomit, feces, rotten vegetables, fish, milk, ... skunk musk & more, even smoke."  "Don't use directly on pets."A.I.P. has a pleasant smell that I can't quite describe for you. The smell doesn't linger nor does it leave a scent on the sprayed object.
I bought this bag for my 5 lb. Yorkie. She fits very awkward inside and it isn't very safe for her. I ended up buying a doggie backpack and it works so much better.

I received the blue one and at first the cats played with it but after a while the ball lost it's novelty and so they almost never play with it anymore, but they do use the scratch pad almost daily so it was worth the purchase. This product has given me a whole new dog.  We had an out-of-control Chihuahua that barks at the slightest provocation.  When people came around he'd bark non stop and lunge at them and try to bite them. We couldn't stop and talk to anyone because he would keep trying to go at them. He was relentless too. We tried everything, spray collar, obedience class, positive reinforcement, you name it.  Nothing was working.  We always said we'd never get a shock collar before but we had ran out of options and it was where we were afraid he'd bite someone, we couldn't go on walks with him, take him anywhere, etc. without him going ballistic at someone.  So we got this collar and it works brilliantly.  If he's in the yard and someone approaches and he starts to act out, we beep him. He stops and just sits there.  He'd NEVER do that before. If we are on a walk and he moves like he's going to start up, we beep him. Before it was like nothing would break through that mission of his to bark at people.  This just interrupts that response of his. Before, we couldn't leave him outside in his kennel because every little thing would set him off.  Now if he starts up, we just hit the beep and he immediately stops. We tested the different levels on ourselves and settled on 3.  4 was a little too much (for us) and felt like an actual shock.  But 3 is a vibration that feels less than if you were walking on carpet and someone touched you.  It's not even to that level, it's just vibration.  Rarely do we even have to use that, the beep really reels him in. I've read horror stories about other shock collars that when they used it on their dog it went running and yelping, and this just isn't the case with this one. Maybe people had the level too high.  With the level 3 he never yelps or runs, it just interrupts his thought pattern and makes him stop. And in all the time he's been wearing it, no one has even noticed he had it on.I would highly recommend this product!

This is the best clumping clay litter I have tried, and I think I have tried every litter on the market. I like World's Best Cat Litter because it is light and easy to clean, but many cats do not like the natural corn scent. If your cat prefers clay litter, this one is the best. It's all natural, meaning there are no added chemicals intended to mask smell. You may have noticed that many brands marketed as "unscented" actually still smell quite strongly of perfume! I am not sure why companies do that, but the bottom line is that added scent is for humans, not cats - cats prefer unscented litter. If the litter box stinks, you need to clean it more often, or consider changing your cat's diet to a high quality meat canned food. Covering up the smell with perfume doesn't work and may drive your cat to start avoiding the litter box as the strong chemical smell will irritate her sensitive nose.Dr. Elsey's litter is as dust-free as any clay litter could be. The dust is minimal while filling the ox and when your cat uses it.The clumps formed are tight enough to keep the unused litter clean, but not overly sticky.the texture is just right, according to my cats.if your cat has litterbox issues, Dr. Elsey's also makes a similar litter called Cat Attract, which contains herbs known to attract cats. You can also buy the attractant separately and add to any brand of litter. I tried it and my cats all immediately went to the box and dug around in it. They obviously could smell the powder and liked it!
This product does what it says it does and my cat likes it daily. At least so far he has been willing to eat it daily.

These are small, thin treats, and work for our toy, medium, and large dog equally well.  Even our picky toy gets excited over these treats consistently, which is a minor miracle!Best of all, they are made in the USA from chicken in the USA, so no worries about contamination from China.  I'm leery of most chicken treats due to just not being sure of what the country of origin was, and a lot of name brand chicken treats ARE from China.  In addition, jerky usually comes in random sized chunks, from dust-like bits to huge chunks, and it is difficult to break or cut into appropriate sized treats.  These are thin, about 1 1/2&#34, square, and the toy manages them without any signs of choking, despite his excitement.I really like these treats.  Also, the box contains four smaller packages rather than just a single pack.  These vacuum sealed packages do require refrigeration if it will be more than three days from the time  you open the package until they are gone.  While the dogs may disagree with me on this, there are far too many in one of the inner packages to use in just three days, even with three dogs, so we stash them in a ziplock sandwich bag in the refrigerator.  We get hopeful glances every time we approach the refrigerator anyhow, and now there is even more interest in what we're retrieving from the &#34,Magic Food Box&#34,.Your dog will profess undying loyalty for these, seriously!  (At least until you put them away or they are all gone.)

First, the measurements: The pads are actually a little smaller than the measurements provided. The measurements provided include the border around the pad (which does not have the absorbent material). However, I must add that we did not use the pads with the holder (we've never used a holder). Second, we found that the pads did not fully absorb our 8 pound Chihuahua's urine (sometimes it leaked right through the plastic underliner). And I cannot imagine what the company is thinking when they promote the idea that liquid turns to gel. No. the urine is absorbed by the cotton (or cotton-like) membrane that is attached to a thin plastic underliner. Third - and I probably should have mentioned this first: The picture is so unbelievably misleading!! You will not receive three packages that are packaged as appears in the picture. Instead, we received three shrink wrapped 'cubes' of 50 pads each - and I should have known there was a problem the moment I saw that each 'cube' was so small. That should have tipped me off to the fact that there was no way 50 pads folded and stacked together then wrapped in shrink wrap could possibly have made such a small 'cube.'  Final word: Not good for my 8 pound Chihuahua....but I am reluctant to say you should not buy them....maybe if your dog is a runt....?

The "normal strength" version of this collar barely registered to my bulldog.  She's cross the line and sort of twitch her head like a bug had flown in her ear.  Now she flinches away when she hear the beep, and yelps if she accidentally plows through the "beep" range into the "shock" range.  She's crossed it once since I got it (to check out a yapping snack-size dog that way going by) but did NOT want to come back over the line.  She nearly yanked my arm off sprinting back towards the house when she heard the beep (I had the collar in my hand to cross back into the yard).Pros:  This shock definitely registers on my dog.Cons:  The black box on the collar is big and heavy, which doesn't matter to the dog, but it looks a little bulky if you care about aesthetics.  It's maybe 1.5"x1.5"x2.5" (but I didn't measure so don't quote me!), in any case, it's definitely bigger than the normal sized collar.

Along with several types of Penn Plax filters (some canisters and some internal filters), I have Eheim classic canister filters--the 2213, 2215, and 2217--on various tanks and find them all great.  They are reliable and push that water through from bottom to top.  The flow rate on Eheims is low, however, compared to Penn Plax's Cascade.  While the downside of the Cascade is that the water goes through the canister less completely because of the design, the upside is the powerful flow, which is great if you have fish that like more heavily oxygenated water and faster currents.  Another plus with the Cascade filter is that the setup is incredibly easy in comparison with the Eheim setup.  For starters, the instructions are clear unlike Eheim.  In the second place, the "in" and "out" flow is clearly marked, which is an obvious trick that Eheim should do.Each of these canisters are great, depending upon what types of critters--fish or amphibians--you are keeping.  I can not testify to longevity of either type of canister as I have had these types for under a year.  By most reports, Eheim fans swear they last forever.  However, I have not heard this about the Penn Plax Cascade.  Given the price, I suspect that it is more cheaply built and, therefore most likely, less long lasting.  I am willing to take this risk and repurchase a Penn Plax if it only lasts, let's say, 5 years or so.  I will see what happens.  Purchase if you like low prices, heavy flow rates, and are willing to take a slight risk about quality.

There's no substitute for a good foundation in training, but there's also nothing wrong with having as many training tools available as possible. Let me start by saying I'm not a cat person (my fiance is). In the words of Mastercard...Priceless.Cons: Cats still track litter out, but that's not about the Litter Robot itself.If you're like me and really hate cleaning up after the cats everyday (and asking others to do it too when you're away), then seriously consider the Litter Robot.Lastly, I bought it directly from LR website. Get the bubble unit, it's brighter and bigger for the cats.

My kitten was spayed 2 days ago and within a couple of hours of getting home, I 2-day ordered this product.  It's soft fabric versus the plastic cone and ribbon that the vet had put on my cat.  She'll be in it for about 11 more days and I couldn't be happier.  She was falling over/getting stuck, unable to put her head down sleeping, etc in the plastic one and this rectifies the majority of those issues - she just seems more comfortable and is finally sleeping with her head down for the first time in days.  It also gives her some more space (whiskers are more comfortable it looks like) and she can better navigate.  She's not trying to get out of this one like the other and is also no longer bumping into things - I think the other really had an effect on her ability to navigate.  Great, inexpensive and effective fix if you've got a cat or kitten facing a surgery + time in a cone.

The bag says that it is PRE rinsed...don't believe it....I place in a 5 gallon bucket and ran water a hose at high pressure for about 15 minutes and it is still chocolate brown. I am afraid it is washing away some good silt, but the bag says to do it..I will bet I lost about a pound of silty material...it looks like small pieces of lava rock  or cinders..we'll see what it does later
My picky cat loves Wellness cat food. He will eat the pouches but he prefers the can style cat food. However, either one will work...my cat digs Wellness cat food.
These balls hold up very well to our chewer/shredder dog.The erratic bouncing is great fun, especially across a tile floor.They bounce very well, so caution is needed when using indoors.

I bought this to supply CO2 to my planted aquarium tanks. It seemed easy to use. I set it up but it has no instructions. I found an ad for it on You Tube but no precise instructions.I had it set to supply the correct amount to my tanks and it malfunctioned after I had had it over a month. It dumped about 15# of CO2 into my Rainbowfish tank and I lost a few fish- nearly lost many more but was able to drain and refill the tank quick enough to save the fish. I still have it but I am not using it anymore with my rainbows- afraid of another malfunction. Wish I could trust it,
Live with woods all around us and poor lil Abby was coming in with ticks on her! I switched to this and have not seen ONE! Just purchased for six more months.  This is my product from here on in!
5 of my dogs share these and they last a long time.. really good quality.. better than giving them rawhides from china!!!

Our 11 week old puppy loves his duck.  he carries it around by the neck or feet.  The toy makes a great sound...not too annoying for us as humans who have to listen to the quack, quack.  He doesn't however love it as much as his Hedge hog and Squirrels in a tree--that is his absolute favorite toy---hunting squirrels.  I guess it is because he is a hunting breed.  he is a Vizsla who will only hunt plush little squeaky squirrels.  But it is still a great toy and he does play with it a lot.

I've had him on this food since he was seven weeks old and he is responding wonderful to it. His stool is solid. His energy levels are extremely high. He looks healthy in every way. His coat is beautiful. He also loves the way it tastes. I don't add anything to it. My puppy is a chocolate lab.
These bully sticks were a good price and good quality. My dog loves them and only gets them when she is in the crate.

After looking at numerous types of pet stairs we decided on these ones because they were fairly cheap, high enough to reach our bed or at least higher than most other stairs available. These do seem like they are made of low quality materials but they hold up to a good amount of weight. Our chihuahua only weighs 6lbs but my fiance and I have both stepped on these without problems. So I can vouch for them holding at least 130-140lbs.

Received this item and the battery cover was off.  When setting it up, battery cover hardly wants to stay on.  Used a piece of tape.The suction cup to hold the unit to the aquarium glass is a joke.  It won't even stick by itself.Accuracy seems to be OK.  Checked with a few other thermometers.

I didn't come across the dust issues that some of the other reviewers had. However, I DO take the litter out to the garage to clean, so maybe that is why.What surprises me most about this litter is that I really don't smell the litterbox at all when I use it. I may even switch to this one permanantly.I bought this litter at Costco, and wasn't really expecting much from it. I was pleasantly surprised that that it worked just as well as thePrecious Cat Ultra Premium Clumping Cat Litter, 40 pound bagI normally buy at Petsmart.The perfume smell is not as shocking as some of the reviewers say. I have a very sensitive nose, and the fact it didn't bother me says a lot. I usually sprinkle Arm & Hammer Cat Litter Deodorizer, with Baking Soda in bottom of the litterbox anyway, and this litter definitely does not smell nearly as strong as that.My kitten isn't picky about litters, and he seems to be fine with this one.All that said, i agree with the bad packaging--- it is just way too heavy, which would be fine, but it has no handle and there is no way to hang on to it when carrying it. It really should be made in smaller packages or have some sort of handle.
Our puppy loves these treats!  We break them in half so hue grey last even longer.  He loves all of his Zukes treats and we love that they are made with wholesome ingredients.

Bought these to use for outdoor feral cats that visit our home at dinner times. We coated the feet in waterproof paint so that we could place the feet in water to keep the ants from finding their food. We use plastic butter tubs for dishes which fit in the holes. They're just the right height for the large male cats who tend to hunker down when eating and are also just the right size for smaller cars who stand up while eating.

Good Retractable Dog Leash. I would not use it on a large dog.. but a small to medium dog would be fine with this. This product is nicely constructed and it retracts smoothly. I am very pleased with its performance. I used it on my 75 dog, but he is older and slower and would never bold or even move very quickly, at least not these days. So, again, I would NOT recommend it for most large dogs.I would however recommend it for small to medium dogs and have already recommended it to friends.

We bought the medium for our two large indoor cats. They like to sleep together, and it is a good size for that. It comes with a lot of stuffing, so the bottom was domed up too much for them. I removed some stuffing so it was flatter, the cats seemed to like that better. For a heavier dog that would probably not be an issue.We have it outside our bedroom door, they do not sleep with us because they get the 1am crazies. All winter and most of the summer they can be found in their bed in the morning.This has a sheet of metalized plastic under the pillow covering and this reflects infra-red heat. This is like the material used in birthday balloons and space blankets. This works much better for cats and dogs than for humans. Humans and horses are the two sweatiest animals on Earth, so plastic sheets quickly makes us wet with perspiration. Cats and dogs only sweat a little from their paw pads so this is not an issue.
My orthopedist suggested I take this product as I have osteoarthritis and the joints in my hands hurt.  I have just begun, so I cannot critique the product as yet.

This item was really great for my 85 pound Malamute who LOVES to explore on walks, doesn't get tangled and is a strong durable weight. Then I decided to try it out on my 90 pound German Shepherd puppy who isn't to great on the lease, well he hit the end of the extension at full speed a few times and to my surprise the leash still didn't break. Such good quality it's worth an extra few dollars.
biggest and best tug - hard to find tugs this size - am ordering additional tugs - great buy!! recommend

Testing this product was a stretch for me, since I generally do not buy dog treats that are made with chicken or are chicken-flavored. My four dogs do not share my concerns, and three of them seem to think that these treats were sent from doggie Heaven. Of course, they ate them so quickly, I'm not so sure if they even knew what they tasted like. The fourth is more of a gourmet, and took her time with the Jerky Snack, eventually finishing it. Was that a smile on her face or a burp of contentment? We may never know, but we do know our dogs won't say &#34,no&#34, to Waggin Train Smoky Jerky Treats, and they seem to be a better choice than most chicken treats available.

My parrotlet likes this toy and is starting to play with it.  It isn't particularly delicate and I think it will hold up well until it is destroyed (as bird toys are meant to be shredded!)  I think it could be a little bit larger because it really is quite small but the medium is WAY too large for the parrotlet sized bird.  I'm satisfied with the purchase overall.

My bird adores this mirror--or should I say, looking at himself in this mirror!  He just chirps and taps at himself in it for minutes at a time.  It is very easy to install, I would recommend this product.  Oh and for size/reference sake, my little bird is a cockatiel.

I ordered the small size, because the Amazon page says that's for small dogs under 25 pounds.  My cocker spaniel is 20 pounds, so well under 25 pounds.  The small size did not fit her well.  The loop for the snout was too small.  I had it at the maximum  circumference and it was a stretch to pull it to the base of her nose as instructed.  I had to return it and buy the medium size.  That was much better.Once I had the correct size, everything was great.  My dog did a little dance to try to rub the collar off, but she quickly got used to it.  We were ready to walk almost immediately.  I was surprised by how much more control I had over her.  It's like she knew who was boss without me saying a word.  She doesn't pull, she obeys my commands.  Even when she doesn't, I am able to get her attention more easily.My dog chases my cat.  I'm working very hard to curtail that.  With this head collar, I'm able to take her around the house with me without her pulling to get at the cat.  The few times she's jumped at the cat, she immediately realized she couldn't and would just sit.Great product.  I will be bringing my dog to training and hoping this head collar will make my work easier.  It already has.

Ever since the pet food recall that happened a few years back I have been super careful which dog foods I buy. I have a 10 year old GSD and now a 5 month old Red Healer pup and both have sensitive stomachs. I've tried other brands of canned dog foods and they seem to enjoy them pretty well, except it really doesn't sit well with their stomachs. So, I happy to be feeding Natural Balance canned food, because here it is larger packages than the local pet store & the price is more what I can afford. I mix half a can in each bowl with some dry dog food and they both love it.I love the not having to drive across town & carry around heavy cans of dog food. :)

This has been a HUGE help.  I have a 14yo husky with limited mobility/spinal arthritis who uses a ramp to get in/out of the car.  I had a hammock on the seat so he couldn't fall, but he would lose his footing regardless when turning around or stepping on the unsupported portion.  This has provided a much more firm surface and he is less wobbly when riding/turning around.  It's still a bit slippery for him (probably wouldn't be an issue for the average dog), so I have attached a beach towel on top of it using velcro.  Was easy to install and seems sturdy/durable.  Just for reference, I have a subaru impreza wagon and it fits well.UPDATE:  I'm knocking one star off after using this for awhile.  Depending on how it fits in your car, be aware that it is possible for your dogs legs to fall down between the car door and the side of this.  My dog had this happen while I was driving and I had to pull off the highway to get him freed.  Might not be a bad idea to stuff a towel along the sides if there is even a small gap.

Cute toy, and I thought my laser-beam obsessed kitties would enjoy it, but no go.  They look at the lights if I trigger it myself, but don't get the concept that they can turn it on themselves.  I think a (human) toddler might actually enjoy this more than a kitty.

I think dispenser is a great concept.  However, I haven't found any treats that work well in it.  Either way too many come out if using the small Zeke's treats, or if you use larger treats you have to shake the dispenser to get them out.  Neither is ideal or convenient.If anyone has the ideal size treat to use with this dispenser, let me know!

This stuff does as it says.  My dog sheds way less now (not totally gone) and her coat is much more silky and soft.  The issue I have with it and reason I gave it only three stars is that the I had to send the stuff back three times to get a product that didn't dome open during shipment.  They send this stuff via air and the seals and lids do not protect against the super low air pressure and freezing at higher altitudes, thus, open containers and an oily mess when opening.  As I said the product itself works, but if you get this DEMAND GROUND SHIPPING or your gonna have a mess when it arrives.

We have made it a point not to give our dogs animal rawhides as they are not that great for their tummies.  Typically, we will buy a bone (yes, actual animal bone) and let them gnaw on that.  So now we have about 20 bones for our two dogs as they stand up fairly well and just don't go away.I was looking for a alternative to the bone, yet not quite as simple as a dog biscuit (which are gone in seconds!!).  These sweet potato rawhides are great!!  It took the dogs about 10 minutes to get through one and they seemed to really enjoy them.

Okay, this one we love. I laughed  at them as they raced through this tunnel sticking their heads out of the hole at the top and chasing each other. One of them took possession of it and would not let the other two inside. She even went to sleep it! If you like to see your cat(s) have fun and tumble all over the floor, then, get them a cat tunnel!! It was worth the money spent...
Catches litter. Vacuum can go over it. What more can I say? Just make sure you clean your litter often. If the cat gets poop on their paws and then stops onto the map the poop is hard to get out.
isn't big enough for my cat. My cat just jumps over it and the litter continues to spread. If it was bigger it would work fine.

My cats have been taking this for awhile now and they enjoy eating these treats.It does show to be healthy even though,I do not know how well it cleans their teeth.I do recommend other people to try this for their cats.
I'm so glad I found this company. We had a major flea outbreak at our shelter this summer and we could not have won the battle without these products at affordable prices.
Zukes is good quality and we have fed these snacks to the mini-dachshund for some time.  She likes them and quality is good.
These pads absorb a lot of urine from the cats.  I have 6 and know 4 are using it regularly.  I need to change one of the box pads twice weekly.  The other less often.

I bought this toy as an alternative to the ball that spins in a circle, which they all love.It assembles easily, and the cats like it .. of course.However, the blue top pulls up easily when my cats play. They put a paw inside the tunnel to push the ball. That pops the top part off, and the ball gets out. They play with the ball just like any $0.25 pingpong ball. It disappears under the couch.At the $15 price, I don't think it should pop apart so quickly (first day, and everyday since).At $49 it would be over,over,over priced.Although the cats like it and play with it daily, I don't like that I have to put it back together a few times each day.I am not going to return it because it is too much trouble.

I got the double version where you put one on top of the other and the top makes a lid so it is double-height.  Worked so well I got a second set for the guest bathroom too.My two elderly large cats love it, and it is a snap to keep clean.  I just line it with a Jumbo Jonny Cat liner, scoop twice a day and replace once a week.  Takes about 12 lb of litter to really fill it but that's a small price to pay for the convenience and cleanliness - virtually no tracking, and happy cats!

These steps are going to please or frustrate and it depends upon your dog. I have a 14 yr old Lasa and these steps work really well for her. HOWEVER, it took patience and training to get her comfortable with them. As several 1 star reviews point out, these steps are soft foam and give somewhat when the dog goes up and down, especially if the dog goes slowly or stops to contemplate the endeavor. Nevertheless, once my pooch began to go up and down at normal speed, they don't give so much and work like a charm. She is happily able to get up on our bed by herself again. (Good for her and good for us).So why not make them harder? Well, the other night I kicked the stairs with my bare foot. I thought, "wow that would have hurt if they weren't foam". So I am one of those who are pleased. My dog is 9 lbs. and fairly adaptable. If this is the case with your little guy, you will probably be pleased as well.Other notes: The steps are lower than expected. There is protective plastic under the cover that should be removed as it is noisy. The steps come with two washable faux lambskin covers.

My gang of nine love this catnip. Even the ones who don't get along will be in the same space so they can roll around it. Most potent catnip I have ever purchased. I am going to order three more today.
Didn't drip water out properly, the one I was replacing works better actually. Returned it for a swift refund. Low build quality, made in China. Really wish Amazon had a &#34,Made in USA&#34, filter.

I couldn't be happier that the very first night my puppy went to this product during the night instead of going on my carpet! The fake grass is convincing enough for him and the fact that he is a Chihuahua mix and very hard to potty train makes this perfect. Highly recommend!

I have a basset hound that cries and bays like crazy when I leave on my bicycle.  After much research I decided to give this collar a try.  I noticed that the packaging stated several times that &#34,white flakes&#34, would come off the collar but not be worried so that wasn't an issue for me.  The flakes were almost wax like, but smelled very good. The collar was definately big enough for my dog.  Unfortunately the collar didn't seem to work at all. My basset was still as high strung as ever.  It was only my first time using it, so I will continue to use it again, but not sure it is going to help.

While I have to agree with many reviewers who commented on the large size of the bowls (they really are better suited for dogs), in my case they are going to be just fine.I am currently feeding any number of stray cats in my neighborhood and this set- up is working out very well, so far. The bowl is large enough so that I only have to set out food once a day or two, and there is plenty of room for a generous amount of water.Since it's winter, I can't give you a 100% guarantee on the ant situation.  But the fact that it is designed so that you pour water in the narrow moat surrounding the food bowls, satisfies by belief that ants will go to their watery grave before getting to the food as well as giving me a decent trail to follow back to destroy their nest. Most important is that the cats will have clean food and water to enjoy.

My cat loves these springs so much that I got to eat my entire dinner without him bothering me! I woke up the other morning with four of them in the bed with me, I guess the cat was busy.They are a little fragile - if stepped on they tend to develop weak spots. I always break off these pieces just to avoid my cat swallowing them. I have also got used to watching where I put my feet!
This was not my favorite book.  My book club read it but I was not crazy about it.  Just not my cup of tea, I guess!

I wasn't sure if I was going to like Tom Violet very much when I began this book but once I got past the first chapter he began to grow on me. Until in the end, I was a little bit in love with him. Tom is a guy going through some career, relationship and family challenges. He is an aspiring writer and has finished his first novel but is living in the shadow of his Pulitzer winning author father. I enjoyed the development of the father son relationship...very funny at times but ultimately moving and satisfying.I can see where the Jonathon Tropper comparisons come from, both writers write with a very male sensibility, both write with wit, insight and heart. I wouldn't say whether one is better than the other because I enjoy them both but I'd say that Matthew Norman's style is less brutal than Tropper's. Loved this one.

It is seldom that I leave a book without having finished it. It seemed to me to be extremely repetitive. John Self is (ha ha) an egotist advertisement-director Britishman who travels to the US to negotiate his first major film. An alcoholic and drug-addict, Self lives obssesed with a woman who cheats on him on a permanent basis. He gets drunk so many times it stops being funny. Amis can write and has a good sense of humor, but the story goes nowhere. Maybe other books by him are better.
